title: Gather is a place to Gather and Share Great Food and Service!
review: Wonderful Food and Service!     Gather is known for gather and share, with multiple small plates to share, appetizers and reasonably sized entrees.  Our group of 5 had 4 share plates, one appetizer and two entrees all of which were shared and was just the right...amount of food- although the apple fritter dessert did put us a bit over the edge…:).    All of the food was very good, the highlights were the crispy cauliflower, gnocchi, and the ravioli appetizer, plus the pork shoulder which was fall off the bone tender with an interesting curry/tomato sauce.  Drinks were well made, service was excellent so the evening at Gather was outstanding.More

title: GREAT BURGERS
review: Sat at Chiefs counter and enjoyed the activity of the cooks. Very professional. Decent service but a little slow to get check. Burgers were perfectly cooked and very tasty. Fries were a Bplus.

title: Just great experience
review: service and food were just wonderful had half chicken and it was best chicken meal i have ever had. I strongly recommend if your looking for high quality interesting food

title: Great place for any meal
review: I live just down the road and have been coming to gather as often as I can. Always consistently great food and quality service. They have a great patio and I've never had a problem with the noise level.

title: Great Food, Wish I Could Have Heard the Description of What It Was
review: This is one of the loudest restaurants ever.  Like, cannot hear the person next to you loud.  The waiter came over and with his nice, quiet voice explained everything to us, with our party catching about every 4th word he said.  "Tonight.... meat.... plate.... sauce....basil...."...Yeah, it is hard to understand anything communicated in this space.    If they are not going to do anything to try and quiet the sound levels, then they need to have whatever the wait staff is trying to say WRITTEN OUT for guests.  The food was delcious.  Fun for sharing.  But again, when it arrives, don't expect to hear what you are eating before you dig in.More

title: Ignore the noise level because this place is amazing !!!
review: First i have to say the noise was an issue, but this joint is a legit top tier restaurant The Asparagus salad was incredible and the Chicken dinner was nothing short of superb. In short you must go and try Gather.  .

title: Nice brunch or dinner
review: As you can see I have been to both Gather and the adjacent Warbler in the past for dinners. Both places have the same owner. I like both places for different reasons.   My party of three recently returned to Gather two times, once for dinner...and then again for brunch. Let me first describe our dinner experience. Gather is a shared plate dinner experience. We started with the kimchi pancake for $12 and the salmon for $13. Then we enjoyed the tartare for $13 and the brussel sprouts for $9. We ended with the uovo ravioli for $11. As you can see from my pics I enjoyed two overnight sensation cocktails for $10 each.  John took care of our table needs. Our total bill was $132 less gratuities.  Then we returned for my first time here for my party of three for our 11:00am brunch reservation. When we arrived we were seated at the high top table nearest to the front entrance behind the host. The place was packed with customers.   I started with my bloody mary for $8. I also enjoyed my eggs benedict for $13. My eggs benedict were a bit over cooked. I really prefer a very liquid egg yolk. A side order of bacon is $5. A single scrambled egg is $1.50.  I ended my brunch with my bellini for $9. A cup of coffee is $4. Our total bill was $92.07 less gratuities. Courtney accommodated our table needs. I will return here again for dinner, brunch or even lunch.More

title: Delicious Brunch
review: My son and DIL recently moved to Chicago so I was excited to visit them. A foodie friend from “home” had read an article on Gather and had told them about it, so I was all in for checking it out. The food was excellent...as were the drinks. Very good service too. Would definitely go back!  ****4 Stars is a very good rating for me. I reserve 5 Stars for the best I’ve ever had and wouldn’t change a thing.*****More

title: Wonderful find!
review: Friends recommended this marvelous restaurant.  We arrived early for our Sunday evening reservation and opted to be seated immediately in the heated patio. That was a great choice.  The staff was knowledgeable, helpful with a guest with some health limitations, and we enjoyed a flavorful...range of dishes, including dessert.More

title: HINT: arrive when the restaurant opens, without reservation, and sit at the Chef's counter
review: Impromptu date night!  We called early in the day knowing that reservations were not available.  We were told that if we would likely get seated at a table if we arrived right when the restaurant opened.  We were surprised, then, when we arrived to an...empty restaurant, as the second couple in line, and tables were no longer available for those without reservations.  (Apparently there was a party that evening; your mileage may vary.)    We had the option of sitting at the Chef's counter or the bar.  At first we were both surprised and annoyed at not getting a table.  But silly us.  Sitting at the Chef's bar was fantastic.  Gather has a very small kitchen, and the three chefs/cooks shared the space very well.  It was a treat to watch them prepare all the dishes, including the ones that we ordered.  The fresh homemade cheese dessert is outstanding.  The whole meal was very good -- salmon, tartare, apple salad, scallop main, and the wines.  We shared the scallop main and the server recommended an extra scallop; we appreciated that they could accommodate.  The all-in price for two people for dinner (sharing one main) with alcohol and tip was $137.More

title: Good Food and Service
review: We  frequently visit Gather because we know the food and service are consistently good. If you like brussel sprouts, give them a try and you won’t be disappointed. When the weather is warm, they have an outside eating area which is nice. I’d definitely recommend...More

title: Get the Donut
review: We had brunch on a Sunday, and everyone LOVED everything! Not one issue with any of the food.  And no matter what you get, though — start with the donut!  You will be glad you did! :-)

title: The food (and service) changed my mind!
review: We went with my daughter and her Boyfriend who told us it was the best food they have had at a restaurant.  When we walked in I my impressions were negative, It was crowded and there was not much room around the tables.  The noise...More

title: My favorite Chicago restaurant!
review: Exemplary restaurant, in every sense of the word!  The service and ambiance are wonderful, and the food is unparalleled.  Gather's manager Emily, is amazing!  She orchestrates all the details, with her assistant manager Erin, and ensures that all of the diners are seated, comfortable, and...More

title: Creative food, limited (but tasty) entrees
review: Not a ton of selection on entrees, but very well executed, creative flavor mixings.  Limited, but reasonably priced wine list.  A couple of shared plates, 4 entrees and a bottle of wine came in at $200, including tip.  A good place for dinner before a...More

title: Mixed Performance
review: Dinner early on Sunday evening. Had our reservation, seated  us promptly, water was poured immediately and a bottle was left on the table.  Orders were taken at just the right time.  Food service was prompt and well paced.   The Steak Tartare appetizer was not the...More

title: Delicious comfort food
review: I recently had dinner at Gather with my partner and uncles, and we loved the family style meal Gather offers on Sundays. Now that I live outside of the US, I miss the midwest comfort foods (corn bread, fried chicken, juicy beef...) and this totally...More

title: Order new food or old favorites served in new ways
review: Gather Restaurant encourages sharing dishes so all diners can have the most unique experience. Take their baby carrots - with couscous and beets and almond brittle. Or salmon with cucumber creme fraiche and sourdough bread. We came for the arctic char, but enjoyed the rib...More

title: Great Fine Dinning at a reasonable price
review: I had dinner here recently with my son, it was wonderful!  It was the best dinning experience that I have had in awhile.  We ate outside on their patio, which had s very warm ambience with lots of plants and lights draped across and candles...More

title: Excellent small share plate dinner
review: I enjoyed dinner once before at a table in the rear inside of the restaurant. This was my first time to eat dinner in the rear outside. It was a very comfortable day. My party of three adults had a dinner reservation for outside at...More

title: Delicious food, beautiful presentation, memorable meal
review: Gather never disappoints: their food preparation and presentation are excellent, as is their service.  This is not our first visit, but this was the first time we actually got a table at their magical patio, more like a private garden in the back of the...More

title: Best restaurant in the city
review: How on earth this doesn’t make the top of list of restaurants to eat at in Chicago is beyond me. Best meal I’ve had ever in Chicago. I have returned many times and each meal is perfection. Cute non touristy neighborhood too. Worth the uber...More

title: Great Mother’s Day dinner.
review: Went there with my sister and our adult children Mother’s Day weekend.  We shared numerous appetizers, too many to remember.  All were excellent.

title: Great food
review: Great food an service The family meal is great Chicken,pork,polenta and potatoes were delicious. Great for friends and family

title: Perfection
review: The food, service and atmosphere were perfect. The staff was so attentive. The food-yum! Steak tartare, crispy cauliflower, raviola, and the apple fritters-oh, the apple fritters. It was an incredible birthday dinner!

title: Fabulous Dinner!
review: The food at Gather was amazing and service top notch. Save room for dessert! Will definitely be back next time we are in Chicago!

title: Foodie Heaven
review: OMG, no words for this fabulous establishment! Ryan and his kitchen are absolutely some of the most talented chefs in town! All ingredients are fresh and mostly sourced locally! The honey ricotta spread melts in your mouth and the bacon rhubarb spread explodes with flavor...More

title: Wonderful Food and Drink
review: Spent the evening in the garden having a fantastic time.  Food was excellent along with the cocktails.  Service was wonderful and very helpful.  If you are looking for a fun unique food menu this is the place.  Must have the Brussle Sprouts.

title: Great Cocktails, Good Food, Try eat at the Bar for a nice cocktail experience
review: We stopped by on a Sunday evening for dinner around 8pm to try Gather thinking it would not be as crowded but it was still packed, so we ended up eating at their cocktail bar after waiting about 20-30mins, and really enjoyed our meal that...More

title: Another great meal at Gather
review: Have tried many things on the menu and none disappoint. Service is excellent. Always enjoy going to gather. Two things:  it is noisy so intimate conversation is tough and you better make a reservation.

title: Gather with Friends or Family and Enjoy!
review: The food was fabulous and designed for sharing.  Innovative, complex flavors and very satisfying.  Prices are reasonable.  Service was outstanding.  We'll be going back soon!

title: One visit is not enough
review: For me, Gather will require several visits so I can try more of the food. When my friend and I initially ordered, our server chuckled a bit as we went overboard on the appetizers and had to cut back a bit. We shared the broccoli...More

title: One of the best meals you'll have in Chicago
review: Our son & daughter-in-law chose Gather for his birthday dinner.  Everything we  had was amazing! Broccoli salad and roasted carrot appetizers were delicious.  Whitefish and Char entrees were outstanding. We definitely will return!

title: Wonderful NYE Tasting Menu, But the Noise Level is Challenging
review: I writing to review the special tasting menu that was offered on New Year's Eve (and maybe for other special event days as well).  It was a super, 7-course adventure plus an initial (not-counted) amuse bouche that provided three different appetizer tastes. The courses ranged...More

title: Best dessert ever!
review: Or daughter introduced us to Gather! We shared the mushrooms, whipped ricotta, cauliflower and brussel sprouts appetizers. They were all delicious with the brussel sprouts being my favorite!!! Shared the chicken entree with my husband and it was cooked wonderfully! So yummy! But the best...More

title: Always Up To Gather
review: Two years ago a friend introduced me to Gather. It quickly became one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago for consistently delicious food and excellent service. After a handful of visits, it remains at the top of my list for a go-to good meal -...More

title: Good Food, Bum's Rush
review: I've eaten here twice. Both times, the food was excellent, not one poor dish across everyone in my parties. Unfortunately, I can't think of another restaurant in Chicago that tries to rush you through as quickly as Gather. Both times I've been there, they tried...More

title: Delicious Food, Great Atmosphere!
review: Food was outstanding.  We shared several appetizers and they were all delicious.  Particularly memorable were the whipped ricotta and the cucumber salad (I believe they were taking it off the menu, but they should totally keep it on!!).  My entree (Arctic char) was delightful and...More

title: Favorite Restaurant in Chicago
review: This Lincoln Square gem is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. The menu is always changing, so every time I dine here, it's a new experience. The Gathering Board is a must-order. One of the best charcuterie boards in town. The wine menu is...More

title: Near perfection
review: I was fortunate enough to attend the last of the 2017 Farmer's Series dinners last night (there's not another one on the calendar until next May), and I was blown away!   The restaurant is not at all pretentious, but it sits right up there with...More

title: Tranquil Outside Space to Gather with Friends
review: Gather is the perfect place to meet friends for a high quality meal in an atmosphere where you can have a conversation. The food quality is excellent and the service well paced. The heirloom tomato salad was so fresh, I thought they picked the fruit...More

title: Absolutely delicious
review: I've been to Gather a few times and it is always excellent.  Sunday nights, they serve family style and I can rave about each dish.  Service is always top notch too.

title: Fantastic Sunday breakfast
review: We had a fantastic Sunday breakfast at Gather.  So many interesting options that we had trouble choosing, but we enjoyed everything that we tried. A little noisy, and it was busy.  There is also a patio if the weather is cooperative.  My daughter has been...More

title: Delicious brunch!
review: We went around 11 am on a Sunday and got seated right away.  The atmosphere was wonderful and unique.  The menu was creative and mouth-watering. We couldn't decide what to get, so we all ordered something different and shared.  Every dish we tried was better...More

title: Nice brunch place, make a reservation
review: This is a nice little restaurant using fresh ingredients. The bloody mary's are also good. Nice atmosphere on the back patio and service is very good.   The menu is very good and we found it difficult to decide on what we wanted because we wanted...More

title: Perfect Wedding Shower Dinner
review: We Loved our time here celebrating a dear friend's upcoming wedding!  We sat out in their lovely yard. Great service & they allowed us to bring in floral centerpiece, cupcakes, etc...  We all ordered the Sunday dinners & added some appetizers:  Sunday Dinner - Fried...More

title: Creative and very good food -- but also slow and very, very noisy.
review: I am "meat and potatoes" diner, so I typically do enjoy unusual or unfamiliar dishes.   Gather is all about creative dishes with unusual, interesting sides, but I really enjoyed the food.  We had a soft shell crab that was delicious and then a bone-in pork...More

title: Delicious food and Awesome service!
review: 6 of us stopped on Saturday morning and had a great and memorable experience.   The staff was very friendly and attentive. Brunch items were true delicacies!  Presentation was appealing and food was prepared with talent. I personally recommend the chicken and waffle which was prepared...More

title: Best meal...dreaming of ravioli
review: I was in Chicago for business and I wanted to eat in my old neighborhood.  Found this place through Trip Advisor and it did not disappoint. It was the best meal I have had in a long time from the greeting at the door to...More

title: Favorite Brunch in Chicago!!
review: I have had brunch here about 5-10 times now and always love it! The food is unique and well executed (my personal favorite is the biscuits & gravy). The staff is also really great. If you are chatty and want to learn more about the...More

title: Absolute Must in Lincoln Square
review: We went for Mother's Day dinner, which was a fixed price family style meal. We chose roasted vegetables, fresh pasta, and short ribs and it was all fantastic.  All the other dishes offered looked amazing. Prep and service are superb. Can't wait to come back...More

title: Delicious Brunch!
review: Went here with my husband for brunch last weekend, and we really enjoyed it!  I got the brioche french toast and he got the biscuits and gravy.  Both were absolutely delicious, flavorful, and surprisingly, not too heavy!  Both dishes tasted homemade and fresh.  We liked...More

title: Sweet Surprise
review: Landed up walking in on Easter Sunday an were informed they had extended brunch hours (until 4). Not really brunchy people are we, but the second we walked in the vibe was too great to leave. Seated us outside under a seriously fab covered patio...More

title: Exceptional food, phenomenal service and gracious host..Well done Gather!!
review: Family and I stopped in for dinner Monday tonight before a play in the neighborhood.   Gather delivered a memorable experience with exceptional food- started with the ricotta followed by  Brussels sprouts, beets and burrata, mushrooms, ravioli and croquettes. The Brussel sprouts was our favorite!! I...More

title: Perfect menu
review: Chicago is a food city,period, and Gather stands out for its unique blend of value and class, with menu choices that are upscale without pretense and adequate without waste. The menu is diverse with meats, fish and vegetables in unique preparation. Desserts are decadent. The...More

title: Neighborhood Gem
review: Interesting, slightly offbeat menu.  Food very well prepared.  Attentive service.  Nice wine and beer selection.  Can be a little noisy.

title: Superb Brunch
review: Second time here for brunch.  This time we had the treat of sitting at the kitchen counter watching the 3 great chefs at work.  A thing of beauty.  From the moment we walked in to the time we walked out, a memorable service experience with...More

title: The Best in North Center!
review: Gather has incredible food from small plates to entrees!  We have been here a NUMBER of time and love sitting at the counter watching the chefs at work.   If you want to try the best food in North Center, I would suggest you go to...More

title: Wonderful Can't Wait to Return!
review: Outstanding dinner for two. First time trying the restaurant on a cold winter night. Great atmosphere. Great service. Great food. Loved my cocktail-The Count. I had the steak meal, and my husband had the trout. Both excellent. Best brussels sprouts ever.

title: amazing food!
review: My husband and I were visiting our daughter who lives in Chicago--I found Gather listed as a Farm to Table restaurant and my daughter had heard it was good but had not had a chance to try it yet. The food was amazing--fresh and wonderfully...More

title: Best Dining In Lincoln Square
review: This by far our favorite local restaurant in the area. The menu is always on point with not only dishes that look creative but taste amazing as well. The staff is friendly and wonderful in they way they will guide you to order the correct...More

title: Great Southern Food with a Twist
review: This place has an amazing variety of southern delites and an unique twist on most.  The atmosphere feels neighborly and cozy.  Come in for an interesting take on comfort food that your grandma used to make.

title: A+ atmosphere, service and food!
review: I met some friends here for dinner and it was an all around top notch experience. They have a fabulous patio with holiday-type lights that set such a cozy by elegant mood. It is my opinion that everyone should try the whipped ricotta appetizer. It...More

title: Sunday supper a disapointment
review: The food really wasn't bad, it's more the way they plated it.  Served family style, the fried chicken was piled on the plate with a mound of coleslaw piled on.  Is this supposed to be attractive?  It made the chicken soggy.  It was also too...More

title: Come One, Come All
review: A friend and I had an amazing good meal here.  We dined on a late summer evening and snagged some seats on the covered patio.  It was the perfect atmosphere for two friends sit, relax, unwind and catch up.  I began my meal with the...More

title: Great Breakfast Place
review: My wife and I went to Chicago to visit our daughter who lives in Chicago. She picked out a restaurant for breakfast close to where she lived so we could walk to it. You really need a reservation to get a seat. I would recommend...More

title: Good food
review: Good food, a lot of vegetable dishes which I liked especially the roasted sprouts. Buzzing atmosphere.

title: FABULOUS FOOD
review: We had dinner during one of the Farm Series evenings and were delighted with the unusual combinations (example):  Sliced sirloin steak, cooked to perfection paired with raspberries...divine. There is a covered patio in the back of the building that feels a little "closed in" during...More

title: Food and service the way it should be
review: This review has been a long time coming. When it comes to modern, locavore, upscale dining in Chicago; Gather hits the ground and runs with it like no other. The chef is absolutely brilliant and his staff can carry his tune very nicely. The front...More

title: Festive bday dinner after square root street fest
review: Festive bday dinner after square root street fest - my husband, 27 yr old son, his friend and me. Started with crispy Brussels Sprouts with toasted pistachio, parmagiano, miso vinaigrette, bonito flake - our favorite of three starters; Crispy Cauliflower with roasted peanut, soy glaze,...More

title: Excellent choice
review: Came with my wife and daughter, met our friends here. The food is just so good! We shared a few things; do NOT leave without having the Brussels sprouts. Very knowledgeable and friendly service, nice atmosphere, good bar, good wine list. We each had an entree, and all were great. Three in our party had scallops and loved them. I had the home made spaghetti and it was perfect. The apple fritter dessert was excellent. A really enjoyable restaurant.

title: Small Gem
review: I had dinner here with a friend. It was a special farm night when they create the menu using ingrediants from a "local" farm. It was amazing. We spilt 2 appitizers, 2 entrees, and 2 desserts. None of the dishes tasted anywhere simular to the others. The creativity with the flavors were truely amazing.I highly recommend a reservation. They opened for dinner at 5 and by 5:30 it was fairly packed on a Wednesday night.

title: Near-Perfect Brunch!
review: This is my second visit to Gather, having enjoyed a near-perfect dinner here about a year ago. This time we went for brunch. After a bit of a wait - no complaints - there's plenty to look at in the neighborhood, our party of 5 was served a delightful and tasty brunch. I had the Biscuits and Gravy and don't think I've ever had better biscuits. The gravy was tangy, the chicken sausage had just the right blend of spices, and it was topped with two over-easy eggs.Heavenly and so filling. One other member of our party had this dish, and we agreed that there was nothing else like it. Another family member had Shrimp and Grits, leaving none on the plate, and kept invading my plate for "just a taste." The pre-teen in the group opted for Brioche French Toast, which he devoured. The service was perfect. The atmosphere was perfect. What a meal!

title: A gem on Lincoln square area
review: We went here during a cold Chicago day. Parking was easier than we thought. The food was spectacular. Our waiter gave us great recommendations and we sampled each other's dishes and they were fantastic. The ambiance is warm, welcoming and cozy so we will definitely will go back again. It's a great dining spot for great friends, family or a date night.

title: A great restaurant for special occasions!
review: I went to Gather for the first time on Friday May 6 for my birthday. We sat outside in there amazing patio area. Often the guests on the patio are an afterthought but not here. We had great very attentive service. Good recommendations and an amazing meal.

title: Great restaurant across from Old Town School of Music
review: The Crispy Brussel Sprouts appetizer, with toasted pistachio, parmagiano, miso vinaigrette, bonito flakes was incredible!!!! My dinner was delicious: grilled sirloin with green cauliflower puree and other veggies. My husband enjoyed his pan-seared scallop dinner, with asparagus, mushrooms, baby bok choy and lobster emulsion. Great choices of wine. They were really nice about serving us quickly, because we were going next door for a concert after dinner. Great service.

title: Homey and Delicious
review: We went to Gather for dinner before a concert at the Old Town School of Music. We sat at the counter, overlooking the kitchen. What a wonderful experience. Gather is a small restaurant so sitting at the counter really felt homey. Service was perfect. We loved our waitress and the support staff. We particularly liked talking to the three chefs cooking the food in front of us. The overall menu is small and it was interesting to see how a few dishes were so popular. The chefs took great pride in the combination of their ingredients, how fresh and tasty their dishes are, and their favorites on the menu. We started with the winter radishes and the Spring greens salad. Both were large and easy to share. The salads were crunchy with lots of texture and flavor. Next we got the homemade spaghetti and the fried chicken. The fried chicken was one of the best dishes I've had anywhere in a long time. I can't tell you how many chicken dishes came out of the kitchen- clearly others loved it too! The other really popular dish was the steak. After watching the chef prepare this entree, I can't wait to come back to try it.

title: Brunch was amazing!
review: We had Easter brunch at Gather after reading many great reviews. There was a special menu, with the typical entrees, but pastries, fruit, meat, and cornbread were brought family style to the table. The food was excellent. The service was fantastic. Easter brunch was pricy at $35; the weekly menu is much more typical. I would go back, and highly recommend!

title: Sooooo gooood!!!!
review: The front of the house functions like a well oiled machine. The food is creative and delicious, while reasonably priced. We've visited often, and service & food has always been a home run. Bonus- there's also an outside area open spring- fall that's beautifully lit & and creates quite a bit more room for the consistently busy restaurant.

title: Continues to be amazing!!!
review: Gather is one of our favorite restaurants in Chicago. We had not been to brunch in a while so it was amazing to see the restaurant super busy and still absolutely delicious. David and his team have it down to perfection.The gooey sticky bun is to die for and their blueberry doughnut is out of this world.We also enjoyed the skillet, eggs benedict and tried the steak and eggs for the first time, delicious !We will be back soon.Thank you! !

title: Good
review: The food was great, we started with cheese plate which was delicious with nice variety. Had scallop dish, really enjoyed. The service was great, only negative is the room is small and got very loud quickly...was hard to hear my friends.

title: Outstanding food and experience all around!
review: If you are a foodie and like to watch the chefs create amazing dishes, try to be seated at the counter in front of the kitchen. Executive Chef Ken Carter and his cooking staff are a delight to watch. But even if you can't watch...More

title: Just excellent
review: Gather is right next to the Old Town school of Folk music in Lincoln Square. The El station isn't too far away and there is a public parking lot (cheap) almost right next store--no transportation hassles. The space is contemporary and classy / chic but...More

title: Creative and tasty food
review: We started out with two appetizers, the salmon and steak tartar. Both were exceptional. Next we split the sturgeon,which without asking,they served in separate plates. We finished off with the apple fritter dessert which was amazing. The drinks were creative and packed a wallop (We...More

title: A great find with creative dishes
review: We were looking for a good restaurant near a lecture we were attending - and we were wowed.  Interestingly, the chef, Ken Carter, worked at Trotter's for many years - I was a guest chef at Trotter's while he was there.  It was fun to...More

title: Great neighborhood place in Lincoln Square
review: Night before Thanksgiving and we were looking for a place to eat. Glad we stumbled into Gather. Nice little local place with great food. Soup to nuts very good. My son said the sturgeon dish he had was the best fish dish he has had...More

title: Neighborhood gem
review: Gather is an amazing place.  Food is exquisite,  service friendly and on point.  Great for a date,  catch up with froends, family gathering or just because.   Some of our menu favorites are the brussel sprouts, raviolo, tartare and the chicken - fantastic wine list and...More

title: Food was Delish & Staff is very Courteous!
review: We ordered the spaghetti, sirloin, beer salad and kale salad as well as a bottle of wine. We sat on the patio that was so beautifully decorated and had heaters! The food was amazing and so was our service!

title: Lincoln Square gem
review: Unbelievable. I'm not sure I've had such a good meal in Chicago in years. Gather blew me away and I highly, highly recommend visiting.  My wife and I had a willy-nilly Friday night a few weeks back and after a semi-botched downtown happy hour, we...More

title: 3 visits in 3 days!
review: My husband and I were traveling cross-country and spent a long weekend in Chicago. On our first night in town, our AirBnB hosts recommended some restaurants in Lincoln Square. We wandered the the streets and decided, on a whim, to dine at Gather. We happened...More

title: Waste of time and money
review: My brunch last weekend at Gather was awful. We waited 45 minutes for one eggs benedict and one biscuits and gravy. When the food finally came they brought the wrong order. When we said that, the waiter huffed a sigh and silently walked away, leaving...More

title: Great brunch option
review: During a weekend visit to our daughter in college, we wanted to get out of the Loop and enjoy brunch in one of Chicago's eclectic neighborhoods. Gather, in Ravenswood, came up from Yelp, and was a great find. We took an Uber to get there,...More

title: Great restaurant in an area where there are many alternatives
review: I went with friends twice this summer.  Each time the experience was wonderful.  No one was unhappy with their choices, and actually they were all very good.  Love the fish, the green beans (of all things), the chicken, the service and the wine list.

title: Good Food If You Can Put Up With The Noise
review: Food was good. Noise level was deafening.  Would not return.  Could not carry on a conversation without shouting.  Good luck hearing what the other person said.

title: Fantastic food and wonderful service
review: On a recent stay in Chicago, we discovered this restaurant was just around the corner. We ate on the patio and, even on a cool night, the overhead heaters kept us plenty warm.  The service was casual and attentive, just perfect.  Now to important matters,...More

title: Table with a view
review: We sat at the kitchen bar and watched the theater of the chefs.  The food was wonderful, the people great, and a lot to see.  Thank you Chef Carter!

title: Perfect meal!
review: It was a warm fall evening when we at at Gather, so we opted for their outdoor seating at the restaurant's rear which turned out to be a perfect choice.  Overhead trellises with strings of lights woven in among the vines gave Gather the perfect...More

title: Great food
review: Excellent food and atmosphere.  The wait staff is outstanding.  They have a wonderful sharing menu. I would highly recommend their Brussels sprouts

title: Gathering Place
review: We were there in August to celebrate my daughter's birthday at her suggestion.  It is an indoor/outdoor restaurant with a lovely covered patio area.  Appears many of the people are from he neighborhood and it is well liked.  Food prices for entrees are good ranging...More

title: Great neighborhood find
review: This restaurant is consistently good! Being from the neighborhood I have been a few times and always been impressed. The real stand-out for me is the Sunday Supper! The chicken and sticky buns are to die for!

title: Great Night
review: We were fortunate to accompany farming friends who supply fresh vegetables to this wonderful restaurant in Lincoln Square, and we were treated very well. Service was excellent, but what they put on the plate was even better. We chose the five course prix fixe dinner. Each dish was on the menu, but Chef Ken Carter picked his freshest favorites and he outdid himself. First course was a lovely beef carpaccio served with red potato chips and veggies. Next we had a take on insalata caprese, with heirloom tomatoes and burrata and basil. A surprise course was roasted peppers with some sort of magical treatment on top. I believe it was a salted fish flaked so thin that it seemed to come alive as the steam rose from the peppers. Delicious and entertaining. There were two mains, a lovely seared scallop first. In my mind, the chicken course was memorable. There were three small pieces of chicken. The breast slices were over the top tender and juicy, possibly sous vide? What I love was the delicately fried chunk of crusted dark meat that was an amazing contrast. They spoiled us with desert and we all walked away full, not stuffed, and happy. My descriptions do not capture the freshness and flavor. You'll just have to go yourself. You won't be disappointed.

title: Fantastic everything!
review: Went in with no expectations to celebrate our 14th anniversary. I was blown away! Started with a great cocktail, the had the mussels which comes with a huge housemade pretzel. I wanted to drink the broth it was soooo good. Then cucumber salad, fresh and amazing, finally ended with the seared diver scallops. Couldn't have happier! Apparently, the menu changes all the time and they feature a different farm every month for a special dinner. A true farm to table restaurant!

title: Absolutely amazing brunch!
review: If you're looking for delicious brunch that is a little different than your typical brunch spot, then Gather is the place for you. There was a little wait for a table but well worth it. We had the omelette, skillet and griddle cakes and a sticky bun. All of which were out of this world. I also had the watermelon juice which was fabulous. The atmosphere of the restaurant is pretty awesome as well. Great furnishing and decor.

title: Amazing eats and great cocktails
review: We only stopped for a quick bite but we wanted to stay for 2nds and 3rds. We walked in and got seated immediately which was a huge surprise. We ordered cocktails which came out quick and the brussel sprouts and raviola. Two of the best dishes I have had in awhile. Definitely worth stopping. Next time I will try to reserve a spot at the chefs table.

title: Great meal, great service, great price!
review: Had the pleasure of dining here for dinner Friday evening.  Everything is prepared in house, very fresh. Good choices of appetizers, entres and desserts.  Excellent wines. Neighborhood restaurant located in near Northside.

title: Interesting and well-designed
review: Eating out a lot - as I have to for work - it's always nice to find places that are unusual and intelligent in the way they design the experience. At gather, the food this evening was superb and the menu challenges to consider what one really wants. The staff know their stuff and it was an all-round very nice evening.

title: Fabulous Food, great ambiance, outdoor dining the works
review: This restaurant has really fantastic food, a chef's table this is so fun to eat at, great outdoor dining as well as a couple of rooms inside to eat in.  Vegetarian items as well as many other delicious meals.  The chicken dish is superb.

title: Nice Sunday Brunch Spot
review: The place has a great little covered patio in back, surrounded by lovely plantings and flower planters. We had cocktails for starters, bloodies and a specialty drink called basil smash. The basil concoction was so good that we've now duplicated it at home. Try the pastries, especially the jelly doughnut which was stuffed with rhubarb filling -- yum! All of our entrees were equally good, with the Benedict taking honors.

title: Almost but not quite
review: So how do you review a restaurant that has excellent food a beautiful dining room and patio area but needs to improve on their service It started with walking in the door Not only did we have to flag down what appeared to be a hostess but she wanted to give us a table of 4 ( we were 2 ) right at literally the front door . Well after I firmly stated our desire to eat on the patio in back I was rather annoyed to see there were plenty of 2 tops on the Patio. Then the poor service continued we had to flag down a bus boy who sent over a nice gentleman to take our drink order. He turned out to be the owner - we expressed our desire for a server but again after 15 more minutes no drink no server . Finally I got up and flagged our server who was efficient friendly but clearly had too many tablesAfter we ordered we did get our food fairly quickly and our cocktails finally came It is quite apparent that they were not prepared for the crowd which was due to The large commercial furnishings Neocon show at the Merch Mart . That is like not knowing the Super Bowl is in your home town Again Food excellent service needs improvement

title: Great Place !
review: True Europeon cafe with awesome brunch and killer mimosa's.Their ambience is sooooo good :)  Did I mention about top notch service :):).. Must go place in Chicago ..

title: Sunday Family Style is Excellent
review: Great food, great ambience, and the Sunday family style dinner is so good and an excellent value.  Loved sitting at the counter and watching the action.  Give Gather a try, you won't regret it.

title: Don't try to talk
review: A friend and I were there for dinner on a Monday evening. The decor is pleasant, the service was excellent, and the food was delicious with several vegetarian choices. But the noise level was unexpectedly high and made conversation almost impossible. I would recommend this...More

title: An OMG Brunch
review: A recent late breakfast/early lunch at Gather left me in my happy place. The staff was stellar and our waiter could have given an in-service on the finer points of his craft. The breakfast menu was familiar yet imaginative. This OMG brunch started with a...More

title: Great service, good food
review: We got an early reservation on Valentine's Day.  The staff couldn't have been nicer.  They had a prix fix menu, but we could also order off the regular menu.  They were able to accommodate my gluten free with little problem.  The kitchen is part of...More

title: Gather the Troops
review: Gather your friends and family together for this little gem.  You are not going to want to miss this one on your trip to Chicago.  My daughter and I happened in here when the restaurant we were originally headed to was closed.  I quickly looked...More

title: Great bistro in a cool neighborhood
review: Having lived in Chicago for over 15 years, I have enjoyed and can definitely appreciate the draw of the fun, touristy restaurants like Gibson's and Morton's, but if you're visiting Chicago and are interested in a great restaurant in an awesome north side neighborhood, I...More

title: Worth the trip!
review: The neigbourhood gem is well worth a visit. We were staying off the maginificent mile and had met one of the owners on a wine tour in Chile last spring, so decided to make the trek out from downtown. By far this is one of...More

title: Fun , small, boisterous, interesting food , very good service.
review: We arrived on time for our reservation, had to wait five minutes for our party of 8 to be seated. The restaurant is a fairly small, narrow rectangle with a bar and open kitchen in the middle. We sat at a large table in  a...More

title: Accommodating
review: Six friends on the way to OTSFM Good Cheer Concert enjoyed a fabulous small plate dinner and drinks before the show. Nice wine selection but small beer choices. That's ok because the sharing plates were the best. Everything was hot, tasty, and different. I'm not...More

title: Great neighborhood spot but also worth a drive
review: We went to Gather as part of an evening at OTSFM. Not sure which was better. Great cocktails, great food, and a lively crowd even on a weeknight. The small kitchen really produces not only quickly, but with creativity and quality. Will be my go-to...More

title: Noisy, fun, great food
review: If you are in Chicago and want to be elbow-to-elbow with good food all around, this is the place.  Gather is not a place for a quiet conversation- in fact, it's hard to have even a loud conversation when the place is hopping. Good thing...More

title: Nice casual spot by Old Town School of Music
review: Enjoyed the food and casual atmosphere at this popular spot across from the Old Town School of Music.  The atmosphere is casual and friendly in this fairly small restaurant.  Space is a bit tight throughout.  Food is prepared in an open kitchen which can only...More

title: Superb!
review: We ate at this outstanding restaurant for Sunday brunch and were not disappointed. Luckily, we made reservations, so we were seated immediately while others stared in through the windows waiting for a table. From beginning to end, the experience was outstanding. Service is friendly and...More

title: Fantastic
review: A fantastic meal and a great seat to watch the kitchen do their magic.  Everything was delicious and the atmosphere was lovely.  A very memorable meal.

title: Hidden gem in CHI town
review: Stunning and amazing food preparation, flavor combinations and presentations won me over.  Shared dishes were enough for our party of four to taste and savor, entrees were also shared and thoroughly enjoyed.   Have to admit the brussel sprouts and the uovo ravioli were my favorites!...More

title: Amazing Burger...and more!
review: Three out of four of us ( & the other person was a vegetarian! ) said this was the BEST BURGER WE EVER HAD!!!! EVER!!!  I have to say I said that with a mouth full of food.... and my momma taught me to never...More

title: Fantastic Food, Average Service
review: I really wanted to rate excellent, but the casual service was a killer. Great atmosphere, art, and chic bathrooms were a stand out.  The skillet was perfect and flavorful, coffee great, and Benedict was perfect.  One person brought water, another took our drink order, then...More

title: Good gathering
review: We liked the patio, the hamburgers and the fried chicken; the place is a good option for a moderately priced restaurant with good food, suitable for family and a gathering of friends.

title: Best veggies ever!
review: Cute atmosphere and great service. I am a huge fan of brussel sprouts and these were truly the best I've ever had.   As were all the veggies we ordered.   It's a farm to table concept so local and seasonal menu.  There were 4 in our...More

title: Very Pleasant Evening
review: Stopped here by chance before a show at the Old Town School of Folk Music, just across the street. We all thought it was excellent. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and the food arrived in a reasonable amount of time. A lot of the...More

title: The best of the bunch...
review: North Lincoln Avenue in Lincoln Square has several good, fairly new restaurants. Gather is among the best. Our first meal there was a family affair for four.  The appetizers were unusual and very good. We each had a different entree and tasted a bit all...More

title: Amazing brunch experience!
review: We arrived with reservations for Sunday brunch at 10:00 (opening)  and were seated immediately in the front room of the restaurant (50 somethings and almost 30 somethings).  Due to about 4" of snow, our party of six was slow -  arriving in spurts, but that...More

title: Shocked by the average rating
review: I'm kind of shocked by the 4 & 5 star reviews this place got.  It was definitely just alright when my friends and I went there.  The service, while being knowledgable and nice, was extremely slow.  Our dinner took 3 hours without even trying to...More

title: Excellent food but high noise level
review: Four of us enjoyed a very nice meal at Gather.  The restaurant is fairly small and the bar area was packed, so the noise level was high.  I had the chicken dinner (pictured above) which was excellent.  My wife had the short ribs which she...More

title: 5 Stars - A Meal to Remember
review: I went here with my two twentysomething daughters. As we always do when dining in Chicago...between the three of us, we never order the same appetizer, entree, or dessert. Instead we all order something different and share-share-share. This allows us to sample a good percentage...More

title: Absolutely wonderful, a neighborhood gem!
review: What a wonderful place.  Elegant but feels like home.   The food is amazing, very nice menu that caters for every diner.  Small plates and entrees available.  We chose small plates so we can taste many things and are glad we did.  The riccota cheese with...More

title: Sunday Brunch with baby
review: We showed up for Sunday brunch with no reservations. We were offered outside or a table by the window.  We were made to feel very welcome with our infant.  A quiet place with understated décor.  Service was attentive.  The menu was inventive.  The food was...More

title: "Gather and Share" Worth the Trip!
review: Gather is a "foodie" restaurant with outstanding service and the food's not too shabby either.  The green beans with chili oil and sofrito aioli are arguably the best appetizer I've ever had.  The grilled octopus was wonderful.  And the Gathering Board with honey comb, cheeses,...More

title: Choreographed Culinary Experience that is Relaxed and Special
review: For my 60th my husband chose Goosefoot and we were not disappointed. The details and explanations are part of the dining experience. Woodstock theme was appropriate for our age, LOL. Edible flowers with sauces to die for.  Special place for a special occasion. Small intimate...place that cannot be judged by the exterior and location.   Thanks for a wonderful meal.   Also note the Covid precautions taken very seriously here at this restaurant. Temperature taken when you enter building and silver ware and glasses protected from germs and environment with clear partitions between tables. Not to mention some fancy gadget at your table to take the particles out of the air at your table.More

title: Wonderful experience
review: When I looked at the others' reviews, I said 'me too' many times! This place was the best! The host treated you like an old friend. The chef (her husband) put something so pretty and tasty in front of us. We took tons of pictures...and gobble up the last bit. The server was professional and very friendly. Looks like she loved her job and and happy to have us there. (I was at Boka the evening before, and the servers were cold toward us) The menu change so I am not going to talk about it.  The food was, and will be delicious anyway.   Plus, I love that they took the Covid seriously: All tables were divided by clear, clean panels. Host and servers all wore mask and keep the distance. All the beautiful, heavy weighted silverare were wrapped, pre-packed according to each course, and put together  in a nice box, to avoid human contact. Each guess had his/her own box. It was a lot of work! They present the box in a neat and beautiful way.  Truely one of a kind!More

title: Goosefoot Restaurant
review: Amazing! The tasting menu is superb! I think it is the Best tasting menu in Chicago. The experience is good for your soul as well as your stomach. I am Comparing this menu and experience to Alinea, Acadia, Boka and more. Thank you so much!...God BlessMore

title: One of the Best Experiences in Chicago
review: This is my fourth time at Goosefoot and I already want to go back for more!!! It’s literally one of the best dinner experiences in Chicago and if you have not been, YOU MUST GO!!! Nina will treat you like royalty and Chris will cook...you some of the best food in Chicago and the presentation is out of this world! Also, the music and theme changes all the time so you never know what you will get!  ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS RESTAURANT!!! It’s a must so put it on your list and GO!!!More

title: Like having the best meal of your life with the best hostess ever in their own home
review: i have always been interested in dining at Goosefoot since it's inception but my dining partner is always intimidated by price fix menus and i can understand the uncertainty of what you will eat and if it will be substantial.  Goosefoot proved those misconceptions so...wrong.  We walked in and were immediately greeted by Nina by name which made me feel very at home and she showed us our table..The theme of Goosefoot for this season is Woodstock and the music the atmosphere and the food has touches of woodstock going through. The thing that made the night special besides the food was the incredible service and just personal attention received by Nina who shared history on the restaurant and the dishes and made the time go by fast.  The was never a lull in between courses as Nina was keeping us attentive and in suspense for the next course and of course we could see the other tables receiving theirs.  The mean started off with the fois gras and the chestnut soup..so delicious, we then had the scallop in the lobster broth..we both wanted more and more of this...the parsnip soup was hearty and delicious with the lentils at the bottom adding a nice texture, then venison entree and the beef...creative, succulent and juicy and perfect especially when all the bits are added together. then we had the cheese course piped in the egg shell, the yuzu palate cleanser presented with the mini replicas of the bandshell at Millenium Park, amazingly creative with the origami touches, we then moved on to dessert which after the custard and the snow globe chocolate, we were so full which was a shock..we had to take the final desserts and the chocolate bars home.  Nina was a delight, the food each course so unique and full of flavor and presented with such precision.  If this is what Michelin is all about then i want this as much as i can. It does take 3 hours to complete the meal but as i said, the wit and conversing you have with Nina will not have you missing the food. Will be back hopefully soon.More

title: Great BYOB place for a special occasion
review: Four of us were there for a birthday celebration.  I love the fact that they change the decor and music to match their themes.  The food for each of the courses was beautifully prepared and delicious.  It's impressive that they can get their soups to...the table served so hot. Nina was a wonderful hostess and our server was very thorough in her description of each course.  The restaurant provides a great opportunity to pair your own wines with their delicious food, and you can buy wine next door, if you wish.  A thoroughly enjoyable meal.More

title: Worth the wait!
review: We have been trying to return to Goosefoot for a number of years since its early years. Finally got a reservation to celebrate my birthday. Absolutely worth the wait! Again, Nina and Chris delighted and surprised us with wonderful, warm service and excellent and creative...food. It’s BYOB, which is great and the chef’s menu is varied and excellent. I hope it doesn’t take us another 4 years to return.More

title: Like having the restaurant all to yourself
review: Our second time back to goosefoot and it was every bit as fun and special as the first visit.  Nina and Chris are amazing hosts and you feel like you are visiting their house and having dinner in their dining room.  Amazing service, playful menu,...great music (curated by Nina to accompany the meal) and wonderful suggestions on the wine pairings (from the store next door - as goosefoot is byob).  A fun dinner experience and worth every penny.More

title: Excellent flavors but something is not totally right..
review: It was a first BYOB experience for Michelin stars restaurant and I liked it. Although our wines were probably not a perfect choice for the menu, it gave a familiar approach to the experience. All be it, it is not necessarily what one is looking...for in these fine dining experience.  The food was delicious, the flavors well balanced and the mix of ingredients not necessarily a surprise. Servings were  too generous specially for the pasta dish and the corn soup. In both these dishes, they  were also to hot. I almost burned my tong.   Plating  is sometimes nice, sometimes leaving a feeling of something more or different should be done.  The atmosphere of the place sets the tone for a refine diner but the music chosen for this period’s theme, Woodstock, sometimes clashes with it all.  I really like our dinner, but contrary to other Michelin stars I have been to, I would not run over for a next time.   Good continuation to the chef and his charming wife and tks for the chef’s own chocolate as a going away present.More

title: One of my favorite meals
review: What a pleasant surprise this little restaurant packs. The Woodstock theme was outstanding from the food to the music, it was spot on. Nina made us few like we were right at home. Every course was amazing. If you like a tasting menu and are...in Chicago this is a place you have to visit. I will be going back for sure. It is BYOB, so grab a good bottle of wine and get ready for a fantastic meal. Parking is around back but street parking is easy as well.More

title: Lovely!!
review: Fantastic place - small, beautiful quiet dining room run by a delightful husband and wife team - fabulous food and you can BYOB without corkage fee or order a bottle or half bottle from their specialty shop next door. Thoroughly enjoyed our leisurely 2.5 hour...beautiful and creative multi-course meal!More

title: Amazing very special
review: Food was amazing! A very special experience. Service was terrific. Loved hearing all the details of how everything was prepared and what the thought process was. Restaurant is expensive but worth it. We paired the wine with the food and it was special

title: Great food with creative presentation
review: The food is still as tasty as it was when we visited years ago. Glad to see the quality hasn’t changed.   Nina is warm, friendly and carefully taking care of us.   It was a great tonight to dine with the family.

title: One of the best anywhere.
review: This was my birthday dinner. And to say it was excellent is an understatement. The tastes, the presentations, the nine courses, the sights, the delights at what were eating, the wonderful service, and the ambience were superb. The cost was not out of line for...the amount of preparation and work which went into each dish. The basis of comparison for future fine dining experiences.More

title: Restaurant decline perhaps associated w new store...
review: Went to Goose Foot for an important celebration this weekend.  As a hostess who has brought others to this restaurant for important celebrations in the past (and therefore talked it up to my current guest), I was embarrassed.  As a foodie who paid a substantial...price for the meal, I was very disappointed. This is not a personal criticism; Nina is a lovely hostess... My only guess is that the couple's endeavor to create a little shop next store and Chris' stated passion to create a "chocolate lab" has depleted resources, such that the restaurant has suffered. The scallops and corn crab soup were good; the pasta was average (expected better); the beef was just okay; the pink peppercorn dish was completely out of balance, the coffee dessert (which I think was supposed to be panna cotta?) was way too thick. In general, portion sizes were off. Oddly, the special toppings (e.g., froth on the soup and dessert) were more something you had to work your way through to get to the dish, rather than serving as a complement to the dish in terms of flavor.  The central theme of Woodstock would have been okay if it made sense; but it didn't (e.g., small cow figurines and colored paper trees??) One of the dishes arrived on a platter for 2 with a 3-D bumblebee made of paper in the center; the meaning of the bee was entirely lost on both me and my guest, and again, just odd. It felt as though they were using old ideas and presentations without putting in the time to be properly thoughtful about the meal as a whole (portions, presentations, flavors) or about making a cohesive story of the theme.  It would seem better to just not have a theme than to keep referring to one that doesn't come through (i.e., make sense). My guest is a foodie too and so, I was in the awkward position of having to acknowledge that the food and presentation were not up to par because they clearly just were not. I think it would be helpful for the owners to either streamline their side businesses so as not to detract from the restaurant or to hire someone to think more carefully about the menu before they lose their local good standing.More

The cost was not out of line for...the amount of preparation and work which went into each dish. The basis of comparison for future fine dining experiences.More

title: Restaurant decline perhaps associated w new store...
review: Went to Goose Foot for an important celebration this weekend.  As a hostess who has brought others to this restaurant for important celebrations in the past (and therefore talked it up to my current guest), I was embarrassed.  As a foodie who paid a substantial...price for the meal, I was very disappointed. This is not a personal criticism; Nina is a lovely hostess... My only guess is that the couple's endeavor to create a little shop next store and Chris' stated passion to create a "chocolate lab" has depleted resources, such that the restaurant has suffered. The scallops and corn crab soup were good; the pasta was average (expected better); the beef was just okay; the pink peppercorn dish was completely out of balance, the coffee dessert (which I think was supposed to be panna cotta?) was way too thick. In general, portion sizes were off. Oddly, the special toppings (e.g., froth on the soup and dessert) were more something you had to work your way through to get to the dish, rather than serving as a complement to the dish in terms of flavor.  The central theme of Woodstock would have been okay if it made sense; but it didn't (e.g., small cow figurines and colored paper trees??) One of the dishes arrived on a platter for 2 with a 3-D bumblebee made of paper in the center; the meaning of the bee was entirely lost on both me and my guest, and again, just odd. It felt as though they were using old ideas and presentations without putting in the time to be properly thoughtful about the meal as a whole (portions, presentations, flavors) or about making a cohesive story of the theme.  It would seem better to just not have a theme than to keep referring to one that doesn't come through (i.e., make sense). My guest is a foodie too and so, I was in the awkward position of having to acknowledge that the food and presentation were not up to par because they clearly just were not. I think it would be helpful for the owners to either streamline their side businesses so as not to detract from the restaurant or to hire someone to think more carefully about the menu before they lose their local good standing.More

title: great food
review: this restaurant has great food.  hence the 5 star review.  but I do think they are pushing the limits with a $135 menu with the dumpy space they're still in.  Low ceilings, blah decor.  Menu barely changes.  Does not seem like their sourcing is local....More

title: Wonderful personal experience
review: Had a wonderful meal at Goosefoot recently. 9 delicious courses with not one bad course among them- all meticulously plated and absolutely delicious. It is also BYOB with no corkage fee which is nice as well. The best part of it was the personal touch...More

title: Amazing food, endearing owners and a dash of luck for a reservation!

title: Amazing
review: This is the second time I've been here. Has been unbelievable both times. Great food. Great staff. We just keep making a new reservation every time we go. It's a great experience all around.

title: Pretty much flawless (and still fun)
review: If you're planning a trip to Chicago, see if you can get a booking at Goosefoot.   It's a refreshing fine dining experience with an emphasis on elaborate and artistic dishes but without any of the pretentiousness that so often accompanies this kind of food. The...More

title: An Extraordinary dining experience; If you are a Foodie, this should be at the top of your list!!!
review: Dined with three friends last night.  The quality of each of the nine courses was excellent.  The creative food combinations and meticulous plating puts this restaurant at the top of my list.  With respect to food, the attention to detail was remarkable.  The service was...More

title: Nine Delicisious Courses in a Homey Setting
review: It seems a little ironic to say that a nine course tasting memo at $115 is a steal. But it is. Each dish is a surprise and each one is delicious. The portion size is just right so that one is not full to bursting.And...More

title: CULINARY ARTISTRY
review: The chance to experience this unique and recent arrival onto the Chicago fine dining scene was arranged by my son and wife for his mother's 65th. Our party of 7 was most graciously greeted at the door on a busy Friday (booked weeks in advance...More

title: Heaven in every bite!
review: Having eaten here three times since it opened in December, 2011, I urge everyone who loves fine food to beat a path to this Lawrance Avenue gem!  BYOB with an eight-course fixed menu lovingly created by the talented young chef Chris Nugent.  Wife Nina graciously...More

title: So good I'm still thinking about it after a week!
review: Arguably one of the most unique meals I've had in the last few years. After seeing all these raving reviews and numerous people talking about this place on Chowhound, I decided that this place was next on our radar when we visited the Chicago area....More

title: Solid Flavors, Beautiful and Complex Plates
review: My wife and I ate here on a Thursday night.  I would definitely recommend this experience to a friend.  Pros:   11 courses of creative, delicious food -- some flavor themes cleverly repeated through the menu, going from savory to sweet. Incredible desserts Amazing presentations Cool,...More

title: Thinking about it makes me smile.
review: Completely subjective review... Food and service were executed at a seasoned professional level  with just the right amount of personality at the table without detracting from the star, the food! Familiar haute cuisine flavors infused with the right dose of experimental cuisine which paired with...More

title: Awe-inspiring from start to finish
review: In support of this review's title: 1. The chef's wife doubles as hostess and makes you feel right at home. 2. The dining room is intimate yet friendly; you can talk to your fellow diners and enjoy your meal without the stuffy silence that accompanies...More

title: Fantastic - worth every penny
review: I'm not one to dine at places like this very often, but after eating here I have to say it was one of the best dining experiences I've had just about anywhere.  Everything here is geared towards not detracting from the food - from the...More

title: "grand opening" indeed!
review: Just when I thought Chicago had enough great restaurants to keep us busy, up pops Goosefoot. What a fabulous evening. For just opening, we were all totally amazed. The front end is skillfully directed by the chef's wife. Nothing escaped her watchful eye. She really...More

title: Quiet, lovely, excellent food
review: We have eaten here many times and keep coming back. The atmosphere is lovely,  the simple dishes are cooked perfectly and the sauces are amazing.

title: Nothing special
review: took friends here for dinner based on positive reviews. I would not say the food was bad (and the friend having the pork and another having the chicken really enjoyed them) but my hangar steak and my wife's trout were very unexceptional. I suspect my...dish came out first and had to sit around until the other dishes were ready as both the steak and the frites were cold when they arrived and everyone else's food was appropriately hot. The other problem was that the oil in which the frites were cooked was old, so the potatoes were very dark and oily tasting. When I asked for hot frites, the server quickly brought another plate of hot, but equally dark and greasy fries. For the price, this seemed like a pretty basic screw-up. Cocktails were weak and expensive. Desserts were good. Overall, I'd say this was not a terrible place, but for the money you can do MUCH better elsewhere. We won't be coming back.More

title: Thanksgiving Dinner Kit to Die For!
review: We ordered the Thanksgiving kit for 4 people, although there were only two of us, and we were thrilled to have the leftovers for dinner the next night.  OMG OMG OMG was this dinner fabulous!!! Every single component was stellar. The turkey, both white and...dark meat, was perfectly cooked and juicy; the brioche stuffing with pork belly was to DIE for (and made the house smell like a bakery); the gravy was so delicious that we made it last throughout the week and used it on shredded chicken; the Yukon Gold mashed potatoes were amazing; the green bean casserole fabulous, the brussel sprouts with bacon delectable. And then, to top it all off, the most AMAZING pumpkin pie you can imagine, fluffy, creamy, and topped with oodles of chantilly cream (and I don't usually even LIKE pumpkin pie!). The cooking instructions were clear and easy enough for me to follow, which means pretty darned easy. CAN WE ORDER THIS DINNER KIT EVERY WEEK???  It will be super-tough to go back to our usual post-Covid family thanksgiving because we'll be dreaming of this meal!   Hoping for a great Christmas dinner kit...More

title: Perfect Corona Friendly Anniversary
review: We really wanted to celebrate our anniversary but would only dine outside so we went internet hunting for the best outdoor dining. We happened upon Bistro Campagne as an option. Upon further review it looked like it would fit the bill perfectly with a nice...French bistro menu and cute/romantic patio area.  When we arrived it was great that we didn't even have to enter the building. They have their own gate to a cute courtyard. There were pretty flowers and little lights. Our server was appropriately masked. I had put on my reservation that it was our anniversary and we were greeted with flutes of complementary champagne! It was a great touch and just the right way to kick off our night.  Our food was terrific as were our cocktails! I went classic French with escargots, steak frites and creme brulee. All in all a pretty perfect night. We can't wait to go back!More

title: Great food, great service!
review: All great!  Have been going here for many years - and othan Kiki's River North, it is our favorite restaurant!

title: Cozy French Country Place
review: A place which you may find in the French countryside on a road trip through Bourgogne, slightly worn, a little eclectic, but good. Service was pleasant, sound level allows for conversation, the food is classic French fare, however not outstanding. The hangar steak was an...excellent cut of meat in a sauce which was slightly too sweet, the bouillabaisse was very good, the beef tartar should be more authentic and display the color, taste and smell of fresh, high quality beef and not trying to hide it. Overall a pleasant experience, expensive.More

title: Food a disappointment
review: Bistro Campagne in a charming space broken up into different areas and includes, weather permitting, a nice outdoor space.  Out server, Ryan, and all the support staff were great.  We had memories of good meals here a long time ago and were looking forward to...our return. The food was not good.  Our escargot had no flavor and the whitefish and hangar steaks were overly salty.  The fries were mushy.  Cocktails were weak and the wine by the glass offerings were just ok. Even with a table of sweet lovers no one wanted to even try the desserts. Prices for such poor quality fare seemed high.More

title: Very nice meal
review: Bistro Campagne is one of our favorite Chicago neighborhood places. The atmosphere is always inviting and the food excellent. We love to take new people to the restaurant. The other night we had mussels and the steak tartare for appetizers, and duck and fish for...our main courses. All were delicious. Thanks again for another great meal.More

title: A so-so French bistro
review: This was a pleasant place with a varied menu and reasonable prices. But the main problem was that bacon was a component of virtually every dish. This made each dish too salty and rich. Although the portions were average in size, none of the three...of us could finish our dishes, and we all left feeling a little sick.More

title: Still a special place
review: We dined here on a cold December Sunday and again had a warm, delightful dinner. My friend had escargot and Amish chicken, and I had the beet&goat cheese app and trout. The goat cheese came as a warm, melty ball of goodness  All dishes were...delicious (and even though I don't like escargot, I did dip my bread into the tasty sauce.  The atmosphere is upscale, yet very comfortable. Bistro will be on my itinerary again, next time I visit Chicago.More

title: Family dinner
review: This restaurant is in Lincoln Square, close to my daughter’s house. My daughter and her family had dinner at the restaurant on Labor Day.  The place is elegant, with soft music, and quiet, good for nice conversation. The service was excellent.  The food was very...well prepared and delicious. I had the Amish chicken and it was one of the best chicken I have had, we also had beef and fish, all of them very good. I had a glass of white wine suggested by the waitress which was excellent.More

title: Lacking something
review: I liked everything about the restaurant.  The setting is beautiful.  The service was great.  The menu was good.  The prices were reasonable.  Unfortunately the food lacked something.  The favor was not as rich as I was expecting.  The mushrooms with the salmon didn't add anything...to the flavor of the dish.  The trout was good but not great and the steak was a little chewy.  The best dish at our table was the chicken.  I would recommend the peach/goat cheese soup.More

title: Amazing dinner and okay dessert
review: We were here the other night for dinner and the food is just spectacular. Reminds me so much of being in France, the atmosphere and decor is really on point. Wine was also good. Dessert we could have s done without, it just wasn’t that...impressive (had the lemon tart).More

title: The real French deal and then some
review: A great atmosphere at this French bistro with a small but interesting menu and the option of a couple of daily specials.  We shared a plate of charcuterie which included excellent pork rillettes, followed by a classic salad Lyonnaise.  I then ordered the trout and...my wife had a scallop dish.  Both cooked to perfection.  We finished by sharing their delicious lemon tart.  They have a nice selection of well-priced wines.  It was a busy Saturday night and we couldn't get a table in their very pleasant patio without a long wait as outdoor tables are first-come, first-served, but we were seated almost immediately at a table next to an open window, which was almost as good.  The service was very attentive and not in the least intrusive.  When my wife made the reservation she mentioned it was an anniversary and after we were seated they offered us a complimentary glass of bubbly each.  What a nice touch!More

title: Relaxingly Deliscious
review: The awesome patio contributed to a relaxing experience with wonderful food and service.  Emily was attentive, knowledgeable, attentive without being overbearing.  Appetizer, entrees, and accompaniments were fresh, perfectly prepared, nicely presented, and thoroughly enjoyable.  We were never rushed and look forward to returning.

review: We have eaten here many times and keep coming back. The atmosphere is lovely,  the simple dishes are cooked perfectly and the sauces are amazing.

title: Good quality, but uneven
review: I have eaten here since it opened. The original Chef passed on a few years ago. This is in my neighborhood so I continue to visit it but often find something lacking. On the last visit I found the use of Dente baby carrots in...More

title: Great ambiance, simply ok food...
review: As I said in the title the ambience is absolutely fantastic here. We ordered two appetizers, two meals and house wine. The escargot for one of the appetizers was absolutely the worst I have ever had. The escargot itself was completely bland.  The escargot garlic...More

title: excellent food
review: Came weekday evening so they werent too busy. They have some interesting items like .  caramelized onion strudel which was really fantastic. The pork chop was probably one of the best I've had in years, large on the bone, very very tender yet cooked through...More

title: Very popular restaurant in Ravenswood area
review: Four of us went to this restaurant on a Friday night.  Was it busy!  But our reservation was honored, and we were seated against a wall that blocked out a lot of the ambient noise allowing us to talk to each other without straining.  Tables...More

title: Great organic French food.
review: I'm always looking for the perfect French restaurant (other than in Paris). Bistro Campagne in Lincoln Square is one of my favorites. I can count on a meal made with superlative ingredients, locally sourced, and many of the French bistro favorites. It's a favorite place...More

title: Great ambiance
review: Went there for restaurant week, I have been there before and really like the atmosphere and the food, this time however i found the boef too salty and coffee was bitter, probably burnt. The server was nice and attentive young lady,  the person who brought...More

title: Just what I wanted
review: This  French bistro serving classic dishes was perfect for two couples meeting up for dinner on a cold winter's night.  We were shown to a room in the back where  the noise level allowed us to converse easily, especially before the room filled up around...More

title: Delicious French Dining in Chicago
review: My husband and I went to Bistro Campagne for a casual anniversary dinner at the end of December. The atmosphere was very intimate and cozy, enhanced by their holiday decor.  Our waitress was very nice and incredibly enthusiastic. The food was a bit on the...More

title: Anniversary dinner
review: What a great gem! We were lucky to get a table in one of their patios - beautifully lit with strings of lights on a summer night. Food and service was spot on.

title: Authentic French food.
review: Casual but elegant - great menu, offer authentic traditional French fare.  Great service- fun atmosphere - intimate but not with elbow room.  Nice lighting. I had the trout- excellent.

title: Inconsistent
review: There were four for dinner and half of what we ordered was quite good but half was mediocre. Steak fries excellent, pork chop ordinary as was vegetarian entree of potato galette and brussel sprout salad ( which I would give 2 stars).  Wine list quite...More

title: local French Bistro Lincoln Park
review: This restaurant was recommended by a waiter the night before when we asked where would you go in Chicago to eat if you only had one night. He asked if we liked French and recommended this great Bistro in the north side. We started to...More

title: Classic Fare in Cozy Atmosphere
review: Warmly attentive service, beautiful French offerings in a charming and comfortable space.  We came in early with reservations and left before it got too crowded and loud. The drinks and dinner are solid. Tables are a bit too crowded for comfort. When the place fills...More

title: Lovely atmosphere
review: We ate here with friends after a weary plane ride but the restaurant soothed our souls!    It really feels like a French bistro.  Our party ate snails, onion strudel, steak tartare, spinach with garlic chips, duck - and of course a couple of pommes frites!...More

title: Great outdoor dining - even better food
review: When you think of outdoor dining in Chicago, you think of streetside with all of the ambient noise. Not at this place. The outdoor dining is in a courtyard (actually 2). Ask for the back courtyard. Great ambiance.   But it was the food that stood...More

title: Moules
review: On a warm evening an aperol is a fine start. Enjoyed a mixed veggie platter and then moules and fries. The moules were nicely prepared, but the fries were soft, not to say soggy and a second order was a bit better, but in both...More

title: Birthday dinner
