review: We were in Chicago visiting family during Christmas week and discovered this jewel in Lincoln Square for our Christmas Eve dinner.  What a home run!!  This is a French style bistro all the way  (well, except for the English spoken).  A lovely European village style...More

title: Back to Paris!
review: It has been several years since we have been here and we were remiss in using distance as an excuse…what a treat! We had an early reservation because of an event at the Old Town School of Folk Music and were seated at an intimate...More

title: Excellence is the norm
review: With friends from out of the country, new neighbors from down street or just a cozy dear heart, one can be slowly drawn into the nexus of excellence behind the doors of Bistro Campagne.   In this disarmingly charming atmosphere, I finally gave up having expectations...More

title: Hmm...French food?
review: French food is exquisite...what a pity it isn't illegal. Did you ever taste French food? Not just eat it, but taste it? You can't taste the beauty and energy of the earth after a few minutes in a microwave. At Bistro Campagne when they serve...More

title: Friendly and consistent
review: We live in the neighborhood and over the years Bistro Campagne has become our go to place for a nice evening out.  We've celebrated our anniversary there several times and find that it is an intimate, relaxed environment with great classic french bistro fare.  This...More

title: Small Intimate Delicious Restaurant
review: Went here after reading TA reviews. Was a great little neighborhood restaurant with a pay to park lot across the street. Perfect. Sometimes when you venture out into the neighborhoods of Chicago you can never find parking. They have a small but great menu and...More

title: Consistently Marvelous
review: I travel to Chicago 2-3 times a year. And every visit, I book a table at Bistro Campagne where I meet a few of my old friends. We love this place! The ambiance is super (especially in summer in the courtyard) and the food is...More

title: Mussels, Glorious Mussels
review: I have reviewed this restaurant in the past, but felt impelled to write another based on its “Bottomless Mussels” promotion offered on Tuesdays. Since Tuesday was our wedding anniversary and Bistro Campagne is like taking a trip to France without leaving the city, we chose...More

title: French Flair
review: Wonderful intimate little bistro. Great neighborhood, lots of shops, restaurants, activities going on. Found easy parking on street. The menu was a great French array and done very well. Wine list was also quite satisfactory. Had the escargots, the onion soup and a goat cheese...More

title: Still a star
review: After the death of the owner, I was concerned.  But his wife and staff have stepped up and kept up the high standards.  Excellent food.  Superb wine list

title: Not to be missed.
review: I simply cannot say about Bistro Campagne. Great food, attentive service and reasonable wine list. Keep an eye out for special events.

title: Wonderful French Bistro
review: This charming and romantic Lincoln Square bistro has two great outdoor spaces. The food and service are both outstanding. The roast chicken is the best in Chicago. The beef cheek special was awesome. This is a restaurant not to be missed.

title: Cute place we just fell upon

review: Driven by dozens of times and finally stopped in.  Gorgeous interior and very romantic/quaint dining spaces inside and out.  Outdoors is nice on an beautiful evening, however traffic noise on both the sidewalk and Lincoln Ave can be busy if you're not use to it....More

title: Great service, tasty French fare

title: Miam!
review: Good service, good food, a very cool place for a familly brunch!! That's so bad, we must pay the parking in the street...

review: The food is excellent and authentic and locally grown (as much as possible).  I had a very tasty duck breast with almonds.  My wife had a vegetarian crepe that she really enjoyed.   The servers were attentive and the many small rooms and patios were welcoming....More

title: Best French restaurant in Chicago
review: I've been to Kiki's and Mon Ami (both are very good), and a few other forgettable French restaurants in Chicago. In my opinion, Bistro Campagne serves the best French cuisine in Chicago. It's a quaint little neighborhood restaurant in Chicago's Lincoln Square neighborhood. Terrific wine...More

title: No "Finer Diner" in Chicago
review: Glenn's Diner is like no other. I didn't believe it until I saw it for myself. It's a seafood restaurant with a patio that offers 16 varieties of fresh fish, some from Hawaii, and 25 brands of cereal for all-day breakfast. To call it a...diner is a gross misrepresentation. In my day, a diner was known as a "greasy spoon," a hamburger joint. Sit at the counter and watch the chef flip burgers on a grill. Located at 1820 West Montrose Avenue in Chicago's Ravenswood neighborhood, at Honore, between Ashland and Damen, Glenn's Diner prides itself on New England clam chowder with bacon and key lime pie, testimony to its sea-going motif. Open from 4 to 8 on Tuesday and Wednesday, 11 to 8 on Thursday and Friday, 10 to 9 on Saturday and 10 to 8 on Sunday, this is the kind of restaurant you'd expect to find on a Florida beach. I came for Glenn's cheeseburger consisting of a house-made half-pound of certified Angus beef with lettuce, tomato, American cheese and 1,000 Island dressing on a sesame seed bun and the blackened swordfish sandwich with tartar sauce, lettuce, tomato and onion on a buttered bun. But I was blown away by the list of fresh fish, each served with potato and vegetables. My wife's favorites are grouper and mahi mahi. My favorites are Alaskan halibut and whitefish. The list also includes swordfish, pretzel crusted walleye, rainbow trout, lake trout, Scottish salmon, yellow fin tuna, red snapper, Dover Sole, Columbia River sturgeon, Arctic char, sea scallop, catfish, yellow lake perch, lobster and Alaskan King crab legs. Start with gorgonzola garlic bread and coconut shrimp. The hard part is to choose which fish you prefer. If you have a hunger for fresh fish, there is no "Finer Diner" than Glenn's.More

title: Wonderful seafood and excellent service
review: Our second visit here. This time to celebrate Mother's Day and a birthday.  We have enjoyed everything we have ordered. Cioppino, calimari, catfish, and Seagood Bisque Fettuccini. Moscow Mule is good, too!

title: Great Fish in an Unusual Setting
review: Glenn’s Diner on Montrose Ave in Chicago is unusual- many boxes of sugar cereal on the wall and known for great breakfast, but at night it is a fish emporium.  On both walls the available fish varieties with their sauces and accompaniments are written in...large print.  Many, many fish options from Walleye to Trout and everything in between including seafood pastas, soups, etc.  The fish was very good, I had Arctic Char with a mildly spicy shrimp sauce, others had the seafood pasta or bronzini (eg branzino) with lentils.  All of the fish were good, the accompaniments were pretty basic- fingerling potatoes, vegetables.  Good service, mellow atmosphere, and fun interior.More

title: A shadow of its former slef
review: Before a dispute over ownership some years back Glenn's was our favorite seafood restaurant.  Last night, after a long hiatus, we returned. To say that we were disappointed is an understatement. The menu is basically the same (but see below), but the prices are much...higher.  My favorite dish in the past was the lake perch, which was sauteed in butter and garlic. It was truly one of the best seafood dishes I have ever eaten anywhere.  Not so last night. The perch seem to have been deep fried, although the menu described the preparation as dipped in flour and pan fried.  What I was served was heavily breaded and cooked to death.  I left most of it on the plate.  Another member of our party had the halibut, which looked, and which was described by her as dry.  A third at our table had the ruby red trout which was cooked well and very tasty.  We waited slightly longer than usual for our food to be served, and when it was served it was not hot.  The perch is served with a very nice garlic butter which I asked for on the side. The perch and accompanying broccoli were not hot enough to melt the butter.  Overall I would not recommend the "new" Glenn's and I will not be returning.More

title: Casual dinner with my daughter and son-in-law
review: Being from the west Texas town of El Paso, I visit my family in Chicago regularly. This was my second visit to Glenn's Diner and it was as enjoyable as the first. Service was fast and the food was excellent. I had the crab cake...appetizer, linguini with shrimp, and key lime pie.More

title: Tuesday is for Tasty Crab Legs
review: If you love Alaskan King crab legs and want to take a friend or a loved one out for a special treat, consider Glenn's on a Tuesday night. It's bottomless Alaskan King crab legs. It's the "Deadliest Catch" brought right to Chicago's Northside!  You get...a small helping of coleslaw and a half corn on the cob. If you want more of  the sides, they'll bring you more. You will need to make reservations for the crab special.  I called Monday afternoon and got my preferred time.  But...only partake in the crab night special with those you care about deeply...for 3 of us and 3 sodas (no alcohol and before tip)the total price was $274.00. Glenn's ain't cheap!More

title: Lunch cioppino for $17.95
review: As you can see I have been here many times mostly for lunch. I love this place for my favorite lunch cioppino for only $17.95, which is quite tasty and filling. I started with my gonzo bloody mary for $11.99. A champagne mimosa is also...$11.99. I was here with my family of four. We all love this place.  My total bill less gratuities was $167. Our server Hector accommodated our table nicely. We will continue to return here for lunch.More

title: Fresh seafood in the neighborhood
review: What a delight to stumble on the neighborhood treat. Small and unpretentious but a full menu of well prepared fresh seafood. From tuna tartare and coconut shrimps and mussels as appetizers to a menu board full of seafood with diverse and delightful sauces.  Salmon to...lobster fettuccine to whitefish to Australia barramundi and too many to list. Give it a try, I’m sure you’ll like it.  And for those for whom fish is not at the top, they have a selection that includes baby back ribs, NY strip steak, salads and much more.  At reasonable neighborhood prices.  And breakfast too which I look forward to trying.More

title: Glenn’s is a GO
review: I love this family of restaurants, Glenn’s Diner and Seafood House and Fahlstrom’s Fresh Fish Market know what people want! I take my out of town friends to at least one when visiting Chicago!  Glenn’s is your typical badass diner plus super fresh &tasty seafood....Breakfast served every day with additional brunch options on weekends only. Seafood specials run Tues, Wed, Thurs.  At Glenn’s, you can eat cereal all day long, they have a huge wall of some 20+ cereal options to add on your meal! Great for kiddos (and adults)! The blackboard menu is outstanding and vast. There’s something for everyone! With all the appetizers, fresh fish options, and diner dinners- you’ll be having a feast.  I love the ahi tuna, scallops and the swordfish, and crab cakes, but I would eat ANY of the seafood options they offer. Everything looks fantastic. The dinner meals are huge and pretty much perfect for a diner, some of my favorites are the spaghetti & meatballs, ribs, and jambalaya.  There’s also a large selection of salads and sandwiches on the menu.More

title: Glenn's Diner: Our love is seafood
review: The back wall of Glenn's Diner & Seafood House is decorated with counter-to-ceiling boxes of sugared cereals. In fact, all-you-can-eat-cereal is one of the restaurant's staples. And breakfast is served all day. But the primary attraction is seafood, fresh fish, even species that you've never...heard of, from Hawaii to Idaho, from Australia to Maryland, from Peru to Alaska, from Scotland to Tazmania, from Canada to the Gulf of Mexico, from the Arctic to the Great Lakes. Located at 1820 West Montrose Avenue on Chicago's Northwest Side, in the Ravenswood neighborhood, Glenn's Diner was created from a desire to re-invent the diner. They advertise the "best New England clam chowder west of the Atlantic Ocean" and the "best shrimp cocktail in the world." They also prepare over 16 fish items daily. "More than any other restaurant in Chicago," they claim. And it's fresh, flown in daily from here, there and everywhere. As an advocate of a more fish/less meat diet, I can only attest to one thing: Glenn's Diner prepares a lot of fish, some I've never heard of before, but it's all fresh and delicious. It's fun to try new items, like Columbia River Sturgeon, Gonzo Tiger Shrimp, Blue Striped Marlin, Tazmanian King Salmon, Mako Shark, Hawaiian Ruby Red Tuna, Australian Silver Barramundi and Big Mamou Peruvian Blue. Most of the time, however, my wife and I prefer old favorites, like Mahi Mahi, Scottish salmon, Dover Sole, Idaho rainbow trout, Alaskan halibut, red snapper, striped sea bass and Lake perch. With a cup of New England clam chowder with bacon, a shrimp cocktail, grilled chicken Caesar salad, creamy cole slaw and Sunrise medley potatoes. If you like fish--remember, it's good for your health--Glenn's Diner is a go-to destination.More
