review: Our daughter found this place by searching for restaurants near the Mercury theater on Southport.  We arrived just before 8:00 PM on a Saturday and even though the place was completely full, we managed to get a table right by the front door after someone...More

title: All you can eat king crab legs on Tuesday
review: One word . . wow!  Great menu!  Excellent service. I loved this restaurant!  The King Crab Legs were succulent and worth every penny!

title: Huge menu and great service
review: Go for the fresh fish!   The options are plentiful and posted on blackboards on either side of the dining room.  I have eaten at Glenn's before and enjoyed the food tremendously.   I had a pretzel coated walleye this trip which was cooked to perfection but...More

title: Fantastic Brunch
review: Service was outstanding!!  The food was delicious, and the mimosas were so tasty, as were the Bloody Marys.  I'd recommend this place for brunch to anyone, and I'm looking forward to going back to try some seafood.

title: Yummmm..Seafood!
review: Delicious fish and there are SO many options that are constantly changing!  The place is tiny, but they do offer some outdoor seating in the summer.  Be prepared to wait a long time for a table during prime hours.  Oh, and they also have all...More

title: Good Food, Horrible Service
review: The food was excellent as always.  Our server thought he was too cool for school with his ivy league cap and lazy attitude.  For example when we asked why the Halibut had been removed from the menu he felt it necessary to make up a...More

title: New Owner, Great Food, Service?
review: It has been quite a while since we have been to Glen’s Diner and we had heard that the ownership had changed.  So, we really did not know what to expect.  As with any big change we did see a bit of a difference. First...More

title: Amazing variety, quality and value
review: Glenn's has a big diner menu, including breakfast all day, but they also have a huge selection of seafood which is prepared and presented creatively.  The clam chowder is awesome.  I had the Walleye Pike, which is coated in chopped pretzels and pan fried.  Everything...More

title: Great Fish
review: I had one of the best cups of claim chowder ever.  In addition, I had the grouper which had a very nice crust on it, keeping it very moist on the body of the fish. Very fresh.  The grilled asparagus was a very nice side...More

title: Diner hits the spot
review: We chose this place because of its having been on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. We were headed from the South Side to Evanston and this was more or less on the in Montrose. We did not have much problem finding street parking during our lunch...More

title: Great selection,  fun atmosphere.
review: Glenns has good, fresh fish and a nice, casual atmosphere.   It is a little pricey for such a casual place.   But there is always a great menu to choose from.

title: Great sea food a surprise
review: Some of best sea food in Chicago. You can also get cereal,pancakes etc. a fabulous blend with hard to find fish gems expertly done.  You will not be sorry

title: New England clam chowder in the midwest?
review: Best New England style clam chowder in Chicago. No, wait, best I've had!  Chioppino was great as was the catfish and walleye pike.  They take reservations.  Funky decor.  All over good experience.  Would recommend.

title: I mean really great food!
review: I had dinner at Glenn’s Diner the other night. It was fantastic. They have over 15 types of fresh fish and have an interesting menu which serves breakfast and lunch items. I think many folks come for the fish dishes. They prepare their food with...More

title: Glenn's Diner - Don't bother
review: We were regular diners at Glenn's until tonight.   Six of us had dinner tonight.  Only five of us received our hot entrees...the sixth was a cold salad and was not delivered to our table until after all hot entrees were eaten!!  Our waiter reported back...More

title: All you can eat crab legs!!!
review: Six of us dined on a Tuesday for the all you can eat king crab legs. We were not disappointed!!! Be sure you make reservations and come hungry!!! Good service and they kept the crab legs coming. There are other dining choices, for those who...More

title: Not worth the hype.
review: Had a reservation for 630. Seated right away.  Gorgonzola garlic bread ap was ok, not great.  Diner's good but not anything out of the ordinary. Pie rather dull. And then, before we had even finished our dessert our waiter told us that the hostess needed...More

title: Horrible smug service.
review: Went here with my husband, our daughter, and three friends, the hostess sat us quickly. The bussers came over quickly and even had some fun passing conversation. Server server server??? Three nope four servers all around and no one comes by for fifteen minutes to...More

title: Awesome Place for Breakfast
review: Over the top friendly staff. Great breakfast menu. Right on the El. Great atmosphere. We were on a tour of Drive Ins Diners and Dives in Chicago and this was my favourite place. We didn't have lunch or dinner, but it looks like they have an amazing sea food menu as well. Next time we are back in Chicago we will visit again.

title: Best adult meal we had in Chicago
review: We took the train from the city to try this place. I ordered the Halibut with a horseradish blue cheese. My husband ordered the sturgeon with a sherry sauce. Both of them we're cooked to perfection. We also ordered the shrimp gargot appetizer. Another two thumbs up. The problems I encountered were the lapse in service and the size of the kids meal. My two girls ages 10 and 12 ordered a grilled cheese and hamburger. They each got a half sandwich with no chips or fries. They were still hungry after they ate, which to me is a huge no, no. Our server was pleasant but unaware of dirty plates on our table and refills that were needed. I would go again but they need some training for their staff and better choices for he kids.

title: Really...
review: Went for breakfast this morning. Had reservations for 11:00. We ordered Kids French Toast which according to my grandson was "Great". My husband ordered three eggs over hard, ham and whole wheat toast, I ordered a seasonal vegetable frittata. Got our meal in about 20 minutes. Another person delivered the meal, not our waitress. My husbands eggs were over easy not over hard, no toast. My Frittata, the eggs were burnt and the veggies were undercooked. Our waitress never came over or came close enough for us to ask that it be corrected. Finally she shows up after we are done. I told her just FYI my husbands egg were cooked wrong, no toast and my eggs were burnt and the veggies were undercooked. She looked at me and said "OK Thank You, would you like your Frittata to take home. I only could eat a 1/8 of it, it was so bad. UGH really why would I want to take something home that I couldn't eat because it was BURNT! It would have been nice to get an apology and maybe a discount. But NO that didn't happen, so I write this review to warn others. What a disappointment. Was planning on going for dinner, think we have changed our minds.

title: Great Breakfast!
review: Pancakes & Omelette were DELICIOUS!  cute, cozy, intimate atmosphere.  Service was great.  Super excited to try for dinner, looked like there was a great fish selection.  Can't go wrong with the breakfast here (wasn't so fond of the potatoes ;0)

title: great seafood, good service and prices
review: We have tried to go here before without a reservation but didn't want to wait an hour so we booked this time. The server was very knowledgeable, the wine prices are good with only what looked to be 100% mark up and the seafood is plentiful and well priced. We had the char, coba and the bass. All were prepared well, presented well and tasted great. The chowder was outstanding. I can't wait to go back. The bonus is we found out you can bring your own wine for a $5 charge which is a bargain.

title: Best we have found
review: Never fail to visit this small diner and never fail to be impressed with food and service.  Great fish choices.  Catfish not farmed, and all reasonably priced

title: Freshest Seafood in Chicago!
review: Glenn's Diner is awesome. I've been there several times and never had a bad meal. From Brunch to Dinner everything and anything is good. Very casual atmosphere, casual but good service. Tuesday is all you can eat King Crab legs-amazing! The cereal wall is pretty tempting too!

title: Best Seafood in the Chicago area
review: Went to Glenn's Diner after seeing it on Food Network's "Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives". We we're visiting in the Evanston, Ill area and knew we had to pay a visit. We were not disappointed. The place is small, has only about 15 tables. We had reservations on a Wednesday night but there were always 1 or 2 empty tables so a walk-in would have been fine. Nevertheless I would get a reservation, especially on weekends. Because it was crowded, it was noisy but you can carry on a conversation.But the reason we went was becasue of the food and we were glad we did. The dinner menu is on two large blackboards on two sides of the room. There were at least 16 different seafood dinners (not counting appetizers), a boneless chop, spaghetti & meatballs, and ribs. I saw no poultry on the dinner menu. My family got the barramundi and swordfish and I got the cioppino. The cioppino was the best I have ever had & I've ordered it on the west and east coasts many times. The serving was huge (it really should be shared with someone else), had tons of seafood and just the right amount of zip. The other seafood was cooked perfectly. Our teenager finished off with the bananas foster and was deeply satsified. This is by far the best seafood restaurant in the Chicago area. It is right next to the Montrose exit of the Brown "L" line so you can get to it from any place in town without any problems. Come prepared for excellent food at very reasonable prices.

title: Huge Fan of this Place!
review: This is really a fun place to go. The fish is fantastic and very fresh, but they run out of it quickly as they only have a limited qty so make sure to go early in the evening. The clam chowder is fantastic which they always have. Keep in mind this place still has diner status, so it is not fancy, it is casual and they serve cereal...Reservations recommended!

title: Excellent Fresh Fish-Preparation Needs Improvement
review: This was our second visit in past year while visiting from out of town. We love the convenience of the Brown line stop a block from the restaurant. The fish is very fresh. Excellent quality which is why we went back a second time. We were disappointed in the preparation of our dishes. The walleye pike had a heavy (as in chunky) pretzel breading. If the breading had been finer it might have been enjoyable but it covered the delightful flavor of the fish. The Artic Char was also very fresh but overpowered by a shrimp diablo sauce.Very disappointing given the prices ($18-28 an entree). Earlier last year when we ate there the first time we had no complaints. In fact we loved how the preparation seemed to complement the chosen fish.

title: Great Neighborhood Spot
review: My son and I walked over to Glenn's after seeing it on Triple D. Love the boxes of cereal displayed on the back wall and the overall feel as we walked in. Good basic foods with some seafood surprises. Very diverse offerings noted on the...More

title: Lively dive
review: Had a great time at Glenn's Diner!  They honored our reservation on a very crowded Friday night. Service was outstanding which made up for the mediocre main courses.  Appetizers were outstanding.  We had shrimp-kargot and calamari.  Seafood entrees were cooked perfectly but pasta entrees were...More

title: If you like seafood--this is the place!
review: Glen's diner is a unique place, you can get breakfast all day and excellent seafood for dinner.  We had 4 different seafood entrees and each of them wonderfully prepared.  Our waiter was very helpful and knew the menu very well.  I would advise making reservations...More

title: What to do on a day off
review: Well you could go to Grand for a bowl of  cereal but for me it has to be the fish always nice to be able to go somewhere with that has great service the waitresses new the menu very well just a great experience I...More

title: Awesome fresh Seafood!
review: We recently had dinner at Glenn's for the first time and it was awesome!  Being disciples of Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives; we have wanted to visit our son who lives close to Glenn's and we were not disappointed.  We were a party of six and...More

title: Awesome Seafood!
review: Glenn's Diner is one of those places that you would pass by then double backbecause the aroma is pulling you inside. The venue is small so make a reservation for dinner. The menu is written on chalk boards lining the walls and changes daily with...More

title: The White Whale
review: Seafood prepared perfectly. Service prompt and knowledgeable. Try the Lake Supsrior white fish. Small storefront under the el. Don't be put off by the location. Go to enjoy seafood prepared and served as it is meant to be. I'm picky and Live nearly three hundred...More

title: Great neighborhood place to eat
review: Glenn's Diner was a great experience. There is sidewalk seating and an attentive waitstaff.  But go there for the food - especially the fish.  The sturgeon dish is remarkably good. I ate at a top rated and very expensive downtown restaurant the night before and...More

title: Seafood haven
review: Triple D find. Convenient to Brown Line, steps from the Montrose stop. Wife had Barramundi and is still talking about it five days later. I had the halibut - kinda odd to have a horseradish sauce with it since it buried a light fish like...More

title: Very good.
review: Meaning to stop here since I saw it on Diner's Drive-In's and Dives. Really wanted to go for dinner but stopped for breakfast. Excellent service and the food was delicious. My choice was rather conservative. French toast with bacon. Served timely and "hot" which is...More

title: Great Seafood in the Windy City
review: This little treasure not far from Wrigleyville offers a tremendous selection of fresh seafood and a very friendly, attentive staff.  Be sure to make a reservation - the restaurant is not very large.

title: Fun night out and great food
review: Found Glenn's through Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. Really great seafood. Family of 5--enjoyed the walleye, arctic char, sturgeon, scallops, and trip. Maple-pecan pie was to die for. Great atmosphere and great service.

title: Clam Chowder Rivals Any-Calamari is the Best
review: Glenn's has a cool atmosphere that makes you want to order everything.  Their menu runs the gamut from fresh seafood to cold cereal, and the servers are great.  The big hit for us was the Clam Chowder.  Creamy, clammy, soothing, filling, and maybe better than...More

title: Great Neighborhood Spot
review: Great spot in the Wrigley Field area. Unique, colorful, but small dining room. Much more than a diner, but breakfast available at all time! Wonderful seafood selection, certainly one of the best in Chicago. Fresh ingredients, great tastes, creative selections. Wonderful desserts - save room....More

title: Excellent everything!
review: My husband and I went last week for lunch, after picking this place because it was featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives on the Food Network.  I wasn't sure what's the menu that was featured, but it was one of the best lunch I had...More

title: Chicago treat
review: Every trip to Chicago must include a meal at Glenn's Diner. Fantastic seafood! Love the scallops! The calamari is the best I've had anywhere. We always arrive mid afternoon and have no problem getting seated. My daughter loves the desserts! Looking forward to my next...More

title: Very Good
review: You cant go wrong here. They have a large menu or you can order off the blackboard which has about 50 more items that change with what's in season. We ordered off the blackboard. First, though, we had my reason for coming here-the best bloody...More

title: Great place to eat
review: Whenever I get to a different town, I try to check out the Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives places.  This is the best one that I have been to.  They do not mess around.  The wait staff is awesome, the food is spectacular, and the prices...More

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE Glenn's
review: Great seafood, staff is so much fun and so helpful when ordering.  They have by far the best Calamari I have ever had.  I usually am not a calamari fan, however, I tried some and wow totally blown away by the tenderness of the calamari....More

title: Long long wait for ordinary food.
review: We visited the restaurant on a Sunday about 11:30 we had a party of 5 which apparently is a problem with the small restaurants in Chicago.  We gave our name and was asked politely to move to the bar to wait for our table.  We...More

title: Not worth the trip
review: my blackened tilapia was good, but the rice and broccoli were horrible.  MaryAnn the server was just as horrible.  The $26 was just not worth it.

title: Glenn's Diner is on your must eat at list
review: 'For those of us who live in Chicago, we know it is worth the wait for dinner at Glenn's. Come here, bring your company here. Seafood prep is delicious. Kids love being able to eat cereal for dinner. Take the brown line right here. And...More

title: Still serving outstanding seafood and pleasing customers!
review: Had a second opportunity to dine at Glenn's--has been 7 months since our first visit to Chicago.   We wanted to see if they could wow us again with their food.  Wow!  Did they ever!!!!  Let me start with an unexpected recommendation.  Try their macaroni and...More

title: Amazing!!
review: If you love fish, this is the place to go!! Service was excellent!  Small ,casual but comfortable . Dining outside during the nicer weather.  Nice variety of food ... Something for everyone.. Especially fish lovers!  Clam chowder was like clam stew!!!

title: The Only Seafood Diner in Chicago
review: There's something terribly wrong with Glenn's Diner. I mean this is a diner serving primarily seafood, more than 16 different daily specials in the meat-and-potato Midwest United States. Are they out of their mind? This is almost unheard of in Chicago. And then they have...More

title: Yum!
review: Well worth the drive from suburbia (and we found free parking right around the corner).  Small, noisy, but a friendly neighborhood vibe and amazing food and service.  We had a reservation, but we waited about 15 minutes when the hostess approached us, apologized and offered...More

title: Worth the trip!
review: Visited in November with my two children after my daughter saw the wall of cereal on Diners, Drive Ins & Dives.  We took a cab in from Michigan Ave area and arrived just as they opened.  We were seated right away and the staff was...More

title: Awesome Seafood
review: My wife and I went to Glenn's Diner on New Year's Day 2012.  Glenn's has a cool diner vibe with a wall of cereal behind the bar and two huge charlk boards on either side of the diner with the seafood menu's on them.  Plus...More

title: Always good
review: Been there around ten times, first review. It is simply always good. Been there for dinner and brunch. The fish is fresh with a wide variety to choose from, coupled with excellent sauces.  The pastas are rich and flavorful. Brunch is among the best I...More

title: Who Can Eat that Much???
review: Holy Cow, and I do mean Holy Cow- the portions  for breakfast at Glenn's Diner are meant for lumber jacks and truck drivers. We, two couples, arrived early (9:30 AM) on a January Sunday morning- were seated promptly by a young guy who could tell...More

title: Great diner food with many fresh fish options
review: This is a funky place in a cool neighborhood.  The food is very good and there are plenty of options, including multiple kinds of fresh fish.

title: Worth the Hype
review: We chose Glen's diner based on a review we saw on the "D,D & D" show.  We were not disappointed.    We arrived on a Wednesday night around 6pm and there was no wait.  I would call ahead, however as the dining room is very small...More

title: Good food, friendly service.
review: We were a party of four on a busy Friday night.  The food was very good.  The soups were just outstanding.  Glenn's new england clam chowder was superb.  Although Glenn's is on the North Side, about a half hour from downtown, it's worth the trip...More

title: Busy Neighborhood Restaurant with amazing variety of fresh seafood
review: We had to wait till 9 p.m. to get a table for 4 on a Tuesday night.  Didn't know it was all you can eat king crab night.  It seemed that at least half the diners were there for that, possibly some still there from...More

title: NEED RESERVATIONS, but worth it!
review: Go early to get the calamari. They were out already by our 7:15 reservations and it is TO DIE FOR. I ordered the scallops off of the chalkboard and they were cooked exceedingly well and topped with bacon. I thought it was the best meal...More

title: Fantastic!
review: Went to Glenn's to celebrate a friends' birthday.  The place is small and noisy, BUT the food was awesome.  I had lobster fettucine alfredo. (Thought I died and went to heaven!)  It was the perfect 'marriage' of two of my favorites.  Can't wait to go...More

title: The BEST meal I've had in a long time!
review: My parents were visiting Chicago this weekend, so we thought we would give Glenn's Diner a try.   My Mother had seen it on the Food Network so she was pretty excited.   (I had also heard mixed reviews from friends & wanted to see for myself.)...More

title: Loved breakfast - can't wait to go back!
review: Went to Glenn's on a friends recommendation, and loved it! The food was fabulous (eggs benedict for me, omelet for husband). Price was reasonable and very good service. Can't wait to try lunch and dinner. Waited about 10 minutes for a table at 11 AM,...More

title: Love it!
review: Next time I am going to brunch AND dinner.  Wow what great food.  The fish selection is amazing.  The potato pancake is heaven.  Ther service and prices are wonderful.  I can't wait to go back.

title: Phenomenal
review: A weekend in Chicago will not be complete without a trek to Glenn's Diner. Just steps away from the Montrose L stop, this small and cozy place is the diner of choice on the weekend. At other times, this is a seafood restaurant but that...More

title: 'Diner' Taken To A Whole New Level
review: We stopped @ this 'diner' for lunch this last Saturday while in town for a Gourmet Food Shopping excursion and were blown away by the selection of food on the menu.  We went expecting standard diner fare and ended up with some of the best...More

title: Unique BYO with enormous...
review: Unique BYO with enormous selection of fresh fish.  The place is small but it has good atomosphere and great service.  Get there early on the weekends though b/c they run out of many of the fish selections.  They are also open for brunch and have...More

title: Fabulous seafood...don't let the word "diner" fool you
review: One of the best fresh seafood restaurants in the Chicago area. I love Catch 35...but Glenn's is better (and more reasonably-priced). In addition to great seafood, the menu offers much diversity...everything from ribs to sandwiches and great salads. There aren't many restaurants that I'll come...More

title: Not so great and dinner is expensive.
review: We were not impressed, found the menu expensive, wine price $8 and served in a small juice glass, staff unfriendly, rush you in and out, tables too close together, people lean on you as they go between tables, food average and costs $17 - $30...More

title: Excellent food, cozy atmosphere
review: Just had a wonderful dinner at Glenn's.  I have eaten at this restaurant at least ten times and every time it is great.  The fish is fresh and tasty.  I tried a salad tonight and it was one of the best I've ever had, especially...More

title: severely underrated
review: People, know your information, if you please. I live right down the street. The chef is a man who was a partner at the Davis Street Fish Market several years ago. He is an expert and produces brilliant fish dishes through a carefully designed system...More

title: Great breakfasts, great...
review: Great breakfasts, great lunches, great dinners.  It's a big statement to say you have the best food in the world and Glenn's delivers.  The pretzel encrusted talapia, world's largest shrimp (one shrimp) cocktail.  Get the mimosa for breakfast, last time I went there Robyn &...More

title: Great fresh fish, reasonable prices and Miller Lite 40s.  Plus, a bottomless bowl of cereal in the morning.  Gotta love...
review: Great fresh fish, reasonable prices and Miller Lite 40s.  Plus, a bottomless bowl of cereal in the morning.  Gotta love it.

title: Just OK
review: Not bad if departing from the "L" train next door on the way home.  But I wouldn't make a special trip.  Their latest banner proclaims "15 kinds of fish, $13.99"  For a place with a dozen tables, how can they  have 15 kinds of fish,...More

title: Comfort food on the healthy side.  I think it's fine, but  know a lot of people who love it. Fish seems to be their...
review: Comfort food on the healthy side.  I think it's fine, but  know a lot of people who love it. Fish seems to be their specialty but it's not my thing.

title: Good place for lunch!
review: Yummy lunch! We ordered online and walked over for pickup - the staff was friendly and the service was quick.  The Turkey and Brie sandwich was great and the Kale & Orange salad was good too.   I wish we would have picked up some pastries-they...looked amazing! Definitely next time!More

title: Lunch is good but the bakery is *****
review: My wife and I stopped at Cafe Selmarie in Chicago's Lincoln Square neighborhood for lunch but the real star of the show was the bakery, which blew us away with its vast array of fresh pastries and desserts. Located at 4729 North Lincoln Avenue, southeast...of the busy intersection of Lawrence, Lincoln and Western, between Lawrence and Leland, adjacent to Giddings Plaza, it is a Euro-style cafe/bakery serving upscale American comfort food with every sweet treat from pumpkin bread to cinnamon bun to banana eclair to salted caramel brownies to raspberry chocolate tart to apple strudel to chocolate mousse torte to tiramisu to German chocolate cake to caramel apple bread pudding to banana truffle torte to strawberry roulade. Order online for carryout or delivery, then pick up your order inside the cafe at the bakery counter. For lunch, my wife had a bowl of tomato bisque soup with an eight-ounce Wagyu beef burger with applewood smoked bacon and caramelized onions on a toasted pretzel bun. I couldn't resist the chicken pot pie with chicken breast, baby peas, carrots and pearl onions in a cream sauce topped with an all-butter puff pastry. Then it's time for a difficult decision. What to take home from the bakery? On this occasion, we settled for a loaf of pumpkin bread, a half-dozen oatmeal raisin cookies, a raspberry chocolate tart, a chocolate mousse torte and a portion of caramel apple bread pudding. But I hated to leave a German chocolate cake and banana eclairs behind. Next time for sure.More

title: One of my favorites.
review: My wife and a I love cafe selmarie. We come often for the desserts alone. The service is always excellent and their salmon is probably the best salmon Ive had in recent memory. I highly recommend.

title: Cafe Selmarie's lovely, relaxed outdoor section- great for coffee and a nosh or a full meal.
review: Servers were available and friendly but not obtrusive, The coffee and cake, and varied salads, were tasty.

title: Perfect after meal dessert stop
review: Stopped in with some friends after a meal at a nearby restaurant. We were looking for something sweet and they delivered. Reasonably priced and delicious cake. Tough time choosing. Had a lot of options.

title: Small in size, Large in Satisfaction
review: Visited here on a whim and we were glad we did. Excellent ambiance, food and service. Our waiter was delightful and the food was delicious from salad to dessert. DId I mention there is a fantastic bakery attached to this wonderful restaurant? Baked goods are...wonderful & we took a few item to go so other family members could try them. Definitely worth trying this choice spot.More

title: Cookie Heaven
review: In addition to top-notch lunch fare, Cafe Selmarie offers superb baked treats. Sesame cookies, almond, pistachio, and jam wonders, pinwheels, butter cookies, kolachky, and more. Plus in a few weeks, you'll see more seasonal delights, like chocolate meringue yums. Splendid presentation, as well.

title: Lincoln Square destination
review: Dinner with three friends -- we each ordered something different, and everyone was pleased with his/her selection.  Wednesday night they offer a prix fixe special  -- 3 courses for $24.   Choose soup or salad;  any entree;  any dessert.  As we head into the winter holiday...season, don't forget that pastry chef Trisha O'Donoghue and the Cafe Selmarie bakery offer stollen, Linzer torte, yule log,sugar plum spice cake, pfeffernuesse, and gingerbread cookies.More

title: Favourite brunch spot in Chicago
review: This is definitely one of Chicago's gems. Great location off the plaza in Lincoln Square with really friendly atmosphere, good indoor and outdoor seating. Food is excellent. Often went with kids and they are really welcome.

title: Great Lincoln Square Cafe
review: Cafe Selmarie remains a standout in a neighborhood with loads of good choices for dining. The outdoor seating was inviting but the 98 percent humidity forced us in to the cool and intimate space. Greeted by the scrumptious pastry array as you walk in the...door we eyed sachet torte before even having dinner! Nice wine options enjoyed by our table of 4. Meals are generous and reasonable. Chicken pot pie comes pastry topped and is enough for two with its succulent veggies. The salads include a protein and were fresh and meal sized. Even the side salad could be shared. We enjoyed our meal and of course ordered a great raspberry chocolate pastry and the sacher torte to top it off ....every mouthful was a revelation! Charming cafe, attentive server, great food and walking distance to the concert we were attending. Can't beat it for fairly priced and delicious food. Just off the brown line on Lincoln Square.More

title: Fantastic Dessert Place
review: My date suggested we go to a favorite of hers for dessert after dinner.  We shared a slice of the Raspberry Bavarian cake, it was awesome.  The waiter described the ingredients just like it was something from the food network as he knew everything about...More

title: Very satisfying breakfast
review: We came to Cafe Selmarie for breakfast and we both had the corned beef hash topped with poached eggs.  The corned beef looked hand cut with large pieces that were nicely crisped.  Very good and very satisfying!

title: Yummy baked goods and lunch
review: My sister and u were bisiti g Lincoln asquare in Chicago and wandered in at lunchtime. The Teragon Chicken Salad was bery good and the chips were served in a small brown bag that was too cute! That being said the waitress could have been...More

title: Excellent place to stay awhile
review: I've been here many times meeting friends and lingering over wine, dinner, and dessert. The food is always delicious and the bakery is outstanding.  The staff has always been kind and helpful with suggestions.  It's such a cozy place to hang out.

title: I visited twice, once or breakfast and once for a late lunch.  Both were outstanding!
review: I have some dietary issues that can be a real pain, and I was able to work around them here and have great meals!  I am wheat intolerant (among other things) and my bunless burger with sweet potato fries was really really good!  The rest...More

title: apple pie was great
review: Not the greatest selection of desserts, but the ones they had were pretty goof. Plus they're open later than a lot of bakeries, which is great.

title: Lunch and bakery
review: Having a burger with brie cheese and carmelized onion was the beginning of this gastronomic experience. Followed by a rasberry torte and cappuccino made it complete. They are known for their bakery so we got a pound of cookies including raspberry linzer. We have been...More

title: A must stop for brunch
review: One of our favorite breakfast and brunch places in Lincoln Square. Love my egg, mozarella pesto scramble with organic chicken sausage.  My daughter got the cinnamon griddle cakes and my oldest  got the beautifully plated shrimp and grits. My husband's favorite is the breakfast burrito....More

title: Yum!
review: Super delicious breakfast sandwiches!  The mocha was one of the best coffees I've ever had!!!!  Cozy ambiance and great service!

title: Average
review: Decent espresso cafe. A small variety of pastries, croissants, pies and cakes. Good, not great.  Also offers lunch and beer, which we didn't get to try.  Has a nice set of outdoor tables overlooking a stone walking area. Very pleasant for the outdoor season.

title: Fine eats and wine
review: A fine small place with delicious food and a nice wine selection. Had Chicken Pot Pie that was delightfully light and suited the warm evening well. The black bean and corn soup had little flavor. Lucky for me I did not have much of it....More

title: Overall Very Good
review: The food and drinks were good. The patio area is very nice. Service was attentive and friendly. The prices were very reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food. A great choice in Lincoln Square for lunch, dinner or just drinks. Beware they are...More

title: Chicago Weekend
review: Authentic German Torten. Tried Black Forest & Raspberry Marzipan Torte. Plenty good size slice, fresh good coffee. Nice ambiance indoor and outdoors. When you get dine head across the street for Germany delicatessen shopping.  Reasonable priced. Defiantly good choice to visit.

title: Good food, reasonably priced
review: I was with a former local and this was one of her favorites.  I could see why.  Coffee drinks good.  Food excellent.

title: Quality, excellently prepared, and more
review: Entering this small restaurant and bakery the first visual is of the baked goods, wonderful variety, colorful, setting one's anticipation for something sweet after lunch.  Or, why wait, it really is what makes me very happy!  Saner minds took control and three of us enjoyed...More

title: Lunch
review: Lunch with my daughter today and we were not disappointed. Chicken pesto sandwich and side salad were delicious as was my tuna wrap. My daughter stated her Latte was the best she ever had. For dessert we shared a slice of Mocha buttercream torte which...More

title: Found: A bakery that makes Pfeffernuesse
review: Cafe Selmarie is a cafe/bakery that is all things to all people. Located at 4729 North Lincoln Avenue in Chicago's Lincoln Square neighborhood, overlooking Giddings Plaza, owners Brigit Kobayashi and Jeanne Uzdawinis and chef Ricky Sakoda offer upscale American comfort food with pastries, desserts and...More

title: Phenomenal bakery!
review: Casual, cozy, family-friendly restaurant with a consistent menu and an extraordinary assortment of baked goods. The tres leches cake is a real treat! Food and service are consistent, but the bakery is the star of the show.  Worth the trip if you have a sweet...More

title: Decadant Hot Chocolate
review: Stopped in for a hot chocolate an a windy, cold Sunday afternoon.  We we served the best hot chocolate I've ever had.  A generous cup  topped off with a thick layer of heavy whipped cream that you could almost cut with a knife. This is...More

title: Saturday afternoon delight
review: Café Selmarie has been a regular go-to of mine for many years. On Saturday, I stopped in for a delicious cup of coffee and a fig custard - featuring fresh figs! I loved sitting outside even in October. The Mayor of Chicago, Rahm Emanuel, stopped...More

title: Lovely breakfast!
review: We stopped at this little cafe for breakfast prior to sightseeing downtown. We ate on the patio, as it was a beautiful morning. Delicious quiche and great service. Also has a great bakery section with lots of goodies! Located in the Lincoln Square area -...More

title: Great food and service
review: My daughter and I enjoyed a delicious brunch at Cafe Selmarie.  It was a very busy Sunday brunch time, but our service was excellent.  The food was exceptional, especially the cinnamon roll and my omelet.  The only detraction was the incredible noise level, with concrete...More

title: European Style Cafe
review: We were taken here by people we had just met and it was a very good choice. The menu had a wide variety, it was quiet and restful on a busy Saturday night in Lincoln Square. Very civilized.

title: Worst customer service in years
review: Skip this place. They discriminate against handicapped and elderly. Skip over customers on wait list, then when called on it, do not apologize but shrug it off. Very limited menu, poor service. Other Lincoln Square restaurants in the immediate area are MUCH, MUCH better I....More

title: Unique menu, good service, reasonable prices
review: A very fine dining establishment and bakery in a lively Chicago neighborhood.  Many interesting items on the menu - - I would call the fare "European-American fusion".  I ordered a spicy shrimp scampi dish which was delicious and beautifully presented.  My wife ordered a chicken...More

title: Nice neighbourhood cafe
review: Located in a nice neighbourhood on a small square, it is really great breakfast / brunch place. They have nice menu with salads, really great sandwitches and entrees and delicious pastries. The cinnamon rolls and tiramisu are amazing. The prices are really resonable too and...More

title: Tastes Great! NOT Filling!
review: Went here on a Saturday for brunch with my boyfriend and 2 friends. Had about a 30 - 35 minute wait (around 11:45 a.m.), but that was expected.  Firstly, it's LOUD inside. The waitress could not hear me from 2 feet away and I kept...More

title: Mother's Day Lunch
review: Lovely little Cafe on Lincoln Ave. where we were lucky enough to get seated outdoors along a side street courtyard with a musician singing and playing guitar. My son and husband had different versions of Eggs Benedict--delicious and perfectly cooked! I had an Arugula Omelet...More

title: Simple cafe
review: Nice simple cafe on Lincoln Square.  Pasties to go look awesome. Breakfast was nice.  A limited menu.  Healthy choices. I ordered a special omelet.  It was more of a solid scrambled egg well cooked then folded around the ingredients like a burrito.  Really tasteless and...More

title: Can you hear me now?
review: This restaurant has wonderful, interesting food and a dazzling array of pastry items. Unfortunately, it is almost unbearably noisy.  Conversation is next to impossible at mealtimes.  I wish they would invest in acoustical panels for the ceiling, or some fabric on the walls to help...More

title: Good for lunch in Lincoln Square
review: Bright, cheerful restaurant/bakery with good food. I usually order the chopped salad. The chicken pot pie and quiche are also tasty. You walk past the bakery counter on the way to the dining room. The cookies are very inviting. In warm weather there is outdoor seating alongside the restaurant. Metered street parking is not too difficult to find either along Lincoln Ave or in a nearby city lot.

title: Best Tortes in Chicago
review: We stopped in for a quick cup of coffee & slice of torte.  We had the Mocha & Tres Leches tortes.  Unbelievably Wonderful.

title: Nice simple little cafe with great food
review: I come here for their delightful strawberry roulade and their consistenly perfect Croque Monsieur. Weekends are busy, but visiting for a weekday lunch gets you seated fairly quickly. Food is delicious. The causal environment is perfect for a small lunch meeting and the outdoor seating is a nice option when the weather is warm.

title: Cozy and friendly
review: Really a nice place. Very family friendly (especially on a Sunday night). My wife really enjoyed the mushroom ravioli in sage brown butter... I thought the lamb chops were good, not great. I always like when the kids menu is simple for a kids palate, but made with fresh, real ingredients... a nice turkey sandwich with fruit fit the bill for my daughter. And she really loved walking up to the front and picking her dessert to be delivered to the table (with a little playfulness from the waiter pretending he was delivering it elsewhere :) A cozy, friendly vibe on a cold Chicago night.

title: great lunch
review: A friend who lived in the area suggested this place and I am so glad she did.  The staff were great and the food excellent.  Well worth a visit.

title: Special place on a special street
review: We got four generations together for a lunch to celebrate a birthday (great grandmother) and a birth (granddaughters first child) born a few months before. Food and service were great. The cafe is in the middle of Lincoln Square street facing a car free plaza. Has the feel of a European cafe. If you love pastry, you will not get past the display cases in the front.

title: Excellent Neighborhood Choice
review: We dropped in for lunch. Very popular place. And besides the food, do look at the bakery items in the front of the store for take-home purchase. Nice atmosphere. Excellent corned beef hash. Also enjoyed the zucchini pancakes.

title: Good brunch in Lincoln Sq.
review: Enjoyable brunch with friends. Staff great handling wait-list with beepers, allows people to explore the area w/o losing place in line. Serice competent and friendly. Imaginative menu and good bakery. Family friendly.

title: Nice breakfast
review: We went here to get breakfast. I ordered a breakfast burrito, which was overall good tasting. The service was good too.

title: A cozy breakfast
review: This is a little cozy place. I ordered the breakfast burrito. Sadly im not to fond of the strong/hot foods. I didnt understand from the meny that it should be so hot, but it was, so one little bite was enough for me.

title: High quality food, creative menu
review: Sel Marie is one of our favorite restaurants and is very reliable.  They have excellent food and the prices are reasonable.  It is also a french bakery so the desserts are sublime.

title: Confortable atmosphere, excellent food...
review: I've been a customer here for years and Café Selmarie never disappoints! Last night the fixed price dinner for $22 included a cup of house made tomato basil soup that was very good. The entrée I chose was a pork tenderloin served over polenta with...More

title: Old World & Contemporary American Fusion Cuisine in a Comfortable Setting
review: We have been frequenting this popular café and eatery for many years. It is one of the cultural and culinary anchors of beautiful Lincoln Square, Chicago's longstanding European neighborhood on the North side, and for a reason: from it's friendly and helpful staff to its...More

title: OMG
review: This place is very romantic and fun.  The coffee was great! And bakery section is amazing!!  I had the Banana cake it was to die for!  I HIGHLY recommend Cafe Selmarie!!

title: Great dinner--but don't forget the bakery
review: When was the last time I complained about the lack of fresh bakeries in Chicago? Unfortunately, Cafe Selmarie at 4729 North Lincoln in Lincoln Square is a long way from our home near North Avenue and Dearborn Parkway. But once you go there, you don't...More

title: Great spot and excellent food.
review: Located right on a plaza in Lincoln Square, Selmarie is a fun spot for people watching and enjoying European-style foods. In nice weather, the outdoor dining is a must. The food is very good if a tad pricey but it's worth it for the destination

title: Cookies
review: Spend a nice day strolling along the many shops in Lincoln Square.  Stop off for a light lunch at Sel Marie.  They have a very good bakery in the restaurant. We always have to take home a box of their cookies, which don't stay around...More

title: Delicious brunch, cakes are amazing
review: This place was highly recommended by our family from Chicago, so we came here for brunch. The food was amazing, I could have eaten everything on the menu, it took ages to choose! We all thoroughly enjoyed our choices, and the food was served quite...More

title: A cozy neighborhood cafe
review: Fresh salads, subtle breakfasts, and a lovely bakery make Cafe Selmarie a great spot if you're in the neighborhood. Service is a little spotty, but it's a busy spot and employees here are friendly.

title: Worth the Stop
review: Their quiche was quite good but needed a little pepper.  The pineapple coconut cake was above average once it warmed to room temperature, and if you enjoy expresso cookie this is the place for you.  The service was good but the tables are close and...More

title: Great casual spot for a delicious meal or a slice of cake
review: Three of us stopped in for lunch here on a Monday while en route from O'Hare to Lawrence and Sheridan.  Luckily, we managed to find street parking on Lincoln right by the restaurant although there are other city parking lots if the street itself is...More

title: Cute brunch spot!
review: Great atmosphere both outside and inside the cafe. Staff were friendly and attentive throughout our visit even though it was busy. Only had to wait 15 mins for a table even though it was 1030 am on a Saturday. Food was great - varied menu....More

title: Great find in Chicago
review: When my partner and I visit my brother in Chicago, we make Café Selmarie a priority for dinner. The menu is creative and the cuisine is always flavorful and very well prepared. Make sure to visit Café Selmarie for a great meal or stop by...More

title: There's a reason this place is always busy
review: I enjoy this cafe for brunch, lunch or a 'to go' cup of coffee and a bakery treat.  I have never been disappointed. Delicious blend of coffee from Intelligentsia available to purchase in bean or ground. The pumpkin spice hot cakes are oh so delicious!...More

title: Get the fried chicken and grits!
review: Awesome little restaurant and bakery in the heart of Lincoln Square.  Sit outside and enjoy whatever entertainment is happening in the little square - music, clowns, jugglers, etc.  Great service and really great food.  Hard to walk past the bakery case without picking something up....More

title: Cake is very good, service is ok
review: We went to Chicago for the weekend. Stopped by Lincoln square for a short stop. The appearance of the shop is nice, with outdoor seating (need to tip for service), or take it in shop (with stools). Cakes are great. Coffee is ok. Waitress service...More

title: Healthy ingredients infuse with a main flavors.
review: The ambiance plus food gives this place great marks . Children friendly which help the neighborhood.  Will return.

title: Good Brunch with an Outdoor Patio
review: Right in the center of Lincoln Square with a good patio next to the fountain, my husband and I enjoyed a nice brunch here. The service was just okay, but the food was good. The ambiance is also nice in the patio area, especially if...More

title: Watching the world go by on a summer afternoon
review: We first came here several years ago when we were considering moving to Lincoln Square, an area of Chicago that feels more like a village--lots of families, civic involvement, handsome old trees and quiet streets. We didn't move to the area, but if we lived...More

title: Feel of Europe, Good Food, Good Service, Ambiance
review: We sat outside and really enjoyed the vibe, the food, and the service.  Three of us are non meat eaters and the menu was terrific for us.  They made an incredibly good roasted Brussels sprout salad and an equally good quiche served with a side...More

title: Wonderful!
review: I had lunch at Selmarie twice while on vacation in Chicago.  The first time I had what amounted to a deconstructed BLT, pork instead of bacon, served on a big bun, with a side of mac and cheese.  The sandwich was delightful, especially with a...More

title: Exceptional Pastry and Coffee House
review: Very European, without the pretense. The selection of fine cakes and pastries is a very nice blend of high-end European and American bakery favorites.  One can order at the counter or opt for table service. There is both indoor and outdoor seating on nice little...More

title: Great food, drinks, and desserts
review: One of my favorite cafés in Chicago. Love their sandwiches, coffee. The half chicken dinner is one of my favs...so tasty and melts in your mouth. Desserts are delicious! It's in a little European neighborhood of Chicago. Love the atmosphere, and summer time their outdoor...More

title: Best strawberry tart ever!
review: Charming place with the greatest sweets ever, had a strawberry tart, crust was amazing, custard good, melted in your mouth. The chocolate expresso tart was just as amazing. Will be returning soon.

title: Wonderful brunch!
review: Friends and I had brunch at Selmarie about 2 weeks ago.  There was an hour wait on Mother's Day (they don't take reservations), but it was well worth it!  We walked past the bakery case on the way to our table, and the baked goods...More

title: Unique Menu and a Quilter's Delight
review: Selmarie is a delightful restaurant located in Lincoln Square. The menu is quite unique, with generous portions. The area we sat in was decorated with quilts producing a very homey atmosphere. They have old fashioned favorites like chicken pot pie and macaroni & cheese. I...More

title: BEST!!!
review: best bakery in area, we come here once a week for years. Cant blame their Very GOOD... GooD fooD & Good SeRvice. loved this place

title: Unbelievably Delicious Pastries, Cookies and Cakes
review: I walked into this cafe/bakery and was immediately met with wonderful smells wafting from the cafe in the back.  In the front is the bakery, a mouthwatering bakery.  There were racks and racks of sweets of all kinds.  I was there after dinner for dessert...More

title: Best Bakery in the City!
review: Not so fond of their full day menu but hands down this is the best bakery in the city.  Fresh ingredients go along way here.  Best bakery cookies - try the florentines....they are amazing.  I have been going here since Selmarie opened and never am...More

title: Excellent café and bakery
review: Go for breakfast or brunch. The place is both a bakery and a café/restaurant. It can be crowded. Very tasty pastry and omelet

title: A very charming experience
review: Being away from home with kids not particularly inclined to try anything new is always a challenge when it comes to meals but being away from home also means new experiences and getting out of the comfort zone.  I did a quick search online and...More

title: Looked in window and Yum!
review: My wife and I had just finished eating at the German Brauhaus and were walking by Selmarie. I looked inside the window and that's all it took. Glass cases full of pastry. We enjoyed a great desert and ended up buying numerous Christmas gifts here....More

title: Delicious treats
review: Whether you're looking for a quick latte before you wander the square; a sweet pastry for an afternoon treat; or a delicious breakfast, Cafe Selmarie is a great place to get all three.  Fresh, consistently delicious, and charming.  Try the fruit tarts, the scones, and...More

title: Delightful bite
review: Such charming atmosphere for this gem of a bakery & eatery where you can enjoy your food inside or right outside. Enjoy fresh tempting desserts like peanut butter chocolate cake, and strawberry roulade which is kind of like strawberry short cake. Always end up just...More

title: Good Food, Really Rude Waiter
review: A friend and I went to Cafe Selmarie because we had been there a few times before and loved the food. We went there on Thursday, June 13. 2013. I believe the server's name was Paul. He was our server the last time a couple...More

title: Overrated and unremarkable
review: Our group of five had dinner on May 16. Two had the herb roasted chicken, on had ribs, one had salmon oscar, the fifth had an appetizer. My herb chicken was close to being dry, and completely bland. The other diners had similar opinions, OK...More

title: Perfect refreshment stop in Lincoln Square
review: We came for late afternoon coffee and pastries. Both were first class. Our fruit tart pastries had short bread crust and intense fruit flavor.   Equally wonderful is the ambience and staff. The space is sunny, inviting and decorated with rotating art works by very good...More

title: Sweet through and through!
review: Lincoln Square is one of those neighborhoods in Chicago that should not be overlooked when planning a trip to Chicago. Cafe Selmarie is a charming cafe with a distinctly European flavor in the heart of the funky, upscale neighborhood. The menu is varied and delicious...More

title: Wonderful food in Lincoln Square
review: Whenever I am in Chicago, I stop by Selmarie. Located in the Lincoln Square area, it is one of those neighborhood gems. Part bakery and part restaurant, it offers spectacular cakes and pastries, wonderful salads, soups, and sandwiches, and a decent dinner menu. On my...More

title: Charming & Delicious Chicago Institution
review: I am a local and a *long* time patron. Cafe Selmarie is one of the main reasons Lincoln Square is such a wonderful place - I would even argue that the fountain square would not be what it is without Selmarie . For many years...More

title: Desserts are excellent
review: We've come here numerous times and it's a lovely place. We haven't found the food to be anything special but the desserts are remarkable. I recommend getting dinner somewhere in Lincoln Square and walking over to Cafe Selmarie for dessert. The cakes are delicious! The...More

title: Love It Here
review: During a holiday-time visit to Chicago, we headed out to Lincoln Square (its adorable main street is great for holiday shopping), and we had lunch at Cafe Selmarie.  Each time I'm here, I find myself wishing that our neighborhood in DC (where we live) had...More

title: Wonderful quiche!
review: My daughter and I were trying to decide where to eat lunch. We decided to try this cafe because of all the beautiful bakery items you see when you enter.  Our lunch was a real treat! So glad we decided to stop. My quiche was...More

title: Charming cafe/bakery in historic German neighborhood
review: This is a charming cafe located in the historic Lincoln Square neighborhood which was at one time little Germany. The neighborhood is no longer primarily German but those German shops that still exist are like small town Germany in the 1960's.  And Cafe Selmarie is...More

title: small savory portions give room for dessert
review: My husabdn comes here with me beacsue the coffee is great and the beer selection is impressive- I come for the vegetarian options and everyone argrees that the deserts rock- orange chocolate flourless cake, cream puffs, fruit tarts- and leave with fresh crosssiants made the...More

title: Desserts and cookies
review: This is always my holiday destination. I will always order my desserts for thanksgiving and Christmas. I love their cookies, they are made with love always taste the same. Go there you will be glad you did.

title: Love the location - food is decent
review: Really love their location, bang in the middle of Lincoln square, great area to hang out, catch some sun and enjoy brunch. They have a decent collection of sweets to go with the other brunchy stuff. Their brea turkey sandwich was ok, good egg options,...More

title: Recommended for Sunday brunch unless a long wait is a concern.
review: Café Selmarie is located in the heart of the Lincoln Square neighborhood that is a very vibrant part of town.  Recently, I tried making a reservation for a party of four for a Sunday brunch, but was informed that reservations are only accepted for parties...More

title: Butter How I Luv Thee
review: While dropping large amounts of cash at Mertz we needed a cool down- with trip to Paree. Authentic coffees and pastries to blow any diet you might be attempting. Butter Cookies are divine. Seriously worth it! Note: Dinner will take more than the change in...More

title: Great food, comfortable room, good service
review: Cafe Selmarie is a delightful European-style cafe and patisserie set next to a vest-pocket park in the midst of bustling Lincoln Square. My wife and I dine here for lunch or dinner frequently, together or accompanied by friends.  The menu leans toward classics, such as...More

title: European Style Cafe
review: I went with friends and we had a lovely meal.  I had tuna salad, my friend had a tilapia sandwich, and my other friend had a croque monsieur.  We were all satisfied.  They have a lovely bakery when you first walk in.....we definitely ordered dessert....More

title: Great neighborhood cafe
review: Great cafe near our apartment in Lincoln Square.  We went for dinner, though I'm definitely going to have to make it back for brunch one of these days.  I had a caesar salad with salmon that was delicious and a squash soup, and the boyfriend...More

title: Oasis in the midst of Chicago.
review: I discovered this Café last year with a dear friend, and have returned several times. Lovely setting. In summer you can sit outside and watch people. The food is wonderful, elegant, and tasty. And the desserts will wow the pickiest person. Extraordinary. Breakfast is awesome....More

title: Wonderful Location, Great Breakfasts
review: We come here every time I'm visiting my best friend in Lincoln Square.  There is something so perfect about sitting on the patio near the fountain and enjoying a nice breakfast (perhaps even some live music).  It's hard to beat this location, and the breakfasts,...More

title: Great brunch place but get there early
review: This is a charming little (and I do mean little) restaurant in the Lincoln Square area. The brunch is great and the pastries and desserts are amazing. Just be prepared to wait a long time if you get there anywhere close to noon, especially on...More

title: Juicy pork cut, amazing sweet potatoes
review: Recently I went to Cafe Selmarie with a couple of friends. Indeed I was a little skeptical with regards to pork cuts and ordered. Indeed it was one of juicest porks I have ever eaten, sweet potatoes were soft, tender and skin was cruncky. My...More

title: Great place for a coffee and pastry
review: Really good pastry. Take a table then walk over to the display case to pick out your dietary indiscretion. Any selection is worth every calorie. Great people watching in the summer at the outdoor tables.

title: Lincoln Square bistro, exceptional desserts
review: Great restaurant with relatively modest menu that changes frequently and always has good selections.   Stews, meatloaf, chicken pot pie are among the regulars.   Very reasonably priced and often has reduced wine prices mid-week.  The desserts -- that you go select from their bakery cases-  are...More

title: Tried the Belgian Raspberry Cake, and Apple Bread pudding with a cup of coffee. Great pastries and awesome coffee. You...
review: Tried the Belgian Raspberry Cake, and Apple Bread pudding with a cup of coffee. Great pastries and awesome coffee. You can grab a glass of wine with an entry or sandwich , also. Great summertime hangout as they have outdoor seating overlooking the fabulous Lincoln...More

title: Cute bakery and cafe
review: This is a nice bakery and cafe with dining options for dinner and lunch. Everything is great, with the only downside sometimes being the selection because the menu does not change very often.

title: Good coffee and breakfasts. Kid friendly.
review: Good coffee and breakfasts. Kid friendly.

title: The pastries are delicious. Brunch is a must here.
review: The pastries are delicious. Brunch is a must here.

title: Good brunch.  Very kid friendly.  Usually worth the wait but not our top-of-mind neighborhood brunch place.
review: Good brunch.  Very kid friendly.  Usually worth the wait but not our top-of-mind neighborhood brunch place.

title: good breakfast!
review: good breakfast!

title: A nice little bakery with a cafe.
review: A nice little bakery with a cafe.

title: Nice family dinner
review: I have been here before with my family for brunch, which we all enjoyed at that time. This was my first time here for dinner with my family of five including my daughter’s two-year old. I started with my prickly pear cocktail for $7. I...was not so hungry, therefore, I enjoyed a half order of provencal mussels for $9. We also shared a large bottle of Pellegrino for $6.   Matt accommodated our table nicely. My total bill was $115 exclusive of gratuities. We all enjoyed our dinners here. We agreed we will continue to return here for brunch, lunch or dinner.More

title: Very good service but food for lunch was ordinary
review: Excellent pleasant service but food for lunch was ordinary. Disappointed that the freshly squeezed fruit juice ordered wasn't freshly squeezed and so had gone 'sour'. The replacement tasted more like Tropicana! Salad was ordinary.

title: Neighborhood-type place with good food
review: Just had a casual family dinner here. They were easily able to accommodate a table of twelve. Tina, the waitress, did a great job. There is a wide range of menu items, but I ordered the vegetarian entree made with several different types of mushrooms...in a delicious wine sauce served over polenta. We ordered at least 4 different starters for the table; the best was probably the cauliflower one. Everyone liked his/her meal. They were able to bring a chocolate dessert with a candle for our birthday person. We were pleased. This is my second time, and I would return.More

title: Cheeeeeezzzy!
review: Great place to have a cheese plate. They offer a few different flights, but you can also create your own or supplement the chef's choices with a diverse list of cheeses.

title: Great Place!
review: We had a great evening with our daughter here. Good beer, wine, cocktails. Food was delicious! We had salmon with eggplant, pork chop, and the duck club. All delicious!  Ended the meal with a port flight. Service was perfect and we loved the atmosphere. We...will go back!More

title: Amazing food
review: Loved this place. Cool jazzy vibe and very good service. The menu is sophisticated and just gorgeous: loved it! Bravo to the chef

title: Nice Ambience, Ordinary Food
review: We chose this restaurant because it was conveniently located for us and the couple with whom we were dining.   We were impressed the ambience and decor when we walked in the door.  And we were pleased to find the staff was friendly and knowledgeable about...the menu.  But the food turned out to be just ordinary.  Three of us had steaks that were tender, but nothing unusual about the preparation.  The fourth enjoyed his pork chop very much.  Drinks were moderately priced.  Probably will not rush back to this place when there are so many others in Lincoln Square.More

title: Expensive brunch
review: This was my first visit here with my party of four for brunch. I started with my usual blood orange margarita. I love my blood orange margaritas. I even make them at home for myself and others. I enjoyed my salmon eggs benedict for $14....We also enjoyed two servings of afternoon delight for $17.85 each. Our two farmhouse burgers were $17 each. Sara served our table needs well. My total bill was $170, which I thought was rather expensive for my average brunch. I doubt I will return here, since there are so many other better choices in this area. Sorry to be brutally honest.More

title: The Best
review: Great location. Nice looking room. The chef has a firm grasp of his flavors.  The menu is varied and interesting. The chef has a firm grasp of his flavors and his kitchen really executes. You want a medium rare burger with a sunny side up...egg perfectly cooked? Check and check.  Crispy fries that aren't over cooked? Nailed it! Best brioche buns ever. Creme brûlée is fantastic. The bartender is a real pro. Great service. This is what so many restaurants want to be but most can't make it work. Fork puts it all together. This is my new favorite place!More

title: Great Lunch
review: Two of us for lunch. This was my first visit. We decided to share several items. Our selections were the eggplant, curry mussels, and duck salad. Each was delicious. Restaurant was quiet and we could converse easily. Great food, good service. We'll be back.

title: Awesome brunch
review: Excellent brunch with some specials that vary. The special I had was lemon cheese stuffed french toast with a berry sauce.  Excellent. Others at my table had salmon eggs benedict, avocado toast w/some other toppings, and an omelet with cinnamon toast.  All came with potatoes...More

title: Not Impressed
review: I've been here on a few occasions and I really want to like this place. It's in a great location and the food sounds like it'll be delicious. I've come for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Not impressed by any of the meals. My pork eggs...More

title: Fabulous Brunch for 160 guests
review: We love this place, and yesterday we celebrated my husband's PhD with a delicious brunch for family, colleagues and friends.  We rented the entire restaurant from 10-12  (Sunday morning). They served yummy, plentiful food buffet style (chilaquilas,, portobello egg sandwiches, smoked salmon platter) the servers...More

title: Skimming on cash payment for the bill
review: I went to this restaurant on Jun 9, 2018 for lunch. The ambiance and food were good. When it came time to pay the bill, which was $48.63, I gave the waitress $60 in twenty dollar bills. Surpisingly, she asked me if I wanted money...More

title: Best Charcuterie in Northern ChicAgo

title: Rude to Families!!!!
