title: Another nice family dinner
review: As you can see from my past reviews, I always enjoy the Supper Club here for $25 per adult. Children are for free. My family of five including my daughter’s two-year old arrived at 5:30 for our dinner reservation. We were seated immediately. As you...can see from my pics we were seated at a nice booth in the rear of the restaurant overlooking the kitchen area. This time I enjoyed my “The Robin” cocktail for $11 followed by a “Purple Martin” cocktail also for $11. We shared a bottle of Pellegrino for $6.  We always order the chicken wings here, which is my favorite. We all enjoyed our other shared dishes. Stephanie served our table nicely. My total bill was $196 less gratuities. Our dinner only cost $100, while the remainder of $96 was for our cocktails. We all agreed we will continue to return here for the Supper Club.  As an alternative to the Warbler I also like the recently opened similarly priced Swift & Sons Tavern.More

title: We enjoyed the food, the ambiance,
review: We enjoyed the food, the ambiance, and the service. Cat, our server, truly enhanced our experience. Nice 70’s vibe interior design. Open kitchen. Inventive menu, but feels like home.

title: Excellent is an understatement
review: Everything about my experience at The Warbler was absolutely delightful. My husband and I dined on a Saturday night. Every detail from decor to cocktails, food and staff was perfect. I think the chef may be a culinary genius-seriously. Every single thing we had (and...we had a lot) was beyond delicious. I suggest ordering the artichokes as an appetizer. Definitely have the green beans and the fresh pasta. The servings are large, so sharing is the way to go. It will be difficult, but try to save room for the amazing brownie and carrot cake desserts.  I cannot wait for my next visit!More

title: Tasty food, attentive service
review: My friend and I had dinner. The mushroom soup was flavorful. We also had the cauliflower, chicken wings and asparagus flatbread. Each item was delicious. My only criticism is the high noise level.

title: Semi-precious
review: Very creative foods, great presentation and clever use of space. There are 4 very different-feeling sections in this railroad-style restaurant (long and thin). We moved from the very open main area between the bar and the kitchen to the more cozy banquettes with kitchen view....We arrived at 6:00 on a Wednesday night and there were more families with young kids than we expected. The food is well plated and the menu extremely eclectic. We were given more recommendations from our waiter than there were dishes but I give him credit for recommending the most delicious, dry, crisp white wine, LA CAPRANERA (in Italian it means Black Goat). He was also very attentive in keeping our glasses filled. The 4 of us shared the sweet corn flat bread, a pasta, the grilled broccoli, chicken wings and the huge plate of carrot cake with ice cream for dessert and all had plenty to eat. The flavor can combos were unusual and mostly worked. Worth a trip.More

title: Excellent!
review: We had Fusilli, Roasted Salmon and Falafel, all were prepared well, served at the right temperature, and the portions were just right.  We felt the price was perfect for the portion size.

title: Great dinner
review: Sat outside on patio, perfect night for dining outside. Flatbreads were great, as were the salads. Unique menu, hard to make decisions. Very friendly and attentive, can tell people that work here really stand by their product.

title: Outstanding experience
review: We sat outside on a summer Saturday evening avoiding excessive noise. The food was delicious, the service great. In addition, the prices were quite reasonable. Flatbreads were especially good as were the appetizers.

title: It’s popular for a reason
review: We really enjoyed the food and cocktails and the restaurant design is comfortable and stylish. It’s not too noisy so you can hear your conversation. We enjoyed a delicious burger and pork belly and black bean nachos. Can’t wait to try the peanut butter brownie...next time.More

title: family-style supper club
review: As you can see I have been here many times mostly for their early bird supper club dinner for only $25. Their family-style supper club is available 4:30-6:00pm Monday-Friday. Our table can choose a selection of five dishes from their regular dinner offering including one...salad, any two appetizers, vegetable dishes or house made pastas and their favorite flatbread. Their  menu is friendly enough for children, but elevated so that the adults will truly enjoy it too. Kids nine and under are complimentary!  We had a 5:30pm dinner reservation. The four of us had a nice center table. I started with my usual purple martin for $11. We always enjoy our shared our arugula salad with whipped ricotta, pickled fennel, marinated olives, lemon vinaigrette, roasted walnuts and herbed croutons. We also always enjoy their Korean style chicken wings with tamari glaze and sesame seeds. We also enjoyed our English pea risotto with mascarpone, spring garlic and parmesan crisp. I also enjoyed my second purple martin and my robin also for $11.  Our food only cost $100, but the rest were our cocktails and wine. My total bill less gratuities was $246. Our server Brittnay accommodated our table nicely. We will continue to return here for their early bird dinner and try to drink less.More

title: Terrific food with exceptional service
review: Dinner here was exceptional as was our server.  We started with the crispy cauliflower with ponzu glaze.  It is easily shared and was really delicious.  I had mussels while others had agnolotti and flat bread pizza.  All perfect.  The cocktails are equally well made.  Highly...More

title: Amazing food!
review: We ordered a lot from the menu! Every dish was simply amazing with a lot of flavors. We were 6 couples and we had an amazing evening. service and food were great!

title: Finally a winner
review: This location has been a lot of places.  I love the vibe of the Warbler.  Drinks are amazing, menu changes and it delicious.   Just a gem in Lincoln Square.  I was here for drinks at the bar this last visit and had such a fun...More

title: Really good food!
review: Very charming atmosphere, great service and a varied and delicious menu. Went there on a Tuesday night with a 6:00 reservation and we were seated immediately. By the time we left, the place was packed.

title: Fun, hip and delicious
review: Wonderful service by Stephanie! We had the mussels with garlic, butter and leeks, and the mussels were very nice, along with bread for dipping. The crispy cauliflower with cashews, sesame seeds and pickled red onion was very flavorful, and the butternut beignets with brussels sprouts,...More

title: Delicious, Creative, and Clean Food!
review: The Warbler has wonderful food.  I always enjoy and savor every last bite.  On Monday - Thursday, they have a early supper club from 4-6.  It is $25 per person and you can select several courses from the menu for all to share.  You won't...More

title: Great Food and Drinks
review: We love to hang out at this local place and just eat at the bar—and so does everyone else! So if you want that experience, come early or you’ll wait. They also have tables, but it’s not the same interaction. The bar area is always...More

title: Weekday Supper Club: great for families
review: As parents of a toddler, my husband and I rarely get the "grown-up" dining experience when we eat out. But The Warbler is brilliant for families with young kids: the early Supper Club offered Mon-Fri, lets you eat delicious beautifully prepared food, drink wonderful cocktails,...More

title: Great service & food!
review: A friend of mine chose this spot and it was wonderful! The setting is a little tight depending on your table, but the service is terrific and the food is a cool variety of delicious choices! The drinks were great and the atmosphere is also...More

title: FABULOUS FOOD
review: from appetizers to main course, the food was delicious! the staff so friendly and helpful with suggestions! homemade pasta, interesting and new ways to prepare vegetables--i can't wait to visit my son in chicago to return.  also, great attitude with children--everyone made to feel welcome--come...More

title: Something for every gourmand (or gourmet)
review: Located on picturesque old street in North Chi-town, this busy spot did more than warble - it cawed, hooted, gobbled and crowed. A lively (filled with happy eaters enjoying exuberant conversations) long, narrow setting (with the bar at the front) the menu offered a refined...More

title: Enjoyable, easygoing, reasonably priced for dinner date at bar; HINT: arrive early if you don't have a reservation
review: My wife and I really enjoyed stopping in for a quick dinner.  Enjoyable restaurant with interesting wines by the glass and very good food.  We arrived at 6:30 PM on a Tuesday night.  Even at that time, without a reservation, we had to wait briefly...More

title: Nice dinners
review: The Warbler and Gather are adjacent to each other. They both have the same owners. I have been to Gather three times and enjoyed my dinners there. I thought I should give the Warbler a try. I am glad I did. I visited the Warbler...More

title: Delicious and cozy dinner!
review: Our group of 5 had a booth with a view into the open kitchen. We shared the Crispy Cauliflower as appetizer which was yummy. For dinner, had the Cedar Planked Salmon with blood orange and citrus puree...delicious! Other entrees were the Crispy Falafel with tasty...More

title: Pretty good place!
review: 4 of us, celebrating a birthday. We drove in from the burbs. More mushrooms on the menu than I expected to see. But all family members would return. It 's loud but, hey, how many places aren't?

title: Obsessed! My favorite restaurant in Chicago.
review: When I found out the owners of Gather were opening a new concept, the Warbler, next door, I was ecstatic. The Warbler has already become my favorite place to dine in Lincoln Square. Heck, in my opinion, it's one of the best restaurants in Chicago....More

title: Delicious!
review: I went here for a group party and loved it. A definite hipster vibe but totally approachable for non-hipsters, too. The food is delicious. I'm a vegetarian and normally ignore pasta dishes, but the ones at The Warbler are legitimate delicious. And the cauliflower!!! So...More

title: Departure from ordinary
review: If you are looking for food that is creative and tasty then Warbler is the place for you. If you like alfresco dining there are 120 covered patio seats.We started the dinner off with cocktails cleverly named for different birds. We ordered the Kookaburra( rum...More

title: Wonderful Bites
review: This is the sister to the Gathering so we had to try it.  They have a lovely bar area, small intimate dining room where we sat just, & just opened the outside dining  area. Our server was David & we had Great service.  Their drinks...More

title: Another winner in Lincoln Square!
review: First time to this restaurant and I am already planning a return trip.  Very nicely done remodel and the food and service were excellent!  I might recommend the fried artichokes for an appetizer - they were amazing!

title: Really outstanding service
review: Really outstanding service, staff and food. Well deserving of their Michelin star rating. We were lucky enough to score a table next to the kitchen and were able to see Chef Ken and staff in action! Loved watching  the good natured  camaraderie that lead to...More

title: Interesting Small Plates; Great Service
review: As the title explains, everything we ordered at The Warbler was interesting AND delicious. Four of us ordered only small plates (& drinks) for our dinner. We all enjoy experimenting with many different dishes rather than just a hunk of meat, poultry or fish. We...More

title: Delightful neighborhood restaurant near downtown.
review: Family dinner in early June, we were treated to a visit to the Warbler.  New to the area and busy early in the eventing.  Inside and outside seating (this summer), interesting menu which on this evening showed some Asian influence.  Everything is freshly prepared and...More

title: Nice, kid friendly neighborhood spot
review: Warbler is a comfortable gathering spot on Lincoln across from the Old Town School. The menu is both small bites, flatbreads and a half dozen larger entrees. There's a bar and the cocktails looked great though I didn't sample.  The redone space is lovely and...More

title: New Favorite!
review: Happy to have this new restaurant pop up in the neighborhood. Went with a group of people, ordering 12 different dishes. We shared them all like tapas, and it was all delicious. They have more entree style dishes as well. Cocktails are solid, as well...More

title: Great New Restaurant Next to Gather
review: Next door to and brought to you by the same folks at Gather, this is another gem that is a must visit in Chicago.  Sure to be a rising star.  Went with my family and we tried at least one thing from each part of...More

title: Small anniversary party catering
review: Luella’s is phenomenal. The owner is wonderful and the staff has always been fabulous.   We got hoppin johns, fried and jerk chicken, mac, collard greens, and corn bread—all phenomenal, and our guests were floored—talkin’ about how delicious it was all night.   Luella’s made our small...family party jump to the next level of fancy, and made it great. I always wanted the food and music to be the best part of this party, and Luella’s gave me that honor.  Genuinely so grateful.More

title: A gem in the city
review: This has to be one of the best restaurants in the City!! From the Chicken to the PoBoy sandwich.. I could not stop eating!! Loved everything and the service is amazing!!

title: AMAZING food-wedding catering
review: Much like with most covid weddings things got turned backwards and upside down, but my husband and I did a significantly downsized wedding, and had Luella's cater it.  We did the fried chicken, pimento burger, shrimp and grits, with mac and cheese and cornbread for...sides, and beignets for dessert.  IT. WAS. SO. GOOD.  We had so many people tell us it was the best 'wedding food' they'd ever had.  We tried the gumbo beforehand, but thought for an outdoor wedding in July this would be a little too hot, but get the gumbo too!  So good.More

title: Comfort food
review: Love the food here, but many of the dishes will make your mouth sign from spices.   Tonight I had the fried chicken and Cajun fries.    Yumm!  It takes a bit to get your order but you know it's fresh so be patient.   Like the fact...it's BYOB.    My wife enjoys the Mac and cheese option.     Oh, and whoever runs the music here kicks!  Great oldies tunes.More

title: Tasty Southern Style Delights in Lincoln Square
review: We went on a Sunday early evening, nice amount of people there. It was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. It was a quaint casual dining restaurant. Pleasantly area with lots of little shops nearby.

title: Great Fried Chicken!! Amen!
review: Luella's Gospel Bird fries up outstanding chicken. Made fresh when ordered, this chicken is a real treat. Be sure to try The Gospel Biscuit with Egg Sunny Up. Also very tasty is the Chicken and Waffle. Both were big hits at our table. And then...there are the sides! We tried the Yams, Mac & Cheese and the Collards...WOW! The Beignets were sweet, fresh and delicious, but the chicken stole the show. Can't wait for our next visit!More
I have never had food as satisfying as this! It was the perfect combo of sweet and spicy! I can’t wait to come back!

title: Great food
review: This place appears to do a big carry out/ delivery business.  However, we ate in.  The food is ordered and paid for at at the counter and delivered to the table by servers.  We had gumbo, chicken, shrimp and grits, corn bread and biscuits.  All...were  delicious and made in the proper southern way. This is a BYOB place so there is no beer/wine/liquor available. Bring your own. They have soft drinks and iced tea.  The staff was courteous and helpful. We’d return.More

title: great  chicken
review: every newpaper article that says anything about chicken   writes about Luella's,,,,well we drove over an hour to get there,,,,we had no trouble finding a parking space...….nice simple place,,,,,,,very clean...…..menu on a board,,,,,,we came for the chicken and is what we got ,,,,,,WORLD CLASS  BUTTERMILK CHICKEN...A HALF OF THE BEST FRIED CHICKEN I HAVE HAD,,,,,,,service could not be better,,,,,,,lady at the table next to us was having SHRIMP AND GRITS,,;; she loved it     with that said   my wife and I will be back      its worth a drive in to Lincoln squareMore

title: Customer Service Sparkling!
review: What could have been a sour 1st dining experience turned into absolute magnificence..due to leadership! The buttermilk chicken & waffles are soooooooooooo good! The greens are delicious & the beignets!!.... Definitely coming back & bringing more friends..

title: Good food
review: Went for brunch on Sunday and everything on the menu looked so good as did the plates of food as they were being served to other tables which made it difficult to choose. Not a large place and it doesn’t take reservations. You pay at...the counter when you order your food. I got the French toast which was a size able portion and my friend got the chicken and waffles. Both were delicious. One warning, the spicy chicken is spicy so order the regular if you’re not into hot food. I’ll return to try their dinner menu.More

title: OVER PRICED and OVER SALTED
review: This is a self service small restaurant (no table service).  You order at the cash register and  they bring the food to the table.  I ordered the catfish ($15) which came with only ONE medium sized piece of heavily breaded catfish and a tiny arugula...salad (definitely way over priced). The catfish was SUPER SALTY.  My friend got the buttermilk fried chicken (4 pieces) and greens ($16).  It was decent but noting special (certainly no better than Harold's Fried Chicken). We shared a Mac & Cheese, which was underwhelming ($8). The best part about the place is that it adds a unique flavor to the neighborhood and it is BYOB.More

title: Warm, friendly and delicious!
review: Pop into this place when I am hungry and want gumbo. The gumbo here is the best I have eaten in Chicago. Order it at the counter and it will be brought to your table. A bowl of steaming rice is put in front of...you and than the server pours the gumbo over it. Cornbread is a perfect addition to it. I am drooling as I write this because it’s so delicious! Friends had the fried chicken and greens. I think everyone should stop in a get a bowl of gumbo!More

title: Brunch Menu
review: It was my first time trying hot chicken and waffle Louisiana style. The chicken was really juicy! I like the mix of sweet plus spicy from the dish.

title: Solid southern food!
review: A fun little southern joint that will hit the spot if you're in the right mood!  I ordered the following for takeout: - Buttermilk fried chicken - Skillet cornbread with honey butter - Hummingbird cake 	 The highlight was definitely the fried chicken. Very flavorful seasoning,...and delightfully juicy. It made me wish I had eaten it fresh, in the restaurant. Next up would be the hummingbird cake, which was a donut-style cake, which was a fun little treat. Cornbread was decent, but I have to wonder if it would have been better had I eaten in the restaurant, where it would have been served in a skillet.  Didn't have a chance to look around the restaurant since I was just quickly running in and out, but it looked pretty cozy, and the cashier was very friendly.More

title: Small anniversary party catering
review: Luella’s is phenomenal. The owner is wonderful and the staff has always been fabulous.   We got hoppin johns, fried and jerk chicken, mac, collard greens, and corn bread—all phenomenal, and our guests were floored—talkin’ about how delicious it was all night.   Luella’s made our small...family party jump to the next level of fancy, and made it great. I always wanted the food and music to be the best part of this party, and Luella’s gave me that honor.  Genuinely so grateful.More

title: A gem in the city
review: This has to be one of the best restaurants in the City!! From the Chicken to the PoBoy sandwich.. I could not stop eating!! Loved everything and the service is amazing!!

We had so many people tell us it was the best 'wedding food' they'd ever had.  We tried the gumbo beforehand, but thought for an outdoor wedding in July this would be a little too hot, but get the gumbo too!  So good.More

review: It was my first time trying hot chicken and waffle Louisiana style. The chicken was really juicy! I like the mix of sweet plus spicy from the dish.

title: Brunch!  Make It Happen!  Southern Comfort Food Elevated.
review: Sunday brunch!  We stopped in on a day with a local festival so there wasn't a long line.  Staff was supper friendly and we chatted with the "family."  Make sure to check out the Art Work and ask about it!  The artist is famous.     The...More

title: Hearty Breakfast, but oh-so-yummy!
review: Had the chicken and waffles and it was fantastic!! The portions are huge, like any true southern restaurant would. You'll definitely leave feeling stuffed, but in the happy kind of way. Would recommend for a weekend brunch!

title: New take on Southern Classics
review: At my friends request we tried various southern classics ranging from chicken and waffles to shrimp and grits. This quaint restaurant is warm and inviting however, we visited on a Sunday during brunch while a limited menu was being served. We would have tried more...More

title: great southern food, slow service
review: If you like southern cooking, you'll love Luella’s. The restaurant is relatively small, with wooden tables along the sides. You order at the counter in the back, then wait for the staff to bring your meal. My husband and I went with a friend, and...More

title: Run don’t walk here and enjoy one of the best meals in Chicago
review: We thought that we couldn’t possibly have a better meal in Chicago until we stopped here. Everything about this restaurant is worth writing about. The ambiance and music is unreal. The fried chicken with smoked honey is the best we’ve ever eaten. The same with...More

title: One of the best in the city
review: Visited this restaurant on a Saturday afternoon and enjoyed some of the best fried chicken and mac n cheese we’ve ever had! We both got the chicken and waffles and split the mac n cheese and washed it down with some delicious sweet tea. Very...More

title: Lunch discovery
review: I was actually surprised to find a "fast food " like service. With such a name, I was expecting a family dinner style restaurant alike the one I got to visit in Alabama and Louisiana. That does not take away the fact that the food...More

title: Knocks your Socks off
review: We've been here several times, always phenomenal. The gumbo knocks my socks off, and I start having dreams about it when the cold weather hits. Well priced. This is a must try

title: Best Biscuits
review: We enjoyed the best breakfast.  The French toast was wonderful.  The biscuits and gravy are on the spicy side, but very good.  The staff was so freindly.  Highly recommended this resturant.

title: Delightful Cajun
review: Found this place by accident and very happy about. Great Cajun food! The jambalaya is spiced perfectly. My wife had a great kale ambrosia salad and our son had a shrimp po-boy. All were super. If you love Cajun this is the place.

title: Food I grew up with!
review: Having grown up in The South I have a great appreciation for southern food. While visiting Chicago my daughter took us to Luella’s for lunch. Whenever I see shrimp and grits on a menu I order it. It was delicious! Both my husband and daughter...More

title: First Time @ Luella's - Planning next visit
review: Order the jambalaya, it came in a cast iron skillet and it was great. Had fried green tomatoes for the first and was very tasty. The food comes piping hot so you may want to wait a minute before biting into the fried chicken, lesson...More

title: Southern Flavors Hit the Mark
review: On our friend's recommendation we tried Luella's Southern Kitchen. Let me start by saying we arrived around 10:30 about 30 minutes after they opened, by the time we left the place was filling up. You place your order at the counter then find a table....More

title: Oh, that corn bread!
review: This place rocks!  Fried chicken is tender and moist and crunchy on the outside. Biscuits are full of flavor (and the jam is pretty good too).  But the corn bread!  So good. I should have ordered a second just to take home. Yum!

title: It brought tears to my eyes
review: Outstandingly Southern food in the Mid-West.   I LOVED my shrimp and grits, and my friends chicken and waffles, collard greens and ham hocks, corn bread...  I am picky and complaining (not bragging). The restaurant is really clean and well ordered. Service is friendly, conscientious, and...More

title: High hopes obliterated
review: Three of us hopped on the brown line to Lincoln Square to try Luella’s after seeing it on Check Please. The restaurant is small and there is no particular ambiance there. We ordered the fried chicken, hot tamales, brisket and mac and cheese, corn bread...More

title: Very impressed
review: New experience for us in this newish Lincoln Square place.  Tried a number of things beginning with the outstanding gumbo! Could have stopped right there.  Green tomatoes good. Fried chicken really good and tender.   Shrimp and grits are excellent.  Only thing we did not care...More

title: Friendly vibe, delicious food!
review: Well I'm not from the south, but this is the southern style food of my imagination. Rich, filling, simple and direct ingredients brought together with artfully complex spice combos. This food is full of flavor. My shrimp and grits came as a generous portion, the...More

title: Southern cooking in Chicago
review: A variety of delicious southern style foods served in a small comfortable restaurant. Here, you order and pay for your food, pick a table, get your own water and silverware, and wait for what is almost always a delicious treat. Catfish tacos, macaroni and cheese...More

title: Delicious Fried Chicken & Collard Greens, Cornbread
review: We were craving for some comfy southern food & found out that Luella's Southern Kitchen was right in our neighborhood & decided to give it a try for lunch! And we were not disappointed! This is one of the best fried chicken I've ever had,...More

title: Can't wait to return
review: My wife and I heard about this place from the Celebrate Black Owned Business week. We were so happy we did. Lu ella's is simply amazing. I am rarely impressed with restaurants nowadays as I have started cooking more. We ordered the fried chicken, shrimp...More

title: It does what it tries to do very well!
review: This is a comfort food stop and shouldn't be confused with fine dining or nouvelle cuisine - this stuff is downright good. Southern cooking loaded with fat and butter and all the things I'm glad I don't know the nutritional info for because it tasted...More

title: GREAT Biscuits and More!
review: My boyfriend and I, along with 2 friends, decided to check this place out for dinner as our friends had heard some good reviews about it. It was decidedly delicious.  The biscuits! Oh, the biscuits and jam. Definitely deserve their own paragraph as they were...More

title: A Real Southern Cooking Find
review: My family, consisting of two grandchildren ages 17 and 12, their parents, the old guy (74) me had wonderful southern dinner last night at Luella's. I love southern cooking, but have trouble finding the authentic stuff.  This place has it in spades.  The biscuits ($5...More

title: OMG, I WANT TO DINE IN MY PJ'S AT LUELLA'S, PURE SOUTHERN COMFORT ;)
review: Cozy little sit down restaurant in the Heart of Lincoln Square offers some of the best chicken and waffles! The price of the waffles and chicken are a little high at $12 but, completely worth the splurge. It's a little confusing for a first time...More

title: Great Southern Fare
review: This casual dining spot offers some of the best southern cooking in the city. Don't be fooled by the casual counter service as they prepare some wonderful dishes here. Best of the lot is definitely the delicate She Crab soup, one of the few places...More

title: Unforgettable Superb Food & Service!

title: Best fried Chicken?
review: We visited Luella's because a friend who knows her way around a kitchen said this was the best fried chicken in Chicago.  This isn't a dish I often indulge in but Luella's was very, very good; for $15, you get a 1/2 chicken, moist inside...More

title: Good southern food but long wait for food
review: We went here before a show at the Old Town School of Folk Music and didn't quite know what to expect. You order at the counter. You're given a number and find a seat. The food is then delivered to you. It was not super...More

title: Very disapointed
review: I went here today because of the outstanding reviews on the internet. I got 3 pieces of fried chicken with a small side of greens and sweet potatoes. I drove to my house which is no more than 5 minutes away. When i arrived and...More

title: High hopes obliterated
review: Three of us hopped on the brown line to Lincoln Square to try Luella’s after seeing it on Check Please. The restaurant is small and there is no particular ambiance there. We ordered the fried chicken, hot tamales, brisket and mac and cheese, corn bread...More

title: Very impressed
review: New experience for us in this newish Lincoln Square place.  Tried a number of things beginning with the outstanding gumbo! Could have stopped right there.  Green tomatoes good. Fried chicken really good and tender.   Shrimp and grits are excellent.  Only thing we did not care...More

title: Friendly vibe, delicious food!
review: Well I'm not from the south, but this is the southern style food of my imagination. Rich, filling, simple and direct ingredients brought together with artfully complex spice combos. This food is full of flavor. My shrimp and grits came as a generous portion, the...More

title: Southern cooking in Chicago
review: A variety of delicious southern style foods served in a small comfortable restaurant. Here, you order and pay for your food, pick a table, get your own water and silverware, and wait for what is almost always a delicious treat. Catfish tacos, macaroni and cheese...More

title: Delicious Fried Chicken & Collard Greens, Cornbread
review: We were craving for some comfy southern food & found out that Luella's Southern Kitchen was right in our neighborhood & decided to give it a try for lunch! And we were not disappointed! This is one of the best fried chicken I've ever had,...More

title: Can't wait to return
review: My wife and I heard about this place from the Celebrate Black Owned Business week. We were so happy we did. Lu ella's is simply amazing. I am rarely impressed with restaurants nowadays as I have started cooking more. We ordered the fried chicken, shrimp...More

title: It does what it tries to do very well!
review: This is a comfort food stop and shouldn't be confused with fine dining or nouvelle cuisine - this stuff is downright good. Southern cooking loaded with fat and butter and all the things I'm glad I don't know the nutritional info for because it tasted...More

title: GREAT Biscuits and More!
review: My boyfriend and I, along with 2 friends, decided to check this place out for dinner as our friends had heard some good reviews about it. It was decidedly delicious.  The biscuits! Oh, the biscuits and jam. Definitely deserve their own paragraph as they were...More

title: A Real Southern Cooking Find
review: My family, consisting of two grandchildren ages 17 and 12, their parents, the old guy (74) me had wonderful southern dinner last night at Luella's. I love southern cooking, but have trouble finding the authentic stuff.  This place has it in spades.  The biscuits ($5...More

title: Not bad
review: Staff was friendly went for Saturday brunch the shrimp and grits were very good.  The chicken in waffle were ok I had better.  For those that don't get out much they might enjoy.  I felt more flavor could have been added to the chicken.  I...More

title: "Slap Yo Momma Delicious!!"
review: Just arrived home from one of the most delicious meals that we've eaten at in Chicago , in a very long time...      Duck Duck Goat, GT Fish, A10, the Promontory, Sunda..you name em.. Every dish was just as flavorful and beyond our expectations.. Gumbo!, Soft...More

title: Waited a long time
review: We decided to try this restaurant for lunch as it had such great reviews.  I was surprised at the small menu which featured the same choices for lunch and dinner.  Upon recommendation of the person who took our order, I chose the fried chicken.  It...More

title: Simply Delicious!
review: DO GO to Luella's if you are a fan of excellent Southern cuisine. We've tried almost everything on the menu on different occasions and I have to say I'm going to present the The List: Chicken Gumbo - five star, BBQ Brisket Mac & Cheese...More

title: Absolutely fantastic
review: Went with the wife for lunch.  Had the best fried chicken I have ever had.  I've had chicken coast to coast (a self appointed fried chicken aficionado) and this the best. The collard greens were not bitter as in most places and had big chunks...More

title: Luella's has grits!
review: Well let me say she has the best grits and shrimp i ever had. Yummy. And no one hut no one will beat the biscuits. Also at the table was her fried chicken which must be the dish of the place as everyone had it....More

title: Simple and DELICIOUS
review: We have been to Luella's several times. It is consistently good. Go to the counter in back, order your food, sit, wait maybe 10 minutes, and....Boom!  Their signature chicken and waffles is magical. Best chicken I've ever had. The chicken is large chunks of breast...More

title: Very Good Brunch Experiene
review: We visited this restaurant for a weekend brunch. My wife's southern benedict and my andouille sausage quiche were both excellent. I never have beignets from New Orleans before; what I had there was less sweet than what I would prefer for desserts. The services was...More

title: Great Staff!
review: Be warned they are a stickler for reservations! We are always on time so it didn't effect us! This is a cozy little place completely causal even for Mothers Day. The staff was welcoming once reservations were established . We ordered the chicken and waffles...More

title: Chicken and Waffles
review: This place hit the spot!!! We started with 2 orders of fried green tomatoes. Very yummy.. We had the chicken and waffles, the taste as good as they were presented. Also the shrimp and grits they were a hit as well. And had the dessert...More

title: Very Good!
review: fter seeing Luella's featured on the PBS show Check Please I wanted to visit. So. Flippin. Good. So good that I didn't even take pictures of my food and dove right in. Nom Nom!  My wife and I started our dining experience with a order...More

title: Southern Yum!
review: This is a small space with great food.  We went to re-experience our New Orleans trip earlier this year.  You order at the counter and we had to wait for a table; 15 minutes.  It was crowded/full at 5 p.m. on a Saturday night. All...More

title: I got my soul food fix!
review: My sister told me about this place so of course I wanted to try it out.  So I brought her and some of my friends to Luella's before I left town.  Aye Dios Mio!  I couldn't choose.  Braised short rib Mac n cheese, buttermilk fried...More

title: Food Overly Sweet
review: You order at the counter but the food is brought to the table. Funky menu. Most items are overly sweet and overly prepared. Will not return.;

title: Nice atmosphere, good food
review: We came for Sunday brunch. It was good, but know that it's a la carte. DH had shrimp and grits (he loved it), one kid had chicken and waffles (loved it), the other had French toast (he liked it), and I had the sausage quiche...More

title: Best-Kept Sunday Brunch Secret In Chicago
review: We just discovered Luella's Southern Kitchen and at first taste it became our favorite brunch stop in Chicago. The brunch menu offers new twists and flavors on traditional favorites like chicken and waffles (how about apple cider waffles, for example?), The atmosphere is casual, comfortable...More

title: Big flavours,  small space
review: One could miss this spot if not specifically headed for it.  Luella ' s is a nondescript store front on Lincoln. A specials board out front alerts potential diners of the delights inside.  The chicken and waffles was served as 3 plump  juicy pieces of...More

title: A Special Place!
review: I was in Chicago over the weekend with a friend who also loves great food.  We wanted to try some of the trendy, higher end places but also had a recommendation to try Luella's Southern Kitchen and decided to go for Saturday brunch.  First, it...More

title: not as good as expected
review: After reading the reviews I was expecting much better than what the six of us got.  Fried green tomatoes was just fair.  Chicken and waffles,   the chicken was good, the waffle was heavy and not much flavor.  Biscuit were under cooked.  The shrimp and grits...More

title: Happy Accidents are the Best!
review: We found this little gem when we discovered our original chosen lunch spot was closed on Tuesdays. We had the fried green tomatoes, chicken and waffles, and the pimento cheese burger. I must say that the flavors were on point. My husband and I have...More

title: I'm coming back!
review: I was skeptical about this place at first,  but soooooo glad I came at my friend's insistence. Catfish cooked to absolute perfection, rich and thick chicken gumbo, deliciously nutty tasting watermelon salad, and the beignets... the ONLY thing that would make those beignets taste better...More

title: Enjoyed good southern meal with friends
review: If you want a light meal - order the catfish tacos.  I also thoroughly enjoyed the strawberry shortcake with ice cream - quite flavorful.  My husband had the chicken waffle - which was unusual and good.  You order at the counter and they bring you...More

title: Great southern cooking
review: Limited menu but 4 out of 4 meals were fantastic! Shrimp and grits was our favorite. Catfish tacos was our second favorite. Fried greentomatoes were okay, but a little heavy on the breading. Extremely friendly staff. B,Y,O.B. A nice touch. Worth a try.

title: Great Southern Cooking in Chicago
review: Chef Darnell can throw down in that kitchen. His food is delicious! This is a small, casual, and comfy joint. My son had the shrimp po boy and it was fantastic. The bread was perfect. I had shrimp & grits and it was very very...More

title: OK food, Service needs to step up
review: Food is OK, but they're still working out service issues.  It's ok if you're in the area, but it's not worth a special trip.  I came here for Easter with two friends.  There was a miscommunication with the chief hostess, but we eventually got a...More

title: Very Casual BYO on the Bayou
review: We frequent Lincoln Square and have wanted to try out Luella's. This is a very causal BYO place with a take-out but feel free to eat-in setup. It offers all the basics. I tried the Shrimp Po Boy which was good and I would get...More

title: Deep South Cookin' in Lincoln Square
review: Sooner or later, it figures that every style of cooking--from American to Italian to French to Greek to Thai to Cajun to anything you can imagine--would find its way to Chicago. The city has become a haven for hot dogs, barbecue, steaks, pizza and seafood....More

title: Luella's Southern Kitchen Chicago, IL is true Southern cooking at its best!
review: As the name implies, Luella’s Southern Kitchen is all about southern casual dining. This is definitely a southern menu... from chicken and waffles to shrimp po' boys to shrimp and grits. Their main menu has 10 entrees and each one is classic and traditional southern...More

title: Great brunch
review: This little restaurant has only been open about a month, but it has quickly become one of our favorites. We were introduced to it by some local foodie friends, who had been previously and had no trouble finding a table for 4 at 10:00 when...More

title: Awesome Southern Food In Chicago
review: We were delighted to learn that Luella's Southern Kitchen was moving into our neighborhood. Finding a Southern restaurant that's walking distance from our home provides us with a great escape to our favorite cuisine without having to board a plane. This casual spot quickly moved...More

title: Fun Steakhouse in an Argentinian style
review: When you think of Argentinian food one of the first things that comes to mind is beef. We were not disappointed! After some empeñadas as appetizers we dug into the main course: steak. All of our steaks were cooked to perfection. My son had the...rib eye and was extremely happy with it. I had the New York cut and it was marvelous. Overall, this was one of the best steakhouses we've been to. And my wife and her mom ordered the steak flight.More

title: Awful Management / Service, Overpriced and Loud
review: Recently moved to Chicago and we usually spend so much time and money finding good food. But What a mistake with this “Argentinian Steakhouse” since we arrived the hostess (Maria) was on her cellphone and it was not welcoming at all. The waitress was the...star of our awful experience. She was performing like a fast food restaurant and not a fine dining like this place claims to be. The main entrees arrive before the appetizers and we we asked for it the waitress trow attitude on us with  “IM NOT AT THE KITCHEN”, so it was not even a simple apology. She decided to cancel the cocktails from us, and took then back when they were already at the middle (so rude). They never brought you sharp meat knifes until you ask for them. The hostess Maria happened to be the manager too, at least she pretended to be, and when she came to talk to us she basically said “NEVER MIND YOU DINT HAVE TO PAY” no intentions to offer an apology. We didn’t almost had the chance to taste anything. The house music was extremely LOUD, you got the feeling to be in a club, so hard to chat at the table.  The few bites that we were able to taste was NOT MATCHING the price. It’s an over rated and over priced.More

title: double birthday celebration
review: My husband and I celebrated our birthday despite Covid... The place is nice a cozy with table separated they had excellent food.  For 4 people we order for Appetizer- 5 pcs Empanadas which is bursting with flavor. Grill Mollejas is so creamy and deligthful, Trios...de Ceviche is must try.. the combination of flavor of shrimp, tuna and white fish cannot be miss.  Pizza a la Parilla - veggie combination with chess and grill to perfection.  For the main course we order the Steak Fligth - of my ...the Steak melt in your mouth and so flavorful.  Paella del Sur - amazing flavor of all the flavor of the sea.  For desert we order Oblivion and La companila - amazing combination of melted chocolate and dulce de leche.   Service is fast and efficient.   I will definitely wants to go back again.More

title: Definitely worth a visit.
review: Definitely worth a visit.  Wait staff friendly, service excellent.  Food wonderful, not sure were to begin.  Steak and ribs perfect and full of flavor.  Desserts amazing.  And a full body cup of coffee to finish the meal.

title: Lively and Efficient
review: Checked out Artango as part of Restaurant Week. Outstanding experience. Ceviche and Empanada appetizers were spot on and the steak? Perfect. Looking forward to sharing a tasting plate on the next visit. Combine great food with a lively atmosphere and efficient service and you get...a premium dining experience in Lincoln Square.More

Came here during restaurant week with 12 friends which we do every year for restaurant week. The food was excellent! The steak and desserts were excellent!!! The EMPANADAS Chef's choice was delicious! Also we had the CEVICHE Ahi tuna, seaweed, huacatay sauce which was good....The STAR ⭐️ of the meal was the OJO DE BIFE a Round Ribeye steak served with homemade chimichurri and mashed potatoes. WOW!! It was amazing! No fat on that baby!! The BIFE DE CHORIZO a NY Strip Steak served with homemade chimichurri sauce and mashed potatoes was a killer too! Excellent steaks!! The desserts were amazing! We had the OBLIVION Chocolate cake and mousse, dulce de leche ice cream and the FLAN Cinnamon and cardamom-infused custard, dulce de leche, meringue. Both knocked it out of the park!! The cocktail “VOLVÉR” which was Xicaru Joven Mezcal, Italicus Rosolio di Bergamotto, Giffard Grapefruit, Fresh Lime, Simple Syrup, Club Soda was tasty as well. Tasted like a smoky margarita.   The only thing I could say for room for improvement is our waiter seemed really overwhelmed and like he did not want to be at work at all that day..I understand that though because I have felt that way before. We were not able to split the check 6 ways ahead of time.More

title: Neighborhood Gem
review: After seeing the chef from Artango on WGN, and all the empanadas that he made...I couldn’t get there fast enough!! This restaurant did not disappoint!! The empanadas were delicious, the steak flight, with its assorted sauces complimented each bite. I loved the short ribs especially!...The drinks...fantastic!!!b Our server Javier a gem. Can’t wait to go back and eat more!!!!More

title: Great vibe and amazing food
review: My wife and I went here for an anniversary dinner. From the moment you walked in you felt welcomed and engulfed by a wonderful vibe. The cocktails were great and the steak and octopus was even better. I can’t wait to go back

title: Another GREAT meal.
review: Dined there on a Monday night. Sat outside on the patio.  The beef empanadas were better this time that the last. The Pulpo a la Parrilla is always one of my favorites. I usually order the Ojo de Bife, but decided to go with the...Paella del Sur.  Another great choice. Small paella was perfect, but I could have ordered the 3-4 paella and could have probably polished it all off.    The wines are alway a good selection.  Nice open space with great staff.More

title: The kind of place we all wish we had close to home
review: Artango is so good I almost hate to share it The food was fantastic.  The atmosphere was inviting and the entertainment enjoyable.  This place is a carryover from a time when dining was more than just a place for food but rather a place to...spend an enjoyable evening  The gazpacho was sooo refreshing and tasty.  I couldn’t make up my mind, so the Cerviche sampler hit the spot. The steaks are very very very well prepared.  Especially the Ojo Di Bife  The margaritas especially the Mango hit the spot and the bartenders know what they’re doing   And you’ll be sorry if you don’t try the deserts  The band played SpAnish flamingo songs and a dancer periodically added some extra pizazz  This is a five star experience!!More

title: Lincoln Square Gem
review: Love the cocktails and the food was delicious.  We went here with a group and had a great dinner.  I had the quinoa risotto and it was amazing.  Our whole group shared an order of paella.  Everything was great.  Our server helped with drinks.  There...is sometimes live entertainment here.  We missed that heading out for a show after.   Loved this place!More

title: Do not go during fixed price events/occasions
review: Went for NYE and there was a fixed price menu with 4 courses. The restaurant was severely understaffed and the whole thing was a complete mess. It took awhile to even get service, and then the timing for courses was completely off. Two of our...courses were also accidentally served to the tables next to us. Everyone was having service issues.   Food was mixed. The first “course” was a tiny shooter of soup. Basically a spoonful and it was off temperature and served in a plastic flute. Not exactly a good start. We had empanadas and crudo as second courses which were pretty good, and then steak and lamb as mains which were quite good. Dessert was terrible - the flan was nearly inedible and the chocolate cake was just OK.   Ambiance was also subpar. Tables were packed VERY closely together - more than what I would even consider “tight” seating for a restaurant. We had to physically move our table so that it was touching the table on our other side just so people could get out. The “band” played for 20 mins and then left the stage. They were great while they were playing but I have no idea why they didn’t play more. Otherwise it was just loud.   Overall very disappointing and expensive. Would not return.More

title: Average
review: I know it’s tough to compete in Chicago to have a top steakhouse. Artango tries, but just doesn’t do it for me.  If you’re gonna spend $150 on a steak-night out with your spouse, you better get top-notch food, service and ambience.  Lobster bisque was...average, but a very small portion.  Steaks were ok, but I can do better at home (harsh but true).  Desserts (cheese cake and chocolate cake) were unremarkable. It’s a shame - there are bakeries in Lincoln Square that run circles around Artango. Maybe step out for dessert?  Service was very kind, but slow and innstentive.  Ambience is loud, more night-clubby than I prefer for a steakhouse. Decor is very nice, however.  Just can’t really recommend this place. Good effort, just isn’t up to the challenge.More

title: Great atmosphere and drinks
review: My friend a native Chicagoan took me here for a relaxing night of drinks. Great atmosphere and awesome bartenders.

title: Family
review: I had eaten at this place before, it is a very nice restaurant in Lincoln Square, with an ample menu. We were a party of 5 on a Saturday evening, we were sitting right away.  The  waitress was very nice, her suggestion of wine for...me was excellent.  We had the short ribs, “lomito” sandwich, paella for 1-2, soup and lobster ravioles. All the dishes were very well prepared and delicious, specially the lobster ravioles. The service was excellent and the price reasonable.More

review: When you think of Argentinian food one of the first things that comes to mind is beef. We were not disappointed! After some empeñadas as appetizers we dug into the main course: steak. All of our steaks were cooked to perfection. My son had the...rib eye and was extremely happy with it. I had the New York cut and it was marvelous. Overall, this was one of the best steakhouses we've been to. And my wife and her mom ordered the steak flight.More

They were great while they were playing but I have no idea why they didn’t play more. Otherwise it was just loud.   Overall very disappointing and expensive. Would not return.More

title: Average
review: I know it’s tough to compete in Chicago to have a top steakhouse. Artango tries, but just doesn’t do it for me.  If you’re gonna spend $150 on a steak-night out with your spouse, you better get top-notch food, service and ambience.  Lobster bisque was...average, but a very small portion.  Steaks were ok, but I can do better at home (harsh but true).  Desserts (cheese cake and chocolate cake) were unremarkable. It’s a shame - there are bakeries in Lincoln Square that run circles around Artango. Maybe step out for dessert?  Service was very kind, but slow and innstentive.  Ambience is loud, more night-clubby than I prefer for a steakhouse. Decor is very nice, however.  Just can’t really recommend this place. Good effort, just isn’t up to the challenge.More

title: Great atmosphere and drinks
review: My friend a native Chicagoan took me here for a relaxing night of drinks. Great atmosphere and awesome bartenders.

title: Family
review: I had eaten at this place before, it is a very nice restaurant in Lincoln Square, with an ample menu. We were a party of 5 on a Saturday evening, we were sitting right away.  The  waitress was very nice, her suggestion of wine for...me was excellent.  We had the short ribs, “lomito” sandwich, paella for 1-2, soup and lobster ravioles. All the dishes were very well prepared and delicious, specially the lobster ravioles. The service was excellent and the price reasonable.More

title: After Theatre Dinner
review: Stopped in after a show and loved this spot. Arrived around 10 pm and the Flamenco show was just finishing. The place was filled, but we were quickly seated. Ordered Martinis which were reasonably priced and a very nice pour. Decided on a number of...More

title: Excellent Argentinean Steakhouse
review: Great place for some typical dishes.  We enjoyed the mixed grill and everyone at the table raved about the mojitos.  I also enjoyed the flan which was one of the best I have ever had - not too sweet and not too eggy - just...More

title: Great atmosphere, amazing music and really great food!
review: Went there with few girl friends for Ian Maksin’s cello concert, not expecting much out of the place, this place looks amazing! The service is outstanding! The food was delicious! We shared whole bunch of dishes; ceviche, empanadas, steak, paella and dessert. Everything was fantastic-...More

title: Romantic Atmosphere Galore
review: We went to this delightful restaurant on a Wednesday night. Typically a Wednesday is not a busy night for restaurants in Chicago. True to form, the restaurant was not very crowded. Therefore it was quite easy to discuss things with my partner and enjoy the...More

title: Great bar!
review: I loved the atmosphere!!!! I had a couple cocktails and they were nice. The staff was extremely attentive. Great experience overall!

title: Very good!
review: My wife and I ate dinner here on August 15, 2018.  Our server, Joel, was great.  Our empanadas, bife de lomo, and plantains were delicious.

title: Fun place with great entertainment
review: Went for the Flamenco Show on Aug. 18. Great performers. Also had dinner, enjoyed the empanada, pulpo, and paella. Planning on returning soon for more.

title: Taste of Argentina on Lincoln Ave
review: We were looking for something different and this Argentine restaurant had been recommended. It had a nice patio for outdoor seating. The inside space is very attractive. We tried the eggplant and lentil appetizer and the ensalda verde for starters. Both were very good. The...More

title: Lovely Outdoor Dining
review: Wonderful spot for music and drinks! The guitar player was fabulous....well known tunes with a 12 string Latin flavor.  Try the Brazilian cocktails...loved the Mojito!  The spicy bbq shrimp was excellent as well. Next time we’ll come back for dinner.  The steaks looked awesome!

title: Great Food and service
review: Fantastic time. Argentina food. All good. Service was excellent  Argentina dancing lessons on Tuesday start at 7:30 pm... Music on speakers very mellow.  The Restaurant has live Music on weekends which I understand is excellent. Another customer we had conversation with says guest entertainment comes...More

title: Food is Delicious!
review: Came here for Mother's Day and everyone thoroughly enjoyed the different food. We all shared bites of what we ordered. By far, the caramelized onion and cheese empanada was my favorite thing on the menu. Would go back for just those.  The cocktails were not...More

title: Soooo good!
review: An awesome local place for great steaks and Argentine cuisine. I had their skirt steak and it was seasoned perfectly, no need to use the sauces that came with it or salt. The flavor was amazing and temperature was perfect. The plantains were spot on...More

title: Excellent food, wine and ambience
review: Visited Artango with my girlfriend and our friend while visiting his neighbourhood in Chicago.  We were seated promptly, even without a reservation.  The restaurant was warm and cozy and, in spite of being quite busy, you didn't feel as if you were sat on top...More

title: Curry in the Chimichurri!
review: The decor of this restaurant is unique. Their cocktails are refreshing.  However, our experience last night at Artango on 2/3/2018 was lackluster.  We were not at all impressed with the service and taste of the food.  We were a four top and seated in the...More

title: Great atmosphere with good food
review: Very nice restaurant with a good city vibe. We had the empanadas and ceviche. The empanadas were very flavorful and full of stuffing (unlike many restaurants). The ceviche crudo was very good but a bit sparse (6 slices of fish). More like Argentinian sashimi. We...More

title: Amazing food, service and atmosphere
review: I chose this as something different and was pleasantly surprised.  The steak I had was cooked perfectly and the fresh cut fries were amazing.  The server was very nice and they offered brief tango dancing lessons to all the guests.  It isn't a cheap restaurant,...More

title: Great food and entertainment
review: I had a dinner with friends and we attended European Cabaret night, food was excellent, meat was cooked to order and ever as I ordered well done it was soft and juicy. Service was very good and desert delicious. Entertainment was  great, we really enjoyed...More

title: Awesome Christmas dinner.

title: We enjoyed our dinner - prices are on a par with similar steak places

title: Go for a Very Happy Hour

title: Night out with friends

review: The service, the delicious food at a reasonable price - all with soft background Argentinian music.....meaning soft enough so WE COULD EASILY talk.....made for a   relaxing, delightful evening....

title: Great Drinks, Great Food, and Great Staff!

title: The food is EXCELLENT

title: Great Atmosphere!!!
review: I loved the atmosphere!!!! The staff was extremely attentive and the owners came over to talk with us to insure that we had a wonderful time. The food was ok, but I REALLY ENJOYED the Polenta and probably could have eaten that ALL NIGHT!!!! The...More

title: Tangolicious
review: Wow, well service is outstanding and the food is delicious.  Presentation is awesome.  Prices aware a bit high but I think very well worth it.  The night we went they had a couple that did a tango dance. A must try for sure.

title: Steak and Tango! Is anything better than that?
review: We came to Artango for our wedding anniversary with a few friend and got our table by the window which is always a nice touch. It feels very lively and European. The tango dancers start around 8:30 pm and I wish they would dance around...More

title: Argentinean Steak!!
review: If you like to have a really flavorful steak, this might be a good place for you.  A group of us went there on Xmas Eve and ordered a wide variety of things...and ALL of us were really pleased.  Even the ceviche trio (which I...More

title: Good Argentine corner of Lincoln Sq.
review: Got there before opening time, so I came back after going to a great store across the street with imported goods.  Few people on a drizzly night early, but I was attended well.  Guess the fire pit was just heating up...both the empanadas and tirado...More

title: Tango dancing entertainment
review: There were 13 of us. The older couples each shared appetizers (empanadas and cerviche) and each shared an entree (mostly steak entrees) and still could not finish. The steaks (ribeye, sirloin, NY Strip) were fine, but not outstanding. The sauces were interesting. The highlight of...More

title: Come to eat, learn to tango
review: The Artango Bar & Steakhouse used to be in the Ravenswood area, but relocated for a bigger place to the Lincoln Square area.  It is now on Lincoln Ave., just south of Lawrence Ave.  Since it is a neighborhood street mall, the street is one...More

title: Poor service
review: We booked a sitting last Sunday for 8 people for 20.00hrs. When we arrived we were the only customer and we seated at the window. The waiter did not give us enough time to peruse the menu, he kept coming over asking were ready. We...More

title: First visit
review: We passed by 2 weeks ago and the gave out sample margaritas and I was sold. Came back today for dinner and the food was fabulous and service was great. Our wait staff knew about the food. We had the Ceviche Trio, beef empanadas for...More

title: Good first visit - Watch out for the sizzlers
review: This was our first visit to this relatively new restaurant in the Square.  Certainly will not be our last.  Ceviche sampler was very good.  Very different from Mexican ones.  Big on the fish / shrimp with interesting seasonings.  Steaks and accompaniments were good as was...More

title: Lincoln Square Gem
review: My wife and I ate here with a group of friends and LOVED it!  Excellent food, great ambiance, great service and after dinner we got a big surprise.  They cleared the tables in the middle of the restaurant and about 15 couples did the tango...More

title: In the mood for Tango?
review: We went there on a Friday night on a whim not knowing what to expect.  It was a very pleasant surprise.  BYOB and the food is excellent.  The service was great.  Tango dancing started at 10PM to the sound of old "classical" tangos. A great...More

title: Wednesday on the city
review: Need to try the Ceviche, it's unbelievable. They bring you 3 different kinds of ceviche, you will love it and for sure you are going to ask for more. The steak is amazing and the deserts are just mouthwatering. One more thing it's BYOB and...More

title: What a Surprise! Art, Tango and Great Food!
review: I don't know what I was expecting when we went to this out of the way restaurant built in former industrial space, but what we got was an art studio, a dance studio and a great restaurant serving South American food, all in one!  The...More

title: Excellent South American Food
review: We went here for Mother's Day and ordered from the fixed price menu.  Everyone in our group really liked the food.  The steak and paella dishes were especially good.  The moment you walk in, you, the art and decor create the feeling of traveling to...More

title: Wonderful dining experience in Chicago
review: This restaurant was wonderful.  First of all, lots of parking right in front of the restaurant FREE!!!  Unheard of for downtown Chicago.  Had the Tues-Thurs deal 3 course special.  Wonderful grilled provoletta, empanadas, seafood paella, entrana with julienne veggies and mashed potatoes and dulce de...More

title: Off the beaten track
review: This restaurant is in a former industrial space with lots of parking out front.  As soon as you walk in, you see interesting art work which continues throughout the large, open eating area. We came for brunch and enjoyed the Latin American twist on traditional...More

title: AMAZING FOOD WONDERFUL PLACE
review: We arrived for our reservation at 645pm it was great no waiting our table was ready.  The food was incredible and the dessert to die for, I will definitely come here for another date or hang out with a good friend, also it's BYOB so...More

title: Hidden gem
review: We came here on a whim and were VERY impressed - one of the best skirt steaks I've ever had, friendly service and a uniquely artistic, romantic dining space. BYOB policy adds to the already great value. Will definitely be back!

title: Astounded by the ART of Artango!
review: Three of us, armed with two bottles of wine and a partial bottle of pisco brandy, had a tremendous meal.  While the menu is very reasonable, the tastes are vast.   We were able to enjoy our first visit and use a Groupon but the prices...More

title: Argentinian rest
review: First time here and won't be the last. This is such a AMAZING place. Only is kinda hidden but service, atmosphere, music, food is so good.

title: Dinner and dance
review: The restaurant is set up to allow for tango classes and demonstration on particular nights. The menu is limited but showcases many South a]American classics. The ceviche was great one night and very mediocre the next time. Lamb pasta is a bit "picante" but overall...More

title: cool atmosphere, average food
review: Love the room, the artwork, the atmosphere. We were only a party of 2 and I wasn't disappointed like the last reviewer, but I wasn't blown away either. The appetizers had good flavor and I love that they come as a variety so you get...More

title: Very disappointing!!
review: My party of 10 dined here on New Years Eve and i was very excited about our reservations. The reviews were great and prix fix menu looked great so we decided to try it out. Bad mistake! The restaurant was not that busy, but the...More

title: Great Atmosphere and Service
review: This was our first time at Roots and we were very pleased  with the  friendly service and  great food.  Yummm

title: great service and vegan eatss
review: Great vegan pizza with protein options and vegan cheese. We also had the sausage and it was very delicious, my meat eater husband and my vegan self both found great things t eat at the same restaurant which is rare.

title: Not impressed!
review: I have visited this location with my family on a Friday night. The weather was pleasant and we sat outside. The server was doing her best to help us, however waiting for the food was almost an hour. I think the issue was they prioritized...the delivery / take out pizzas and we were left behind. The pizza came in with long strips that is their signature I guess, but not sure I like it. It is hard to take the pizza slice that is extra long from the tray. Also the sausage / pepperoni were at the bottom. I know we were told these facts before ordering, but certainly didn't like it.More

title: July 4th Happy Hour
review: We were visiting from STL and wanted to try the BEST Cheese sticks in Chicago...maybe the world.  So we went here and ordered them along with the 32 oz. goblet beers that were half price.  What a deal.  These cheese sticks are the very best...I have ever had.More

title: Happy Hour Pizza
review: We went here for an early happy hour.  Little did we know that for the price of a 16 ounce you can get a 32 ounce.  Warning that it is a lot of beer to drink with a pizza. We had the cheese sticks and...they were delicious and the best that I have ever had.  Waitress said they were voted #1 in Chicago with their cheese sticks.  I believe it because they were so good.  Then we ordered a handmade pizza for 2.  It was wonderful but the 2 of us could only eat half of it.More

title: Delicious Pizza
review: I've had this delivered twice & it was amazing!  I'm from the East Coast so i miss normal triangle pizza.  they have great options for toppings.  Can't wait to actually eat inside the restaurant.

title: Bad service, mediocre food.
review: This is my third visit since they opened and each time, the service has been really poor.  I don't find the pizza that exciting.  The atmosphere is decent but I just don't know why this place is packed as often as it is.

title: Good atmosphere and pizza
review: Service was great! We ordered a vegan pizza which is off the menu. A picher of cider was nice for a hot day.

title: .....PIZZA IS A MANY SPLENDORED THING......
review: Upfront confession: my go-to wood fired joint a block away was closed for a private party.  Seeing the sign in the distance, and burning daylight, I hoofed it on down.  Since ANY claim laid to regional authenticity depends on there being more than ONE purveyor...of same, I question on principle the "quad-cities" concept.  I've delved deeply into the dish with Chicago pies, danced through odd combinations (Canadian bacon, shrimp, pineapple) in Stockholm, so now a puffy hand-tossed malt sweetened crust?  Why not?  I opted for the pulled pork variant, with its branded bbq sauce.    Two notables: there's a generous circumference of crust bereft of any topping. Also, the shredded cheese is added last, so it's not exactly melted or bubbly.  Curious. Had to check twice, but I wasn't imagining a sprinkle of cole slaw under the cheese. Edible - yes. Pizza - well maybe.  Served scissor-cut into strips and eaten on odd wooden "plates", I feel a point is being made here.  Like the noble hipster, are we different for our own sake??  Final comment needed on the cost: this place ain't cheap!  Were it not for the happy accident of "half-price pizza happy hour", into which I luckily fell, this $28 item would have suffered a harsh valuation.  Even at $14, for the quantity of pork presented, it's tres cher.    I applaud their farm-to-table sourcing, even making their own sausage in-house.  Sadly, this approach is best suited to an exclusive bistro, whose cuisine justifies and can absorb the extra cost.  Time will only tell if novelty alone creates a niche.More

title: Always a treat
review: We travel to Chicago to visit family a couple of times a year and always eat at Roots at least once trip. The Mozzarella Sticks are the best I’ve had anywhere and we love the pizza crust. Great beer selection and being from the Northwest...we love different kinds of beer. Anyway Roots is great place to eat lunch or dinner if you’re in Chicago.More

title: Average pizza + Very noisy  environment
review: They have many unusual types of pizza. Be sure you know what it is before ordering. The one we ordered had no cheese no pizza sauce.  When we were there, a children's sports team arrived.  We were willing to be tolerant of some extra noise...More

title: Quad Cities pizza?
review: Didn't like it.  Sweet crust, not enough sauce, very blah.  Ordered a large salad that easily fed four of us... but didn't really like it either.  Felt like something was missing.  After rechecking the menu, the kitchen had forgotten tomatoes.  We were too hung over...More

title: LOVED!!!!!
review: Pizza was amazing!!! We also got the fried ravioli, one cheese and one with meat...I think the cheese was our favorite though both were  delicious  ! My daughter, Jaymee, and I split a Build your own salad..so good!! We will definitely go back!! Beyond our...More

title: Handmade pizza
review: Nice atmosphere with ability to watch the pizza maker throw the dough for crusts.  Kids really enjoyed watching him toss the dough.  Also, they give the kids a small ball of dough to play with while waiting.  The salads are HUGE!  You can create your...More

title: Try something new

title: Great beer selection + handmade pizza
review: Roots is a true gem! With one of the best beer selections in town, I am shocked they aren't on every "best in beer" list. We discovered them due to a Founders tap takeover this week and will be back for sure. Roots also has...More

title: Loved the salad, unique pizza
review: Roots Handmade Pizza bills itself as having "Quad City's Style" pizza.  I can honestly say now that I'm glad that I have never even visited the Quad City's.  We ordered a tomato, avocado & mozzarella salad which had Mighty Vine tomatoes, diced avocado, roasted corn,...More

title: PRICEY PIZZA WHICH LEAVES TASTEBUDS DISAPPOINTED!
review: Well... after 3 tries to make this restaurant a family favorite of ours, we just always leave disappointed with the quality of the food. We've been to Roots in the Ukranian Village when my older son lived there and it was only "OK". Now that...More

title: Best pizza in Chicago from an east coast lady
review: This is the best pizza I have found yet. I'm from the east coast and very very particular! Love the home made crust, excellent sauce, fresh veggies, perfect proportions of sauce to crust to cheese! I'm in heaven! Lived here almost two years without good...More

title: Became a regular at this place...
review: LOVE LOVE LOVE everything about this place.  Pizza is outstanding.  They have so many interesting specialty pizzas with unique toppings or you can just build your own.  The beer menu is incredible.  We have brought so many people to this place because we enjoy it...More

title: Flawless
review: I've been to Roots somewhere between 10-15 times. Best mozzarella sticks I've ever had. Best salad I've ever had (tomato, avocado and mozzarella salad) and the taco pizza and pulled pork pizza are unique and outstanding. It's hard to choose between the two so go...More

title: Great gourmet salad, pizza, service
