title: Nice Pizza place
review: Was in town visiting and met up with some friends that live there. Came for a late dinner on a Saturday night. Place was pretty busy since the Cubs were playing in the playoffs and did have to wait a few minutes for a table....More

title: Great West Town Pizza
review: Located beside West Town Bakery this Pizza place offers great pizza with a variety of offerings.  Try there fried mozzarella- sinfully good.

title: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!
review: Each time i visit this place i am greeted with a friendly smile and seated quickly.  My server Sarah came to our table quickly and had a fabulous sense of humor and service.  The food was perfect as always.  This is a pizza that is...More

title: Great pizza and other stuff
review: Had this meal delivered from the new lawrence ave location. Ordered a salad, mozzarella sticks and pizza. Everything was really good, especially the handmade mozzarella sticks. Get the homemade ranch too. Really good. Will definitely order again and again!

title: Interesting pizzas with a fun outdoor setting
review: Started the meal off with some fried ravioli which are always one of my favorites.  They claim to have "Quad Cities" style pizza which was something new to me - they cut the pizza in half and in strips.  Who cares how you cut it!...More

title: Terrific food all around
review: We had a big gathering at our friends' house and had a ton of food delivered from Roots. All of it was fantastic, top to bottom, from the cheesestick pizza, deep dish pizza, chicken chorizo dogs, foldovers, salads, etc. I would absolutely recommend anything from...More

title: Very Good Non-Chicago Style Pizza
review: This place was a very good alternative to the thick crust Chicago style pizza. We have been here on several occasions. The pizza is always very good, and the monkey bread is a must. The pizza has the right amount of sauce and cheese, and...More

title: Good Pizza even better Gluten-Free pizza too!
review: Our family with 2 small children enjoyed Roots very much!!  We also have some food allergies as well as gluten sensitivity who was able to enjoy the best GF pizza they've ever had!!  Highly recommend Roots!

title: Great food.
review: The cheesesticks are really good. I've also had the taco pizza. One of the best I've ever had. I try to go here on each visit to Chicago.

title: Child Friendly
review: Not wanting to disturb other restaurant patrons it is hard to go out to lunch or dinner with a baby.  This restaurant makes it a delight. There is a special area of the restaurant where you can eat with your baby and not worry that...More

title: NOTHING SPECIAL
review: I ordered from here for the first time and 'boy was i a un happy camper. The pizza was not what i expected the sausage looked like pizza hut crumbled and the crust was suppose to be thin crust..not. Ordered a italian beef combo. meat...More

title: Great atmosphere
review: This is a really nice restaurant.  It's roomy, family friendly, nice staff.  I love the decor. Appetizers were good, we tried the artichoke spinach dip.  Buffalo wings were super hot. Service was quick.  Pizza came out before we even finished the apps.  I would only...More

title: Menu is already in the garbage bin
review: My boyfriend and I were so excited to finally try the new Roots Pizza in our neighborhood (Lincoln Square). The first time we tried to dine-in the wait was 45 minutes+ so we headed elsewhere and promised to return. The next time we called around...More

title: Love this place!
review: A group of us got together at Roots for a fun Sunday lunch.  The extensive beer list was impressive for the men, while the food and child-friendly atmosphere appealed to us ladies.  We are originally from the Quad Cities, so the pizza was spot-on to...More

title: Great Pizza, Great Local Beer Selection
review: We went to Roots for salads and pizza, and everything was great. The name refers to its focus on sourcing local products, including the beer. The pizza dough is made with malt, which gives it a slightly sweet flavor and great texture. Dishes can be...More

title: Awesome place
review: Not your average Chicago pizza.  They bill it as Quad City pizza because of their malt crust.  Been here twice and both times the service was very good.  Sarah was our server today.  Great atmosphere and food.  The mozzarella sticks are huge and yummy.  Highly...More

title: Not your Standard Pizza
review: If you are looking for a typical style pizza you will be disappointed. This pizza is special and delicious. I recommend the pulled pork, BLT ( put the mayo on even though it sounds sort of gross, it's great), and the taco. The short rib...More

title: I would call it gourmet pizza!
review: It was my first time here and it won't be my last.  It started with a great server, continued with a killer taco pizzas and finished with a reasonable bill.  It you are a pizza lover and like more than pepperoni you will love this...More

title: Really Good Pizza!
review: I'm really picky about pizza. I rate this in the top ten of my life. It's clean, open and airy. The pizza was great and they have a lot of options. Great beverage choices, excellent service.

title: Largely disappointed
review: Ordered a pizza and salad to share. The pizza was bland and I think it is over priced at $25. The sauce was not to my liking as it seemed like paste instead of sauce to me. The salad on the other hand was a...More

title: The pulled pork pizza is the best pizza I have ever had in my life!
review: The two best things about Roots: 1. The Quad Cities pizza (in strips instead of slices) is great 2. The pulled pork pizza is seriously the most amazing and delicious pizza I have ever had in my life. The other two pizzas we had were...More

title: Casual & Delicious
review: Great selection of beer - and seasonal beers - to choose from.  Samples offered. Delicious pizzas and large selection of salads. Casual and comfortable.

title: Nice way to spend an afternoon
review: After seeing Roots Pizza on a local cooking show here in CA, we made it a point to visit the restaurant on our visit. We had It was a destination that proved to be further than we thought, however it was so worth the journey....More

title: Good stuff!
review: They have good gluten free pizza crust, with lots of different topping options. The make-your-own-salad is great- if you can manage not to get overwhelmed by the toppings! We had food delivered- friendly, in time.

title: Comfortable Restuarant
review: Large selection of Midwest Brewed beers. Very good pizza. Service was very good. First time at this location, and I will stop by again.

title: How can you not like this pizza?
review: The only thing I don't like about Roots Pizza on 1924 West Chicago Avenue is it doesn't deliver in my zip code. In virtually every survey I've read on "best pizza in Chicago," Roots is listed among the top 10. So...if Roots can't come to...More

title: Have the monkey bread you wont regret it
review: I do not like deep dish Pizza so we went here instead.  We had a shrimp appetizer and the monkey bread.  Both were delicious.  The monkey bread is light and fluffy and garlic flavored it was delicious.  The pizza was wonderful the crust had a...More

title: 3rd try not a charm
review: My friend lives within walking distance so we want to like the place, it's so convenient and had an outdoor space.  I've gone three times now and my opinion has not changed. The meat on the Italian beef sandwich was dry.  My friend had the...More

title: Pizza with a twist
review: Different approach to making and serving all natural product in a pizza format.   Delicious food and a great atmosphere.  Although we dined in the early evening the bar like environment must really hop at night.  We went strictly for the food and enjoyed it very...More

title: Good but expensive
review: Visited roots with 3 women and our 3 teenaged daughters on a Sunday night. The place was busy but we were seated right away. Our servers were friendly and helpful. GET THE MOZZARELLA STICKS. I felt very 1989 ordering them but, OMG, they are made...More

title: Just OK
review: We went to lunch at Roots and fully enjoyed sitting outside and the service was good. The food was fresh but underwhelming.

title: One of my favorite pizza places in Chicago
review: Having lived in Chicago for over ten years now, I know there is no point to calling something the "best" pizza - everyone has their favorites.  But this place is definitely one of my favorites.  If I lived in the neighborhood I'd visit more often....More

title: Creative & delicious pizzas
review: I really enjoyed the pizza at Roots - especially the way you could mix and match the creative pizza toppings into a half&half pizza. Both sides were delicious!

title: I'd like to think I'm a connoisseur of pizza...and I give this place an A+.
review: They have the most amazing "Lilly's bbq pizza."   Made with a beer crust which is perfect not to sweet not to buttery the absolute perfect blend. Topped with delicious cheese, bbq pulled pork, and slaw to top it all off!  What I love most is...More

title: Great foord and atmosphere
review: There was a bit of a smell of gas coming from the brick wall but it seemed to be outdone by the delicious food smells.  The pizza is OK but everything else we had on the menu was outstanding!!

title: Cheese Sticks from Heaven
review: The pizza at Roots is Quad Cities style.  That means it has a malt crust.  It is really good.  It is really filling.  But as good as the pizza is,  you might consider skipping it because the other stuff on their menu (mostly fried bar...More

title: Didn't live up to hype, but still good
review: My friends from the Quad-Cities couldn't stop raving about Roots so we made a special trip downtown to try it.  If you don't know, they publicize their malt crust and scissor-cut pizza (strips vs. wedges) as a point of differentiation.  They were conveniently located on...More

title: SALAD!
review: Five stars for the salads here - tomato, avocado, and mozzarella was SOOO GOOD and the greek was relish!  This is a first for me, but I think the salad was the star and it outshone the pizza!  Good beer selection.

title: Good Gluten Free Pizza
review: Many of my friends are often on the hunt for gluten free pizza.  This time and time again has won as a favorite for them.

title: Great pizza and sidewalk area
review: Stopped in one evening and sat in the sidewalk cafe area which is off the Main Street. Lots of people to watch go by. Service was extremely attentive from the hostess to the waitress to the bus/support staff. Our pizza was very delicious, and I...More

title: Homemade- quality
review: They make their own sausage, root beer, cheese...amazing salads in a trough...big enough to share. The pizzas are hearty and unique. So nice to go someplace that is not a Big chain.

title: Sorry, but Quad City-Style Pizza just isn't that good...
review: Obviously, artisanal pizzas are hot, and this place is directed at that market.  And...the kitchen has credibility, as the chef formerly worked at Blue 13 (one of my favorites before it closed).  Abundant and very nice outdoor seating on Winchester (a side street, away from...More

title: Best pizza in/around West Town
review: I have eaten here a few times and always enjoyed it. They make a quality pizza, I actually prefer the non-gimmicky pizzas. The cheese alone or something else simple will be good. They have taco pizza's and those types of things which are good too,...More

title: Great Pizza
review: We had a fantastic spinach dip as an appetizer, then a sausage pizza and BLT pizza.  Both were great.  Parking is a little dicey but worth it.

title: Fantastic pizzas!
review: The pizzas are so delicious, you'll wish you found this place sooner.  However you need to arrive with an appetite as the portions are massive, you won't leave hungry... Try the mozzarella sticks too, the mozzarella is home made and mega tasty!

title: Great food lousy service
review: Great atmosphere in a neighorhold restaurant. Food was great and the portions were huge     howerever  the service was not good.  It toke forever for the server to take our order and in the middle of taking our order she disapeared only to come back a...More

title: Neighborhood pizza joint.  Great handmade pizza and craft beer!
review: Neighborhood restaurant / bar.  Easy walk from Ukraine Village or Noble Square.  Safe area.   Pizza was delicious.   The malt crust, sauce and mozzarella are all home made.   The roasted beet and goad cheese salad was also great (I would go back just for that).    They...More

title: Tasty pizza
review: We liked the atmosphere in the restaurant ,it was busy but not too packed. We ordered a starter that came,but the main took a little longer but they gave us a larger pizza and apologised .the food was good and worth the wait.

title: Good pizza
review: Our first visit, but very satisfying.  Tasty, but not heavy, nor mushy.  Good environment, will visit again

title: Good Pizza but Weak Service...
review: I've eaten here in the past with no issue, but this time we ordered to-go since we had a big family group at my son's apartment.  He called in the order and they seem to only use one name - so he gave them his...More

title: Good pizza
review: Though not Chicago-style, deep-dish, the pizza was very good with a very flavorful crust that enhanced the overall taste.   We visited while a street fair was going on in this neighborhood, so it was loud and crowded.  Our server took a long time to fill...More

title: Chicago pizza flying under the radar
review: Chicago hand tossed style pizza was delicious. The service was great, had 4 teenagers and a toddler with us and the staff was great with them. 7 people had pizza, wings, and cheese sticks oluplus our drinks and the bill was just over 70 bucks.......More

title: Great sandwiches
review: The food is very good here.  The restaurant's atmosphere is relaxing.  The feel is casual.  We came here with friends who live in Chicago. I don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu.  It was great!

title: Awesome!
review: Since moving to Chicago, I've been on a quest to find a favorite pizza. I've been to 20+ pizzerias so far, including most of the iconic ones. I've had some terrific pizzas and a few clunkers, but so far Roots Handmade Pizza is definitely in...More

title: Honey sweet crispy crust
review: RThis was my first visit to Roots.  We had a large veggie pizza and really liked it.  They put on lots of mozerella, over a simple sauce that works well.  The crust is sweet and crispy, and tastes like it is made with honey.  As...More

title: On the pricey side, but worth it
review: Went here with my wife and friends on a couples date. The bill at the end of the night was steep but worth it. The pizza tastes great, the beer selection is good, the staff is nice, and it's never so crowded that your up...More

title: Terrific Pizza, good vibe
review: The pizza here is different, and delicious.  Highly recommend giving this place a try.  Good beer menu, good vibe and great service make this a go-to-spot for lots of occasions.

title: Great party
review: This was home to Miami Hurricane fans for one night and the party was great. The pizza is some of the best I ever had and the Mozzarella sticks were even better. They provided excellent friendly service and I would  sure to come again on...More

title: Flavorful handmode food, neighborhood friendly
review: The homemade mozzarella was a clue as to the care taken with all the food.  These mozzarella cubes are coated with a special thin herb crust and deep fried.  The marinara sauce served with them is so good, I could eat a bowl of it...More

title: Great Bistro - done in by Covid sadly
review: All I can say RPI Chez Simo. Our favorite restaurant in Chicago. Brought you back to Paris. Small, family own and run. Great food, and BYOB. Gracious host .  I hope they open another one.

title: French Gem In Ravenswood
review: Our friends selected this little throw back in time. Started garlic cheese(with olives) butter on baguette toast delicious. Our friends brought 3 amazing wines 2 reds, and an Icewine for dessert.  Braised lamb shank with peas and couscous was great, Steak Pomme fritters was good,...a little overcooked but still moist and delicious. Seared Duck breast and leg confit with polenta, braised red cabbage was exceptional. Lastly braised Salmon on whipped potatoes was great as well! The food is prepared to order so allow some time. The duck especially,  unfortunately we weren't told in advance. We enjoyed the atmosphere and drank while the wait was well over an hour. They apologized, waived the corking fee(s), complimented our desserts that were also delicious. Next time we'll come on a weekday for faster service. Food was definitely worth the wait!More

title: Amazing French Food!
review: I discovered Chez Simo Bistro a couple of years ago and have probably introduced 15 people to the restaurant since.  The food is really great, and since it's byo, the tab is always reasonable.  Simo, the owner, is so charming.  I always enjoyi going back.

title: A true French Experience
review: This wonderful gem is like having a small piece of Paris. Great food. Authentic.  Not snobby. BYOB. French music, the staff speaks English and French. I get the coq au vin, always!!!! Cheeses outstanding. Had a pear poached in red wine- heavenly!

title: The best soupe à l'oignon!
review: By far the best soupe à l'oignon that I've had in a very long time! This is a great BYOB family owned and run restaurant, with great service and ambiance! When you can speak french to the staff, you know you are at the right...place to eat french food!  I'll be back soon for more soup.More

title: Delicious food with a French Flair - Best Creme Bruleee!!!
review: Have visited this Bistro and it never fails to please!  The canard is not only the cuisse de canard but also the duck breast - beautiful!  My husband insists on having the steak frites even tho the frites are shoestring potatoes rather than delectable real...frites. BYOB makes it more affordable.  Friendly service.  Creme brulee - one of the best!More

title: Charming Bistro Serving the Classics
review: Love the unassuming atmosphere, friendly staff, classic bistro fair done perfectly, and BYOB to boot! What's not to love?

title: A little slice of France in Lincoln Square
review: We're lucky to have an authentic French Bistro so close to home. Simo ran the prestigious Kiki's Bistro kitchen for 10 years. After they closed he decided to go out on his own. In an area that's glutted with dining choices, he brought something new...to the table. As a BYOB place, you can bring your own wine and splurge on the food! The French Onion Soup is as real as it gets, and the short rib choice makes it worth a trip off the beaten track. Save room for the chocolate mousse or the profiterols and you'll go home thinking you've been to Paris!More

title: A pleasant evening
review: A recommendation of a friend, who knew the c-Algerian owner,  we made reservations for 7:00-- glad we did, as the restaurant was full on a Friday night.  Traditional decor. Perhaps it's my obsession  now, but the center of the restaurant was quite dark.  We were...well-lit on the periphery.  We wanted a light meal; ordered two appetizers.  The Madeira gave the sauteed mushrooms a nice touch,  The terrine was fine, the accompanying cornichons and preserves a tad parsimonious. .  BYOB has become an attractive option here in Chicago. My friend brought a Spanish cava always reliable.   The prices and the food were juste, but not exceptional.  Our host, Simon, charming and attentive.  The server could not muster a smile and I am not sure her college football shirt fit in the atmosphere of the restaurant. White shirts and black bow ties are..partout!More

title: Quaint and Cute without Pretension, Excellent traditional French Cuisine
review: The server was outstanding, as he was just attentive enough, genuinely pleasant and gracious. The Coq au Van was warming, hearty and authentically flavorful without being overbearing. Likewise for the french onion soup. I couldn't have asked for a more pleasant evening for my wife...and I!More

title: GREAT  BISTRO  !
review: Best  French bistro  . Good  food  , escargots , mussels , steak  frites , fishes  special ,chocolat mousse , bread  pudding ....  etc  !!!! ,

title: a sweet neighborhood place with very good  French food
review: I don't know what has taken me so long to review this place as I have been there many times during the past few years, and  I keep returning.  The food here is very good, the ambience is warm and fine, the service is excellent,...More

title: Delicious French Bistro
review: This was our first time at Chez Simo Bistro and we will definitely go back. It's a true French bistro,  serving all the classic dishes.  The roast chicken was true classic.  The Coq au vin was a beautiful presentation and delicious. The lamb shank was...More

title: Wonderful French Bistro
review: Went there tonight with 7 friends. Truly French bistro. Excellent food, wonderful owner service  . The ambience was that of many French bistros I've been in all over France. I strongly recommend . Plus it BYOB what could be better?

title: Tres Delicious!
review: My French may be rusty, but my taste buds can tell good French food when I have it. And this French bistro is worth a visit. The food is tres tasty, and the chef will visit your table to make sure that the food is...More

title: Delightful find that BYOB only made better
review: Chicago has so many great small restaurants. However, finding a delicious French restaurant where we could BYOB and not be charge a corking fee was awesome The escargot was classic and the duck was among the best I have ever had. Access with the Damien-brown...More

title: Charming local French BYOB
review: What a charming French bistro!  Went there at the suggestion and with our daughter and a friend both of whom live in the area.  Thursday evening it was very quiet (horrible rainy weather may have accounted for it).  However, diners were treated with friendly and...More

title: wonderful, wonderful!
review: Had lovely dinner with friend. Classic French bistro atmosphere and food. And the BYOB and prices are even lovelier. The foie gras was divine. We also had the yummy soupe a l'oignon gratin gruyere, scallops, mousse au chocolate, and tarte satin. Everything was wonderful.

title: Fabulous Food. Excellent Service.
review: This French restaurant is a little gem. The food is fantastic and affordable. The service is excellent, making suggestions and accommodating our needs. Love that it's BYOB as well, so liquor doesn't run up the bill. Loved the beet salad appetizer with a side of...More

title: Excellent BYOB! Great food and service!!
review: Great French restaurant!! The service was excellent! We brought in our beer tasting and paired it with their delicious French cuisine. Their french onion and mushroom soups were great to start with! The duck was fantastic! Finish it off with creme brûlée or bread pudding!!

title: BYOB to a Classic traditional French Bistro
review: Warm, welcoming food and service. There is no "scene" here, it is a neighborhood bistro. Traditional all the way -- foie gras, escargot, french onion soup, lamb shank, coq au vin, steak pommes frites, etc. By keeping the menu limited to French classics, everything is...More

title: French as French can be ...
review: In a little nook of a place in uptown Chicago on Lawrence is this gem of a place for French food. For a snowy Friday, we had that French ambiance with really good food. The mussels in cream sauce was simply delicious, and that cream...More

title: Quaint
review: Authentic French BYOB bistro with charmingly eclectic decor. The food is decent, but nothing too special - service is adequate. The menu is a bit limited, seating not too comfortable. Bread below average for French cuisine, good portion sizes.

title: Classic French Cuisine in a Charming Atmosphere
review: What a gem! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is absolutely charming. It can get a bit pricey depending on whether you order appetizers and desserts, but there is a mid week prix fixe early dinner option that is great. Soup or salad, entree...More

title: clasique excellent
review: like EDGAR SAID place should be mobbed,classic as it get hidden gem family run husband /wife /their kids .chef jose and simo 50 years experience between both makes it as real as it get food decor ambiance .i asked simo about the sauces how good...More

title: Classique!
review: Chez Simo should be mobbed.  The lines should be out the door.  The prices should be higher -- but they are not.  The food is classic French bistro -- not heavy at all but wonderfully prepared.  Last night I sampled the Pate (one of the...More

title: AWFUL service and no apologies
review: A group of 9 friends and I were recently here recently for dinner on a Saturday night (with a reservation mind you...). We were seated right away and were given assistance opening our wine bottles (this is BYOB) which was wonderful! This however, is where...More

title: OH!  MY!  GOSH!
review: Just returned from an early dinner at Chez Simo, an excellent cozy spot in an unlikely location on W Lawrence just east of N Damen near Lincoln Square. My man and I took advantage of an advertised prix fixe dinner special in order to try...More

title: Friendly Neighborhood Bistro
review: This is a neighborhood gem of a French bistro with very good classic French bistro fare. Very personal and friendly service by owner Simo, his wife and staff. We have been there several times on Friday or Sat evenings. The menu is constant with the...More

title: Delicious
review: We had a delicious meal -- starting with French  bread & butter, then apple & blue cheese salad. I had salmon which was moist and melted in my mouth, served with julienned mixed vegetables and squash puree. My wife had medium rare duck with polenta...More

title: A bit of Paris in Ravenswood
review: A great French meal was had by myself and 3 friends today. Portions were generous, entrées were nicely presented and desserts were small but just enough. Price fixe is a bargain at $25 before 630. Friendly server who never let our water glasses get empty....More

title: Rare French Find in Ravenswood
review: Local friends recently introduced us to this rare gem for our wedding day dinner. Our hosts, Simo Ely Yacobi and wife Rashida Kechab welcomed us with open arms. Within minutes, we felt completely at home. Along with Chef George Vega, they have refined an authentic...More

title: Feel like you are in Paris in Chicago!
review: This restaurant is really my absolute favorite for a special night out. The food is top quality and the atmosphere is like a quaint French bistro somewhere in Paris with Edith Piaf singing in the background. The best part which makes it affordable is that...More

title: Delicious food
review: We went to chez simo bistro 2 night ago . The food is very delicious . keep room for desert . The owner in very friendly and know his menu . It feels like a brassie in France .

title: nice byob
review: Always good to find a BYOB with really good food. Authentic French Bistro.  Good food and service.  street parking

title: Corkage fee
review: I want to correct the review of a previous poster as this was misleading to us when we went yesterday.  There *is* a corkage fee of $5 for BYOB.  I guess the $5 charge covers the bottle opener which was lent to us to open...More

title: WOW! WHAT A FIND!
review: Chicago's Chez Simo Bistro at 1968 W. Lawrence Avenue might not look like a FIVE STAR restaurant on the outside, but it's what's on the inside that counts, and on the inside it is FIVE STARS all the way. The Ragout de Champignons (appetizer) was...More

title: Excellent French Bistro
review: This is a quintessential French bistro located in an out-of-they-way area of the city. We discovered it quite by accident, but loved it. Nothing fusion or ultra-creative about the cooking, but that’s not what it’s about. It’s solid, delicious, French bistro fare, and on that...More

title: Out of the way restaurant (for non-locals) worth the trip
review: I hope neighborhood folks and visitors support this place. The food is delicious and the service is friendly. Since it's BYOB, it's going to be a more reasonably priced dinner--but there won't be people stopping in to drink. So don't be deterred by the location...More

title: Terrffic French in Lioncoln Square
review: Chez Simo Bistro opened just about a month ago. We heard about it through one of the services that send me recommendations for new places around Chicago. My wife and I have been here 4 times in 4 weeks. Once we took my daughter and...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Gene’s makes me wish I still lived in Chicago! Outstanding “Deli” in Lincoln Square!
review: Gene’s Rooftop Beer “und” Wine Garden used to be the old “Meyer Delicatessen” located at 4750 N. Lincoln Ave. in Chicago’s “Lincoln Square” area also known as “German Town”. I do not remember exactly when Gene’s took over Meyer’s Deli, probably at least 10 years...ago, but they did a wonderful job opening it up to have two main floors, as well as having a rooftop bier garden.  They have the best sausages, and, if you love Pierogis, the best freshly made pierogies. They will also ship the items you select! The prices are incredibly reasonable. I found they also have a amazing selection of wines and beers. (One could easily find the best German biers for an Oktoberfest!)  Gene’s is a must place to try. If you have not been there, just do it!More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Loved the Beer and Brats!!!
review: I stopped in for dinner and it was a great experience! I had 2 brats, sauerkraut, a roll, and a beer and it was all delicious and priced very reasonably! The rooftop has plenty of areas for sitting and standing. The store on the levels...below contained great German food and beverage items as well! I would definitely return!More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: A deli, rooftop beer garden and sausage market--all in one
review: Chicago has reopened and Gene's Sausage Shop and Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden is back in business. John and Gene Luszcz opened their small neighborhood deli on West Roscoe Street in 1972. They moved to a bigger space on Belmont Avenue in 1980, then opened...a full-range European market and delicatessen and European-style rooftop beer and wine garden in 2009 in Lincoln Square. Located at 4750 North Lincoln Avenue, south of Lawrence, the complex is open from 9 to 8 Monday through Saturday and 9 to 4 on Sunday. The sausage market offers more than 40 varieties of sausage, from Kielbasa to bratwurst to salami to Polish sausage to Alpine sausage to kiszka to knackwurst to smoked pork to smoked ham to garlic Old Word Krakow sausage. The deli offers 30 home-made sliced meats, imported chocolates and cookies, German limburger, spaetzle, smoked fish, cured herring, smoked bacon, smoked pork loin, daily special such as cabbage rolls, blintzes, stuffed duck, schnitzel, Hungarian goulash, kolaczki, ciabatta, pretzels, poppy seed cake, German Stollen and chrusciki. Not to mention sandwiches such as corned beef, roast beef, honey ham and turkey breast. And the liquor department offers imported wine, beer and liquor. It's the kind of place where you can spend a few hours, shopping, taking a lunch break and topping off the day with a drink or two. If Gene's doesn't have it, it probably doesn't exist. Just ask the man behind the counter and he'll find it for you.More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: The German Grocery Store Here Is The Real Hidden Gem
review: Yes, Gene's has a rooftop German beer garden, but for us the real draw is the unique German grocery store, butcher shop & specialty liquor department that all occupy the lower level of Gene's Sausage Shop & Delicatessen. If you are German-American, lived in Germany...or just love to travel to Germany, this place is a MUST. They have an extensive offering of hard-to-find German food products, German schnapps and German meats & cheeses - and their selection extends to other Eastern European & even Scandinavian products. There's so much crammed into 2 floors of this very special European market. After stocking up on German delicacies, you can enjoy some of their authentic German wurst with German beer or wine. Prost!More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Gene’s bier garden is Chicago’s best wurstgarten
review: Looking for a Chicago version of a Wisconsin beer garden?  Gene’s Sausage Shop’s roof-top is a Lincoln Square tiny-take on the beer and pretzel consuming phenomenon.  Sure, there is no Milwaukee River or polka band to accompany your bier trinken erfahrung, but the sausages, fresh...from downstairs, are revelatory compared to the the Usinger mass produced fare served in MKEs Estabrook Park.   We tried both the Smoked and Brat samplers and compliment the quality and freshness of the sausage offerings.  The Alpine and Hunter sausages were our favorites, spicy and smokey with toothy casings.  All served in splendidly comfortable picknik style surroundings with paper napkins and a selection of good mustards.  And don’t forget: the beer.  Prost!More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: UP ON THE ROOF!
review: An incredible view of the beautiful Lincoln Square  neighborhood with a delightful setting featuring German Beer and Food! We just loved our visit to this cozy little rooftop featuring an outdoor grill and relaxed seating on large wooden picnic tables with umbrellas. The casual seating...provided privacy if needed or a great group setting. Friendly staff both grilled selections, including Brats and Kraut, German Sourdough Pretzels, Potato Pancakes and German Potato Salad and served beer and wine from a central location in a order and pickup style ( NO WAIT STAFF). It also may get a little rushed waiting in line to order food, and with no menus, and only a small flyer posting the offerings, it's easy to miss a lot of the items. .Both Tap Beers and cans of Beer were available. Craft beer and Imported German Beers were offered. The rooftop is only open on some days, mostly on weekends, so it might be a good idea to phone ahead.  a great OKTOBERFEST destination!More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Glad we went
review: It was my first time here. My partner found it on onlyinyourstate.com.  It has delicious food.   A cute store on the first floor, wine on the second floor and a cute rooftop on the third floor. Make sure you have cash for the roof top....That’s all they except. It is a cute chill rooftop over looking the street. They had birdhouses and tomato plants.   It’s a neat place to go to at least once in the summer when it’s not to hot or sunny.   You share picnic tables with other people so be cool with that. In the fall they have little apple trees that you can go apple picking with. Fun place.More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Bikes over on a beautiful night
review: Great summer evening- and our biking destination.    Lots of families and babies out on the nice night.  Perfect.  Just came for beers.

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Awesome in a beautiful August afternoon!
review: Sampler platters were a hit! Perfect surroundings with open grill. $1 water and soda. Cute bathroom. Recommend since Brauhaus is closed.

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Fun in the Sun in Summer
review: It's worth the experience getting to the rooftop just walking through Gene's downstairs store. So many good things! And the rooftop lunch experience was terrific. It was a sunny but not too hot day and people were friendly (yes, there are a lot of friendly...people in the Windy City). We shared a table with some strangers who bantered with the best of them. Our fresh hot brats were really tasty and we'd gladly recommend Gene's to anyone, without reservations, pun intended.More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Hidden Gem
review: I was excited to find this hidden gem in the city. It's hidden through a little grocery store and up on the roof. Gene's is a nice place to relax on the weekend for a few beers and a sausage. Also enjoyed the potato pancake.

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: I would be shopping here all the time if I lived here!
review: What a great selection of delicacies and treats from Europe! I would be shopping here all the time if I lived in Chicago -- unfortunately, I was visiting so I could only buy 1 package of sausages to take home with me on the plane....More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Great butcher shop
review: Everything you could want. From custom meats to rabbit. Decent little grocery store too.  Definitely try the rooftop in the summer.  We plan our  Chicago activities  around Gene's in the summertime.

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: A rollicking, delicious lunch on the roof
review: We entered the deli on the first floor and admired all the choices of sausage and other foodstuffs.  Next we jammed into the elevator to get to the rooftop.  The menu for both beverages and food is on the wall and above the bar.  We...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: A MUST see!!
review: We went here the last time we were in town and had to go back again. This  time the rooftop bar was open so we went up and had some beer and wine .  There were some people getting food which looked  yummy! German food...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Casual, friendly summer dining
review: The rooftop beer and wine garden was so much fun.  Its picnic style so you can talk to people and get a sense of community.  The food is great, we love brats and hot dogs and the condiments make my mouth water just thinking of...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Great Rooftop View, Beer and Food Selection is Limited
review: We love this place when they open in the summer. We great awesome food items from their grocery downstairs. Any rooftop bar in Chicago is always going to be a hit for Chicagoans. You can see the city from up top and there's a sense...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Grocery, deli, butcher shop, bakery--and a rooftop beer garden!
review: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden at 4750 North Lincoln Avenue in Chicago's Lincoln Square neighborhood is all things to all people. After closing their Belmont Avenue location after 36 years, owners John and Gene Luszcz moved to Lincoln Square and opened up a multi-story...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Great Gourmet Grocery
review: We were in town looking for some old fashioned kielbasa and all the trimmings. This was had a kinds of sausage available and so much more. Their deli selection of salads and sides were great (loved the herb potato salad) and their coolers had everything...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Great view with German food and beer! (Wine too!)
review: Great local spot! We visited on a warm sunny day in June. Nothing fancy, they grill outside and you go up and get your drinks and food at the counter but everything is very good. Very casual and enjoyable. Everyone that I saw was enjoying...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Surprising little rooftop escape
review: Genes Market is a very nice specialty market with interesting meats and international food products. Once in the shop walk towards the back and you will find a large fairly slow elevator. Take it to the 3rd floor. Once there you will see a place...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Potato Pancakes on the Roof!
review: Shopping at Gene's is a regular stop for my family.  Love the store, full of tasty European treats.  The rooftop is a perfect addition.  Elevator to the top, get in line to order from the grill area, find a seat and wait for your number...More

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Delicious!
review: Sausage was amazing & the location was great! We stopped as afternoon break in shopping--it was a great choice!

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: What a great surprise
review: This is a really fun place the store on the 1st and 2nd floors then the rooftop bar! Yes a must do! The sandwiches, beer and wine and great rooftop atmosphere where everyone was having a great time.

restaurant_name: Gene's Rooftop Beer and Wine Garden
title: Gourmet food on the go!
review: Go early to pick up the best of deli, salads (love the beet salad), hot cooked foods (like perogie, stuffed cabbage, teriyaki chicken, potato pancake, goulash, & more), cheeses, sausages ( including liver & other cured meats)! Too bad there is little to satisfy seafood...More

title: Check it out!
review: This is a wonderful treat into asian cuisine with a Russian overtone - people are from Kazakhstan and have wonderful menu items you won't find elsewhere

title: Lovely & a Cozy place
review: We have been there about 4 times and with different people and not once have we been disappointed! The salads (avocado with shrimp & the JJ special) both are excellent! Love the lula kebabs and shashlik...we always bring some home. It’s a small place and...They are always busy so a reservation is highly recommended. The icing on the cake is that it’s a byob...enough said 😉More

title: Introduction to Central Asia
review: We've been curious about food of this region and a friend discovered Jibek Jolu online.  Their website had photos of the dishes on the menu.  The three of us decided to try it.  On a bitterly cold winter night we found street parking right in...front of the restaurant.  There were only a few occupied tables at 6:30 pm but they were doing a good takeout business from a window facing the kitchen.  It was fortunate we had studied the menu because our waitress had little English, being a recent arrival from Kazakhstan.  We ordered the big plate of assorted traditional dishes which featured several types of dumplings, a shredded cabbage dish, plov, lagman noodles with beef, and a couple other items to sample as much as possible.  We also had "Jibek Jolu special" salad, a dish of plov (a rice dish flavored with meat and veggies) and lagman with lamb  (hand-pulled noodles with a separate tomato-ey, vinegary sauce).    The food came quickly.  It was a plentiful amount, quite tasty and filling.  It was not at all spicy, altho there was a small glass condiment jar of ground red chilis on the table to spice up the dishes, if desired.  I tried it but didn't think it had much of a kick.   The salad was our favorite, served cooked, which was a surprise.  We would have shared a slice of honey cake for dessert but they were out of it.  The decor is cosy, with the ceiling meant to evoke a yurt and Asian-design wall hangings.     By the time we left at 8:30, the place was nearly full.  Most of the patrons appeared to be  of Asian descent, so the food must be pretty authentic.  We thought it was a worthwhile  experience.  Go with several people, get a variety of dishes and share them.More

title: A great place for a long dinner with friends
review: We go here every few months for a long BYOB dinner with friends. They have tables of different sizes that accommodate small and large groups. They don’t rush you, so you can enjoy a long evening without feeling like you are holding them back. The...food is delicious. I have tried almost everything on the menu, and everything is good. We usually get a few things to share. My favorite is Lagman soup. This review is for the Lincoln Square location. I think they also have a downtown location, but I haven’t been there.More

title: Authentic
review: As a former Peace corps volunteer who spent over two years in this Central Asian country, I was excited about visiting this tiny restaurant. The restaurant resembles one of which would be in the country, authentic decor inside with servers (and time of my visit...patrons too) from the country. The menu was an eclectic mix of not only Kyrgyzstan food, and they serve the same delicious bread with every meal. I ordered the lagman, pasta was tasty, but the meat was a little dry. Other than that I would say definitely worth a visit especially if you are interested in trying something different.More

title: A Blend of Cultures
review: Interesting little local Central Asian eatery. Kyrgyz cuisine offers one of the most interesting hybrid of indigenous, Mongolian, Korean, Russian, Turkish, Middle-Eastern fares that belie its historical “Silk Road” heritage. Try any of the tandoori dishes, kebabs, traditional Kyrgyz offerings. I love the Korean Carrot...Salad and order it every time I dine at this establishment.  Space is limited. Seating can be hit or miss.  If you are looking for something different- this place might hit the spot!More

title: What a Wonderful Treat!
review: It has been thirteen years since we adopted our son from Kazakhstan, and we were so excited to try this place! I can honestly say I have never had better food in my life. Inexpensive, and every single dish was amazing! Great atmosphere and very...friendly. Highly recommend! Also if you are wanting to bring kids and not sure what to order, you can’t go wrong with blini or manty.More

title: Amazing ethnic favorite--BYOB--MUST GO TO!!!
review: One of the most unique ethnic restaurants anyplace, maybe our 5th time here. We recently had friends in, looking for a unique dining choice, and even though this was a half hour from their downtown hotel, we brought them here. Definitely worth it! Avocado salad...a favorite, also the boscht. Hard to pass up the hand-pulled noodles (lagman...we prefer with lamb, but beef also great). Many many wonderful choices on the menu; I got the assorted traditional dishes (yet again), because that way you get a taste of lots of them and they're all good. Very reasonable pricing. BYOB. Friendly staff--recognized us even though it had been 4+ months since the last time. We love love love this place! And not expensive, either ($86 before tip for four, including a pot of tea).More

title: Loved it and will go back
review: The four of us had different dishes and each was very happy with their order. I had Borsch (hot) and Solomon fish. All was done to perfection.

title: Mixed bag
review: The chickeb salad was WAY toos salty.  Send it back, and the second attempt was still barely edible from too much salt.  And we like salty foods. Beef and cucumber salad was ok, Cabbage roll and dumplings were good.  The service was painfully slow and...inattentive.  Always interesting to try new foods, but no reason to return here.More

title: One of our favorites!
review: Amazing food...small intimate setting. One of our favorite places to go when we visit Chicago!  If you can't make up your mind the traditional sampler is wonderful. All of the starters are good!

title: Amazing Central Asian Food
review: The food is very delicious. From the taste it was obvious that the meat was fresh. The meats were slowly cocked. The soup was very good.

title: Must go! Delicious! Unusual! Friendly!
review: We happened on this place and tried it. Liked it so much we came back a second night with friends, and will bring more later this week.   The food is "central Asian". That means there are dishes that are Slavic (like the borscht, which had...a broth redolent with flavor, meat, veggies, and a dollop of sour cream and bits sauce of fresh dill). Some are found in western china (like the Langan, which is a hand-pulled noodle with different kinds of sauces available). There are also really delicious salads--eg, avocado salad has chunks of avocado, chunks of tomato, cucumber, dill--a very very distant cousin of guacamole. Tandoor chicken was succulent and flavorful, can't say exactly what it was flavored with; not like Indian tandoor...more a marinated flavor.   Wait staff is sweet beyond belief. It takes a bit of patience to explain what you want sometimes. Seems like many many more of the patrons are from Kurdistan, and there will be families with young kids, young guys being with other young guys, and not too many ordinary Chicagoans. To me, that's just part of the fun.  Going there the first time? Get an assorted traditional dinner dish. All of it was good. You can sample almost everything. Good value. Lots of food...one of those plus an appetizer enough for two people.   Inexpensive too. About $50 plus tip for two our second time. It's a BYOB, so that saves too. (There's a liquor store with decent selections and prices a 3 minute walk away. )More

title: Amazing
review: The best food I ever had! Warm atmosphere and excellent service! We enjoyed dining with them.As well, the restaurant was very clean. Thanks!

title: Great First Kyrgyzstani Food Experience!
review: I had never had Kyrgyzstani food before trying this place on a friend's recommendation.  We had a big group of 10 or so, and they took a reservation for us earlier that day and got us seated right away.  The wait staff was very helpful...and helped us pick out a bunch of dishes to have family style.  The waitstaff was very friendly and helpful and after they brought us an extra couple of dishes by accident, they let us keep them for free!  The food is an interesting mix between eastern European and Middle Eastern, which I suppose makes sense.  We especially loved the kuurdak beef which is savory and salty, the grilled skewers which are perfectly fire grilled and tender, the tangy and savory Jibek Jolu special salad, the herbal and refreshing carrot sald, and the fried beef pastry appetizer that I forget the name of.  All of it was very good--very hearty and filling, not spicy at all though, FYI.  The prices are also extremely reasonable--dishes are between $8-20 and we ordered probably a total of 12-15 dishes and it ended up being only about $25 per person with tax and 20% gratuity.  Great find!More

title: Check it out!
review: This is a wonderful treat into asian cuisine with a Russian overtone - people are from Kazakhstan and have wonderful menu items you won't find elsewhere

title: Lovely & a Cozy place
review: We have been there about 4 times and with different people and not once have we been disappointed! The salads (avocado with shrimp & the JJ special) both are excellent! Love the lula kebabs and shashlik...we always bring some home. It’s a small place and...They are always busy so a reservation is highly recommended. title: Amazing
review: The best food I ever had! Warm atmosphere and excellent service! We enjoyed dining with them.As well, the restaurant was very clean. Thanks!
