title: Delicious!
review: Went with my husband to check it out while in Chicago. It did not disappoint! The food was very good. I had a veggie pie (best way to describe it without knowing the name of it), some crepes filled with lots of cheese, and several...More

title: Central Asian food  Try it!
review: I went with a former exchange student from Kyrgyzstan to experience food from her country.  We ordered Jibek Jolu "the Silk Road" special salad, Funcheza, steamed Manty (dumpling) Plov and Samsy. I recommend then all. It is a cozy place with Kyrgyz decorations.

title: Wow, this was really good!
review: Not living too far away from Jibek Jolu, I had actually passed by it many times.  Friends of ours picked this out because of the dumplings, so why not.  The name of the restaurant, Jibek Jolu, means "silk road", which goes back to the storied...More

title: Hearty and Delicious
review: We dined here with friends and didn't know what to expect. Our Russian friends did all the ordering (the staff speaks Russian and English), which was great, as we were unfamiliar with most of the menu items. Appetizers of Chebureki (Fried pie filled with lamb)...More

title: So good!
review: This restaurant has 2 locations. We went to the one on Oak str. If you don't know about this place, you will never find it. It's small and located in the end of a street. The sign is so tiny, we didn't even noticed it...More

title: Wonderful hidden gem
review: I can't attest to the authenticity, but I enjoyed everything we ate there. It is like China, India, and Russia had a beautiful food-baby. This one of the things I love about exploring new foods, you can taste the influence of all the cultures along...More

title: Lincoln ave surprise.
review: This is eastern european/ western asian comfort good. I still can't tell you what we had but I can tell you it was served quickly and it was very tasty and worth a second visit to try a remember what we eat.

title: Authentic Central Asian food, a pure delight!!!!
review: Having lived nearly a full year in Kazakhstan, I can attest that Jibek Jolu's cuisine is very authentic and true to the native cuisine.  Every bite of what we ordered was pure perfection and completely brought me back to the 'Stans!!  The staff were all...More

title: Surprise!
review: I took my fiance to this restaurant as a surprise. She just entered the US for the first time from Kyrgyzstan and absolutely loved the restaurant. I loved it as well. The food was fresh, large, and delicious. Fully plan on going again. Central asian...More

title: Something Different
review: I was excited to try this place, have never had Kyrgyz food before. Overall it was a good experience. the restaurant isn't that large of a place, maybe about 12-15 tables, the feel was very comfortable, and the decor was very cool, it actually felt...More

title: Didn't hope for much - Greatly surprised
review: I had the laugman and salad and jerovnia and permeni. (noodle vegetable soup, salad, fajita, boil meat ravioli). A great and delicious bit of Central Asia food. The food is good quality and I highly recommend it.

title: Something wonderful
review: The food was all excellently prepared and was what I was hoping for. Something different from the usual but accessible for outsiders. Jibek Jolu delivered on both counts.  The service wasn't what you'd get at a typical restaurant, but you're not here for the service....More

title: Something different - and good
review: This was our first time at a Kyrgyz restaurant.  We ordered a variety of items and shared family style.  Regretfully we could not try any dumpling dishes - they were all out!  The service was adequate.  Prices are very reasonable. Be warned - servings are...More

title: Silk Road of Chicago
review: Jibek Jolu which means "Silk Road" brings the cuisine of Kyrgyzstan to Chicago. With influences from Russia, Turkey, India, Korea, and China this is food everyone needs to try! A delicious part of my meal was the egg salad type appetizer! Yum! I ordered the...More

title: Take a cue from the locals
review: My rating is only average, but that may be unfair to this quaint little restaurant. It's just that I don't have a lot of experience with this type of ethnic food. My wife and I were on a Russian cruise in 2014 where we tried...More

title: Kirghiz restaurant on Chicago's northside
review: Four of us, devotees of ethnic restaurants, tried the Jibek Jolu in order to try Kirghiz food (two of us are passionate about Persian and Afghan food).  The restaurant is a very casual, informal storefront restaurant on Lincoln Avenue.  Service was friendly and casual.  The...More

title: Terrific & BYOB to boot!
review: Had a dinner with 18 attendees last night (Friday).   There have been some slow service comments, after last night I have to believe that this is due to cooking from scratch. Wait staff was VERY friendly and made very good suggestions as to how much...More

title: Dissapointed
review: The only Kirgis restaurant in Chicago proved to be a real disappointment on our recent visit. We had our expectations pretty high, but sadly none of the dishes worked for us. Some of it (but not all) perhaps could be explained by a peculiar day...More

title: Brings back memories
review: We visited Jibek Jolu in hopes of finding familiar Asian/Russian foods and we did. We ordered belyashi, chebureki, manty, borsch, golubtci, tefteli, lagman and all of that was delicious and affordable. The restaurant was clean and comfy, Russian pop music channel was on TV and...More

title: Great food...whatever combination it is!
review: Been waiting to try this Central Asian (Russian-Mongol-Krysygstani) food for a while...and was better than pleased with everything.  Good homemade noodles, lamb and beef turnovers.  Pelmeni dumplings as good as anywhere.  Simple place, reasonable prices...you won't be disappointed.  Another wonderful immigrant addition to our long...More

title: A very interesting place
review: As of the time of this review, I was trying to find and get to know some hidden gems of Chicago, as well as doing and seeing things very different or almost impossible to find in my home country. Of course, food is included. Jibek...More

title: Fabulous and interesting find in Lincoln Square
review: Fabulous fine on Lincoln Ave.  Food is a wonderful combination of Eastern European, Indian and Asian flavors.  It's not fusion but Kyrgystani food.  We had two types of dumplings filled with ground meat and flavored with vegetables and dill.  They were wonderful with homemade sourcream....More

title: Here is a unique one!
review: I believe this may be the only Kyrgyz restaurant in Chicago area, if not in Illinois. It is not a fancy one but has good home-cooked type food. Menu seems to have influences of the Russian,Mongol and Turkish (plus a few others?) cousines. We had...More

title: One great taste after another
review: Chicago has always been and will always be a city populated with immigrants.  One shouldn't come to Chicago without exploring the rich offering of ethnic restaurants and Jibek Jolu should be on the top of your list.  The first and only Central Asian (i.e. Kyrghyzstani)...More

title: Best Italian food I’ve had in a long time!
review: Every dish was great, duck with mashed potato’s, short ribs over risotto and Amish chicken.  We all shared and I want to go back and order the short ribs for myself.  Found out they have a patio for summer months, I had a lemon vodka...drink, can’t remember the name, but that drink with some of their polenta fries and their burrata cheese with grilled veggies on a summer night on their patio, yum.  It’s hard to find restaurants with this quality of food.  Taking friends back over the weekend.More

title: Great home comfort Italian cafe.
review: Truly tasty menu of Italian dishes. Great flavors and food pairings in each of our dishes.  Service was spot on. Ambiance is comforting.

title: excellent restaurant in Lincoln Square
review: We were in Chicago in mid-July in the Lincoln Square area and tried several restaurants for lunch and dinner: Greek, Brazilian steakhouse, Fork and Due Lire. They were all good but Due Lire stood out for quality of service and food. Their outdoor patio in...the back was the icing on the cake. We tried the specials and were not disappointed. The chocolate dessert was also wonderful. The waiter was very helpful in selecting both a wine and dinners. Very knowledgeable and professional. would highly recommend and will go back next time we are in Chicago.More

title: 5-Star Experience
review: The best most authentic Italian food ever had.  The ingredients were fresh and handmade with flavors that made every ounce of my being shutter.  I have never had such depth of flavor before in a meal.  I had the Risotto and it was phenomenal.  We...started out with a Beet salad and a trio of aranccini's and croquettes.  My husband had pasta with a meat sauce that was loaded with meat.  Our friends had the new York strip and the duck.  Both could not stop eating, even though they were full because it was so good.  Desert was a chocolate Souffle that was mouthwatering.  The environment is cozy, clean and beautiful.  The staff is outstanding.  Met the chef and manager and his wife was our server. She also hand makes the pasta.  The bread and meats are sourced from local establishments.  We can't wait to go back.  Absolutely nothing bad to say.  Masterpiece of a place.More

title: Good food
review: Very small place. Food was good not amazing. Server was excellent. The dessert was the best part of the meal.

title: Perfect meal
review: This quaint and cozy little Italian spot can't do it any better. The gnocchi was recommended and was pillow soft, with oxtail ragu - lovely. The tagliatelle bolognese was cooked perfectly, and the special duck was spectacular. Service was absolutely wonderful by Suzan. This place...is consistently great.More

title: Divinity if you love authentic Italian Cuisine!
review: While in college I stayed with an Italian family for a year and their Nonna made the most delicious bread! I have not been able to find a restaurant that could replicate ghis heavenly delicacy until now. If an Italian retaurant can serve "the real...deal" when it comes to bread I can trust they know what they are doing! The wine list was short but the amarone we tried was perfect with my braised shortrib ravioli, delicious!!!!! The sauce was a red wine reduction with butter-perfection. The percentage of shortrib meat to pasta pillow was also perfect. For appetizer we enjoyed olive medley with a layered foccacia, procuitto purses, burrati, and peppers. Dessert was a homemade flan and finished with a lemoncello served in a short flute. Thanks to the chef for his magic!More

title: Best Italian food
review: We went to Due Lire this evening with our children and grandchildren. This is a wonderful little neighborhood place. It was the best Italian food I have had in a long time. The waiter was wonderful even when the grandkids got a little restless. This...is definitely a place for families but also pretty and cozy enough for a romantic dinner. Nice variety of entrees, wines and desserts. Everything was delicious. I can’t wait to go back there.More

title: Great service, food and atmosphere
review: Very charming and cozy (if the weather holds, I recommend the back patio). Incredibly gracious service by Katia, and wonderful wine (Barbera) with the salumi formaggi platter of meats cheeses and jams over toasted bread - just enough for the four of us to share....Our friends enjoyed the lamb chops and the short rib ravioli with porcini mushrooms, and we loved the maiale (wonderfully tender pork with radicchio gorgonzola risotto) and the tortelloni with brown butter sage sauce and almonds. Finished with a beautiful flan. Could not have been better!More

title: very ordinary and a little expensive
review: An all around disappointment. Small space, very very noisy, attentive service but not well informed servers. Food was ok, pasta well cooked but not any special flavor. we thought it was expensive for the serving size. and we were not expecting mega portions, but leaving...hungry, even with two appetizers and an entree is not common.We had a dessert, not sure what it was called a dough with some cream, one of the worst ever.By then we just wanted to leave.More

title: good italian food
review: We ate the specials (mushroom soup, pasta with peas and ham) and short rib ravioli. For dessert: chocolate cake and apple strudel. All good. Drank chianti and lemoncello. Service was good but somewhat rushed for the main dishes. No bread on the table. When full...More

title: Solid food and wine
review: Menu is limited but with plenty to like at this intimate spot. Even on a cold rainy night, it was full as people kept their reservations and came out. Server Tall Kevin was honest and efficient - courses came out quickly from the kitchen. We...More

title: A True Italian, not Italian-American Restaurant
review: We returned two years after our first enjoyable visit and we pleased to find our initial impressions confirmed.  Due Lire is not your typical pizza, pasta, and tomato sauce kind of place.  It reminds us more of the country osterias we've encountered in Italy where...More

title: A nice experience
review: Discovering a so nice and charming Italian restaurant in Lincoln Square was a wonderful surprise. Great food, amazing service in a pleasant place even though a little bit too loud.

title: Delicious & efficient
review: We dined here prior to attending a concert just down the block. We allowed ourselves well over an hour but we're done within an hour, plenty of time to spare. We had appetizer, dinner & dessert but did not feel rushed.  All of our food...More

title: Another Lincoln Square Gem
review: Was in town to visit an old friend from the neighborhood.  My oh my but Lincoln Square has changed -- in a great way!  More restaurants, the old movie theater was redone, another Old Town School of Music Venue and, of course, Dure Lire Vino...More

title: Neighborhood Find
review: Feels authentic here and the staff is very attentive.  They were out of the wine we wanted but we were given a very good recommendation for an alternative wine by perhaps the owner.  The food was tasty although the steak was overdone and it was...More

title: A local gem!
review: We arrived at 10:00PM, after a nearby concert and were graciously received by the owner and staff. They have seatings until 10:45PM on Friday. Excellent menu, beautifully prepared and presented, with an affordable wine list. Definitely a keeper!

title: one noisy place
review: even ordering was a contest as the noise level was so high. The food was mediocre and what passed as risotto was soft rice with some good seafood on top. The sauce was tepid and very un-itialian. The whitefish looked good but was not very...More

title: Great Service and food
review: Small intimate place.  The owner was very friendly and made sure he talked to his guests. Our waiter, sorry cannot remember his name was very attentive, knowledgeable and offered suggestions.  He explained the specials and menu items very nicely. It is a place where you...More

title: Service has turned terrible
review: What happened to the service here- not for the good! We have been going to Due for several years, bringing friends and others. The food and service has always been outstanding, that is until yesterday.  The first clue should have been that the familiar staff...More

title: Excellent!
review: Went with my daughter and her boyfriend  on a Saturday night.  A little cramped and loud but the food and service were great.  The gnocchi wee some of the best I have ever had (and I've had a lot).

title: Good food... Very good Italian appetizers
review: I went with a group of friends to a due lire before a concert in a venue close to this restaurant... We ordered a bottle of Pinot noir that was very... Ver good.. The server... Well the entire service team...was extremely on point... We order...More

title: Don't Bother
review: My friends and I ordered 2 appetizers to share and 3 entrees. We waited quite a while for the apps to come out, but they never did. When we were served the entrees, we asked about the apps we had ordered. The server said that...More

title: Italiano autentico!
review: We tried this place when Bistro Compagne next door was closed, and so glad we did. The pastas were home made and fabulous. We had bucatini in a cream sauce and papardelle in a wild boar sauce (THE best of its kind ever!) Super beat...More

title: Best pasta in Chicago
review: This restaurant serves the best pasta in Chicago! Also has a wonderful selection of reasonably priced Italian wines. Massimo, the boss, is a wonderful host.

title: Wonderful Italian in fun neighborhood.
review: My husband and I dined here for the first time on Saturday night.  When we walked in at 6:30 p.m. it was empty, but by our second course it had filled up and was very lively.  Great Italian wine selection, delicious appetizers followed by fresh...More

title: A neighborhood spot that we missed
review: We have passed here several times and I am ashamed to say so.  This was an amazing Italian place.  Everything from scratch!   A perfect date night.  They have an awesome patio spot in the back.

title: We enjoyed our mail, even with the problems
review: We came on a busy Saturday night. The manager/host was nice and gave us an excellent table to the side. The restaurant is loud, but nothing that we felt took away from our evening. Everyone seemed to be having a good time. The drinks were...More

title: Neighborhood Italian food at its best
review: Tried it for the first time about two months ago, it became an instant favorite, so have been back several times since. The food is simply excellent— difficult to describe in words what the palate experiences.   Never thought veal meatballs could be so good, or...More

title: Everything Good Except the Noise Level
review: We went to Due Lire after a concert at the Old Town School just down the block.  Our table was ready, the menu was interesting, the food was very well prepared, and the service was knowledgeable and helpful.  However... the noise level was AWFUL.  The...More

title: Italian make it best
review: Love the courtesy of the owner Massimo. Passionate and always serving the best. Menu change many of the items seasonally. Don't come here is you are planning to stuff yourself with bread and meatball sauce. These are real italian dishes (and portions).

title: La Cosa Vera ( The Real Thing)
review: Like many restaurants in Italy, Due Lire is a small, intimate, knee to knee kind of place.  Rather than heavy tomato/pasta/cheese combinations of what we usually think of as Italian food, Due Lire focuses on delicate and subtle flavors.  The ingredients are fresh and well-prepared....More

title: Attention to Detail with Sophisticated Flavors
review: This was my first visit here. My daughter & her boyfriend have been numerous times. They always order the Amish Chicken & have never been disappointed! So we shared 3 appetizers, Arancino, Misto& the Frittelle! All delicious. Followed by the chicken "Galletto", & Maiale. Both...More

title: Quaint place, excellent meal
review: Four of us lingered for three hours here, enjoying wine, delicious mussels and fried artichoke hearts as appetizers, good pasta main courses, and tasty gelato desserts. The staff was attentive, but not overbearing, and we enjoyed this place a lot. Parking is available on the...More

title: Yummy, authentic Italian food
review: The owner of Due Lire moved to Chicago from Naples, Italy. He buys his ingredients fresh daily and creates the most amazing, authentic Italian dishes. Try the short rib ravioli or any of the daily specials. You will love this place!

title: Oops
review: Though the food was good, well prepared and presented, our waiter had dirty fingernails!  Won't go back there again!

title: Good food
review: We went for a family dinner. Very helpful server. Menu is not large like other Italian restaurants. The tables seemed small and tight for four persons. Portions were smaller than I expected. Overall good experience.

title: A Lovely Evening Out With Friends
review: Went here with a mixed group of friends to celebrate a birthday and it was pretty perfect. The menu has a great blend of dishes supportive of both the vegetarian and non-vegetarian palate, the server was knowledgeable and helpful in suggesting wine pairings and the...More

title: Excellent italian food, outstanding service
review: Small, cozy restaurant.  Interesting and unusual dishes.  Not the usual dishes found in Italian restaurants.  Outstanding service, friendly staff.  Definitely worth a trip for dinner.

title: We wondered why it so empty
review: There were only two people eating when we walked in, but the host wanted to seat us right next to them.  We preferred to sit elsewhere, and she finally agreed. It appeared that the host considers himself an entertainer of sorts, so we got a...More

title: Delicious!
review: Our first time here and it won't be our last.  The service was excellent, with a great explanation of the dishes and specials and how they are prepared.  As others commented the short rib ravioli was fantastic.  The other ravioli dish was also very tasty....More

title: Delicious homemade Italian cuisine
review: Due Lire is on a city block that contains several other restaurants.  Nothing fancy from the outside and certainly simple on the inside.  But it is the homemade Italian food that sets Due Lire apart from many other Italian restaurants.  There is plenty of street...More

title: Cozy Italian atmosphere, great food and service.
review: Due Lire is in Lincoln Square. Nothing flashy from outside, inside it's...an Italian restaurant. I mean, just like one of those warm, no frills restaurants you would find in Tuscany .  Something immediately told me I was going to eat well, and it was a...More

title: Cozy place, delicious food
review: I was surprised by the cozy, warm place and attentive service. The food was delicious and beatifuly presented and, in my opinion, the size of the portion was perfect: enough to enjoy and not to feel stuffed. I recommend it :).

title: Very pleasant outdoor patio
review: Had a very lovely meal outside on the back patio.  Weather was still wonderful and food awesome.  The waitress really explained all the items on the menu thoroughly and gave great suggestions.  Very helpful.  Easy parking right across the street.  Very nice.

title: The impact of service
review: I had never dined at this restaurant on Lincoln Ave (interestingly it's right next to recentlly reviewed Bistro Campagne) and was looking forward to catching up with two great friends we hadn't seen in awhile.  The dining experience was above average in the food area,...More

title: Moments of Yum
review: My girlfriend and I stopped  in last weekend having heard great things about Due Lire's ravioli.  We ordered a variety of dishes to share, and some were outstanding, like the burrata special which was served atop a bed of fried baby potato buttons and artichoke....More

title: Italian in a differen way
review: I stumbled acros Due LIre on a local TV channel food review about their gnocchi.  I never REALLY had gnocchi and the samples I had previously were "lead balls".  Due Lire's gnocchi are exactly the way the TV channel described...pillows  You need to try them....More

title: Food outshines the atmosphere
review: We were very impressed with all of the food.  The portion sizes were perfect, none too big.  We did every course.  I had a very tasty whitefish, which I highly recommend.  However the highlight was the short rib ravioli.  I was less impressed with the...More

title: Very good meal
review: We are residents of Chicago (South Loop) and have been venturing into different neighborhoods. I haven't been into the Lincoln Square area for a while so we thought we'd check out Due Lire.  We made reservations on Open Table.  Make sure you make them, because...More

title: lots of potential, but.....
review: Ate here Sunday night with a party of four without a reservation.  Samll intimate restaurant that seats 42 max.  Prices quite reasonable ($12-$18) but very small portions; really tapas style, but without warnign. There is a definite attempt to not stuff you, which is fine,...More

title: Upscale Italian not on Taylor Street Does Exist!
review: We we walking to another restaurant and noticed this place en route. The menu looked appetizing and the smells wafting from the entrance were amazing.  So without a reservation, 5 of us were immediately seated at a side table and the endulgence began.  We ordered...More

title: Echt Lekker!
review: Have heard about this place for a while, couldn't wait to check it out. Very cozy atmosphere and pleasant staff & service. Our pannekoeken were delicious, offering savory or sweet with a great variety of other breakfast options. Eet smaakelijk.

title: Delightful
review: Dutch pancakes at their best. Also French toast, bacon eggs and hash browns and fresh orange juice. We got in early and got seated on a Saturday morning. Accommodating to kids.Fast friendly service.

title: Awesome Dutch Pannenkoeken
review: his is a little Lincoln Square neighborhood gem. When I say little I really mean tiny so expect to wait on the weekends. Service is very attentive and they filled my coffee cup at least 3 times before my food arrived. We ordered the strawberry...Pannenkoeken which was excellent. I tried the ginger raisin Pannenkoeken. In my opinion it was way too sweet but I did enjoy the raisins in the pancake. I wish they had a raisin apple combo. We also ordered the cinnamon raisin French toast. It was as close to the flavor of a cinnamon roll and it was delicious. We also ordered the breakfast sandwich. Delicious. Definitely get the pork sausage for the best sandwich.  Pro Tip: It’s cash only so make sure to bring cash and if you forget don’t fret, a Chase is right around the corner.More

title: I love this place!
review: Discovered this little restaurant place a few years ago by accident & love to go!  We try to get to it whenever we are all in Chicago.  I had the apple ginger pannenkoeken (Dutch pancake) this time and it was delicious, but then again, breakfast...there always is!  My granddaughter had a mouth-watering grilled cheese, & my husband had strawberry whip pannenkoeken.  The service if friendly (always is) & uniquely decorated.  If you get there late & have to wait, it’s worth it!More

title: Amazing food
review: What a great breakfast spot love love it the pannenkoeken were amazing we had one savory and one sweet everything was super fresh and light would definitely coming back very soon

title: Absolutely stunning breakfast, this coming from someone who believes breakfast restaurants are non essential
review: The food is out of this world in quality, I mean it, this was by far the best breakfast I ever had, professional in making breakfast is rare, I don’t believe in breakfast restaurants and usually try to skip straight to lunch. This spot is...my only breakfast restaurant that made my list of must come back to eat at spots (that’s why I do TripAdvisor). So be smart and go here, you will thank your good fortune, a table of three had the breakfast meal of their life, all gave it 5 stars.More

title: LIKE BREAKFAST?  THIS IS FOR YOU!
review: For 19 years this small venue has been delivering very LARGE tastes. Pannenkoeken are Dutch pancakes-much larger and much thinner than American pancakes which are served open faced with either sweet or savory ingredients . My most recent delight was a white peach Pannenenkoen served...with home made whipped cream, powdered sugar and hazelnuts & finished with prickly pear fruit puree!! Traditional American breakfasts are served, but I'v been there 10 times and I'm still working my way thru the Dutch dishes. It is truly small and especially on the weekends you will most likely have to wait to get in (consistent with their hospitality 5 or 6 chairs are made available to make the waiting time easier to take) They are open ever day except Tuesday and lunch is served as well but so far I haven't turned the menu over to look at the lunch offerings!More

title: So Yummy!
review: We've never had Pannenkoeken before and it was so good! The restaurant was small and quaint, the food was superb! The french toast with fresh fruit was really good as well as the fresh squeezed orange juice! I'm craving the pannenkoeken from Texas!

title: Super breakfast
review: A small cafe but food and service are great. Was in Chicago visiting and I was dying to get back to Pannenkoeken as I had eaten here before and had spoken very highly off it. It didn't disappoint. Very friendly service, food was delicious and...everything came out promptly. Definitely worth going to for breakfast if you are in the area.More

title: Just Awesome and Unique Food! But You May Have to Wait.
review: Food is Aces, Staff are also Aces, one drawback is just the size of the place. Normally, I do think that smaller spaces make it more intimate which is why it has been my go-to "Morning after brunch date" place in Lincoln Square. The food...is light enough and the coffee is well made. However, as it got more and more popular over the years (A Good Thing for the Business), you would often be put on a waiting list as the space can only accommodate so many diners at once. They do take your number and contact you once you're up. I usually use the long-ish waiting time to browse around the shops at Lincoln Square. So it's not that much of a con for me. But if you are starving or can't stand waiting, you may just want to go some place else. They don't take reservation so you have to go in to be put on the waiting list. Having said that, The food is authentic, unique, and deliciously light! Hope this Helps!More

title: Tiny place good food
review: We came here with our son and his girlfriend as they live in the area. The place is very small but it works for what it is. The food was very good and the service was good. Neat little place to experience.

title: Unique Dutch Pancakes Plus
review: Tiny spot serving tasty dessert and savory Dutch pancakes, a delicious fruit topped Belgian waffle, various French toast dishes plus standard breakfast dishes. Fresh squeezed orange juice, plus good coffee. A very small seating area, but they will take your cell phone number and call...More

title: We are always back
review: I was craving for their waffle but changed my mind last minute for the Pannenkoeken. It was great, tasty, not fat at all, perfect for a nice breakfast. I dont know if they change the coffee but it was better than last time! Staff is...More

title: Amaziiiiiiing
review: Came here because we were caving for waffles. While reading the menu we didn't knew anymore what to chose ! So many things, pancakes, waffles, pannenkoeken, salty or sweet. We sticked to our first choice and weren't disappointed at all ! Light, fresh, fruits were...More

title: Wonderful
review: Very small Dutch diner.  20 seats.  We tried to get in on a Sunday and it was pretty impossible.  Monday was much easier.  Really nice great service.  Food is excellent and priced good.  Highly recommend

title: Bring your appetite!!
review: I read about this place back in December in the Southwest Airlines Magazine.  This was my second visit in a week here in Chicago. Its UNIQUE!  Big pancake type crepes served with apples, bananas and chocolate and other goodies.  Not much on decor and the...More

title: Delicious and Excellent Breakfast
review: Breakfast at Pannenkoeken Cafe was fantastic (although I didn't actually care for the pannenkoekens themselves). The french toast was within the top 5 that I've had.  The service was great.  And the prices were fair for the portion size.  My only qualm was that it's...More

title: Breakfast any time
review: My friend didnt have to ask me twice.   OJ fresh squeezed with bacon and havarti cheese pancake.  (don't forget-bring cash)

title: Tiny but delicious
review: Pannenkoeken Cafe is a delightful, tiny space that offers some delightful breakfast choices.  The food is worth going, but you may feel a tad bit squeezed, so if you do not like close quarters, choose another place.  I felt right at home, like I was...More

title: Not for me...
review: Cramped, slow but friendly service. Omelet was good, not great. Pancakes were okay. I am not into sweet breakfast therefore i didn't try anything sweet. Perhaps that is were their strength is.

title: I Love Pannenkoeken (Ik hou van pannenkoeken)
review: This place is unlike any other pancake house you'll EVER go to (well at least in the Chicagoland area). I've been studying the Dutch language and culture for the past year and when I found out that there was a pannenkoekenhuis nearby, I just HAD...More

title: Wonderful Taste of Holland
review: TINY place, but it is outstanding.  Their thin pancakes are incredible, sort of like crepes but much better.  I particularly like the savory bacon and cheese with their molasses from The Netherlands.  The staff is great as they maneuver the tiny space.  They are only...More

title: A Return Visit Is Most Definitely In Order
review: I finally made my way over to the Pannenkoeken Cafe when a friend was in town. It's small, so expect a wait. What's nice, though, is that they'll call you when they're ready, so you can walk over through the square while you're waiting. Anxious...More

title: Dutch pancake... Really, really goood!!!!
review: Finally found the dutch pancake which is just as good as Linda's pancake in Aruba! I missed it terribly and was craving for it... Search it and found it! I tried it last Sunday and will go back again this coming Saturday... This time with...More

title: Tiny town
review: Very small restaurant. Service was good food was tasty. Price was Chicago style. Ok for first time I don't think I would make a second visit. I think it is an acquired taste.

title: Delicious and Original
review: Quaint breakfast/lunch eatery in Lincoln Square area of Chicago. Delicious fresh squeezed orange juice..watch it made in front of you. Dutch style pancakes are the specialty. I'd never had these before. You can have them made sweet or savoury..or a combination. I had one with...More

title: Small Breakfast Jewel
review: Only seven tables.  Wonderful breakfast menu, the usual, plus all varieties of open faced dutch pancakes.  Great freshly squeezed orange juice.  Definitely will return.

title: Its ok...
review: It was my first time having Dutch pancakes, they are bigger, thinner and a little crispier than regular pancakes. The place was tiny, but we went fairly late for bruch time, so it wasnt that busy. The pancakes were OK,, a little dry, their special...More

title: Best pancakes ever!
review: We tried previously to visit this restaurant on a weekend and there was a long wait.  We tried again during the week and were able to get a table immediately.  This is a very small restaurant. Seats about 20.  The waiter was pleasant and efficient....More

title: Very enjoyable despite the tight space
review: People who love food will sacrifice comfort and ambiance (among other things). If YOU love food, try Pannenkoeken. If you want to eat breakfast in a place with many tables that accepts credit cards, go to your nearest "Golden Whatever" and you'll probably spend the...More

title: Tasty - I loved the bacon, mushroom, and cheese.
review: Tasty - I loved the bacon, mushroom, and cheese.

title: pannenkoeken are big flat dutch pancakes...and they're delicious! they have both sweet and savory. that's pretty much...
review: pannenkoeken are big flat dutch pancakes...and they're delicious! they have both sweet and savory. that's pretty much all they've got. the place is tiny - probably seats about  30, so go early. I think they started taking reservations in the winter because there's no room...More

title: Excellent Bavarian Food
review: Really wanted some Bavarian Pork Shank like you get in Munich.  Orderd them from Himmels and was pleasantly surprised. Ordered the spaetzle as the side and it was excellent , although I really wanted to try the dumpling. Pork shank was well roasted, juicy and...tender. All portions were very generous.  The Wiener Schitzel was good and thought it was very generous in terms of portions. Great experience.More

title: Delicious German food with Pizza as a Bonus
review: This is a super cute restaurant in the Lincoln Square neighborhood of chicago.  We stopped in for lunch and had the roast duck and a pork shank.  Both were delicious.  This restaurant took over when Pizza DOC left so they kept the pizza oven and...in addition to serving traditional German food, they also serve pizza.  We were there around 4 PM on a Sunday and it was not too busy.  They had a nice Meimi Pinot Noir for only $9 a glass.  Service was quick and friendly.More

title: OUR FAVORITE!!
review: This place never disappoints!  Huge portions, absolutely delicious food—both the pizzas and the authentic German food.  The chicken schnitzel feeds me for days!!  Fun live music a lot of nights, nice wine pours, friendly servers.  A truly great restaurant—you won’t be disappointed!!

title: Great local German restaurant and bar
review: We stopped by during the Apple Festival just a few blocks away. Good food, friendly service, and live music. The wurst platter was excellent and huge. The brat was actually weißwurst (white sausage), which is rare in the U.S. The schnitzel was well done. Good...German beer. It’s NOT Lo-cal but that’s not why you go to a German restaurant. They bake their pretzel bread in a stone oven right in the dining area. Also serves as a neighborhood bar.More

title: Rare Find
review: It's rare to find a German restaurant in the Chicago area (Haufbraühaus does not and will not ever count). The spätzle with gravy is great comfort food, especially with the gravy they make. There is a good variety of types of German cuisine on the...menu, so most palates should come away satisfied after their meal.More

title: A great taste of Germany!
review: My wife and I love German food and Himmel's is spot on. Try the duck you will be amazed. Good German food is getting harder to find and Himmel's is a real find.

title: Good food (German and Pizza), entertainment but a bit noisy
review: Have been to Himme'ls a number of times.  This Saturday, after the very cold and snowy days, two of us went to enjoy the German food.  We arrived a little after 7 with a reservation (always a good idea on Friday and Saturday).  Himmel's has...a bar and seating.  Good friendly waitresses and an accordianist on Saturday evenings.  He is a fun musician playing energetic older songs.   Some of the people get up and dance.  Great to join or fun to watch.  The food is very good, most main courses in the low to mid $20's.  All have a German base.  I had Wiener Schnitzel that was a good size dish (took half home) and tasted great.  Dish came with soup or salad,  I had a very good spatzel potato soup and finally an apple strudel desert.  The only issue is the level of noise, crowd talking over the music.  Is a fun place but not if you want to be in a quiet romantic restaurant.More

title: A must visit
review: If you are anywhere near Lincoln Square you should stop by Himmels for Dinner. Great food and drinks with live music most nights.

title: Great German food!
review: Our family was in the Lincoln Square area the day after Thanksgiving and decided to have a late lunch at Himmel's since we all love German food. We were the only ones there when we arrived so service was fast, food hot and our waitress...very accommodating. Some of us ordered the Spatzle soup which was good although very heavily salted. The pretzel bread they bring to the table is outstanding!. Several of our party had the wiener schnitzel which they said was very good as was the chicken marsala. I ordered the Rahm Schnitzel, It comes with a creamy mushroom sauce which is delicious although there truly is too much sauce on the plate. One other dish our group tried was the Kasespatzle - a German Macaroni and cheese with spatzle- very good. We all would definitely return.More

title: Wonderful Food, In Lincoln Square
review: Excellent Food, Great German food, and Italian also. The Staff is Simply Superb, and friendly Folks, The SaurBraten is Wonderful.... 5  Starts!!!

title: Great Food, lousy service
review: Chicken Schnitzel was outstanding. Mash potatoes with Mushroom gravy was excellent.  Salmon was great. Service was poor. Waitress was difficult. Would not allow any substitutions because she thought it was not an appropriate blend with the dish. Ordered a second beer and it never came...More

title: Nasty manager, terrible customer service
review: Don't be fooled by the recent positive reviews, Himmel's has gone down hill. We used to love ordering from what used to be a nice neighborhood spot. Yes, it was way overpriced and the food was sometimes inconsistent (under seasoned, under cooked), but we were...More

title: Something for everyone on their menu!
review: My husband loves German food and with The Chicago Brauhaus closing we decided to give Himmel's a try. The interior is decidedly European which sets the atmosphere. Our group of six were able to sit at a large round table which is better than a...More

title: German and Pizza
review: German and European dishes plus brick oven pizzas give plenty of choices. Eating at bar worked well for me going there solo. Wienerschnitzel with spaetzle and red cabbage did not disappoint. As good as any I have had in Germany. Did not have a host/hostess...More

title: Food was great
review: We happened upon this place walking down Lawrence. We looked in the window and it looked adorable so we went in. The food was excellent, all of us thoroughly enjoyed the dinner. It was a bit of a strange mix of German food and Italian....More

title: Little Bavaria ... and Pizza!
review: We stopped here while staying in the  Ravenswood area. It was great! I think we were the only out-of-town customers in the place. It was friendly with  live music and then the whole place starting singing a German drinking song. Anyway we had the Spaetzle,...More

title: Amazed!!
review: I was blown away by this restaurant!  The food was amazing, they had live acoustic music and the musician was mind blowing talented.  The décor was charming and service great.  Definitely will be going back.

title: Great food, but be prepared to wait
review: Celebrated an early Mother's Day dinner here with a family of 10 people.  The restaurant serves a mixture of traditional German food, Italian pastas and pizzas.  The portion sizes were large and the presentation was excellent.   The Rahm Schnitzel was outstanding!  The wait for the...More

title: Love the Food, but So Much Extra for Subbing Sides is Too Much
review: I rarely give unfavorable reviews, but I am very disappointed with how this restaurant is run. The food is excellent. The portions are generous. And the ownership/management is nice. So why am I not giving this place a higher review? Because there is something wonky...More

title: Nice Local German / Italian Restaurant
review: To tell the truth, we made our first visit to Himmel's on Valentine's Day, because our usual restaurants in Lincoln Square had no tables available, but we were glad we did.  This is a very pleasant restaurant:  brick walls, pizza oven behind the counter, not...More

title: Delightful family run restaurant
review: Excellent German and Italian food!  wood burning pizza oven, intimate atmosphere.  Pleasant Sunday brunch

title: Great German Food Find!
review: What a great find!  When it seems like we have fewer and fewer good German restaurants in the Chicago area, we happened upon Himmel's.  It's a very quaint restaurant which has a brunch buffet on Sunday.  We decided to order off the menu and boy...More

title: Best food ever
review: This place was so good we went there Saturday and Sunday.  The food is Italian and German but so so good!   For Appetizer we ordered the Obatzda which is a cheese spread served with Pretzel bread and radishs.    My friend ordered the Kasespatzle which is...More

title: German and Italian food, Really
review: Every dish we ordered was better than the next. The Italian rice balls appetizer had a flavorful and fresh tasting tomato sauce and was cooked perfectly.We each had a different German dish entree.  All were delicious and large portions. Service was fast and helpful.

title: unusual, tasty mix
review: Aside from the fact that it was 95+ outside and the wood-fired ovens were keeping the interior just as hot and the AC wasn't palpable until we were waiting for the check, I would recommend the restaurant. The menu is obviously schizy and it's understandable....More

title: Loud kids bad smell
review: We came for what we expected would be a great experience due to previous reviews. We were in general very disappointed although some of the dishes were very good.   The initial bread was dry and too thick a crust.   The large open area is filled...More

title: Great neighborhood gem!
review: Really enjoyed dining at Himmel's. Everything we ordered would be between 4 and 5 on 1-5 scale. Don't miss the Bavarian Pork Shank and the Champignon Rahm Schnitzel both of which are excellent! The one thing they could improve on is their wine selection. Mostly...More

title: German-Italian
review: What can we say about Himmel's Restaurant? Fantastic! If you like pizza, who doesn't? try one for an appetizer, then move on to your main entree. We have been there quite a few times and haven't had a bad meal. Pork Shanks, Pizza, Schnitzel, etc....it's...More

title: Italian-German Fusion
review: In a location that was previously just a pizzeria, There is now a full-service restaurant the serves surprisingly good food.  The menu offers both traditional southern Italian dishes and southern German dishes.  I had the veal saltimbocca and my wile had the roasted duck.  Both...More

title: Ok - but there are many other German Restaurant nearby that are better.
review: HIMMEL’S – 2251 W Lawrence Ave., Chicago, IL 60625, Ravenswood, (773) 784-8777, himmelschicago.com  Was ok- Had the Champignon Rahm Schnitzel — Pork tenderloin medallions seared and sautéed in butter and finished in a shallot mushroom cream sauce – Served with Spätzle and red cabbage. It...More

title: Our last night in Chicago was one to remember
review: On our final night in Chicago, we stepped outside the Andersonville area and headed for nearby Lincoln Square for a visit to Himmel's, a German-Italian restaurant.   Before we walked into the small, homey place, we walked the neighborhood, listened to some live music just off...More

title: Good Pasta and Bratwurst???
review: A very interesting mix of both German and Italian cuisines.  Run by to sister inlaws with different backgrounds and culinary taste.  The menu gives you a great selection with good pizza's and home made pastas whether it being Italian spinach gnocchi or german spaetzel.  The...More

title: Cold night in Chicago Warmed by Great Food
review: While visiting our new grandson in Chicago, my wife and I decided to try one of the local restaurants within walking distance of our rented apartment in Lincoln Square in Chicago.  We chose Himmel's by chance since it was close, it was open, and it...More

title: Love, love, LOVE this place!!!!
review: Excellent, excellent food! Never a let know. Food is consistently delicious. If you want German, best German food in town, my opinion. If you are in the mood for Italian, wonderful pasta dishes!!! Their pizza is excellent, best thin crust, wood-burned pizza in town! My...More

title: Good food, but experience not positive
review: We visited on a Saturday night around 8 p.m., the restaurant was open until 11 p.m., and only had a few guests.   However, there was a ton of staff present.   We ordered appetizers well before our dinner, which were quite good, but they arrived under...More

title: great pizza with good service
review: we love the thin crust pizza here , interesting mixture of german and italian food , serve freshly baked bread on sitting, servers very attentive good  pasta choices with nice salads too.

title: Love the Spaetzle
review: Beautiful neighborhood place.  Glad it is in my neighborhood!  Mix of Italian and German food, flavorful meals, and excellent service.  Nice options for my vegetarian family.  Some pasta choices, pizza, and of course, the spaetzle, my favorite.  They serve the spaetzle on the same plate...More

title: Outstanding Food, Super Friendly Service
review: Really enjoyed my dinner at this local German restaurant.  Sat at the bar with a friend and had Champignon Rahm Schnitzel  — Pork tenderloin medallions seared and sautéed in butter and finished in a shallot mushroom cream sauce. Served with spätzle and red cabbage.  The...More

title: German and Italian Cohabit, Nicely
review: Pizza D.O.C. changed and reincarnated itself to Himmel's, mixing traditional German food with pizzas and other Italian fare D.O.C. was known for - same owners. Well done! Pizzas and salads, and brews, are still superb; can't wait to try the German fare next time.

title: Random dinner
review: Very good neapoliran style pizza. Server very kind. Strange mix of Italian and German cuisine but it works.

title: Consistently Good Italian Food and Pizza
review: I've been coming to this restaurant for years.  The restaurant used to be an Italian restaurant called Pizza D.O.C.  The owners are the same but decided to change the name of the restaurant and add some traditional German dishes since they are of German descent....More

title: Better go now because their days are numbered.
review: My husband and I went to Himmel's on a Saturday night around 7. We did not need a reservation. We were walked to a table and then had to stand there while the hostess (who was chatting at the bar when we arrived) cleaned off...More

title: Nice Neighborhood place
review: Himmel's combines the use of a great original wood burning oven from Italy to produce excellent pizza's along with traditional Italian and German entrees. We started with the Shrimp wrapped in Prosciutto on a bed of mixed greens with a balsamic reduction sauce which was...More

title: Wow! An amazing all around experience
review: Wonderful warm atmosphere with amazing food and attentive service. A group of us celebrated Valentine's Day together at Himmel's. The service was top notch-even though the place was packed. The food was thoughfully prepared and tasted great-each dish had a little heart snuck into it-heart...More

title: Italian-German food combination
review: As is typical when you walk in to a German restaurant in this neighborhood, there are always signs that it is authentic German.  Until you get to the menu, then you notice that there are more Italian dishes on the menu than German dishes.  Then...More

title: Not good
review: What was once a fine neighborhood Italian restaurant with well-prepared traditional cuisine has, following a change in ownership several years ago, become a strange amalgam of German and Italian cooking with neither done especially well. Pasta dishes include spaetzel,  the entrees are various schnitzel dishes,...More

title: Fabulous in Chicago!
review: The most wonderful German food I have tasted! Here on Friday night with a great guitar player. Absolutely amazing dinner. Comfortable, great service, relaxed and delicious. Perfect evening - NOT pretentious - just a truly NICE evening!

title: Awful
review: They would get zero stars if that were an option. We ordered through door dash and one of the dishes we received had NO ingredients, just the sauce. I gave them a call and instead of rectifying their error (their error, not doordash) they told...me to just complain to door dash. Awful customer service, horribly rude woman on the phone and terrible food. Save your money and don’t order from there.More

title: Good food and flavor
review: This was my first time here and it was great given the circumstances great flavor and portion size a must try

title: Taste very close to Thailand!
review: Taste is authentic and I’m Thai. I tried Pho Tak and Pad Ped Pla Duk (spice level 4). Both are well done!

title: Delicious Thai food
review: The restaurant is clean. The service is excellent, and the wait for the food isn't long. The food at this restaurant is really tasty — it is very good. this is a place that I would go to.

title: Tasty Thai
review: Had some spring rolls that could have been more tasty. The Gaeng Panang with chicken was exceptionally tasty. The service staff was friendly and attentive. The price was right, too.

title: Poor quality
review: Service was good ! Tom Yum was tepid and watery. Pad Thai was very greasy and not tasty. Another dish was fine but lots of chicken and not much veg.

title: Basic Thai food!
review: I was really craving Thai food and wanted a good place so I read some reviews online. This restaurant have over 300 reviews. It okay, but not exceptional. I ended up ordering papaya salad and two entrees. Not exceptional, just okay.

title: Good, inexpensive Thai food
review: We visited on a busy Saturday night, but the service was quick and the food was quite good. The pad tai was good, but "mild" was very mild indeed. Certainly worth a visit if you are in the area.

title: Delicious Thai food
review: The three of us each chose a totally different entree and the flavors were totally different as we would expect.  And they were spicy as we like them.

title: Spice up your taste buds
review: This is a good Thai Food restaurant. You can have various levels of spice but the menu offers a rich offerings.  The Restuarant offers ample space to have a mid-to-high number of people l.

title: Very good and fresh food
review: Good and freshly cooked food.  The reataurant has different dishes to choose, from meat til vegetarian. Prices are decent,

title: Delicious, inexpensive, nice
review: I was surprised at the high quality and low price of this restaurant. The portions are generous, the service is excellent, and the atmosphere is classy. This is a nice sit-down restaurant for families, couples, or singles. Two of us had the pad thai -...it was great. My husband had a basil fried rice, which came in a huge portion and was delicious. I also recommend the spring roll appetizers - they are perfect for sharing and slightly sweet. If I lived in Chicago, this would be my go-to restaurant!More

title: Wow
review: Im not really big on thai food but the food here was amazing i had the crab rangoon, and the Khao Nar Ped (	Sliced roasted duck with stir-fried Chinese broccoli, served with sauce over steamed rice ) what a dish i recommend

title: Save the Airfare to Bankok, Come to Opart in Chicago.
review: The Tiger Cry beef is excellent as well as most any of their dishes. The Pad Kratiam Prik Thai is my favorite.  It is basically,garlic and pepper chicken.  Ordering your meal spicy is not for the faint of heart!  This is a BYOB place which...is not too much of a killer as right next door is a liquor store.More

title: One of the best Thai in town at a middle-level price range but poor quality rice
review: Opart Thai isn't your cheap, quick, thai restaurant place... It's moderately priced and you will usually end up spending $20/person for your meal with 2 people consisting of a small appetizer for 2, plus 2 main courses without soft drinks... So just keep that in...mind. It is BYOB, so at least it helps with keeping the cost reasonable. The food is usually excellent though it depends on which time and day of the week you go... We usually have their shrimp & vegetable thai stir fry and their catfish + veggy basil stir fry... The pad thai is also pretty tasty... Their Tiger cry is awesome. The curry is good except for the chicken they use which can taste pretty blend. Their ONLY MAJOR drawback is that they DON'T GIVE RICE with dishes & the rice you buy for $1 or $2 extra is very poor quality rice. Something they really need to improve upon. Also some of the meat like "bbq pork" used is pretty poor quality too, they should improve upon that. The seafood & tofu are pretty good quality though & the beef too... The chicken & pork are not alas. Overall this is an excellent place to eat Thai in Chicago as long as you know what to order (don't get chicken or pork - poor quality used -> Something they need to improve upon).More

title: Awful

review: Standout dishes include green curry, peanut lovers, and pad Thai. Even their wonton soup is incredible. Yes it's not a traditional thai dish, but they completely re-make a standard soup into something magical. It's filled with fresh wontons, herbs and a good amount of garlic,...More

title: Excellent Thai food in Lincoln Square
review: A strong menu of excellently produced meals. The seasonings were spot on for us and the variety kept everyone pleased. We will be back!

title: Thai goodness
review: Gone here several times with my family the food is always fresh hot the service is always good can't beat the price if you like authentic Thai food this is a place for you ask for the tiger cry very very good appetizer

title: My go-to Thai!
review: Title says it all; we eat here at least once a week. My favorites are the pad Thai, green curry, tiger cry, and Thai fried rice. We've tried many other dishes and have never once been disappointed. Great, friendly environment inside (i've eaten there 2-3...More

title: Great Thai Downtown, but at out-of-town prices!!
review: Great flavor and portions without breaking the bank.. Colleague and I ate at Opart after trade show and had appetizers, lemongrass soup and two spice awesome entrees, all for under $50 (including tip).. Full flavor and just right amount of heat without having to ask...More

title: BEST THAI IN CHICAGO
review: You can't go wrong with Opart Thai. It's right off the Western Brown line stop, and there's parking right across the street in a pay parking lot.   Get the Tiger Cry. DO IT. It's amazing. Charbroiled pieces of the best tasting beef you've ever had....More

title: Excellent Thai
review: I've never actually eaten in the restaurant, but we take out from here pretty frequently. I love their Thai curries, Pad Ped Paak, Pad Prik, etc.

title: Good Panang Curry
review: Panang curry is my go-to Thai meal and what I judge Thai restaurants by.  It was very good.  Lots of chicken and just the right kick of heat.  The rest of my party rated their dinners from okay to very good with the just okay...More

title: Below Acceptable...
review: Yesterday was the third time I ate at this restaurant.  Each time I have left less than thrilled.  The first two times I thought the food was bland and tasteless.  I also thought the portion sizes were small.  Yesterday, my food was better than usual....More

title: Outstanding meal
review: My sister introduced me to Opart Thai house and i'm glad she did.  This is one of the best Thai restaurants i've been to....ever.  We had chicken pad thai and tofu chunks for starters---all excellent and tasty....  She has a beef and flat rice noodle...More

title: YES YES
review: My wife and I have been to this crowded great buzz place 2 times.The first time was simply superb..The second tmme was better than ok.The buzz and authenticity rank very.A nice neighborhood feel..We will go back..A fav Thai w menu thats sweet..BYOB..

title: Dream Thai food!
review: I have been here twice, the first time 3 years ago. The food is super fresh, very various, tasty, simply fantastic. I strongly suggest this restaurant. Try the pad thai with transparent noodles, it's a different twist. Ps we were 8 and we spent 118...More

title: Yummy!
review: While the waitstaff will never win "most attentive" the food quality here more than makes up for it. Good portions, great flavors, stellar menu!

title: good authentic thai
review: very good thai food, good selections in the menu, and the deserts are yummm. not many places that serve as good thai in the city.

title: The Best Thai I have Ever Raten in the US
review: Opart never disappoints. The first time I dined there was over 25 years ago. I no longer live in the Chicago area, and is make Opart a destination dining experience.  This Thai food is the real deal and I always leave satisfied.   Note, the don't...More

title: Fantastic Thai Food at a Great Price
review: This storefront restaurant, right near the "elevated" tracks in Chicago was a surprise and a delight.  The appetizers were delicious (spring rollsand pot stickers), and my entre was wonderfully spicy and healthy (chicken and green beans).  The BYOB policy makes an evening out very reasonable,...More

title: Good authentic Thai food
review: This is a very low key restaurant on state street, great food and good to ok service. The food is authentic Thai. We had tom yum koong, sum tom, yum woon sen, red curry chicken all very good. If you like beef do not pass...More

title: If you love Thai food, you will love this place.

title: Meh

title: Great lil Neighborhood Authentic Thai Restaurant Service w a Smile:)
review: I landed in Chicago craving Thai food, found this place as 2nd best Thai food in Chicago and was very impressed and satisfied. The service was fast and extra friendly. Great food! We tried a bunch of appetizers... The grilled pork was our favorite. Each...More

title: Great food.
review: We usually have their food delivered and its usually here within 30 minutes. The food is consistently tasty and spicy.

title: One of the Best Thai Places in Chicago
review: Fabulous Thai food in the Lincoln Square area of Chicago. We've brought several friends here who were all Thai food fans, and no one has found Opart Thai less than excellent across a variety of dishes. Good service, nice atmosphere.

title: Great Thai Food!

title: Great Thai near Lincoln SQ

title: My favorite Thai place in the city
review: I love this place.  I love the food, I love the location, I love the atmosphere, and I love the staff.  Their desserts and Thai iced tea are to die for.  Reasonable prices for the amount of food you receive.

title: Great for the price, healthy, quick, tasty

review: I love this place.  I love the food, I love the location, I love the atmosphere, and I love the staff.  Their desserts and Thai iced tea are to die for.  Reasonable prices for the amount of food you receive.

title: Great for the price, healthy, quick, tasty
review: Good solid Thai food with plenty of variety to please anyone for lunch.  Good, fresh food, not greasy, VERY reasonable prices. I also asked for no soy sauce and they delivered a soy free, yet well seasoned dish.  Lincoln square area is pretty neat, plenty...More

title: Quite good, not great
review: Really nice little spot out of the main streets of Chicago. More of a neighborhood spot than tourist draw, with good (but not amazing) food, and friendly service. Neighborhood is decent but gets a little sketchy after dark though nothing too out of the ordinary...More

title: Food Good & Service Average
review: I came here today and sat outside for a few drinks and appetizers.  Always a cute place food is not bad.  But, service is just service.  The only pleasant server was the nice young girl who served the Chips/Salsa & replenished the water.  The girl...who served me Luz, toke my order and delivered it promptly.  But, nothing beyond that and could not look at me.  Odd, shy what ever you want to call it.  But, the other server did the same thing to the other single diners as well.  I'll go back.  But, this kind of service all ways makes me crazy and needs to be noticed.  Wake up ladies!More

title: Margarita Party
review: A friend took me for a bday dinner and recommended their Margaritas - I got a Passion Fruit, Frozen - wow so Good!  It was Huge and ridiculously tasty... dangerous.  I loved the Beef Lengua, so tender - kind of hot as I got the...Spicy salsa verde.   She got the Carne asada & Chile Relleno combo and we both tasted all the orders & I must say, Delicioso!  We also got the mixed Veggies instead of Rice & Beans.  Too much food - I got leftovers.  Wonderful Fun place - come & enjoy!More

title: Best Mexican in the area
review: Love Garcia's! It's our go-to place when we can't decide what's for dinner, get so hungry, and then something finally comes to mind! It's a very large restaurant, always busy, but service is fast. Great food and great drinks!  The indoor area is great for...families, but a tad loud, so not recommended if you plant on having a heart to heart conversation over margaritas.More

title: Great food with excellent margaritas
review: Every time I return to Chicago I always go to this wonderful place in Lincoln square for great food. I recommend the ‘Chicago’s best burrito’. And the margaritas are best in the pitcher!!

title: Mexican and Margaritas
review: Busy place. Parking is tricky however there is a paid parking lot just south of the restaurant.  The restaurant has two entrances, one on Western and one on Lincoln. There is limited seating in the waiting area.  The restaurant is very loud and sometimes it...is hard to hear.  I tried the chicken tortilla soup for an appetizer however it turned into my meal since the portion size was a big bowl.  You can have the soup without chicken as well (I think adding chicken is an additional $2). I had a pineapple and coconut margarita and it was delicious. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in the areaMore

title: Food and Margarita Overload, And I Love It!
review: When you come to this place. Expect two things: You'll never leave hungry and You won't ever go dry. From their Big-sized flavored frozen margaritas to their scrumptious, big helpings of Mexican food always complete with all the necessary accoutrements. This place hits the spot...for Mexican Cuisine cravings and/or those late-night after drinking needs. This place has been in Lincoln Square for many years and it seems to be still very successful. The only change from a few years back 'til now  are the prices. It has certainly gone up. So it's not cheap eats anymore. It's evolved into a Lincoln Square restaurant with Lincoln Square prices. It's not a bad thing, I'm happy to pay more because the portions are still just as big. This is great for meeting friends or having a Very Good Mexican Dinner. Hope this Helps! Salud!More

title: Very good Mexican food
review: We ate at Garcia's Restaurant when another restaurant where we wanted to go was closed on Tuesdays.  Garcia's Restaurant is interesting in how it is physically laid out, as there is an entrance on Western Ave., and an entrance on Lincoln Ave.  The restaurant is...decorated in authentic Mexican decor.  The staff was friendly and we asked to be seated on the patio which is on the Lincoln Ave. side.  We ordered a ground beef torta with rice and beans, as well as two tostadas - one pollo (chicken) and the other carne asado.  Everything was hot and tasted great.  The service on the patio was very efficient.  The price was reasonable.More

title: Good Late night option
review: Needed somewhere to eat at midnight...this was the place. There was a very lively atmosphere. The wait time was minimal (needed seating for 8). The food was great...very authentic Mexican. Although our waitress seemed to have an attitude...and her tip reflected it.

title: Very good Mexican food
review: Two things are very important when you go to eat, the food and the service.  The good was very good and the service was great.  Thank you Evelyn

title: Beware... Bad business practice aimed to nickle/dime the diner...

title: Very tasty
review: Love this place ! We've been coming here for years . Food is great place is very clean . Very crowded on the weekends but they try to accommodate you as quickly as possible.

review: Went to this restaurant late at night and they were still busy. Good sign. We had the carne asada burrito - outstanding! Could not finish mine as I ate too much guacamole and chips beforehand. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

title: Good Mexican food

Servers were very friendly and water glasses never empty. Servings are large and very well priced. Must try.More

review: I just love this place. Nothing beats home cooked Filipino food, but this place comes pretty damn close. My go to is the beef caldereta with huge chunks of tender beef chunks, potatoes and bell peppers in a rich tomato sauce. Susan was such an...great server. Can't wait to go back.More

review: This was wonderful! So glad we made a reservation because it got full! Me and my boyfriend celebrated both of our birthdays here together and the food was just like home. We ordered Beef stew with vegetables (Filipino style), Crispy Pata (pork leg) and Lumpiang sariwa. All tasty. Would love to...go back with my daughter this time. Priced reasonably.More

title: Wonderful
review: Wife loves Filipino food ,been looking for a place ..Couldn't find one but was recommended this place and it was perfect.. Good tasted the best we have Filipino friends and family who fix food and it was just like eating at Thier place ...Would definitely...recommend this placeMore

title: Uniquely Different-And Good
review: Very small, family-run ethnic restaurant.  Freshly prepared food; good choices; BYOB (package stores in area). Gets a bit smokey in dining room. Take Brown Line 'L' to Western Ave stop; or Lyft.

title: Real Filipino food
review: Isla Pilipina is a great family style restaurant serving all the Filipino favorites. I️ had Sinigang — a tamarind based soup with Bangus (milkfish) and it was just like I️ remember it from the Philippines and from my relatives cooking. You can get all the...standards, lumpia (egg rolls), adobo, the famous Bicol express (Laing) for vegetarians, kare kare (oxtail), tinola, various kinds of pancit (noodles), sizzling Sisig and much more. They also had some less often found items like Mongo (beans), Dinaguan (try it and ask later), and Pinakbet. The latter is hard core vegetarian Filipino. I️ also like that I️ could was my meal down with kalamansi juice. The service was really friendly and the background music the night I️ was there was really strange. I️ don’t know if anybody else noticed it but I️ heard Metallica, Testament, Gary Numan and Gang of Four. Somebody in that place likes metal and alternative a lot. Great meal. Very affordableMore

title: Awesome goodness!
review: We had the kare-kare, calamari, pinakbet, and lechon kawali. So happy with our choices! Perfect quantity for 4 people to share. The ox tail in the kare-kare was tender and the sauce was flavorful. Crispy lechon kawali, you know it came out fresh from the...fryer! Friendly service, too!More

title: Positive comments
review: Highly recommended!they serve authentic foods.pls call for reservation the restaurant is smaller to avoid long wait.fast service and friendly servers Reasonable price .great experience, be back soon.

title: Amazing food

The food was great. Must have the lumpias and the oxtail. Would go all...the way north just to eat there again.More

review: We are looking for Filipino restaurant and found this in google and we tried it and it was good. Only thing the price is expensive for a simple dish. But other than that it is good
