title: Tasty food.  Unbeatable value.
review: I've been to this Filippino restaurant three times now.  A word about the location.  If you are from out of town, it's in a residential neighborhood on the far north side nestled between Lincoln Square which has a German Flavor and Albany Park, which is...More

title: Good food, good price!
review: I have been trying to find a filipino restaurant for 2 years and this absolutely awesome. The food was delicious, service was prompt and the price was just right. We had to wait an hour so we grabbed beer at one of the German Bars...More

title: Great Filipino Food!
review: This was our third visit to this restaurant.  The food tastes great, is authentic, and the presentation is very appealing.  Everything we've ordered from here is delicious.  The lumpia shanghai is perfectly fried and served with a great sweet sauce.  The longoniza is also delicious...More

title: Not in a good part of town.  Service Sucks
review: Was there last weekend; was told that we should call for reservations.  Called two hours early for 7PM reservations.  When we got there, we were told that they couldn't accommodate us and we COULD/MAYBE be seated at around 815PM. there was another couple there who...More

title: Best Korean BBQ
review: This was the best Korean BBQ I have had. We went with a large family and ordered the 4 meats combo. I love the coal fire taste. It so much food and all of it was good. Service was unbelievably fast. I would only wish there were better ventilation.

title: A great destination for authentic Korean BBQ
review: I was overwhelmed by the tsunami of tasty banchan but what mattered more to me was the taste of the Hae Moul Pajun and Wang Kal Bi we ordered. Both the Hae Moul Pajun and Wang Kal Bi were both fresh and delicious. I was also pleased by the service. The owner was hands on and ensured that we had an excellent dining experience. By the way, I saw a few customers commenting about the price of their meals but what San Soo Gab San charges is in line with other Korean Restaurants. I am a native Chicagoan who will definitely go back to eat there!

title: Great food
review: This restaurant is one of the few great Korean restaurants in Chicago. Its large and a fun restaurant. The food is wonderful and the menu selection is huge. I go all the time.

title: Not all it's made out to be
review: I have eaten at a lot of korean restaurants and this is just not all of that. I was not impressed by the overall atmosphere and property. The service was just so so. The food was delivered quickly once we were actually waited on. They bring out numerous side dishes but don't ever refill them or even offer. The meats were brought out quickly and they did do a good job of trading out the grill as it got dirty. We had to chase them down to get water refills and a check. Probably won't be returning any time soon.Parking is very limited here too.

title: Extremly over rated in my humble opinion
review: This location was highly recommended. The atmosphere is average but pretty outdated. The parking is at a premium at this location. The wait staff is very inattentive for the majority of the evening. The service provided by the staff is good as far as taking care of replacing the grills as needed. The meats are fresh and they do bring them out fairly quickly. If you are used to the Korean format of getting numerous side dishes you won't be disappointed as they bring out numerous ones. But I'm used to having them refilled/replaced which doesn't happen here. They don't even ask if you want more. I will find others to visit.

title: cook your own dinner!
review: three friends and i headed to this place on a rainy sunday evening--it was warm and filled with people. your table has a kind of pit in the middle of it where, after you order, a server will place a brazier filled with charcoal, i think--anyway, something that's burning, and a grill cover and you will grill whatever delicious meats you ordered.we ordered a tasty seafood pancake (filled with squid pieces), pork belly kim chi (my companions warned me that it was above my spice level so i didn't try it, but they all liked it), and three kinds of meat. each meat order comes with soup and rice which meant that we shared three soups and three rice four ways--there was plenty of food so it wasn't a problem but be forewarned. the soup is kind of miso soup with an extra kick and a lot more things in it than a typical miso soup. you also get about 25 little shallow bowls of various things to tempt your palate--again some were deemed too spicy for me, but there were things i could eat--some kind of marinated potatoes, seaweed strands, vegetables in a kind of cole slaw sauce. i know we got the bulgogi and some beef ribs but i didn't hear what the third meat was--another kind of beef. we designated one of our number to be in charge of cooking the meat pieces. everything was thinly sliced so that it cooks quickly. there isn't a ton of ambience and be warned, your clothes and hair will smell of smoke, but it was tasty and a fun meal to do with friends where if you don't like something, someone else will be there to finish it for you. staff was helpful and the food came quickly. don't plan on putting your elbows on the table--there won't be room with all those little bowls!

title: Delicious food!
review: You are seated at a table, which has a 12” or so hole in the middle, and after you order, they bring out an array of small bowls with sauces and appetizers. Then you get a Korean miso soup, which was yummy. Then they bring a fire pot which goes into the hole in the middle for you to cook your entree. Except for being a little smoky it’s great fun to cook and share your different entrees.

title: Just about one of the most amazing dining experiences ever...
review: I can't begin to pronounce what we had for lunch but when you are served 14 different sides and three different meats, rice, and a complete vegetable stir-fry, you've landed in foodie heaven. Seriously, the language barrier doesn't exist here. Just point, eat and enjoy.

title: Good stuff
review: Tasty and lots of banchan.  Miso soup was excellent as well. Gets very crowded so be prepared to wait. A little pricey but a good treat every once in a while.

title: Got Ripped Off
review: Food is great, service is alright, but the management is absolutely ridiculous. We ordered a set for five people (which the menu does not specify it’s per person), and our waitress demanded that we order six meats instead of five (one of my friends is vegetarian, so she wasn’t going to eat the meat but we got charge 30 extra dollars anyway since the waitress insisted on us ordering 6 meats). Menu does NOT specify that the special deal for groups are 30 per person, wouldn’t have minded paying for it if they didn’t charge us for an extra person who did not even eat any of it. On top of that, they forced 18% gratuity AFTER tax, which is not only illegal but added almost $100 extra to our bill (223 before tax, 247 after tax, and 292 + tip AFTER TAX). Extremely disappointed in the management for ripping us off like this. We did talk to the manager and tell him that you cannot charge tip after tax, but I don’t think he understood English well and he was trying to rush us out of the restaurant. Very upset with how this was handled. Talking to our credit company to try and stop the illegal charge, but who knows what will happen. Definitely not coming here again. Make sure you check the receipt before you pay (since they don’t give you a detailed receipt afterwords). Try to avoid getting ripped off like we did.

title: Without parallel
review: Friendly and thoughtful service. Perhaps the best Korean cuisine we have ever experienced.  Superb quality meats: kalbi, poolgogi.  San Soo Gab San exceeded our expectations in every respect.

title: Very good
review: This is my favorite Korean BBQ in Chicago.  It is nice an open.  The ventilation is perfect.  If you want an authentic Korean experience check this place out.  You can get a feast for very cheap.  If you don't know what to do the staff...More

title: Very different
review: One of the best Korean BBQ in town, located at Lincoln Square crossroads. You get a grill on your table and choice of meat that you want and an enormous choice of side dishes to pair with. Must try.

title: Not good. IT'S GREAT!!!!
review: What a great dining experience. Authentic Korean food cooked over hot coal. The side dishes alone were excellent particularly the spicy squid and pickled daikon. The Bulgogi beef is wonderful, marinated to perfection. The baby squid is also outstanding.  The staff is very friendly and...More

title: Nice place for gathering and family
review: San Soo Gab San is one of my favorite. They opened very late, close at 1am on weekdays and 2am on weekend. Korean BBQ, literally is you cook your own meat on a grill. They were using charcoal grills that built in each table. It...More

title: Be sure to check your bill
review: Was excited to eat here and the food was good...however, the total bill seemed to be off big time. Should have read other reviews regarding asking for a detailed breakdown of the order. Be careful when you get your bill, ask questions. We also tried...More

title: One of the best KBBQ I've had in awhile
review: This might get long. lol  So me and five of my friends went here after a kpop concert. When we got there, it was only two tables being served with us coming in made it three total. So, we ordered two pork belly, an order...More

title: Seriously wish I had gotten a whopper instead
review: I tried their table BBQ with 2 cuts of their pork belly and unseasoned beef ribs which neared $60.00. Well, the expensive dinner wasn't quite so wonderful. It was a flavorless outing here and a visit my purse absolutely regrets; a place I now wish...More

title: Hidden gem!
review: We enjoy Korean food and ventured into the city for lunch at San Soo. Food was excellent, servers were pleasant but not overly friendly - could be the language barrier. Plenty of options on the menu, with a wide selection of banchan accompanying the meal....More

title: I think we need a bigger table
review: We are novices when it comes to Korean food but this place got a 2016 Bib Gourmand from the Michelin Guide (meaning it's good food, under $40pp for 2 courses plus either a glass of wine or dessert).   So we figured we couldn't go wrong....More

title: Hot food and cold services
review: I have heard about the place from many resources and a strong recommendation from a Korean. Finally got to try this place. BBQ is good but not the best.delicious and generous side dishes.if you like to be walked away from and totally ignored while she...More

title: Lots of Korean natural !
review: But be prepped to.get quick, impersonal service along with not knowing EXACTLY what ur eating, and itll be tasty and hot

title: Holy banchans!
review: Holy banchans!  They aren't kidding about the plethora of banchans, we got a total of 26 and most were really good!  It was a great way to start our meal.  We ordered the seafood pancake, bulgogi and the kalbi short ribs.  The seafood pancake is...More

title: Great Experience for those new to Korean Food...
review: This place is a hiidden gem on the North Side of Chicago. Its a Korean Restaraunt where you cook your own Dishes(BBQ Style) on your table. I have never ordered any Cooked dishes, but I am pretty sure they have them. Besides, coming here for...More

title: Great experience
review: We had lunch and it was delicious! But for me it was too many sides that I did not had the chance to eat. If you want to use the Yakiniku table you have to order 2 orders otherwise they will cook your order in...More

title: This is an amazing hidden gem on Western
review: This was our second time going to this location for Korean and it was amazing.  It was filled with asian guests and the tasty smells assaulted your senses as you walked up close to the building.  You pick the kinds of meat, and then they...More

title: Excellent Bulgogi
review: Excellent korean BBQ. The variety is amazing and they start off by serving you atleast 25 bowls of short eats.  The bulgogi is to die for ...  Would go there again purely for the Bulgogi.

title: Best kalbi in town
review: I have been going there since 91. Still a great place to eat. The kalbi is wonderful. A must try. You won't regret it. The prices are very reasonable. Service leaves a bit to be desired but the food makes up for it.

title: What Happened to my favorite Korean BBQ spot in Chicago??????
review: I have been coming here for over a decade and always loved the rich flavorful meats and yummy abundant sides.  In the last few years this place has really lost its touch.  I took my mom there for Mother's day and ordered the kalbi and...More

title: Satisfying
review: Good amount of food. My boyfriend and I got there to eat. We wait about 45 minutes to dine. It was Saturday dinner and was very busy! But good food and filling.  You don't need to order too much, two orders of grill was enough...More

title: BBQ & sushi
review: Liking the combo of Korean BBQ and Japanese sushi. We loved everything we tried. Was a bit smoky in there but we're happy they were able to seat a large party at the last minute. Would recommend a reservation if you have a large party...More

title: DON'T...JUST DON'T
review: Two people for lunch ordering off the regular menu came to $80.  Sure, you get the HUGE tray of mini bowls of stuff, but each is filled with up to 3oz max of vegetables.  The protein is on the plate.  Decent quantity, but just standard...More

title: Interesting but average
review: We ended up here for dinner and had a selection of dishes, food, service and the facilities were average and nothing better. Too expensive for what it is and food was just ok

title: KOREAN BBQ
review: This Korean BBQ is my wife's favorite!  We both love all the side dishes and the quality of the food.  If you like Korean BBQ then this is a restaurant you will enjoy.  Not fancy, booths are small but the restaurant can hold a lot...More

title: Beyond expectations
review: Wow! we had an amazing Korean bbq, we ordered the marinated beef, and it was just insane, they brought all this side dishes all very good, great place to go and get satisfy.

title: Great experience
review: Excellent food and fun venue.  Sample any and everything.  Fun place to eat for sure.  Only knock, and it can't be avoided, but you will leave there smelling like Korean food.

title: Great Korean BBQ, Service Lacking
review: This restaurant has great Korean BBQ. It was very tasty and the sides were plentiful. It is a little expensive, especially when you have to cook your own food. The service was lacking. There was even a "call" button at your table that either did...More

title: Best korean bbq in the chicagoland area
review: Quality & flavor of their korean bbq are unbeatable. A bit pricey with no allyoucaneat offers but i dont mind paying more for good food. Service a bit slow but friendlier than other korean bbq jointe. Decor needs improvement

title: Not Bad, But Not the Best
review: This is one of the more popular Korean BBQ places on the north side of Chicago. While enjoyable, it is, however, not the best. The food is comparably priced to other places of a similar nature, and it seems always crowded, but it lacks the...More

title: Authentic in every way
review: If you crave authentic Korean BBQ in an authentic setting, this is the place for you.   You can smell the cooking meats from the parking lot and when you enter, the smoke is so thick you would think the place is on fire from all...More

title: My favorite restaurant of all time!
review: I've been frequenting this restaurant for the past 5 years. They used to stay open until 5am, so it was a perfect place to go after one of my gigs or on the way home after a late night. Just recently they changed their hours,...More

title: enjoyed a bbq lunch
review: We have some Korean favorite dishes but we never experienced do-it-yourself BBQ. Ordered kalbi, bulgogi and one bibimbop for lunch. No disappointments. Since they were not terribly busy, we got personal attention- they basically cooked our food for us. Salad assortment was good, soup a...More

title: Korean BBQ
review: I really don't have a lot of experience with Korean food.  But this place is nice to take your friends.  The food is descent.  The wait staff are pretty nice.  Parking lot is a bit tiny and they also serve sushi....which I've never tried....

title: Average food, weak service
review: Five adults wanted to try this popular neighborhood Korean BBQ.  The majority of us (maybe all) wished we made a different choice.  An admission to start:  None of us had a ton of experience with Korean BBQ but everyone is pretty adventurous when it comes...More

title: Really good
review: We had 4 Kalbi and a Dolsot Bibimbap.  We all loved it.  The cooking surface is on the small side, so one batch is about 8 pieces only.  I knew it was just impossible to cook and eat at the same time, so I had...More

title: Good Food with "traditional" service
review: The food is great here, a bit on the sweet side though.  service is mediocre, looks like a lot of "housewives" running the business. Has a "traditional" mom n pops style service

title: A bit chaotic, plenty of fun, good food
review: We got lucky: no wait (on a raw Sunday evening), no impolite service many people complain about (quite the contrary, they were very attentive, and we not Korean), and the meats we ordered for BBQ were very well marinated, especially the ribs. It's not the...More

This seems to be a very popular Korean BBQ place but we found the meats average at best, we had a party of 8 so we ordered quite a bit of food.  The Kalbi beef ribs were not very well marinated and sliced too thin,...More

title: Good marinade for BBQ, over 20 side dishes
review: Like everywhere I went in Chicago, the wait was around 1 hour.  The place was packed and kind of chaotic.  When we finally were seated, service was immediate- over twenty banchan were offered.  Most were good, some were kind of odd (potato salad?).  My friends...More

title: An adventure!
review: My husband & I had never been to a Korean restaurant before so it was definitely an adventure!  (I don't like to cook at home so cooking my own food at a restaurant isn't something I want to do.)  We couldn't get over so many...More

title: Great for lunch or big deal dinner
review: First the negatives, they put so much banchan on the table that it's hard to move & the parking lot will test your patience & parking skills.   Better to park on Western or ride your bike.  I had lunch here many times, love the bibimbop...More

title: LOVE all the side dishes
review: Yes I agree the service can be a hit or miss but the food is just AMAZING!!  I go here everytime I visit Chicago.  Sometimes the service is down right horrible and sometimes it's fine!  Just went yesterday and it was fine.  The food was...More

title: Good food, interesting experience.
review: We visited with a large group, including two people of Korean descent who pretty much 'drove' for us.  The parking lot and restaurant were packed, but luckily we had a reservation.  We had beef short ribs and thinly sliced pork which we cooked on small...More

title: Average Food; Poor Service; Better Choices Elsewhere
review: Compared to other Korean Restaurants, just average at best.  On the plus side, they use real wood charcoal for BBQing the meats, and lots of panchans.  On the negative, the panchans were not particularly spicy or interesting.  Most dissappointing was the Service, which as is...More

title: The Best Korean Side Dishes.
review: I'll give a mixed review to this one. First of all the parking space is small but you can get a spot for sure. They open late I think until 4 A.M. ? Divided booths that provide a little bit of privacy. Serving Kirin Beer...More

title: horrible service, but you get a sick amount of pan chan (free small plates), and it's open to 5am
review: horrible service, but you get a sick amount of pan chan (free small plates), and it's open to 5am

review: So much ban chan! That's my favorite part about this place. Kalbi is good but not the best I've had. Chap Chae is not that good...sticky noodles? Now that it's been reviewed on Check Please, it's a lot more crowded so expect to wait around...More
