title: this is a great spot for...
review: this is a great spot for yummy korean food anytime of the day! They're open 24/7 and great soups and BBQ. Decent price.

title: Yum!!
review: We tried a variety of menu items from burgers to Ruebens to BLT’s to fish tacos. Everything was excellent!! This is my go-to restaurant when I’m in the area!  Try it - eat in or carry out: it’s all delicious!

title: Very good, but today, not at the top of its game
review: We had been to Rockwell's neighborhood Grill before, so we thought that we would try it again.  We were seated immediately and our server was there and was quite efficient, attentive and personable.  We ordered a chopped chicken salad, as well as the "build your...own" burger.  The salad was good.  The burger wasn't done the way that I had asked, which is medium rare.  We were not fans of the seasoned French fries, as they just seemed way too seasoned.More

title: Great Local Pub, Kid-Friendly
review: We stopped in for another lunch today. The place was empty mid-afternoon on a Monday, so we had great service. Our two lunches were great, a lemon pepper fish sandwich and a southwestern grilled chicken sandwich. We didn't get fries today, but they're hand cut...and excellent every time.More

title: Wait Staff was Exceptional
review: Everyone was really nice and seemed legitimately enthusiastic about the food and drinks. We got great recommendations and fast service. I get the feeling this place is busy early and, arriving after 8:00 as we did, it was a lot more chill. The draughts are...a bit esoteric, but they staff was ready with knowledgeable opinions and sample. Everyone in our group enjoyed every aspect of their meal. There's ample parking (and it's right next to the Rockwell Brown Line stop). There are tons of highchairs standing at the ready for family dining, but I really enjoyed our adults night out.More

title: Nice Menu and Good Food
review: For a neighborhood bar and grill, this restaurant is quite good. The menu is fairly extensive, the food is very good, the service is great, and the prices are reasonable. If you’re in the neighborhood, give this restaurant a try.

title: Great neighborhood restaurant.
review: Great food plus good service. In the neighborhood and easy to walk to. Rockwell-Brown Line stop half a block from the restaurant. Also, has outdoor seating in the good weather. Great place for young families.

title: Great service! Very good food.
review: Whenever we visit Chicago we enjoy Rockwells grill. This time was especially good because our server recommended a very good gluten free beer for my wife.

title: Great neighbourhood spot
review: I've lived around the corner from this place for over two years. They have a great rotating beer selection, burgers, and brunch. This place is also super kid friendly, too. Enjoy!

title: Are you ready for a "Big Ollie?"
review: Rockwell's Neighborhood Grill is everything you would expect from a local pub...fast and friendly service, comfortable surroundings and a menu filled with home-cooked, couch-potato items that you enjoy while watching the Cubs or White Sox or Bulls or Blackhawks or Bears on TV. Located at...4632 North Rockwell in the Lincoln Square/Ravenswood neighborhood, it is a kid-friendly local pub with craft beers, burgers and bar food in a tavern space with TVs and a patio. You can't get more homespun than that. There is so  much to choose from. Start with nachos or chips and salsa or cheddar fries or Louisiana egg rolls or a bowl of chicken tortilla soup. Add a Classic Caesar salad or a chopped chicken salad or a taco salad or just plain mixed greens. For the main course, choose a hot turkey sandwich or BBQ bacon burger or chicken strips or a 9-ounce pork chop or a burrito or a marinated skirt steak or a pork shoulder sandwich or 1/2-pound of Certified Angus beef with pepperjack cheese, grilled jalapeno and onion or spicy buffalo sauce and bleu cheese or home-made bacon jam and cheddar. How about The Big Ollie? If you've got an enormous appetite, this is the challenge of a lifetime--two 1/2-pound beef patties, each topped with Swiss and American cheese, Applewood smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle and Rockwell's signature sauce. Or, if you aren't so ambitious, build your own burger. Choose the meat, bun, cheese, condiments, spices, sauce and other extras. And don't forget the sides...fries, cole slaw, baked potato, rice, black beans, sauteed corn or mac 'n cheese. You won't go away hungry. And you'll want to come back to order what you missed the last time around.More

title: Nice Neighborhood Grill - Huge Burgers!
review: My family stopped here for lunch last week. We had the loaded fries as an appetizer, my son had a build-your-own burger and my husband and I split the fish tacos. Large portions, delicious, fresh food. Salsa that came with the fish tacos was very...fresh and had a nice kick. Chips were homemade and the burger was huge! Nice beer/drink menu as well.More

title: Great Neighborhood Grill
review: Great little spot for basic but delicious pub fare and sports viewing. Nice outdoor area in the summer time, neighborhood feel and decent service. We return often, and carry out sometimes as well.

title: Nice neighborhood restaurant with outdoor seating
review: Located just south of the Brown Line CTA Rockwell stop, this is a great place to stop on your way home from work, or stop in during the day.  The interior has a nice ambiance, there is a medium-sized bar with more than adequate seating....More

title: Good Vibe, Kid Friendly, Delicious Soup
review: My friend lives in the hood and we wanted a casual place we could catch up and have a little bit of something.  A bowl of Chicken Tortilla Soup was tasty, filling and a great value ($6).  There was lots of meat and crispy tortilla...More

title: Good place
review: Food looks and smells great, but we are just brown lining it, great beers! The bartenders are really friendly too!

title: Great food and great service
review: We went early Saturday morning for brunch. Bloody Mary was on point! Breakfast burrito was amazing as well. Our waitress was great and very friendly, we will definitely go back soon!

title: Great neighborhood pub, kid friendly
review: We live a few blocks away and come back here frequently. Each time we've taken guests, no one has ever had complaints about the food. Great indoor or outdoor seating. There's an extensive burger menu, fajitas, blackened fish tacos, cheddar bacon fries, a rotating steak...More

title: Neighborhood Staple
review: I should start off by saying that I live in the neighborhood and this is our go to place. Reasons why: wide ranging menu with options for all (including my vegan diet), fantastic beer selection, creative cocktails, super friendly staff. We've been here with large...More

title: Very good
review: Great service. Heck of a beer menu. Did not try the fried bologna and velveeta hamburger. But the vegetarian chili, handcut fries, and roasted turkey sandwich were great.

title: Great food and beer selection
review: I frequent Rockwell's and find it a great place for dinner/drinks in the evening and also weekend brunch. Their food is great and unique for Chicago in my opinion (bar food with a southwestern twist). They always have a fantastic selection of beers too. Some...More

title: Great Drinks, Great Food, Great Staff
review: Rockwell's is a great bar to go to for almost any occasion. I've eaten all three meals here; the menu is solid for each. The food has a tex-mex flare and it is really good. I highly recommend the nachos (I get them veggie), fish...More

title: Nice Neighborhood Spot
review: Nice corner location with a cute outdoor seating.  I love sitting outside and it's on a sidestreet so very easy to chill.  Casual, nice and relaxing.  Local spots rock! Enjoy

title: "Where everybody knows your name"
review: Well, actually, nobody knew our name there. But the warm, publike atmosphere in this place tucked into a leafy corner of the Ravenswood neighborhood made it seem like one of those "Cheers" sorts of places. Our daughter is new to the area and we walked...More

title: Neighborhood Joint
review: This established burger joint is within a half block of the Brown Line, and it's nestled in a mature Chicago neighborhood.  It's been around for a while, as you can tell by the vintage photos on the walls.  My partner and I had a taste...More

title: Delicious food for all meals!
review: Pleasant atmosphere that allows one's leashed dog on the patio. Food is tasty ~ portions are plentiful ~ prices are appropriate. Friendly staff too!

title: An extraordinary meal, filled with creativity and a bit of humor
review: We finally made it to Ileana Regan's fine restaurant.  Chef was there to help explain the theme:  Harry Potter.  The place is small, you prepay well in advance, and is filled with nice staff willing to answer my questions (I've worked in restaurants and play...in the kitchen a lot at home).  The theme hit many of the characters' favorite dishes (Dumbledore, Hagrid, etc.), with titles like Herbology, Fleur, Stoat Sandwich, Butter Beer.  The portions are thankfully small - with 11 or 12 courses, that helps with what can be an overfilling experience.  Our favorites were the mandrake - a radish in edible soil with cultured butter on the bottom; the pasties, one of peas, one of pastrami, and lamb in a tiny cast iron skillet; a spiny lobster disk with saffron; a porridge with chicken stock (Chef told me how they get such a deep flavor - they reduce it); and we ended with her take on butter beer - an oat ginger cake with butterscotch and white chocolate.  A fun meal, served wellMore

title: A Tasting Menu from Outer Space
review: 9 Tables and 9 staff, prepaid and Had to book 2 months ahead as it is 13 on Chicago’s too 50. Even though we were late due to snow they accommodated us. Service was great. Have to be ready experiment at a tasting place. This...is our third and have not had a miss yet. Decor was simple but matched the Star Wars theme of the meal (changes seasonally) as did the music. Great experience at the hands of two women turning food into art with a theme twist.More

title: Outstanding food and great fun
review: We were there (unplanned) for the Game of Thrones menu. The links to the show felt a bit forced, but the food was generally very good. Service was incredibly friendly and informative. We will definitely be back.  Some courses worked better than others, but the...overall sense was that of fine dining on a lower key scale. The room is small and the decorations are charming. Every member of the crew was helpful at various points of the evening.   Now high on our list.More

title: ONE OF THE BEST CHICAGO OFFERS. High value fine dining.
review: My review is based on about a dozen dinners, variety of fixed menus at Elizabeth. I have tremendous respect for Chef Iliana Regan. Always extending herself, trying new things, innovating and "re-innovating."  Never shies away from challenging herself and her guests.   A workaholic. In fact,...I worry at times she works too hard.  All dishes beautiful, and delicious. For further details, check out my yelp reviews.  Highly recommended. Mehran (of Chicago)More

title: Hoped for more
review: Me and my S.O. had the Pagan Fire dinner.  We each ordered the different tracks: God and Goddess and tasted each.  I have to admit that i was really expecting tastes to "wow" me based on the reputation of this place.  I was disappointed.  Nothing...was horrible, the sea Urchin mini tacos were borderline, but nothing stood out.  The presentation was fabulous - most of the courses were served with edible flowers.    Based on the small sizes, the taste of each, and the price, i would not go back.More

title: Very disappointed
review: It was not my first time eating at a restaurant with Michelin stars (one in this case) but it was my first time being disappointed by one.  I went there with my husband for the Pagan Fire menu in July, to celebrate my new job....The restaurant is small but nicely decorated, the food was ok (flavors were a little underwhelming), the presentation was good but the portions very tiny.  I understand that that you don't get abnormally huge portions at restaurans like this, and that's how it should be.  HOWEVER, I don't think you're supposed to leave hungry either. Like I said, I've been to plenty of restaurants with Michelin stars and not once have I still felt hungy afterwards.   For example I've had a 5 course meal at one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants (Maze, in NY) and I was full, maybe even too full.  We had a 6 courses at the Elizabeth and  actually had to eat something small at home afterwards because we were still hungry!  We weren't very thrilled about the wine pairing either.  We will not be going back unfortunately.More

title: New Gatherer Goddess
review: We chose to visit Elizabeth because we wanted to support a female chef Michelin Star restaurant. She did not disappoint. Everything we had was absolutely amazing and it was an incredible choice for our last day in Chicago.  The place is quaint, makes you feel...like you have been personally invited by Chef Iliana Regan and her friends for dinner. We enjoyed every minute of it.More

title: SOS ......3.5 stars
review: We went for the NOMA menu and to be frank we were disappointed.  Out of the 11 or so courses only 3 were really good: the bread and butter, the yogurt with peas and the lobster, probably the nicest piece of lobster I've ever eaten....the rest of the menu was blah, under seasoned and tasting of nothing but the herbs placed with tweezers on top. Salt was sadly lacking and every dish seemed to come with "sorrel from our roof top garden", talk about a sorrel overload.  The wine pairing was decent but we didn't have a clue what we were drinking as the lady that served the wine was completely incoherent between her mumbling and speed talking. It became a running joke as the evening went on, placing bets on whether or not we would understand anything she said.  However, our waitress was good and service was well paced.  SOS, take your pick of its meaning with this meal, either "send out salt", or "save us from sorrel"More

title: The best meal I've ever had
review: This place is quite literally the best. I went during the downtown abbey menu season. My SO booked it and paid-- I've since read that it's very expensive, so I'm not quite sure about the value since I am still unaware of the actual cost....That being said, it was the best meal of my life.  I tried things I didn't even think I'd be able to keep down (apparently fois gras is DELISH)!  It was a wonderful experience.  The chefs were fun to watch, the servers all very informative.  If you can, try to put this on the list.More

title: Underwhelming
review: Went there last week for a Game of Thrones inspired dinner. The whole thing lasted somewhere around 4 hours for 10 courses, out of which 4 were desserts. I liked the appetizer and one of the desserts. Out of the remaining 8, 5 were ok...and 3 were bad. I wouldn't put it in the same category as Sepia, Naha or Dusek's, even though it has a Michelin star, just like those 3 restaurantsMore

title: Disappointed
review: Disappointed and surprised given this restaurant's reputation.  We went with two couples and weren't impressed.  The flavors were uninspired, nearly everything was served lukewarm, and service was interminably slow.  I understand the pre fixed small plate concept, but we waited an inordinately long time between...More

title: Unique and Thoroughly Enjoyable!
review: My husband and I went to Elizabeth for dinner last November and returned last week for brunch. Both experiences were worth the wait to get a reservation and worth the $$.   Dinner was the Winter theme with about 12 courses. Chef Regan's approach to dining...More

title: Innovative and Amazing Flavors
review: We visited Elizabeth- chef Iliana Regan's masterpiece named after her deceased sister,  in February 2016. The featured menu was the Winter menu. Regan is self taught chef (She holds a degree in Fiction Writing) but has worked at some of the best restaurants in Chicago,...More

title: Chicago's most original restaurant
review: My wife and I had heard about Elizabeth and, frankly, we were reluctant to see what this fine dining, farm-to-table restaurant with tasting menus featuring a Midwestern cuisine largely consisting of fruit and vegetables is all about. "Chicago's most original restaurant" is how it is...More

title: Colossal Disappointment
review: Chicago is a great foodie town, and there are so many great restaurants to choose from, I had a difficult time deciding where to go for my birthday dinner. I thought about Next or Alinea (and planned plenty of time ahead, so I could have...More

title: Fantastic experience.
review: This restaurant exceeded our expectations and we had a most wonderful evening.  I won't go into all the different food details as things change here quite often but I will say that everything was presented beautifully and we enjoyed all the awesome flavors in each...More

title: Always a treat for the taste buds!
review: My wife and daughters have visited Elizabeths on numerous occasions.  We have yet to be disappointed!  The food is always unique, extremely clean in taste and curiously delicious.  The focus on fresh ingredients is undeniable and it resonates in every bite.  We will surely visit...More

title: Outrageous corkage fee
review: The outrageous corkage fees, $45/ bottle, was a sour end to an interesting, surprising and sometimes delicious dinner.  My friend had been told it was BYOB so we bought wine.  I've never paid that much anywhere in the world.

title: Delightful Imaginative Whimsical Experience
review: This is a unique unpretentious restaurant located in a storefront on a busy street near Lincoln Square.  The windows are shaded and there is no sign so you would never know it was open or that it was a restaurant unless you had the address....More

title: Beautifully Plated, Thoughtfully Conceived and Delicious
review: I have dined at Elizabeth over the years because I think Chef Iliana Regan is incredibly talented. Each season she seizes upon a theme for her tasting menu. I think her plating is well done, beautiful and the thought and heart that she puts behind...More

title: Creative dishes artfully presented
review: Elizabeth has been one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago for two years now and I have dined here a number of times. The dishes are always changing, although the style of the chef remains consistent. A typical dinner consists of 10-15 courses that are...More

title: Another fabulous meal in Chicago.
review: We used the concierge service of our Visa infinite card to obtain reservations before we left Toronto. This was our second visit to Elizabeth Restaurant. The number on the door is the only indication that you have arrived at the restaurant. There is, a la...More

title: Overrated Compared to Other Chicago Options
review: Chicago has a lot of amazing dining options, which is why I would caution folks in considering Elizabeth. If budget isn't an issue, then this place is worth trying. If you're saving up for a special dinner, I would recommend you consider other restaurants. The...More

title: An authentic culinary experience, there's substance behind the hype!
review: Heard great things about this restaurant, but tried to keep my expectations low.  These tasting menu places, especially with a theme can be so underwhelming, more hype that substance.  This was not that.  A truly authentic culinary experience, interesting flavors, inventive dishes, memorable bites.  We...More

title: Who knew foraging could be so fun?!
review: Tried to get into Alinea (it was full - shocking...) and was referred to Elizabeth instead. Really glad we ended up here, as the food was very imaginative and delicious. Also, for this level of quality and presentation, we found the pricing to be rather...More

title: Seasonal excellence
review: Elizabeth presents a multi-course dining experience, with all the foods being very seasonal.   The dishes are tailored to the season, and are presented in interesting molecular gastronomy manners.   The centerpiece usually contains something edible, as well presentations may involve a terrarium.   There are wine pairings...More

title: Outstanding value
review: Having recently eaten at Alinea, I can truthfully say that Elizabeth is just about on a par with that "best restaurant in North America" and much more affordable.  What I especially liked was the option of the half-flight of wine.  It was the perfect amount...More

title: An overall good experience worth a try
review: Elizabeth is worth a try for anyone who enjoys incredibly creative food, combinations and presentations. The dining room is fun and low-key and despite the price point, not stuffy at all. A few minor misses on service, including being asked if we wanted anything to...More

title: The food combinations were too over the top
review: The reservation format should have tipped us off (you must pre-purchase a transferable "ticket" ) to the fact that this place is DIFFERENT! The 18 course meal was presented in the most beautiful artistic effect I have ever seen. Changing the silver and usual serving...More

title: Terroir terriers
review: Started well with the intense carrot mouth bombs and a nice champagne (Serge Faust), nice touch with the roe, followed by a great flavour of mushroom tea. A wonderful Tyler winery Cabernet franc accompanied some earthy flavoured celeriac soup and fried woodland mushroom.  The whole...More

title: Simply divine and inspiring
review: We could go into detail of all the amazing, delicious and creative dishes, but our title really speaks to what comes to our mind as we progressed through Chef Regan's tasting menu.  She orbits at the level of an elite class of talented chefs, innately...More

title: Gathering a Feast
review: For a visit to Chicago, I initially tried to get tickets for Alinea, but was unsuccessful. Searching for alternatives I learned about the Elizabeth Restaurant, and I'm glad I did.  The front of the restaurant is so nondescript it's easy to miss. It sits next...More

title: after much expectation a disappointing evening. 3.5 stars
review: i was really looking forward to trying elizabeth and the diamond menu i had purchased 6 weeks in advance (you are charged for food and a 20% service charge in order to secure a table). we were sat at 7pm and were told to expect...More

title: A unique, sensuous & engrossing meal
review: I'm Australian. I came to Chicago for a brief four day / three night 'restaurant tour' following a conference that had brought me to the USA and sunny Florida. A Chicago based colleague arranged a wonderful eating itinerary showcasing the breadth of restaurants & styles....More

title: This girl is a genius
review: We don't consider ourselves "foodies" but we like to try things and Elizabeth was the ultimate experience. Storefront in a non-descript neighbourhood and then you enter a cozy space where you spend the next 4 hours in culinary bliss. We had the deer menu -...More

title: Lovely, Unique Dining Experience; A True Gem
review: Tonight I had the privilege of attending Friends & Family night for Iliana Regan's Elizabeth Restaurant (due to having won a contest). Elizabeth will be opening to the public this Wednesday. Iliana had been serving mind blowing, extravagant multi-course dinners out of her apartment as...More

title: Wonderful experience
review: I would consider myself a "mild" foodie.  I don't love experiences that are so uptight you feel uncomfortable.  I also like most foods, but not all.  Elizabeth is fit for the biggest foodie right down to the "mild" foodie.  With a small space (I believe...More

title: Nice place to visit... though a little loud
review: I needed to find a place to get some dinner prior to a concert at the Old Town School Of Folk Music, and finding Daily Bar & Grill just a few doors down from my destination made it an obvious choice for me.  Fortunately, the...choice turned out to be a very good one. The service was fast and friendly, the menu choices plentiful, and the food was served hot and fresh. I opted for the chicken tenders, and when I tried to order cheese fries, the waitress told me they came with fries, thus saving me a little money. (I paid extra for the cheese, and I'm glad I did, even if the fries were a little on the crispy side - a bit overdone, but still very much edible.) She even apologized that the plate didn't come with a second BBQ sauce I had requested, but I told her not to bother getting it, because the amount served was more than adequate.  The only real negative was that it tends to get quite loud indoors - but seeing I was going to a concert, I don't think I have the right to complain about noise. And, it soon died down to a more manageable level.  I rarely get to this area, but I'm glad I discovered this particular business, and am looking forward to a return visit very soon.More

title: Disappointing!
review: I have eaten here before when in town and had a good meal. We chose to eat there today so that we could sit outside and enjoy the patio. Our waitress had ZERO personality. The food was so mediocre!  The chicken wrap was just OK....The Mac & Cheese was truly an abomination!  How do you screw it up so badly!!??  Kraft Easy Mac would have been a welcome substitute. The patio was great but the rest of the experience was disappointing.More

title: Best at what it does
review: And what it does is provide simple but delicious bar food in a neighborhood bar atmosphere and it serves you good drinks for  a reasonable price. Really good selection of draught beers. Great martini in a proper martini glass. Very friendly. Excellent chicken pot pie....I cannot fault this place. Has a big outdoor patio in summerMore

title: Great spot
review: I stopped between 2 customers to meet a friend for lunch. We had a great time. Music, food, beers, atmosphere, it’s all there! And a very good service on top of that!

title: GREAT FOOD, Great music and great company
review: My husband and I live in Lincoln Square and go here often. Sometimes for just a quick drink or an appetizer or dinner. We have never been disappointed. The wait and bar staff are attentive and friendly. Food comes out quick and hot. And it's...good food. Simple but good. I would highly recommend a visit! Oh, and I love the music they play over the speakers! A great station, whatever it is!More

title: Good outdoor place to eat
review: My Aunt from California was visiting our family. We decided to take my Aunt to visit my daughter's apartments. After visiting the apartments, we decided to eat at the Daily Grill. What was nice about this restaurant you can eat outside and eat. It is...nice if the weather cooperates. Had a good time there.More

title: Excellent service, good food
review: We finally came here to eat after admiring the outside of the building for awhile and we were not disappointed with our choice. It was a slow Sunday with a few tables occupied. Several outdoor patio tables were occupied, but while we were tempted by...the attractive patio, we wanted to escape the heat. We were greeted immediately by a waiter who turned out to be our waiter. Being former journalists, we enjoyed the news theme and especially admired the deco bar. We studied the bar list and settled on a refreshing cider and a local beer before ordering the grilled cheese and the turkey rueben. The food was very good, and both sandwiches were served with fresh cut fries. I especially appreciated the gooey quality of the grilled cheese and hubby reported the hefty rueben was delicious. He ended up bringing half his sandwich home. Throughout our meal, the waiter was friendly and attentive. He treated all of the customers with the same upbeat attitude. We will definitely eat here again.More

title: Outdoor lunch
review: The three of us had a wonderful lunch with wine and a couple of beers.  We shared a chicken wrap that was great except was a little to spicy for me so I ate most of the roasted turkey sandwich.  Both were very enjoyable and...tasty, came with fries.  We had a couple $5 beers, IPA’s and one had a sparkling wine$7.50.   Our waitress was super nice, friendly and attentive.  It was a beautiful day to have a lunch with the locals and a few dogs.  We headed inside to finish watching the World Cup.  Very friendly place with good food.More

title: Great outdoor patio
review: My favorite thing about this place is the outdoor patio. Nothing better than sipping a beer outside. The drinks are always solid, the food is just standard bar food. As long as that's all your expect out of it, you won't be disappointed!

title: Great burger
review: The Sunday edition burger was awesome! Great food, great service. Not a large crowd on a Monday evening. Had a great window seat.

title: A Rainy night of playoffs!
review: Well, it was an odd Friday night, and a heavy rain came through as if we hadn't just moved from Tampa. Four inches, the Airport claimed the next day. Being used to the rain, we walked to the Chicago Brauhaus only to find it completely...More

title: Great Pub & Grub!
review: 4 of us stopped in for lunch - one is only 1 yr old! He didn't get carded 😉 and we had a great time. Great wine and beer selections and huge portions. We shared a steak salad, a grilled Susan's salad, a walnut salad,...More

title: Easy going place.
review: We liked that they have open seating. Why bother dealing with a host/hostess? The service was friendly and efficient. Overall a nice experience.

title: Great Food
review: Stopped here after running around the city for a little while.  It has a unique place on a triangle-snapped corner, and a gal in the nearby "sweet shop" told us that they had a good menu for kids and adults alike.  The Cobb salad was...More

title: Really Good Pub Food
review: Good spot for lunch or dinner before or after a class or event at the Old Town School. For my money, best burger on the block. Good list of wine and beer. Friendly service. Can be noisy if there's a hot game on the TV.

title: Great local destination!
review: Just a wonderful place to have a drink or meal, in a wonderful part of Chicago.  Grab you a booth in the outside corner and enjoy the views. We make a point of going there every time we visit.

title: Good for adults
review: Not the most kid friendly, but the food was good.  The apple cider vinegar salad with walnuts and chicken was quite good for a lighter choice.  Macaroni and cheese was really good.  Tater tots and sloppy joe could have been better, not much flavor to...More

title: Nice atmosphere
review: Beautiful wood paneling, clean and comfortable. Service was good, but the chicken fingers was just average.

title: Friendly staff, comfortable atmosphere, tasty food, great beer list
review: The Daily is a perfect neighborhood restaurant. The menu has something for everyone - tasty burgers, large fresh salads, cold weather comfort food - and it's all prepared well with generous portions.  The tap beer list is good and there are additional bottles worth trying...More

title: Nice lunch
review: We went here to get lunch. It was a nice location. It's probably great to watch sports here in the evenings, but we didn't try that. The burger I ordered was good and tasty. Sadly, the Coke I got was closer to water than Coke....More

title: A good lunch
review: I ate here for lunch one day. The atmospher was good and barly. I ate the Fish-n-chips. It was tasty and good. Ordered Coca Cola, but its was really outwatered.

title: Nice friendly bqr
review: Went here for a quiet lunch and beer. Wings were good and the Caesar salad was a Caesar salad. Friendly service. All round good value.

title: Vacation location
review: When we come to Chicago, we always have to stop by Dailys for lunch.  Their burgers and fries are delicious. We always get the Sunday burger and cheese dip for the fries. The service is always good, as well

title: Good pub food
review: A good selection of icy cold beers on tap. Pub food that is fresh and tasty. I enjoyed a beef burger with cheese. It arrived with a  perfectly cooked juicy pattie. Service was friendly and attentive. Good food for the price.

title: Always Good
review: We eat here often when going to the Old Town School of Folk Music for a show (just a few steps away) and the food is always very good.  The burgers are excellent, as is the fish and chips, the turkey wrap, the chili mac,...More

title: Great burgers
review: Whenever visiting Chicago, we have to go to Dailey's for their delicious burgers and fries, especially the fries with cheese.  Other menu items look good, but we always stick to the burgers.

title: Unusual experience
review: Good but unconventional jambalaya, solid hummus dish, and good chili Mac, on a cold, rainy Chicago evening. The only real downside to this average Chicago bar's ambience is a talking urinal device that are stream activated. They loudly blurt out information about a History Channel...More

title: Your neighborhood bar
review: This is our go to place.  When you want decent and consistent food and reasonable prices.  Our fav dish is the turkey Reuben with fries.  They're happy to cut it in two and it's plenty for both of us.  Service is good.  Wide beer selection....More

title: Excellent, reliable, fun
review: We have eaten at the Daily several times, most recently for lunch on May 15. The menu is American pub food. They have some very nice salad choices if you want an alternative to burger style eating. As always, service is fast, friendly, and very...More

title: Better than average bar food
review: They have a nice, casual, outdoor seating area tucked far enough away from the street that you don't have to experience Lincoln Ave traffic while eating. I've always ordered salads, usually the Santa Fe or Asian Chicken, which are fresh and tasty. Fries are delish....More

title: Decent bar food & nice outdoor patio
review: Nice local place. Good daily specials on food & drink. I especially like the Tues dinner salad special. It's also a great place for outdoor dining or just hanging out.

title: Best portobello sandwich around!!
review: I would go 4 1/2 stars. Very good food overall, great beer selection, good and friendly staff, especially the bartenders. Only 2 tv's, which can be a problem if you want to catch a game other than Bears, Sox, etc. but this is Chicago!

title: Fun neighborhood haunt with good food.
review: We went here on a Saturday night, and it was a 30 minute wait for a table.  Known for their Reuben sandwich, burgers, and fries, they also have good comfort food, i.e. chicken pot pie, meatball sandwiches, etc.  Good draught beer menu.

title: Good drinks, decent food
review: Good drinks, decent food, and in our neighborhood.  Service is usually good too, and they have a nice outdoor patio during the summer.

title: Nice and reliable. Some...
review: Nice and reliable. Some of the food is great, some isn't.

title: Good bar food.  Great patio for the summer.
review: Good bar food.  Great patio for the summer.

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Nice taproom serving great beer!
review: I stopped by here while passing through Chicago. I had one of their beers in the past and wanted to check out what else they brewed. This is a pretty cool taproom, they seem to have 2 fairly close together but this is the one...i found on my visit. I got a flight of 4($12) and had 2 that were fantastic. Craft beer comes at a bit of a premium here with some of it being worth every penny.More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: A bench A beer and a wheel chair
review: A warm fall nite outside. My best friend who is in a wheelchair seeks a place where he can enjoy the breeze and refresh with family at the end of a wooden bench. Cheerful waitress found us a perfect space and suggested a perfect brew...that satisfied our thirst. What a joy.More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: BEER!!!! YAY!!!
review: The beer is amazing!! I love the Bodem!!! The food is really tasty too!! This is my wife’s favorite brewery in Chicago! It is a great atmosphere in here too! The tour is super fun!!! If you love beer; you gotta go to Half Acre!!...It is a Chicago beer classic!! Who doesn’t love drinking a Daisy Cutter???!!!! C’Mon!!! Soo Good!!!More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Casual tap room with good food & great beer
review: Enjoyed some Half Acre standby's as well as new offerings...love this brewery. Fun place to hang out with friends.

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: crazy fun
review: I thought I already reviewed this place.  Forgive me if this is a repeat, plox. So, this brewery has some of the best beer in Chicago, without question. I don't know who the owners are, but everyone that works here makes me feel like a...long lost cousin.  It's also really pretty inside, in a minimalist way. I would live here if I could.More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Great beer and atmosphere
review: We come here on a regular basis for great beer and good food. It's even more fun in the summer when you can sit outside.

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Good Beer - cosy atmosphere
review: Stopped in to try their beers, and my husband tried a flight. He enjoyed it.  I was disappointed that they offer absolutely no wine.  Tried a bottled root beer soda pop - it was OK.  Seating was a bit tight - and the outdoor area...wasn't open due to the weather.  Nice to see that it was very family friendly.More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Good Beers
review: Always plenty of good beers to choose from at Half Acre.  Kitchen on premises looks like a lot of the food is made from scratch.  Free parking and an outdoor beer garden make this a great stop in the Summer.  Also Spiteful Brewing is on...the opposite corner of the same block.More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Great beer selection. Good Food. Great vibe. Free Parking!
review: Great taproom.  Most importantly, they offered a wide beer selection.   I generally do not like hoppy beer, and I associate Half Acre with hops. So I was pleasantly surprised to find a number of interesting options on their menu. My favorite was their barrel-aged stout...- but, doesn't that go without saying?  We also loved that they have a full kitchen, with good food.  Their space has the modern industrial vibe that one expects from a taproom, but they also offer outdoor seating for the warmer months and a seating area inside the brewery - which looks like a lot of fun.  Bonus - they have a parking lot!More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Great beer, food and service
review: Visited a friend of mine who works in the kitchen here. We were smart to arrive early, around 1pm, as the place quickly filled up that Saturday. We got a table, enjoyed a flight of beers that was accompanied by a receipt that clearly noted...the order of the beers, and ordered several starters to share, including the anchovies toast (get 'em! so good!). All the bread at Half Acre is made in house and is very delicious. Even when the place was full, our server was super attentive and friendly. For our main course, we got porchetta noodles, which were super yummy. One of the owners is from Italy - needless to say, Half Acre knows what they're doing with the porchetta.More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Very Cool Vibe!
review: Great move by Half Acre to open this super cool taproom!! Lincoln is nostalgic but hated the cold stone seating which was uncomfortable , cramped, and vanilla. The new place has a totally different vibe and a very nice place to sit and taste some...More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Oh So Nice!
review: A "quiet" place on the far north side in an unassuming building with a back entry, this place has the beer and the good short menu to please you and your friends or group on a lofty afternoon or evening.  Half Acre pumps out a...More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Nice Brew Pub!
review: A new brew pub!!  Upon entering the courtyard of this very unassuming converted building you'll see a nice sized parking lot (free) and plenty of outdoor picnic-bench style seating.  As soon as you enter the building itself you are hit with the strong smell of...More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Sunday afternoon fun!
review: Outstanding beer, great food, friendly atmosphere, attentive and helpful waitstaff. We tried a variety of beers - each had an amazing depth of flavor that we rarely find.  Definitely try the white anchovy crostini! They make their own bread, and all the wood is hand...More

restaurant_name: Half Acre Beer Co Balmoral Tap Room & Garden
title: Only had the liquids this time!
review: Clean, bright space with lots of friendly helpers around - looks like they all enjoy their jobs and co-workers. I was first in this day, and they had about 14 beers on tap, of all types. I had a flight consisting of Tuna Pale Ale...More

title: Quiet place to have a unique breakfast sandwich.....
review: Order at the register and find a place to sit at this small spot off of Geraldine's.  It was a perfect place to have a cup of coffee and a delicious breakfast sandwich. I'd come back again.

title: Best Sandwich Ever
review: Jumped in for some average lunch food and had my socks knocked off. Ordered the Dagwood B sandwich to split, and was glad we did. Definitely feeds 2 with the 2 sides that come with the meal. Mouthwatering and an explosion of flavor... anywhere from...the onion, avocado, shrimp, root beer ham, brisket, mango-chipotle chutney, and pickle! This was a true delight—and something I will crave again until I am back in the area. Sweet potatoes and beans were equally amazing. Attentive staff and friendly atmosphere.More

title: Great selection of sandwiches
review: Varied choices with soups and salads as an option. And beer of course. Is larger on the inside than it looks from the front.

title: Solid
review: Casual bar fair.  Good higher end burgers and a kids menu of good food (versus some low end shlock).  decent selection of beers.   I would recommend if you’re in the area, but wouldn’t go out of my way to go back.More

title: Nutball
review: This was the best grilled cheese I’ve eaten. The cashew butter was an addition I’ve never thought of, but it made it delicious.

title: Mediocre
review: Average service and mediocre sandwiches. Would not come back which is a shame as it could have potential.

title: Just OK
review: Stopped by Jerry’s for beers and small plates with friends on our recent trip to the Windy City and found it to be very average.  Of the 6 beers we tried, only one stood out.  The appetizers were mediocre as well...nobody finished the soft pretzels....Service was a little slow.  The couple next to us left before being served.  We did enjoy the outdoor seating; a wonderful place to people watch.  While I wouldn’t go out of my way to stop here in the future; I wouldn’t really avoid it either.  Maybe we hit an off night?  Might give it another try?More

title: Nice spot great service
review: Stopped for lunch dined outside beautiful park like setting server was good and attentive food was great. Had a grilled corned beef it was awesome very good ice tea also

title: I want to try this place
review: My daughter recommended Jerry's in LSQ and so I decided to try it. I was very pleased. Drink menu is extensive and beer selection had a nice variety as well. Menu was a variety of sandwiches all of which intrigued me. I chose the Pepe...L which was a pot  roast,  mozzarella  combo and it was excellent. There are a number of sides of which you get two so my choices were greens with vinegarett and potatoes salad. Both were delicious and although the portions appear small turns out they were just enough to accompany the large sandwiches that are served. Everyone else in our party also loved their meals and by the way three out of five had to use take home boxes because they couldn't eat everything. Fun place, good food, good drinks and nice classic rock playing as well.More

title: Not a Great First-Time Experience
review: I had driven past Jerry's in Lincoln Square a few times, and my wife and I decided to give it a try last night as it is in a great location (next to Cafe Selmarie and across from the old Chicago Brauhaus).  It was 14...degrees outside last night, and we were hoping to enjoy some comfort food on a cold Saturday evening.  The first challenge was getting inside the restaurant, as the door on the south entrance was locked.  We entered through the west door and stood in the front of the restaurant for a few minutes before being seated.  While there was only one or two tables filled at Jerry's, the host did not ask us where we would like to sit but rather put us next to a large table with a couple of young children.  We chose another table across the room, and five minutes later another group was seated right next to us even though there were many other open tables.  I had to borrow a napkin from the adjacent table, as our table had not been properly wiped down.    The waiter (who was also the host and bartender) brought us two menus and two small glasses of water, and quitely walked away.  The water was quickly finished, and only refilled upon request after a bit of a delay.  We came across the daily specials menu at our table, but none were highlighted or shared when we ordered our meals.  I ordered the half-sandwich and soup combo, and was told that the sandwich I ordered could not be included in the combo.  I ended up having a skirt steak sandwich and gumbo with a side of sweet potatoes.  I have to say that the overall quality of the food was not an issue, as the sandwich was delicious with excellent and unique toppings, the gumbo was tasty with just the right amount of spice, and the sweet potatoes were very well done.  The challenge with the half sandwich was the rather small size, and the side serving was gone in a few bites.  Unfortunately, the gumbo was warm at best, which was disappointing on a cold Chicago night. For a $15 sandwich meal (plus tax and tip), I had higher expectations.  My wife ordered a breaded BBQ chicken sandwich with a side salad and a side of sweet potatoes ($14.50).  She enjoyed her meal, as the sandwich was delicious and the side salad with vinagrette dressing was quite tasty.  In fact, she could not finish her meal and brought the rest home.  The waiter brought the check in a timely fashion, but did not ask if we would like dessert.  In fairness, there was alot to like about Jerry's in terms of interesting decor, ample beer and sandwich selections, numerous flat screen televisions, and of course the centralized location in Lincoln Square.  However, it was tough to get past the poor service, small portion sizes, and relatively high prices for sandwiches at Jerry's.More

title: Good beer and hamburgers
review: I was visiting Lincoln Square when I found this place. The service was really good, the waiter was very attentive. I ordered a very small beer but that was my mistake (I don't understand ounces measure), but the beer was good.More

title: Great Corner Spot in the ❤️ Of Lincoln Square
review: I always went to Jerry's in Andersonville and always had a great sandwich or meal. I have know been going to Jerry's in LSQ. It's got a nice outdoor space in summer and is right on top of the middle meeting spot. Food, drinks and...More

title: Late lunch on a Sunday
review: Crowded, but we didn't have to wait for a table. They had gluten free bread for my sandwich. Good food.

title: Late lunch
review: Stumbled across this restaurant while shopping. What a great find. Outside seating was great. Service was quick. Broad selection of beers including my new favorite Lost Abbey's Judgement Day. I had the meatloaf sandwich and my wife a Korean BBQ chicken sandwich both of which...More

title: Great indoors or out!
review: Outdoor seating is first come first seated and it is lovely opening on to Lincoln Square. Inside is nice also with large open windows. The menu is creative and interesting with lots of choices. The craft beer list is extensive.

title: Perfect Patio and Offering
review: I really enjoyed my visit to Jerry's for three reasons. 1) dining on the patio while tucked away in the courtyard rather than on a sidewalk was a very pleasant experience that allowed for uninterrupted conversation. 2) awesome fun and engaging staff that know the...More

title: Good and fast
review: Great sandwiches that are made and served very quickly.  Staff were very friendly too! Really good for a quick boost of energy during a long day's sightseeing!

title: What kind of sandwich you want
review: 1st time here me and my wife were blown away by there amazing menu every sandwich has a name for it and is unique in the way its topped with sauce or ingredients the staff was amazing and so was our server a must try...More

title: Always different
review: It seems that the motto at Jerry's Sandwiches is each of their restaurants has their own peculiarities and on each day, you will find different sandwiches on the menu.  Not only that, but you can also make adjustments to your sandwiches, so you would have...More

title: Something for everyone
review: Sandwiches made any way, with any meat, vegetable or bread. I ordered the eggplant sandwich. It was very good with a selection of vegetables on it. A family member ordered one of the salads with steak. It was huge, fresh and had several different vegetables....More

title: Mostly really eclectic sandwiches
review: We had never been to Jerry's on Lincoln Ave., but our friends that we were meeting there recommended it, so why not try.  Jerry's is located in the middle of the Lincoln Ave. strip between Lawrence Ave. & Leland Ave.  It is on the east...More

title: Sandwiches and a bar
review: The title of my review kind of says it all.  On a slow Monday afternoon the lunch service was inattentive.  There is a much better place across the street but it is closed on Mondays.More

title: A Lazy Afternoon on Labor Day Weekend
review: The weather was perfect and we were looking for a outdoor setting for lunch. There outdoor seating area is part of an open court yard which had a lot of families and a lone guitar player-perfect for a lazy afternoon. It was around 2, so...More

title: Horribly rude hostess, but the rest was great.
review: Had it not been for our server, Jason, and the sandwiches, I would have left 1 star and I would have just left the establishment! I wouldn't have even had a sandwich but for the nice server. The hostess or owner, a gray/white haired lady,...More

title: Sandwiches Galore!
review: My husband and I visited this restaurant for a Saturday lunch.  The outside is nondescript with no indication of the type of food.  Upon being seated, we discovered that they have a huge variety of sandwiches - burgers, sausage, seafood, veggie, pork... you name it....More

title: Be nice or leave - the sandwich place
review: Be nice or leave - That's the sign u will. Definitely see if u are waiting for your turn to be seated and I am positive if u are visiting this joint during weekend u won't miss it because waiting is about an hour. Not...More

title: The Gyro was really good
review: I was visiting my daughter at school and wanted to get a sandwich quickly so I ordered a Gyro sandwich from here.  It was delivered via Doordash 20 minutes after ordered.  The sandwich was very good and it was still hot when I received it....They had a generous amount of lamb on this sandwich and it was big.     I don’t have any complaints about my order.  I also ordered a Caesar salad as well so the delivery was free.More

title: come because of burgers.............
review: typically i visited Hubs in past for their burgers and fries which are decent sized. this visit,  i shared the burgers, fries and gyros.  burger still good. gyros, i've had better. overall still will come back for burgers.

title: excellent spread  provided for our nurses
review: What an incredible meal was provided by the HUB.   chicken was great,  the gyro s were superb.    comments regarding the sauce for gyros  was so positive on line, and they were right.     i will also  recommend the greek salad as there was no skimping on...all the vegetables.  Learned of this restaurant as one of our physician gifted us for lunch.   i will definitely recommend to others,  and get there when i go to the cityMore

title: Best gyros
review: One of the best restaurants for gyros. Nice and clean restaurant with good food,shakes and desserts.Highly recommended!!!

title: Chicago style fast food!
review: Very tasty bites, cooked fairly very fast. The choices are endless as some of us had gyros on top of a greek salad and I had full slab of ribs which was a huge entree, you definitely need to share. Garlic bread that comes with...the entrees is awesome. This place reminds me old Chicago diners. Enjoy the food!More

title: Chicago hotdog
review: Good Chicago hotdog!. Fries are real potatoes.😁 It's actually better and cheaper than Superdawg.People were nice and the restaurant is clean.

title: Good food at reasonable price.
review: Had Gyro sandwich which was very good and substantial.  Son had Gyro plate which was pretty huge.   Also had Italian beef sandwich which was OK for flavor and huge.  I prefer the beef to be sliced a little thinner and wetter. Still good.

title: MY # 1 LUNCH SPOT
review: My go to for lunch 3 or 4 times weekly. Love you hub's Lincoln Automotive team.The cooks and the girls up front are so thoughtful.When did I visit last 3 hours ago for lunch.

title: Great gyro the portions are very large!
review: Our friend let us know that you get a lot of food here. I should have believed her. I got a gyro platter and it was LARGE. It was like $9.50 and I ate two gyros(you assemble them yourself in the platter) and I still...had to take home enough meat to make another at her place! Daughter had chicken kabob and husband had pea soup and and a sausage. You do order at the counter and then they call your number to go get. I really liked it!!More

title: Cucumber sauce is better than "da juice"
review: I went here with a group.  Those with gyros raved about them.  One person tried the meat (she had never had one before) and liked it.  I had falafel, which was ok.  It had a very strong flavor, and I did not like-a da juice....I did like-a the cucumber sauce, which the friendly staff gave me more of.  It's a very clean, quiet, spacious restaurant.  It is reasonably priced, I would go there again.More

title: Pretty good gyros
review: Went here for a quick dinner. Had gyros salad and pork kebabs.  Everything was fine, kind of a fast food kind of place but good if you want a quick dinner.

title: hubs restaurant on  [ lincoln]
review: i have eaten here a few times and the food was good there were a lot of people dinning in i was lucky to get a  seat i just waned a light lunch so I got a b.l.t that was about the cheapest

title: Delicious Family Food
review: I have been going to Hub's over 20 years and never had a bad meal. I don't stick to just one item on the menu. I have had burgers, hot dogs, gyro dinners and many others. The service is great and the food is outstanding....More

title: Thought it might be better than average
review: From the outside, I thought it would be better than what it turned out to be.  A relatively nice restaurant which was clean and roomy, you go to the counter and order your food.  We tried some lemon rice chicken soup which had about the...More

title: Run of the mill
review: Very typical gyros place. Nothing special, consistently average. A little on the pricey side for the quality. It is convienent however I would not go out of my way to dine here.

title: Dependable
review: Good place for a gyros.  Been coming here for years, but not that often.  Each time the gyros hits the spot.  Good sauce and paired with fries.  You get your food fast.  Tables are clean and the service friendly.  Definitely worth it when you're in...More

title: Poor service
review: Hubs built a name as a neighborhood staple. Now the service is slow and the counter girls outright rude and lazy is my perception. Food is average for the prices I suppose. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here and often only...More

title: was great now good
review: hubs use to have the best food when it came to quality but for the past few month it seems like the quality has changed that im not so impressed with anymore and also the portion size has gotten smaller

title: Plentiful tasty food
review: This place is unpretentious, but offer very large plates and quite tasty. It is a type of Greek fast food that is conveniently located, decently priced and opened late at night. Good option for a quick bite. You can't go wrong.

title: Stunning Gyros
review: It's unusual to write a review on a single sandwich at a fast food restaurant, but in this case it's necessary.  Hub's restaurant, a Greek fast food place on Lincoln Avenue in Chicago, has the knock down- drag out best gyro sandwich in the world....More

title: decent Chicago fast food
review: decent gyros (featured on saturday night live a buncha years ago), decent burgers, and decent chicken. nothing outstanding but the prices are good and the portions are huge. certainly worth a visit if you're in the area.

title: Worth a visit---authentic & delicious
review: I ate here when I visited Chicago a couple of weeks ago.  My mother (who lives in town) had been here before.  It is BYOB, and we brought 4 cans of hard cider to have with dinner.  We ate outside on the patio, and the...service was ok.  They seemed slightly understaffed, so we waited awhile for the food.  My mom and I are big fans of small plates, and we were not disappointed.  The food was delicious--we shared the Bruschette Miste (bruschetta) and a pizza with cheese and eggplant for an appetizer.  My son had the La Cheese pizza for his entrée and I had La Parmigiana di Melanzane (eggplant parm appetizer).  We were pleasantly full and did not order dessert.  I would definitely come back here again on our next trip to Chicago.  It's a small place, and not in the downtown area, but its worth the trip.  Parking is on the street--we had no trouble finding a spot in the evening.More

title: BYOB Italian Heaven!
review: This little corner spot was introduced to us by a friend who lives not far from there. If you like cheese and pesto on superb pasta, try their lasagna Casale.  It was delicious!  The Suppli appetizer was also quite tasty.  I wanted to try the...roasted cauliflower appetizer but it was already sold out.  I wish we had a spot like this on the South side!  How great to have an excellent table service BYOB restaurant nearby. (No wine list. )    And friendly attentive service, too!More

title: Want real Italian?
review: In a diverse,quiet neighborhood ? This small but adequate diner has pasta, pizza, friendly people and good fish.. 2 blocks from my home.. it's a nice stop off for people returning from work or just out for a friendly and reasonable  sit down place

title: Enjoyed this neighborhood Italian restaurant
review: We chose Italian for dinner and came across I Monelli.  It is located on the southeast corner of Winnemac Ave. & Western Ave.  There is street parking available, though you are close enough to Lincoln Square that you might want to obey the parking signs...as the meter people do come around.  We were seated immediately.  Our server, Yahaira, was very nice and very attentive.  We ordered the seafood risotti di mare, which was Scoti arborio rice in tomato sauce sauteed with shrimp, calamari, broccoli, garlic, butter and finished with a touch of white wine cream sauce.  We also ordered the classic lasagna with meat.  Both entrees tasted very good and there were ample portions, so we left some room for dessert and took about 1/2 of the entrees home.  For dessert, there was a special cheesecake al pistacchio which was a delicate pistacchio mousse on a cookie crumb base.  It was light and delicious.  The prices were reasonable, the service was very nice and the food was very good.  What more can you ask for?More

title: Nice dinner with family
review: This is a small cosy neighborhood restaurant. The antipasto tray was excellent and enjoyed by all from age 4 to 71.  We also shared a family size salad with delicious Italian dressing.  The  meat sauce on their pasta is very tasty.  I enjoyed a sausage...lasagne, but it could have been more moist. All in all it was a fun family evening. They do not serve wine, but you can bring it in and if you forget there's a liquor store nearby,More

title: Food
review: Delicious homemade pizza! It was the same fresh tastse and magical feeling as when I was actually in Italy.  TY!

title: Good, so 3.5 stars, but That's not Possible Here
review: Good restaurant, very family friendly. My husband had the gnocchi and really liked it, a friend had the lasagna and said it was good, other friend had the tagliatelle bolognese, which he really liked. I had the Mediterranean Tilapia, which was good - capers, tomatoes,...zucchini, with carrots and asparagus on the side. Lots of carry out orders were picked up while we were there, so obviously a popular place for the locals. Service was slow, but friendly...servers were a little confused at times (two different people asked about the check after we had already paid).More

title: Delicious Italian Food and Pizza!
review: Charming and cozy restaurant in Lincoln Square.  We started with the pizza, which is rectangular and you can order a whole, half or quarter.  It was very light and crispy for a pan pizza and could have easily eaten more.  The lasagna had home made...noodles and was perfectly prepared.  For dessert I had a cannoli which was the best cannoli I have had for a very long time.  Our waitress was great and very helpful.  Reasonably priced and a BYOB.  I will be back!!!More

title: Delicious
review: My favorite is the I Monelli pizza-a rectangular pizza with little piquant bits of sausage, pepperoni, onion, & green pepper. We always start with one of the special of the day appetizers or salads. We have many favorites-most recently we had fagioli and pancetta-delicious!

title: Great food
review: Ever since moving to Chicago, this has been an easy place to go to and consistent on the great food. I don't have any complaints whether I order online, call in or dine in. It's always been a wonderful experience!

title: Motto bene (Very good)
review: We have been going to I Monelli for years, probably once a month, and we have never had a bad experience. It is truly a hidden gem and a neighborhood treasure. We like it because it's easy to get to from the north suburbs and...it has a decidedly unpretentious air about it. Cozy and comfortable, it makes everyone feel welcome. The staff is terrific and Chef Vittorio is jolly and friendly. Food is Roman style, I guess. The pizzas are terrific and amply sized, with medium crust. Recently they have offered a thin crust circular pizza that is perfect. Most of the pasta is house made. I recommend the tagliatelle bolognese; it's absolutely delicious. But even the basic spaghetti and meatballs is an excellent dish. I Monelli doesn't have a liquor license, so it's BYOB, making the place even more affordable. (There is a liquor store across the street, however.) Can't say enough about this place. It's down to earth, friendly, and serves great Italian comfort food. Carry out is also quick and efficient. The place can get filled up on Friday and Saturday nights, but if you like to dine before 7:00, you can usually get a table. It's always good to make a reservation, just in case. Week nights are often free and clear. Go by yourself, with a significant other, or group of friends. You won't be disappointed.More

title: IT S GOOD
review: great pizza pasta and ,more  but be care full  on what time and day you go cause  you could be  waiting a while for there great food

title: I Used To Like This Place, But Not any longer
review: I have eaten here a few times and always thought it was a good neighborhood spot.   I had dinner there tonight and, as a result of my experience, would not recommend it.   It took almost an hour to get our meals (nothing complicated - chicken/pasta...dishes)  and one of my dining companions complained that her chicken was tough and the vegetables were cold.   The dish was taken back, but she was not satisfied with the warmed up attempt with the dish.  As a result, she did not eat.   The most troubling thing was that the waitstaff/management did not seem to care.   They offered to take 10% of the bill to which I told them that was not acceptable and that the one dish should be removed from the bill.   They removed it from the bill and offered to get something else, but we did not want to risk it taking another hour to get a meal.   Furthermore, it looked as though nobody else was getting food.   My dish was okay, but there was no excuse for this as the restaurant was not filled.    I cannot recommend this restaurant and was embarassed by this place as I recommended it and this was the first time my companions ate there.More

title: Delicious, friendly, consistent AND BYOB!
review: We found I Monelli when we were searching for a place to meet city-living friends halfway from the near northern suburbs, Smallish, cozy friendly family atmosphere,  Smiling, attentive servers who genuinely aim to please.  Thin crust pizza is excellent alone or as an appetizer.  Pretty...standard Italian menu.  All dishes nicely prepared and would rate very good to excellent.  My particular favorite (after 3 visits) is the gnocchi.  Not quiet, but not loud; no need to shout across the table to have a conversation. Would serve for a low-key romantic dinner. Each of the times we've been there, the other couples were also pleased and have since gone back.  I'm really impressed with the consistency - each of our 3 visits were without any disappointments.  AND, it's BYOB so you can drink what you like.  Just goes to show that there are places to eat that aren't hyped much but do a really nice job year after year.More

title: Great Italian BYOB in Lincoln Square
review: Been here many times (almost weekly). This is a really enjoyable family operated place with daily specials that are always fresh and creative. Vittorio, the owner /Chef, takes great pride in all of his offerings. My wife and daughter love his Carbonara. I love his...Chicken Saltimbaca (not always on the specials list, but well worth a try when he has it.)  Even his Pizza is incredible, especially if you like a thin, crunchy crust. We haven't found this kind of crust anywhere else. The whole place is run by family. (Mom,Dad, Sister, brother, nephews and a great serving staff. Absolutely worth a visit !More

title: small, cute place and great pizza
review: I Monelli is a small place but nicely done and clean. It has a family owned look and feel to it. The pizza is very good -I had the Margarita and shared a Vegetariani (sp?) with my sister. Both tasted great. The service is very...More

title: Great small Family Operated Italian joint
review: We first visited I Monelli about (2) months ago after they appeared on "Check Please". The place is quite small and probably seats about (30). Our first experience here was wonderful. We had an antipasto appetizer and the bruchetta. I ordered the spagetti carbonara (best...More

title: Good Pizza, Less than average food
review: We've been here a number of times because we tend to go to BYOB restaurants.  We went recently with friends and ordered a pizza as an appetizer which was excellent.  Two of us ordered salmon for the entree and it wasn't very good.  My husband...More

title: Excellent pasta, pizza (sausage)!
review: We went there with a large group (18) and the service was wonderful as well, was the food.  We had a couple different pastas, pizzas (the sausage was excellent)!!!  Everyone loved it. The atmosphere is simple so don't expect a lot but the food was...More

title: Went with large group and tried almost every pasta - they were all perfect. Pizza is really good as well. Plus it is...
review: Went with large group and tried almost every pasta - they were all perfect. Pizza is really good as well. Plus it is BYOB.

title: The pizza is fantastic and it's a BYOB, which is nice.
review: The pizza is fantastic and it's a BYOB, which is nice.

title: Get take-out during lockdown
review: We usually visit Monti's a few times a year for their great Philly cheese steaks.  With the Covid lockdown we missed our early 2020 visit, so we decided to order take-out. The on-line ordering was simple to use, the order was ready for pickup at...the specified time and the food was delicious as usual.  Even though you can't eat on-premise, ordering take-out is a great alternative and helps keep Monti's in business until things get back to normal.More

title: Casual Dining
review: Local pub with good food and service. Monti's has the best Philly  Cheese Steak, outside of Philadelphia; authentic and tasty. We travel to Chicago often and go to Monti's as part of trip.

title: Chicago's Best Cheesesteak
review: The Place Monti's is located at 4757 N Talman Ave Chicago, IL   That's said it's in Lincoln square just off Lawrence.  It is a pub atmosphere with a Pennsylvania theme.  There are seats at the bar and ample tables available.  The Menu Monti's has many...menu offerings, starters, soups, salads, hoagies, grinders, desserts etc.  Their focus and specialty Is on Philly Cheesesteak and they do it very well.   Simply amazing!!! They have a good variety of options and add-ons but the Philly cheesesteak is delicious.  The Experience/Value/Service Overall we had a very positive experience at Monti's.  Good selection of beers and mixed drinks.  Our service was good the place was clean and the value very fair for the cheesesteak delivered.  You may find a cheaper cheesesteak but I'm not sure you will find a better one!!! Highly recommend you give Monti's a try.More

title: 20 minute wait for a mini cheesesteak in an empty restaurant
review: First and foremost, Montis has the best cheesesteak sandwiches around. Unfortunately,  I just received some really bad service while there. Came in to order, said I need to place an order to go. Bartender took my order. Usually it's only 5 minutes to get an...order. 15 minutes goes by in an empty restaurant. Bartender comes back to me and says what did I order?  I told her the order, she says the computer is dropping orders. Proceeds to re-enter the order. She did ask if I wanted a chili, I said I just want my order. Boy did she turn "cold" then. 20 minutes in still waiting, she brings my order on a plate. I said no, I asked for a to go order. Very unapologetic,  just sorry. Proceed to slide the bag to me, "sorry". Just walked away.  I asked to speak to a manager,  she said she is the only one here. I asked if is typical for a 22 minute wait for 1 sandwich.  "Sorry". Very cold.  Told her you just lost a customer, "sorry". Well I'm sorry I won't be back.More

title: Best Philly Cheesesteak in Chicagoland
review: Had a fantastic experience at Monti's.  They do their Cheesesteaks right.  Authentic bread brought in from Philly, meat is incredibly tasty and thinly sliced.  Wouldn't hesitate to go back again.

title: Best cheesesteak in Chicago
review: Went here for the first time 2 weeks ago and tried one of their original  cheesesteaks with cheddar and grilled onions and one with provolone and grilled onions.  Both were excellent but I think the one with the provolone was slightly more favorable.  The prices...were a bit high but the cheesesteaks were excellent.More

title: Worth visiting for a very good sandwich
review: We went here specifically for the Philadelphia Cheesesteak and were not disappointed. The cheesesteak is very much what you get in Philly, tasty meat and onions, goopy, flavorful cheddar and great bread. The fries were also good, if a bit salty. The 8 inch version...of the cheesesteak is large enough for most people, while the "mini" version is just right for a lighter eater. Service was quick and friendly.  Although the cheesesteaks were a bit pricy when compared with equivalent sized Italian Beef sandwiches, the uniqueness factor made it worth the difference.  Monti's is easy to get to via public transportation. The brown line 'L' Rockwell stop is about 1 1/2 blocks away.  Monti's is on our list of places to visit again.More

title: I'm from Philly and these cheesesteaks are awesome!
review: I highly recommend this place. My wife and I go here once a month, and love it! The variety of sandwhiches is great and the fries are yummy. They fly the bread in from philly everyday and at one time even had tastykakes! If you...are from Philly, you will know what they are!More

title: Cheesesteak sandwich direct from Philly
review: It took a couple of native Philadelphians to bring an authentic Philly cheesestreak sandwich to Chicago. The husband and wife team of chef James Gottwald and Jennifer Monti realized their dream by combining the best of Philadelphia and Chicago in their cozy restaurant/bar at 4757...North Talman Avenue in Lincoln Park. They feature Philly cheesesteaks, pizza, hoagies and a full service bar. The rolls are Amoroso from Philadelphia and the ribeye is from the Midwest. Located five blocks west of the intersection of Lincoln and Western--the location is a little tricky, on a side street off Lawrence Avenue, so Gottwald's directions are to take Washtenaw south, Leland east and Talman north--Monti's offers something for everyone with a lot of friendly atmosphere and neighborhood cheer to go around. The signature item, of course, is the Authentic Philly Cheesesteak, prepared with black angus ribeye, grilled onions and smoked provolone or aged cheddar or white American cheese and served on a Philly Amoroso roll with fries. If you have a big appetite, start with a plate of boneless Buffalo chicken nuggets or jumbo wings. A delicious alternative to the Philly cheesesteak is the Italian hoagie, which contains salami, hot capicola, black pepper ham, smoked provolone, oregano, lettuce, tomato, onion, mayo, oil and vinegar. Or the turkey hoagie with white American cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and mayo. For dessert, you might opt for a sticky bun with house-made cinnamon, a Philly favorite. But I preferred the Italian Water Ice, a tasty Italian popsicle. Wash it all down with a glass or two of lemonade. Next time I have to try the thin-crust pizza, part skim mozzarrella cheese with seasoned tomato sauce and Italian sausage. Honestly, it's hard to choose between Monti's Philly cheesesteak and Al's Italian beef sandwich. I'm glad I live in Chicago and can enjoy both.More

title: Best Philly cheesesteak in Chicago
review: I grew up on cheesesteaks while visiting family in Philadelphia. This small spot on a side street off Lawrence does a great version. It's Also a great neighborhood bar/ place to eat. One draft beer on tap that changes. V-good cocktails. My favorite bar in...the neighborhood. You can watch sports here but not as noisy as most bars. A little gem.More

title: What Went Wrong?
review: We ate lunch here several months ago, and we were very impressed. We returned for dinner recently, and we were unimpressed. There was less meat on the steak sandwich and virtually no cheese. I hope that this was just an off night, and not a...trend.More

title: Delicious, Hidden Gem! Come with an appetite!
review: My boyfriend and I came here on the recommendation of a friend and purchased a Groupon ahead of time. We were not dissapointed WHATSOEVER! This place is relatively small and tucked away but incredibly clean with a friendly atmosphere. Our waitress was very nice and...had a lot of great beer recommendations that they were trying out before they put them on the menu full time.  My SO ordered the Cheesesteak Hoagie and I got the Rocky (easy on the hot-stuff). Both sandwiches were HUGE and delicious! We also had the rainbow and lemon Italian ice (dessert included in deal) which was refreshing even though were stuffed to the gills! Highly recommend Monti's! We will definitely be returning soon!More

title: The Best PhillySteak!
review: OMG!!! I wanted a phillysteak and I google Monti's.  I live on the far southwest side and yes I drove 45 minutes to get this sandwich it was worth the drive.  Some say it's a little expensive but it's worth it.  This is a most...have.  I order my food to go, while I waiting on my order I had a drink it was great.  The serves was great, inviting and out going.  Thanks I will be back, you have to try the Nutty Fig drink.More

title: Tucked away but worth a visit
review: Monti's is a Philly Cheese Steak specialty bar... yet to try the food (that my friend ensures is better than the Cheese Steaks he's had in Philly), but went for a couple of beers... interesting craft selection and comfy setting.

title: Loved it!
review: I love a good Philly steak!   We researched this restaurant prior to our trip, and it did not disappoint.  I had the authentic Philly cheesesteak and my husband had Niko the Greek.  We loved them!  Their salads are excellent, too.

title: Get take-out during lockdown
review: We usually visit Monti's a few times a year for their great Philly cheese steaks.  With the Covid lockdown we missed our early 2020 visit, so we decided to order take-out. The on-line ordering was simple to use, the order was ready for pickup at...the specified time and the food was delicious as usual.  Even though you can't eat on-premise, ordering take-out is a great alternative and helps keep Monti's in business until things get back to normal.More
