review: I love a good Philly steak!   We researched this restaurant prior to our trip, and it did not disappoint.  I had the authentic Philly cheesesteak and my husband had Niko the Greek.  We loved them!  Their salads are excellent, too.

title: Gotta try this Cheesesteak
review: My wife and I were traveling through the Chicago area and decided to give this place a try.  We will be beck.  She had an original cheesesteak and I had the Rocky.  It was spicy!  Some places advertise menu items as spicy and I am...More

title: Awesome Philly Cheesesteaks!
review: Great food (Philly Cheesesteaks) and a very interesting and extensive bottled craft beer selection. The cheesesteaks are made with shaved rib eye steak and are absolutely delicious. I get the South Side Johnny and my boyfriend gets the Rocky, which is super spicy. The service...More

title: Best Chinese restaurant around
review: I haven’t had there food in years we got it delivered to my daughters and it was even better than I remembered. I had the Tao chicken mild. Was perfect. And the crab ragoons are so good. We just always enjoy there food.

title: Great Food
review: Whenever I'm In the mood for Chinese Shanghai is were I go for great food and super friendly staffs must try place

title: dinner
review: The restaurant is very clean and the staff is quick and helpful.  We had the mongolian beef and the chicken with peapods, it was delicious and more than enough food.

title: Most amazing Family dinner
review: This is my all time favorite Chinese restaurant Hands down. From service to the quality and taste of the food is above and beyond anything I’ve ever had in illinois. My favorite simple dish combination fried rice medium spicy, crab Rangoon and pot stickers along...with a great egg roll and egg drop soup bam what a meal. cant forget the almond cookies !!  This evening my sister ordered the Mongolian beef which was full of flavor great dish! Everything is awesome you won’t be disappointed!More

title: Great Chinese Spot
review: We recently went to Shanghai Inn with our family and were very happy with it. We were looking for what we call “New York Chinese,” which we define as a place having good versions of the classic things we grew up with (egg rolls, doughy...pork potstickers, sesame chicken, moo shu, etc.) We definitely found what we were looking for!  We had great pork potstickers, boneless bbq pork, sesame chicken, chicken moo shu, sweat and sour shrimp, and pork fried rice.   Service was fast and super friendly. We’d definitely go again!More

title: Great food and service
review: Havent been here in a long time and The food was great and the server was amazing very friendly and polite cant wait to go back

title: New favorite Chinese spoy
review: This will be our new Chinese food joint for our family.  Luckily it is not that close to our home, otherwise, we will be there all the time. All the dishes we ordered were excellent with great flavors and right amount of heat for our...taste.  We will definitively going there as often as we can.More

title: Sunday Regulars
review: Shanghai is our go to neighborhood spot! We’re here three or more times a month. Staff is extra friendly and helpful in making decisions. Food is delicious whether youre dining in (get the hot tea + know that mostly everything is largely portioned with plenty...to take home) or picking it up to go. We consistently order the wonton soup, potstickers (outstanding!), beef & peapods, shrimp & lobster sauce, any type of chow fun or fried rice. We always venture out, choosing something new when we dine in. I recommend giving Shanghai a try, I don’t think you’ll be disappointed!More

title: Super food!
review: Very nice staff serving great Chinese food in large portions.  My lunch special was large enough for two to split for dinner!

title: Great Food Always!
review: This has got to be my favorite Chinese restaurant in Chicago. Food in tasty, spicy (when requested) and well sized portions!

title: Excellent
review: A small local restaurant that deserves attention. The food is fresh and delicious and comparable to the finest that Chicago has to offer

title: Your own personal Chinese restaurant
review: Take a chance on this place. You won't be disappointed. One of the few in not the only restaurant in the area that serves Pressed Almond Duck because it takes days to prepare. Lisa and the staff are wonderful and they make you part of...More

title: Tried and True.
review: Another family favorite, we've been eating at Shanghai Inn since it opened. My mom remembers the staff when they were just kids helping at the family restaurant after school. This is honestly some of the most delicious Chinese you'll have in The States. The vegetable...More

title: found some good chinese food
review: Whenever i try a new Chinese restaurant, I first order the basics to gauge whether or not the more complex dishes will delight my finely tuned palette (no, not really). To my surprise, Shanghai Inn serves up some really good and moderately priced Chinese food....More

title: ENCORE WITH THE BEST DOLMADRES FOR A GREEK RESTURANT UP IN LINCOLN SQUARE
review: Well despite knowing all the Greek restaurant around from downtown Chicago Greek Town to the city outskirts and suburbs I have to say this place has the best Dolmadres. the feelings that use and the sauce that they pour over the grape leaves is just...phenomenal. I have a dull Madras elsewhere and nothing compares to this place. I have discovered this place from my close friend who took me here two years ago and you should get a lot for not too much money dining out. I started out with an appetizer Dolmadres since I was tempted to eat a regular size but it would make me feel full and not to order anything else . I ended up getting the lamb shank chops cooled medium well with rice baked potato and peas on the side. Very delicious. I am ending my meal with baklava for dessert. Other than that if you come here to give this place a try. It's a hidden gem tucked in between Lawrence and Lincoln avenue.More

title: Great Greek food and a lovely outdoor patio setting.
review: What a find! We had dinner here and ordered a Poseidon salad which is a lovely Greek salad with chargrilled fresh octopus on top. I had a combination plate of grilled octopus and calamari which was served in a paprika lemon sauce and was absolutely...delicious, and I enjoyed the char grilled edge to the seafood. Service is friendly, authentic Greek and very efficient. My seafood platter was served with a side of potato,  rice and peas so there’s no way you can leave hungry.  Very reasonable prices and a nice Greek wine list with glasses at $7-8.More

title: Terrible Moussaka
review: I was so excited to try this place and picked a traditional Greek dish for both of us - moussaka. It was abysmal - mostly potato and the tiniest amount of eggplant, beef without the classic flavors (or even much flavor at all) and a...rock solid small layer of bechemel sauce.  And not even hot enough.  Needless to say we will not be returning to try another “genuine greek” dish.More

title: Sort of authentic
review: Am I a snob if I say I've been to Greece and this place made me sad? Everyone in there was Greek. The food was inexpensive and it showed. For such a prime location it was DEAD at 7PM on a Saturday night. We walked...by just while talking a walk. The rain had stopped. Lincoln Square is a nice place for a walk on a winter evening - lots to look at and several stores still open because of Holiday shoppers! So we decide to go in. The entire restaurant is empty and dark except the front six tables. They were up on a floor next to the window. The rest of the place literally had the lights off. The bar only serves beer and wine - or it might serve more but the menu only lists beer and wine. We had kids with us so we didn't sit at the bar. There was no wait. We were greeted immediately. The prices were the first to catch my eye. Second was they had "specials" for a Saturday. That should have told me something but occasionally I like to be optimistic. We started with the Saganaki. Our waiter ordered it and brought it right out. We told our son, "look" but before he looked up it was over. There was literally no "presentation". Our waiter almost looked embarrassed. I saw two other servers do this two more times. There was no presentation. How sad. Isn't that part of the flaming cheese? The "opas" were barely audible  and almost apologetic. But the cheese and bread were fantastic. We also had a greek salad - generous helpings of feta but maybe two olives. The tomatoes were mealy but that's only Chicago in winter, probably couldn't be helped... For dinner our son ordered a pasta dish that was supposedly served with browned butter and a greek cheese. It was mushy tastely spaghetti with some parmesan. It tasted oily. It wasn't good. It was in bad need of salt. The pasta was so overcooked it barely had texture. I ordered the Lamb special with artichokes in a lemon sauce. Well I got a soup bowl with a marvelous lamb shank drowning in the lemon sauce and four large artichokes. The lamb was good but there was way too much sauce. It was slightly nauseating. It was thick and glopy. It didn't taste bad. The menu didn't describe it as if my lamb would be drowning. My husband got the BBQ lamb "back". he had to ask, "what part is the "back" and the server said, "it's like ribs" but there was no bone. It was just dry lamb. It had a nice taste but it was super dry. It came with rice and peas. Overall we were underwhelmed. Our server was very nice and attentive. As we were leaving the place started to fill so they turned on some lights. They had three big parties - 8 or more people. I probably wouldn't try it again or I'd stay away from "specials". We were going to get saganaki and gyros but the Lamb specials seemed like such great deals since all other lamb on the menu was twice the price. Now we know why...More

title: Wonderful Adriatic Experience
review: Between the tasty Mythos and Hillas beer and the tzaziki and octopus, what a treat.  Authenticity and generous portions. I need to get back to Greece with my bride.

title: Simple and delicious!
review: Barba Yianni lacks the luster of all the big Greektown places thankfully, but it makes up for the lack of a circus atmosphere with what feels like home cooking.  The staff is very friendly, very attentive, and very keen with recommendations to make your entire...table happy-happy!  I adore the lemon soup, so luscious and creamy!  Even the sides like toast potatoes, rice, and peas are just so yummy - just like your Greek gramma would serve up!  Mousskas (with meat) is my favorite - the layer of bechemel that oozes from top to bottom is so rich and comforting!  Fantastic sourdough bread and olive oil starts off every meal perfectly!More

title: Go for good food, just expect poor service
review: I live nearby, and I come here a lot. The food is fantastic, the wine is great, the ambiance is cool.  The service is unreliable at BEST. I usually come here alone, and it means either I cannot take three bites without the server asking...if I’m done and trying to take the rest of my meal away from me, or I sit for 30 minutes with finished plates of food, an empty wineglass, and have to go to the host stand myself and ask for the check, though I’d intended to stay for another drink. I tend toward exaggeration, and unfortunately both of those are very literal descriptions of several experiences here. It honestly ruins the experience of an otherwise great neighborhood spot.More

title: Underwhelmed
review: First off,  we went on a Saturday night and the place was spotty and  not busy.  We ordered a lamb and a chicken entree.  Both were under cooked, bland and cold.  The server took it back to reheat the food, but returned with someone else's...plate.  Minutes later he came back with the original lamb entree and it was still cold.  Really??    We eventually requested to speak with the manager or owner, but he never came to our table.  Apparently, management does not appreciate it's patrons experience or quality service.More

title: Excellent Aunhentic Greek in a nice neighborhood setting
review: Barba Yianni is a very nice,  authentic, full menu Greek restaurant. The menu is quite extensive, and they offer a unique daily special. It was Wednesday, and we had the stuffed green peppers. The serving was quite large, and was accompanied with a nice serving...of rosted green peas and a small potato. We passed up on many other awesome menu offerings to take advantage of the daily special. Bread (albeit somewhat dry) and olive oil for dipping was included. Also included was the choice of 2 soups. We has the split pea and it was fabulous. We also ordered the house greek wine. It was good, and it has a unique pine undertone and nose. And it is described that way, so no suprise. A glsss will take you through the meal.   The Restaurant is just a very short walk off of the easily accessible CTA Brown line at the "Western stop" (direction: Kimball). It's about 12 - 15 stops out from "central city" and located in beautiful Lincoln Square. (NOT Lincoln Park). The street and area is lined with shops, and a host of other ethnic restaurants, all of which looked very interesting as well.   The restaurant was very clean, it had quite an appealing and authentic feel, including the staff. Its worth the CTA ride out just to explore the area and then have dinner. I enjoyed the feel of the restuarant as well as the entire neighborhood. The prices were very reasonable, and the portions were Chicago- sized. It seems they have a small dance floor and band stand, but no entertainment on the night of our visit. In fact an artist was painting the Chagal inspired mural behing the band area.   There are several different sections in the restaurant for seating, yet it's not a huge. restaurant. The bar area was attractive, and there were street-front windows, with high top tables located there, as well as bar seating.   Just hop on the CTA brown line toward Kimball, and discover a great neighborhood area of Chicago outside of the normal Michigan Avenue / State Street strip. You will be glad you did.More

title: not bad
review: the place is cozy and the staff are freindly but the food is avarage and the hookha is bad  the enviroment is not bad but it is good for one time to visit

title: Decent greek food
review: Have been here multiple times over the years when visiting in Chicago.  Decent food, large portions but not the best Greek food I've ever had.  This last time I had the baked lamb with rosa marina and it was fine, the meat we tender but...More

title: Great Food!
review: The Saganaki (flaming cheese) was mouthwatering! The Dolmades was my favorite! Wish I could get good Greek food like this near me!

title: Great place for Greek food. Lookout for Flamming Cheese
review: Stopped in late (8:00 PM) for a bite to eat on a Saturday night. Nice clean Mediterranean Grecian seaside resort decor inside. Open view to patio seating looking out on quaint Lincoln Square for people watching in summer. We sat inside due to large group....More

title: Slow...
review: Boyfriend and I went for a very early dinner-6pm.  We were one of 2 tables and we could not believe the lack of service received. Food was fine but we just could not get over the fact that we were practically ignored. A touch pricey...More

title: Greek Food in Lincoln Square
review: Good Greek food at reasonable prices.  The servings are plentiful, the combination plate was large enough for leftovers.  The Saganaki (flaming cheese) is my favorite appetizer. Nice outdoor seating area but the inside also has a good ambiance.  Good service and friendly waitress.

title: Great food and vibe
review: Truly appreciate the efforts of Anas, he does well to keep a fine establishment with good food and service. Great staple in Lincoln Square!!!

title: Good Greek in Lincoln Square
review: Lincoln Square might seem like an unlikely spot to find a Greek restaurant that would stand up well to the restaurants of Greektown, but this one is a great relic of the attempt to create a Greektown North nearly half a century ago.  The room...More

title: Slightly above average Greek cuisine
review: Located well away from Greektown in Chicago, Barba Yianni Grecian Taverna is located on Lincoln Ave., just south of Lawrence Ave.  There is a lot of competition with Argentinean, Mexican, German and other restaurants, that Barba Yianni Grecian Taverna has to stay on top of...More

title: Amazing and priced right!
review: This wonderful neighborhood place in the heart of Lincoln Square is so far ahead of any other Greek restaurant where we've eaten.  Food was authentic and totally yummy. Best Saganaki , Grecian chicken, or octopus. Wine and drink prices very fair. They even had a...More

title: Best Greek food--and I've been to Greece!
review: Comfortable outdoor tables. Terrific, unhurried service. Grilled octopus is the best anywhere. Lamb chops are wonderful. And all the standard Greek fare is very, very good. Hint: Don't let them sit you in the back, unless you want to be alone in a very large...More

title: "AMAIZING ATMOSPHERE AND EXCELLENT FOOD"
review: I love this place, great atmosphere, amaizing service and beautiful place to go out with your friends and family and just enjoy time in this Greek tavern.

title: Greek Food Craving
review: Excellent food and service at great prices.  Beware that you will either get no more than three refills on your drink, or you will have to wait for a long time.  Once you have completed your order, it can take a while to receive your...More

title: Great Smelts!
review: This place is traditional in its decor and menu offerings, and while a little dated on both fronts the friendly, attentive staff, good food, and great value make it a charming place to eat. It's location is also a plus, easy to get to from...More

title: Amazing service!
review: What great service!  We were having a very late lunch with my parents (Greek food virgins) and toddler daughter and our server made what could have been a challenging dining experience into great example of Greek and Chicago hospitality.  She helped my parents select menu...More

title: Sadly, much anticipated Octopus was served tepid, forecasting a mediocre meal
review: The octopus appetizer might once have been tasty, had it been served hot of the grill.  As presented, however, it was spongy and lukewarm, as if it had been prepared at lunchtime and forgotten on the buffet table to be served at dinner.  Very unpleasant....More

title: Great find
review: This is a fine Greek joint to find on the north side of Chicago. Very nice staff and excellent food.  The price is right too. Try the baked chicken and the gyros.  We will be back

title: Consistently good Greek food
review: We have been going to Barba Yanni for over thirty years. The location and food fits us like an old shoe and it occurred to me I had not reviewed it on Tripadvisor. It's that kind of place; so local and comfortable that you can...More

title: Copious servings of decent Greek food
review: The Lincoln Square setting is a big plus and it is large enough to serve lots of people. All the signature Greek foods are here and the servings are truly large. The food isn't over-the-top good but it's tasty and a bit different and quite...More

title: Excellent food, Good service, Friendly environment
review: We went to Barba Yianni Grecian Taverna to celebrate our youngest grandson’s First Communion. This was his choice. It is his favorite restaurant - a young man with a discriminating palate. We have been here before and it never disappoints. The food is excellent –...More

title: Comfortable affordable local Greek restaurant
review: I've eaten here several times over the years and was delighted this week to see the prices haven't changed much, the menu was not overly americanized, the wine list was updated, and the lamb still better than I can make myself. The restaurant retains it...More

title: Friendly service and great food
review: Good standard Greek dishes, you won't leave hungry. Everything we had was hot and fresh and the service was friendly.

title: Great Greek Food
review: They have great Greek Food with an extensive menu a small cozy bar with entertainment and dancing on various nights.

title: Good gyros - nice outside dining
review: Nice restaurant in an original German suburb of Chicago. Outside dining was fun, the service of Krisztinsa great. No beer on tap :-( but good selection. We had the gyros plate which came with a soup and plenty of tasty gyros and sides. Especially yummy...More

title: Great food!!! Great price!!! Ok service!!!
review: Cant say enough about the food and the value...both fantastic and much better than greek town... the service was ok...waitress was a lil dry in the personality department and rarely checked up on us to see how everything was or if we needed anything...I think...More

title: Interesting Greek for the price
review: Second time we've enjoyed Barba Yianni for lunch in the last 18 months on our visits to Chicago. White tablecloths, inside and outside seating within the Lincoln Square Mall of unique shops along pedestrian-dominated streets. This Greek restaurant's signature "Flaming Cheese" appetizer is lit on...More

title: Over all good food & good service!
review: The area is lincoln square which I love for the several restaurants and ambience. The restaurant was good but the charcoal chicken and the filled chicken were very good. The waitress was very sweet, knowledgeable  of the menu and among everything no pressure from her...More

title: Good Lunch
review: Nothing special, egg lemon soup and a Greek salad.  The soup was good,  No better or no less than the average Greek restaurant.  The salad greens were crisp; however, the feta was not crumbly like other restaurants and it was over dressed and the dressing...More

title: Great Greek food
review: I love Greek food and this restaurant made my day.  Delicious feta and olives to start.  The prices and drink list were good, too.  We both had the special of the day, which we could have split due to the large portions.  Delicious.  Outdoor patio...More

title: Serviceable Greek Food
review: The service was excellent; the plates were full. The food was good, but not great. It was an OK value for what we received.

title: yeah tango!
review: I went the restaurant 3 times and i enjoyed so much. Every Wednesday Tango Night! All of the people dancing and it seems very nice. There is a tango teacher who is Somer and he is dancing perfectly. Also Tango's musics are really nice. Besides...More

title: Not as good as Athena but still good stuff and friendly service.
review: Not as good as Athena but still good stuff and friendly service.

title: Good food, GREAT service...
review: Good food, GREAT service !!

title: They're open late.  Yay!
review: They're open late.  Yay!

title: Wonderful Service, Superb Food
review: This restaurant has recently moved to new location on 4603 N. Lincoln ave. in Chicago.  We had not been to the old location but our friends had.  The service was incredibly friendly and welcoming from the moment you come in the door.  The food was...great - lots of garlic in all the main dishes I tasted, but wonderfully flavorful.  I had the chicken cacciatora, a delicious blend of garlic, wine, olives, and mushrooms.  My wife had the Alfredo - equally delicious.  And a nice cannoli for dessert to top off the evening.  The place is not fancy, but a warm and inviting spot for enjoyable occasions with family and friends.  Definitely a place I would return to.More

title: Caro Mio a Disappointment
review: I visited this restaurant about 5:30pm on a weeknight. Only one other person was eating in the restaurant at this time. The restaurant has a cute design. I ordered a Neapolitan anti pasta—polenta with ragu sauce which was homemade and delicious. I inquired whether the...pastas are all home made and the waiter said no. Only 1 or 2 of many pastas on the menu and specials list are homemade including lasagna which is strange for an Italian restaurant. Is it too much to ask for an Italian restaurant to make fresh pasta? For my 2nd dish I ordered the Italian Festivo which was on the special list which was freshly made and inckyddd a meatball, manicotti, Italian sausage and something else in a light red cream sauce which was ok. The price point for this restaurant on Wilson Ave west of Uptown is too high for this neighborhood. These prices you would find downtown. $12 for an anti pasta and $22.95 for all pastas (including those not made fresh) is a bit steep. Additionally, as other reviewers have stated, the restaurant serves stale Italian bread which makes no sense except a desire to cut corners—it would be better to serve no bread if it isn’t going to be fresh. I had no problem with the restaurant not serving alcohol but the greatest problem is the lack of parking. Parker’s beware that most residential streets surrounding the restaurant have permit parking all day. There are much better choices for Italian food—Calo, Spacca Napoli (a block away from Caro Mio), Anna Maria Pasteria, Topo Gigio, Italian Village and on and on—and all these restaurants sell alcohol.More

title: Nice Little Neighborhood Spot
review: This is a small bistro-type restaurant in the Ravenswood neighborhood of Chicago.  The interior design is well done and the wait staff is friendly and helpful.  The food portions are absolutely enormous, plan on taking home leftovers.  The food itself, however, is a decidedly mixed...bag.  The Garlic Bread is great, out of this world!  But the main dish had a marinara sauce that was way too sweet and Italian sausage that was too salty.  All in all, while this was a satisfactory place to eat if you are in the neighborhood, it's not really worth going out of your way for.More

title: Excellent Neighborhood Gem
review: While visiting, i wanted to go to Little Italy, of course, more of a tourist high priced area now, my friends introduced me to this restaurant. Hand made pasta, excellent food. I enjoyed salmon with spaghetti..my friends had chicken parmigiana with rigatoni..calamari and green bean...salad.  You can bring your own wine, no corkage fee.  Great atmosphere!More

title: An annual event
review: Back again this year to enjoy a family get together. Perfect environment. Food is delicious. The wait staff allowed us to enjoy the moment. A great place.

title: Neighborhood Eats
review: Excellent value - big portions at reasonable prices are served at this cosy corner location.    Strictly BYOB, with a good variety of standards.  Tasty comfort food, but not for foodies.  You will have plenty of leftovers!   Service is friendly, informed, engaging and prompt.  Street parking.

title: Outstanding Italian experience
review: We had a chance to dine at Caro Mio while visiting our son in Chicago. Our friend from The Real Chicago magazine recommended it to us. Wow, was he right. This is a BYOB restaurant which keeps the price under control. The food is outstanding....We starting with Bruchetta. I think it might have been the best I’ve ever had. My wife had Salmon Fra Diavolo. Absolutely loved it. I enjoyed it the next day as well. I loved the eggplant parmigiana. It was wonderful. My son loved his Lobster Ravioli. It was a quiet Tuesday night. We were able to catch up and totally enjoy our meal. The staff was professional and attentive. Thanks to Trent and Caro Mio.  We will go back when we’re in town.More

title: Solid American-Italian experience
review: You want solid American-Italian food, big portions, ... that's the place. It is a bit tight but friendly, cozy.

title: BYOB and Enjoy!
review: Several store fronts on Wilson Ave with parking in the evening just a block or two walk away...  And you'll find a menu with fine 'home' made pastas and other treats.  Calamari frittii is always a good starter and it was here too.  large portion...shared with 4 other people without a fight.  Garlic bread was also ordered, but given the food to come, that wasn't a good idea... but it was all eaten anyway.  Pumpkin stuff ravioli was on the menu and was perfectly done.  I went for the linguini frutta di mare which had plenty of clams and shrimp along with some squid and mussels.  finely done.  others had other pastas all of which were fully enjoyed.  home made options should be taken as the pasta is just so fine.  no desserts after all that!  we brought beer and wine and i can't recall if they was a corkage charge- if so, it was very small.More

title: Good dinner with a problem
review: The table we had was tucked away in the back corner of the room. The service was good considering how crowded they were. I used the bathroom and there was no water in the sink. After going back, our food was served, and it was...quite good. Then I noticed a gradually growing puddle next to us. They were cleaning, but it still came because a pipe had burst. The servers were good about boxing our leftovers and getting us the check so we could leave.More

title: 70th Birthday Dinner
review: With the family in tow we headed to north Chicago to Caro Mio, a small Italian restaurant we had heard about through word of mouth.  It did not disappoint.  Calamari was crisp and fresh, marinated green beans were outstanding...a must have.  Dinners were large and...More

title: Great homemade Italian
review: Cozy little place on Wilson, with friendly hosts. Went with friends who were regulars...lots of vegetarian choices on the menu for them. We shared the zuppa di pesce, the veal arrabiatta, and the salmon portofino (balsamic, honey, pine nuts, green onions). All were large portions...More

title: A hidden gem
review: Caro Mio is definitely off the beaten path in the Ravenswood neighborhood, but it is worth the journey.  The restaurant that spans three converted storefronts is nicely decorated in a simple Italian motif.  The wait staff was excellent and our orders came up with a...More

title: Cozy Italian Restaurant
review: This is an excellent neighborhood restaurant in the Ravenswood section of Chicago. The menu is extensive, and the food is excellent. It is near public transportation.

title: Nice Italian Cuisine
review: Went here with my daughter and her husband. It's byob and had been recommended by a co-worker. My daughter had one of the specials, a pesto and asiago cheese stuffed gnocchi with a creamy tomato sauce. I had a taste and if I had tried...More

title: About what I expected
review: We went to Cara Mia last night for dinner with another couple. I found it to neither be the horrible meal that some trip advisor reviews said or the great little Italian restaurant gem that others said.  They were very busy but honored our reservation...More

title: Not a real italian restaurant
review: If you have never been to Italy maybe you could think this is italian food!!!! But it is not, at all!!! Terrible recipes, too many ingredients, too much salt. Local definitely unattractive. Never again!

title: My last visit......
review: On my last visit I think it really was my last visit. The food is very salty.... overly...the Appetizer.was.forgotten (again).  It's not inexpensive. Over the years its gotten a little worse each year. The bread is.from a precut store loaf. The BYOB is the saving.grace...More

title: Too Salty, But BYOB (Guess You'll have to drink extra wine to mask the salt)
review: Been here twice. Too bad the first time was for my birthday dinner. I think my meal had a months worth of salt content. BOTH of our dishes. We were going to send them back but the issue was the red sauce- which restaurants make...More

title: Very good and lots of it
review: This place has very good food and lots of it. Don't get in a big hurry because made-from-scratch takes time. It's BYOB and quaint with tablecloths and flowers. This means your food will be around $20-22 per plate. My husband got the chicken picatta, I...More

title: A hole in the wall Italian
review: This is a BYOB As in booze OR butter! They refuse to serve you butter with their good bread?  This is a return visit as my Chicago kids love this place.  Probably because they deliver huge entrees that are boxed for lunch the next day....More

title: BYO and eat some great Itallian food
review: A little hard to find - but a worthwhile find! Great Italian food and excellent service. Be sure and bring you fav0ate wine as the nearest liquor store is 3 blocks away.

title: Birthday Dinner for My Wife and Family
review: This is a BYO Restaurant. This is probably the 3rd or 4th time that I have been here, Everything is made from scratch including the Pasta. To say the least, the food is very excellent and the service matches it. The décor is very nice....More

title: BYOB - Bring Your Own Butter (too)
review: This was our second time dining at Caro Mio.  While it is a fun place to eat and the food is reasonably good, you notice more the second time in.  The dining room was really cold and the tables are tightly packed together in there....More

title: Amazing food
review: Nine of us met here for dinner. Four of the people had been here and loved the food.  I second their opinion, the menu was huge and varied, the portions were generous, the prices were extremely reasonable and the food was excellent.  The service was...More

title: What is that smell?
review: Was always a fan... Soooo disappointed in changes made!! Looks like they took over a couple storefronts next to them.... Bad idea! Walking in there is a smell of possibly sewer... Could not put our finger on it but nothing that would intise an appetite....More

title: Low key place for weekday date night
review: Opens during the week at 4 for dinner and we arrived at 440pm and had the restaurant to ourselves the entire time.  I brought my own wine and my husband had some, but he was never asked if he wanted anything else.  After ordering we...More

title: Excellent pastas
review: Interesting and excellent menu.  BYOB is a real plus.  Wish they would take reservations for smaller tables

title: Authentic BYOB Italian in Lincoln Square
review: My visit was with my fiancee, my parents, her mom and grandpa. We came early on a Friday night and the restaurant was modestly occupied. We ordered brucescetta and polenta for the appetizers. Both were very, very good. It's hard to get brucescetta wrong, but...More

title: Service is not a strong point
review: Nice ravenwood local Italian spot.  Service is not strongpoint as one waiter and 1 bus girl.  Portions are huge!!  You can easily order one and share or take half home!  Desert not a strange point.  Byob is nice.  Keeps your bill low.  Always a good...More

title: Hurtful experience
review: Went last  night with 3 other women of color  and we're treated  disrespectfully. We ordered six appetizers  and 2 desserts spending  about $100 but the management  came over to tell us we had not spent enough money and to never return. I've  been residing in...More

title: Great food, but service and courtesy?
review: This is the second time we have visited this restaurant. Both times the wait they  had anticipated was way longer than they had stated. This time we went down the street to a local place and gave them our phone. Lo and behold after waiting...More

title: Good Italian Food
review: Was craving Italian food on my recent trip to visit my son in Chicago so we went to Caso Mio.  We entered the restaurant about 7:30 pm and were immediately seated.  We also had my infant granddaughter with us and they were very accommodating offering...More

title: Best Meal
review: We had 8 people and all meal where out standing. I have been at Caro Mio at least 20 times and never had a bad meal. The help is great. You can bring your (BYOB) The price very fair.This is a out standing Italian Restorante..

title: Not sure why people go there
review: I've lived one year in the neighborhood and never went there. I finally went and regret it. The food was really salty and poor quality. The décor and menu is straight out of early nineties. the staff does not do much to improve the experience....More

title: Just be careful!
review: Came with 14 other persons and out of the 14 orders only my order was messed up. I was given the wrong food item so I made a suggestion that the guy getting the orders should read back the orders before getting them filled. The...More

title: Good Italian Meal in Ravenswood
review: This place is kinda isolated and in a little neighborhood spot.  The food was huge portions and delicious.  Sauce is homemade with high quality ingredients.  We had the amazing calimari to start with (wayyyy too much for 2 people) and then ordered Chicken Parm and...More

title: Big, tasty portions in Chicago
review: On our last night of a short stay in Chicago, we went with friends to Caro Mio and found a terrific place to eat. The portions were large and delicious, the wait staff was effective and the experience was a good one. That they allow...More

title: Great Italian Food
review: Whenever I'm craving a feel-good meal I usually turn to gnocchi, and Caro Mio knows how to do it.  They also give you huge portions that will keep the heartiest of appetites satisfied.  And BYOB too, so how could you go wrong?

title: Owner is frightening
review: The owner dared me to write this...so I am (I also assume he will respond-- if he does-- I am a woman and I think your restaurant is terrible. And no you cannot speak to my husband).  I am that bad review. And you may...More

title: Informal Fun
review: This is a place for eating, not fine dining.  Very informal, tables close together, no pretensions.  We arrived early on a Monday evening, and were seated right away.  They allow you to bring your own wine without a corkage fee, which is a big plus...More

title: Pretty Good BYOB
review: Upon entering the restaurant we were struck by the informality of the place.  The barely had a host/hostess stand.  More like someone found us and told us the restaurant was filled (no reservations).  They placed us at a table next door in their banquet space....More

title: Neighborhood Italian restaurant with big city credentials
review: Wonderful flavors and generous portions combined with a "no corking fee" policy make Caro Mio one of the most inviting Italian restaurants in Chicago.  The Caprese salad or bruschetta are two of many delicious starters.  The skillfully prepared pasta, veal, chicken and sea food are...More

title: Large Portions
review: Great little Italian place tucked away in the Ravenswood corridor. It is BYOB, which great, but also reflected in the price of each dish. The portions are so large you easily get two meals out of each order.  Last visit was on December 31, 2012...More

title: Really Good Italian Food
review: Went here on a Sunday night. The food was excellent and Authentic Italian. The waiter, Jean Piere, was an absolute delight. We took our time and the staff was very supportive of a slow, romantic meal. The Bruschetta was the best I have had.

title: Second time around and still good!
review: We like to go to Caro Mio so we can BYOB only this time it's wine!  The food is good too.  The portions are huge but the prices seem to be a bit large too.   I also always feel cramped at the tables.  This time...More

title: best Italian food in Chicago
review: I have had just about everything on the menu...my favorite is the lasagna.  Service is great and BYOB is awesome.

title: One of the best Italian restaurants in the city!
review: Even though I live in this neighborhood, it took a co-worker who lives in Lincoln Park to tell me about this place.  I had my birthday dinner here with my family, and it was outstanding!  There were at least 5 daily specials, and they all...More

title: PLEASE DO NOT SUPPORT THIS RESTAURANT
review: We celebrated my friend's graduation at Caro Mio. My girlfriend was assaulted by the owner. He made a scene in the restaurant in front of all of his customers on a busy Saturday night, and I'm wondering who else was in the restaurant at the...More

title: Great Italian Eatery in Ravenswood; and BYOB
review: Can't believe I haven't been here sooner; since I moved into the Ravenswood neighborhood in May.  Ambiance is small, quaint, romantically decorated and lit.  Italian food served is wonderfully diverse and interesting; and, all seemed excellent.  What more could ask for -- how about BYOB...More

title: One of our fave neighborhood Italian places.  We'll dine in or get it delivered.  Nice family run place but sometimes...
review: One of our fave neighborhood Italian places.  We'll dine in or get it delivered.  Nice family run place but sometimes they overdo spices and/or garlic.

title: I saw a terrible fat and big rat running from the kitchen ! ! !
review: I love Italian food. Nice Place but DISGUSTING experience the last week IN CARO MIO RESTAURANT...  BAD SERVICE and  THE WORST the  big, big  RAT runnig from the  KITCHEN !!!!  i am sorry but it's the true.

title: Italian. Byob. Food is soooo good! Really cozy place. Plan on spending 20 bucks a plate, which is okay since you're...
review: Italian. Byob. Food is soooo good! Really cozy place. Plan on spending 20 bucks a plate, which is okay since you're bringing your own booze. Nice waitstaff.

review: I had heard about this place from a friend and was eager to try it out.  It exceeded all expectations.  A great atmosphere in a cozy warm spot under the El.  Great friendly service and stunning food.  We had the Calamari, which was as fresh...More

review: Excellent neighborhood Italian place!  Stuffed gnocchi in totmato cream sauce was fabulous!  Tiramisu was also amazing.  A little loud and crowded/cozy, but well worth it.  BYOB.

title: good food, but it's a bit dark and noisy.

title: Delicious Italian food, wonderful atmosphere, great service and BYOB! You can't beat that.
review: Delicious Italian food, wonderful atmosphere, great service and BYOB! You can't beat that.

title: They offer very tasty Italian dishes.  I have not had a bad meal there yet.  Their service is flamboyantly nice and...
review: They offer very tasty Italian dishes.  I have not had a bad meal there yet.  Their service is flamboyantly nice and fun.  Their interior decor is filled with romantic colors and art by local artists.  It's BYOB so enjoy a great evening with great food...More

title: Have not had a bad meal... huge portions, and BYOB!
review: Have not had a bad meal... huge portions, and BYOB!

title: Wonderful Evening
review: We ate at this Ravenswood BYOB last Friday night. It is a cute, candlelit, nicely decorated restaurant with wonderful homemade Italian food, and it is family-run. The bread served with olive oil, Parmesan and chopped fresh garlic is addictive. Order any pasta served with creamy...More

title: Top and cheap
review: One of the best pizza in town.  Pasta super good as well. Portion very generous.  Prices really competitive! BYOB! Highly recommended

title: The Best Wood-fired Pizza in a Laid Back Atmosphere
review: This has been our go-to date night spot for seven years. Our favorite: margarita pizza, add pepperoni. We typically bring a bottle of wine, share a pizza, and still have some to take home. The Greek salad, lasagna 'Art', and the crostini with house-cured meats...are all also divine. Don't forget to leave a little room for Nutella crepes! And say 'hi' to Jenny for us - our favorite salty waitress! ;)More

title: Neighborly, full of life  & off the circuit
review: Want a small, lively & friendly place?  And with great menu, terrific dishes, super pizza and fantastic value? Pizza Art Cafe provides all. We've been with a group, with family and just the two of us. Each time Pizza Art delivered what we were in...the mood for.whether it be pizzas appetizers Italian dishes and don't forget their unique bruschetta.  Their muscles serve as a great appetizer or as a fun entrée. My favorite includes the Jasco balls and risotto Di Mare. Four pizzas we prefer the porcini mushroom and the Siciliano those two being very different. Service has always been friendly and competent; but spotty during one visit.  It's a great little spot that takes reservations, so make them so you're not disappointed. And the fact that it's BYOB makes it a bit more economical. So go if you're looking for something casual, fun with good food in on the economical side. Definitely recommend it.More

title: European Traditional
review: Went to Pizza Art Cafe for dinner Friday night. Made reservations same day for 7 pm. Seated immediately upon arrival. They have a wood burning pizza oven right by the entrance. The restaurant is cozy, and it filled up as we had our first course....My wife enjoyed a very large Greek salad while I had the white bean soup. The soup was served in a larger bowl and had smoked ham and beans with carrots in a tomato broth. Very tasty.   We shared a pizza that had chorizo sausage, roasted red peppers and olives. The edges of the crust were blackened from the wood stove. It was delicious. This place is BYOB, and there was no corkage fee to open and chill out sparkling wine.   Service is pretty good. Can get a little slow when they are busy. For a nice Italian meal for two on a Saturday night in Chicago...$33. Great deal!!More

title: Artful pizza . . .
review: I've eaten here many times on our visits to friends in the Lincoln Square area, where the Pizza Art Cafe is a handy neighborhood stop for dinner. There's a full American Italian menu, all of it good, some excellent. The pizzas are lovingly made in...a wood-burning oven, and I've watched the chef test and re-test to make sure the crust is perfect before removing: there are some creative and delicious toppings (I've come to love the tuna and arugula). Outdoor seating as well as a lively and cozy indoors.More

title: Love It
review: This place knows pizza!  We love it.  It gets crowded but there's a reason; their pizza is great!  It's rustic, thin crust but that's one thing that sets it apart.  This is a must visit place.

title: Great food at rock bottom prices!
review: BYOB and amazing food. We haven't spent over 30 dollars here for the both of us. Great priced food!!

title: Excellent wood fired pizza
review: We live not far from Pizza Art, so we have visited many times. If the place is busy, you'll want to get your appetizer and especially your pizza orders in quickly. It takes a while. We suggest the crostini with smoked meat, a rib cut...they smoke on site. You can also get pizza with the same meat. Whether you go meat, veggie or even mixed seafood, you can't go wrong. It is BYOB, with no corking fee, which helps keep costs low. A few outdoor tables are a nice addition during the summer months. Carry out also available.More

title: Great Brick Oven Pizza
review: We tried this place in December 2014, a few days after Christmas.  On the night we went in the place was jammed and loud, which was a great thing.   Every table was filled, people seemed to be genuinely enjoying being there and having a good...time.  My wife and I brought a bottle of wine (byob) and sat down.   We decided to go with a salad and a pizza.   I have to say that we really enjoyed both.   We got an arrugula salad with smoked salmon.  Very delicious and the veggies were fresh.   We got the quattrro formaggi pizza (4 cheeses) --- instead of a blend of the four, the four cheeses each made up a fourth of the pie.   Again very enjoyable.  Next time we are visiting family in Chicago we will certainly be back!More

title: Excellent Neighborhood Gem
review: Delicious brick oven pizza, salads and appetizers, and great authentic deserts. I recommend trying bruschetta, greek or prosciutto salad, and literally any pizza on the menu. Oh! And Pizza Art is BYOB.

title: Great Pizza
review: This is a neighborhood BYOB place, don't expect 5 star service and you'll have a great meal. Atmosphere is perfect, especially now it's getting cold.

title: They Know Pizza
review: This is a noisy, fun neighborhood restaurant that really knows how to make good food.  You will have to wait for a table even with a reservation but it's worth the wait.  Their salads easily feed 2-3 people.  We ordered the house salads and they...More

title: Outstanding Brick Oven Pizza in a Small, Nice Atmosphere
review: This is a great small neighborhood place with an amazingly long list of brick oven pizzas from which to select. Starting with appetizers, try the vaguely identified Smoked Meats. We're not big meat eaters, but we never pass on this one. The Bruschetta with smoked...More

title: Very good pizza!!
review: Cute atmosphere, great pizza, BYOB, so inexpensive too!  Sevice can be a little spotty, can get rather crowded. Highly recommend.

title: Salt is the predominant taste in this pizza.
review: Was looking forward to trying Pizza Art Cafe since it is in our neighborhood. Restaurant has warm, romantic lighting and inviting atmosphere. The wood oven burns with authenticity. However, when the pizzas arrived, both my husband's and mine had tasteless crusts (where's the yeast?) flat...More

title: Crisp Thin Crust Pizza in a Deep Dish Town
review: The oven at Pizza Art is magical.  This is the best thin crust pizza I've had outside Italy.  A lot of care goes into each pie.  I live nearby, so I usually get carry-out.  Dining-in can be a wonderful experience, too.  The dessert crepes are...More

title: Best pizza & octopus in Chicago
review: Small and cozy restaurant. Feels like visiting someones home. Smells tasty all around, the pizza oven is right next to dining room. The service is just perfect, not too friendly or pushy, and definitely not cold. I fell in love with this pizza from the...More

title: Excellent Pizza and Italian Specialities, Quaint Atmosphere
review: Wow, I can't believe we rode our bicycles past this restaurant several times this summer and never noticed it -- and, I'm always on the look out.  Anyway, finally found this 'hidden jewel' 50ft from the Rockwell L Station, and we will undoubtedly now be...More

title: Amazing Pizza but have you tried the Filet Mignon?
review: All I can say is WOW... this great little place gave me my favourite meal whilst over visiting friends in Chicago.  The food is basically an amazing twist on Italian classics supported by probably the only REAL pizza oven in this town; having lived in...More

title: Amazing bites for grea nights
review: I went to this little place based on the reviews online... Although quite small and in a quiet neighbourhood the place was packed and I was lucky to get seated. The BYOB was a great touch considering the "credit crunch" etc and the food spot...More

title: Yummy.
review: Yummy.

title: great atmosphere. yummy...
review: great atmosphere. yummy pizza.

title: Best Bosnian food in town
review: Love this place amazing service, food is like back home, took my boyfriend so he can get some "Bosnian" experience and he loved it, definitely my number one place for Bosnian food!

title: Apetizer...bosnian chease
review: Apetizer was great chease and chease burak, all with pepper and black olives was great. Later on I have ordered plate with mixed Bosnian meat... I don't like it... potatoes felt old and they have had a little bit rice under ... weird mix... The...worse thing I have tested was... dessert....apple baklava...it was too wet and it wasn't too inviting.  The restaurant is unique due to an old school design. Time have stopped there, which is kinda cool.More

title: Great Bosnian food.
review: My family visit Sarajevo restaurant from sometimes when we want to eat some good Bosnian food. Restaurant is very clean and Owner Enes is always very friendly. Food is always well presented and prepared. Always looking forward to going back there to eat.

title: Excellent, authentic Bosnian food
review: I loved the food here. The young woman who served me was very hospitable as well. As the name implies, the restaurant serves Bosnian food. I enjoyed cevapcici (skinless cooked sausages on bread), and the bread was nice and fluffy. The chorba (Bosnian veal and...vegetable soup) was amazing too. I wish I had gotten a chance to try other things, but I was full from what I'd already had. The portions are generous so try to eat here with a friend and split the food.More

title: Hearty and delicious
review: Excellent beef, lamb and fish dishes prepared with authentic Bosnian flavors. Homemade soup a knock-out. Reasonably priced, great service. The four of us enjoyed every bite.

title: Great location, amazing cuisine, one awesome experience
review: Restaurant Sarajevo has to be one of the best restaurants I have ever dined at, located in the rather eclectic Lincoln Square neighborhood, Restaurant Sarajevo fits very well into the neighborhood, The cuisine if anyone is curious is Bosnian/Serbian so things like Cevapi (A skinless...sausage like kebab typically served sandwich style under two house made flatbread, Kaymak (A cream based spread) onion, and roasted bell pepper, I had this and let me just say that eating that dish was a culinary sensation I would like to repeat, They also take pride in what I'd have to say is the best salad I have ever eaten, and also quite addicting goat cheese which quite honestly might of been the best goat cheese ever, It didn't taste like mostly salt (like most goat cheeses I have sampled) and it doesn't dry out your mouth that much. Long story short: Restaurant Sarajevo is definitely a unique dining experience that will amaze even the most adventuresome of foodies or travelers with memorable results.More

title: Best place to eat in Chicago
review: It was 5 of us for my American friends it was first time eating Bosnian food and they loved we went back few times already Cevapi are the delicious Bosnian pita bread Lepinja is so yummi Visit Sarajevo Restaurant when you visit Chicago it's worth...and not expensive.More

title: Great food
review: Vacationed in Chicago and my friend who is Bosnian wanted to eat at this restaurant.  The food was excellent and the service was great.  I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the Chicago area.

title: Outstanding Food and Great Value
review: Hard to believe this small, family run restaurant makes it. The two times we've visited, the dinner crowd was sparse. But the crowd is missing a treat, passing Restaurant Sarajevo by. Adriatic specialties like cevapcici, and burek grace a substantial menu that runs from seafood...to schnitzels. The cold smoked meat appetizer and Bosnian salad are not to be missed, each providing plenty for two to share. Specials include such delicacies as braised lamb shank entrée and a zucchini and cream sauce stuffed phyllo appetizer. friendly commentary and menu advice from the owner make for a pleasant, friendly experience. House made breads and delicious baked goods round out the meal. BYOB and enjoy this East European gem.More

title: Excellent Food and Service!!!
review: The waiter who served my party at Restaurant Sarajevo is one of the best I have ever encountered. Initially, I was slightly nervous about eating here since we had a vegetarian in our party. I let the waiter know when I called to make a...reservation, and he assured me they would work with us. I expected this to mean a simple plate with veggies over pasta or something like that. However, the incredibly thoughtful waiter put together something that was simply amazing - he combined several of the foods from the menu to create a varied, delicious, and generous vegetarian meal. This was not all, however. Sensing that we were not familiar with Bosnian cuisine, the waiter offered to create a large and varied plate for the remainder of the party which was comprised of several different menu offerings. The food was very well done and the service was perfect. Next time I visit Chicago I hope to come back, and I will happily recommend this place to anyone. Thank you Restaurant Sarajevo!!More

title: Save your money
review: I don't know where to start. The service is excellent thoughtful and informed. The atmosphere is that of a gypsy wedding with loud music and louder people. The food, you ask? Inedible! Meat is overcooked and dry and tasteless. Vegetables don't go there. I don't...know where these other people ate but this place is a total waste.More

title: Bosnian fare
review: This quiet unassuming restaurant is on Chicago's north side.  Been there 15 years,  Food is good, portions generous but service slow.  Plan to sit and talk some, don't be in a hurry.  BYOB, if you make a reservation there is no corkage fee

title: If you are in the neighborhood..
review: My is ONLY reluctance  in recommending Sarajevo is that TripiAdvisor ts often for tourists  and this is sort of  in a nowhere neighborhood.   The food is great, the prices affordable.  altogether a great  dinner.Bring a meat-eater and enjoy

title: Fantastic Experience!
review: From the outside, this place looks a bit like a front for something sketchy. The exterior is drab in a pre-fall-of-the-Berlin-wall sort of way. In their window, they also have photos of their dishes - something that normally sends me running in terror. But do...NOT judge a book by its cover!!!  The inside is beautifully wood paneled and way more upscale than you would expect, though I did not feel underdressed in jeans. We had never had Serbian food before, and I figured it would be sort of like German - it is really more Turkish.  This place is BYOB and the food is reasonably priced. The bread is homemade, as is the sausage...something you don't find all the time. The service is pretty attentive and very friendly - when we both ordered the sampler, the waiter offerred to make us up a special platter to share, and it was excellent. The best potato salad I have ever had, and a range of meaty things, wonderfully seasoned, but not over spiced. We left stuffed and I think the bill was about 44 dollars.  This is a GREAT family place, a great place for a romantic evening out...I don't have a single negative to say about this place....though vegetarians might not find much...there is fettuccinni alfredo (which seemed out of place) so I guess they will eat that...  Very highly recommend!!!More

title: Restaurant Sarajevo..You MUST try it
review: Excellent, food, service, but the background music was too loud. The  food selection is large, you will find items that are on fine continental restaurant menu...call for a reservation and they allow you to bring your own wine without corkage charge. Some of our group...had a chicken dish, veal, Bosnian mixed sample dish ..all were really prepared well with good prices. Deserts were outstanding. You won't be disappointed....Street parking seems ampleMore

title: Best Bosnian food in town
review: Love this place amazing service, food is like back home, took my boyfriend so he can get some "Bosnian" experience and he loved it, definitely my number one place for Bosnian food!

You won't be disappointed....Street parking seems ampleMore

title: Dissapointing
review: I was so excited about going to this place since it had high ratings. First, the place is very nicely decorated and clean. However, the server was not very helpful recommending some dishes. We started with the fried calamari as an appetizer and it was...More

title: Outstanding Food!!!
review: This is my first restaurant review, though I've rated many hotels.  I feel I have to rate this, because it is so good. We have eaten there twice, and both times, the food was excellent.  There were four of us on our recent visit, and...More

title: Great experience!
review: Probably doesn't hurt that my husband is Bosnian, but we really enjoyed our meal there.  I wish they were closer to downtown, but the drive was manageable.  I've eaten a LOT of Bosnian food, mostly homemade, and this was one of the best meals I've...More

title: Great place to try Eastern European food
review: Do yourself a favor the next time you're in Lincoln Square and venture west along not-as-pretty Lawrence Ave and try Restaurant Sarajevo (I don't know why they call it "Coffee Restaurant" here). Once you are inside, you'll feel like you're in another land. We've walked...More

title: My wife and I have been to Sarajevo twice...
review: My wife and I have been to Sarajevo twice and it just keeps geting better I We were greeted with very nice service each time. The food is so good and the menu is extremely large. Each time we were greeted with a ton of...More

title: An authentic experience
review: I visited Chicago in July 2010. Being Bosnian, I couldn't pass up a little taste of home. The food we ordered was authentic and delicious. I was impressed by the classy atmosphere. They did a very nice job furnishing and decorating. The service was also...More

title: Meatlover's Paradise !!! Best Crepes and unique Bosnian Coffee !
review: If you want to have GREAT MEAT dishes with authentic flavour.... served with beaming smile and a MILE wide open heart, then say goodby to fast food restaurants, say goodby to expensive restaurants .. say good by to all the chains and WELCOME TO SARAJEVO..........More

title: Memorable Mushroom slice
review: I have twice had a slice of the mushroom pizza. It was truly delicious. I also liked the crust with it. The cafe is not a big place, and not where I wanted to sit during the pandemic (last time I ate at the bus...stop bench outside), but they say they are moving at some point to a likelier neighborhood and maybe the space will be more open.More

title: Bland bland bland
review: I just ordered and was delivered a 20" build my own pizza. I really wanted it to be delicious. I read some reviews and had hoped for the best. This business, Jimmy's Pizza Cafe, does offer a 10% military/police discount which about covers the enormous...tax rate in Chicago. I spoke with a pleasant enough woman on the phone while ordering it. She told me that the crust was hand made and that the fresh mozzarella was delicious. So what did I do? I chose sliced tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, spinach, chicken and it came with some of the usual sauce and shredded mozzarella that pizzas tend to come with. The pizza with delivery ($3) plus the tip ($3.20) cost $45.00 (with the 10% discount applied already). I opened the enormous box. The visual presentation was pleasant enough. I slipped two pieces onto a blue ceramic plate, hunkered down in front of a movie and eagerly took a bite hoping for a super satisfying taste to wash over my taste buds... It was so bland. So very very bland. Nearly tasteless. I chomped into the somewhat tough and overly chewy "handmade" crust. It was utterly dissatisfying! I was so hungry and so desirous of some good pizza. I am originally from NY and I have had some excellent, excellent pizza in my life. This was just not it. Not at all. I managed to slog down two slices, as I was totally famished, and I was so unhappy. The chicken was in small 3/4" x 3/4" x 3/16" squares and they were so dry. Not fund to chew or eat at all! There seemed to be no seasoning not any sort of noticable " pizza" zest to it at all. I dusted it with some black pepper I. Hopes that it would assist the blatant blandness. To no avail. Even the crust edge was unpleasant to try and chomp, chew through. I will not get another expensive and tasteless pizza from there again. Sorry. I would much rather write a pleasant review but my experience with this bland and tasteless oversized disc has left me without the words and experience I had hoped to have had... If you opt to try this pizza from this business, I certainly hope you have a better experience. Good luck!More

title: Close to NY Style Pizza - but somewhat Inconsistent
review: The Pizza would have been EXCELLENT worth 6 Stars but for the fact that it was TOO SALTY, which messed up the taste. Still, it had excellent thick crust around the edges and was baked just right. My wife who usually tolerates a lot more...salt than I do also felt that there was too much salt on this pizza.  It's a terrible shame that someone was heavy handed with the Salt. If I lived closer I would have returned it, but given that I did not want to drive all that distance I did not do that. The 16" Pizza cost over $21 with taxes, which is quite expensive even relative to Gourmet Italian Places that serve authentic Marghereta pizzas.More

title: My favorite pizza
review: This pizza is so fantastic that I get hungry just writing this. I like New York style pizza, this is the place to be. A little pricey at about $24 for a two topping pizza but worth every penny

title: Authentic NY Style Pizza
review: Crust was perfect, nice char, not soggy in the middle. we had a 20" pie, with their homemade sausage, onions, and Basil. Sausage had a nice kick. Slices folded perfectly. Solid flavor on the sauce.  Salad was good, as were the homemade garlic knots.  The...homemade Beignets were OUTSTANDING. They rival anything i've had in New Orleans.  A few tables, so basically a care out place. some parking in the rear. Price was ok.More

title: Unbelievable Pizza
review: If you love thin crust pizza, this is the place. It's New York style and it's great!  Highly recommend

title: White sauce pizza!!
review: Loved this pizza place! Great New York style pizza, lots of garlic and cheese. Had the white sauce pizza and the special of the day, both great!

title: Disgusting! Health Code WARNING
review: I just ordered Jimmy's pizza and this will be the last. After waiting an hour, typical for Chicago, our delivery arrived. My girlfriend had opened the box and picked up a slice, only for me to realize that we received the wrong pizza! I called...the store back and spoke with their manager Jimmy, whom did not apologize and said the driver would be back to give us the right pizza. When the driver arrived, he asked for the wrong pizza back. When we told him that we touched the pizza he explained, "Well, we need the pizza back as the store is far away and I need to deliver that pizza as it is close by." We then repeated that we TOUCHED the pizza, and he continued saying he needed to deliver that pizza. We reluctantly gave the pizza back as we couldn't believe this was happening. I asked for the manager to call me back, he never did, so I called the store back to speak with Jimmy about the matter. I asked him if it was his policy that when a mistake was delivered to take back the order and try to re-deliver it. He said that the pizza wasn't delivered. When I told him that the driver literally told me that he needed the pizza back so he could deliver the pizza, he then raised his voice yelling at me to not accuse him and that he'd take a picture of the pizza if I needed proof. I proceeded to explain that I do not believe him as I'm sure a pizzeria has other pizzas and I'm only taking them at their word. He then got very upset and said "I'm done with this" and hung up. Instead of being apologetic and trying to remedy the situation, he only escalated the already disgusting situation, with horrific customer service. The pizza was luke-warm, if not cool to begin with, but fine otherwise. The garlic knots were sub-par. So if you're looking to spend $60 for average pizza that's slightly cool, being insulted, and with a topping of possible 2nd-hand pizza, this is the place for you.More

title: Cheap, carryout
review: Visiting Chicago and saw an article recommending the pizza. The restaurant is very unappealing, but most customers were taking carryout. The pizza is premade and sold by the slice. They reheat what you order, but our slices were still room temperature when served on paper...plates. The pizza was mediocre. If you need to eat cheap, this might be worth a try.More

title: Great slice of ny pizza
review: Terrific slice of pie ny style.  Lots of options and garlic knots excellent as well.  If in area, perfect for lunch or dinner?

title: Fresh Baked Beignets
review: I've walked past it many times, but today the thought of beignets drew me in. It is an incongruous mix--pizza take out and old fashioned cafe. I order coffee and am told the beignets are fresh baked so I wait. It's a time between times--not...More

title: Perfect pizza and beignets
review: We were looking for good beignets in Chicago and Jimmy's Pizza came up. We thought it would be fun to checkout, and it was. One of those places with a few things on the menu that they really know how to make well. We knew...More

title: I would go back in an instant - for the beignets!
review: Located right on the southeast corner of Foster Ave. and Lincoln Ave., Jimmy's pizza has a steady flow of walk-ins for CTA bus travelers, as there are two bus stops at the intersection.  There is parking behind Jimmy's Pizza Cafe, so you don't have to...More

title: Delivery
review: Ordered a 16 inch and Jimmy's salad. It came in 30 mins. Piping hot! If your looking for NY pizza this is your place. 😀 It passed for cold pizza for breakfast. I will come back but still searching for best Chicago thin. The salad...More

title: My favorite pizza in Chicago
review: I'm from the east coast and cant stand deep dish pizza. I also lived in Brooklyn for a while so when I am in Chicago, I always stop by Jimmy's for a slice and an order of their delicious beignets. I'm so glad they've been...More

title: The best beignets outside of New Orleans
review: We can here specifically to try the beignets. Three puffy delicious warm delights melt in your mouth. I consider myself a beignet fanatic as one of the main reasons to go to New Orleans is for beignets. They come with a small amount of powdered...More

title: Road Trip for Beignets
review: We didn't try the Pizza, we wanted to taste New Orleans in Chicago. 10 minutes after arriving our order of Beignets were delivered to our table. Fluffy, fresh and hot, they were delicious! We will go back for them.

title: A little less homesick for Brooklyn!
review: I grew up in Brooklyn (and my mom later lived 2 blocks from the immortal DiFara’s), so my pizza standards were set very high. Been a Chicagoan for 37 years; I agree with Jon Stewart that deep-dish is tasty, but it’s still a casserole in...More

title: You need a good pizza.  I get that.  Here's the real deal.
review: Jimmy is a real person who makes real pizza.  What makes Jimmy's pizzas different from all other parlors is the dough.  It's all about that dough.  Chewy and tasty.  Top the best dough with the freshest ingredients and you got a delicious pie that can't...More

title: GREAT PIZZA!!!
review: My wife and I just moved back to Illinois after living eight years in Florida. We never found a good pizza in Florida and this was the first one we tried since being back. What a great find! Awesome thin crust pizza! We highly recommend...More

title: Best new york style pizza in Chicago
review: My friends and I have ordered this for delivery plenty of times and we're never disappointed.  Love it. Every time.

title: New York-style or thin crust pizza?
review: There are more than 30,000 pizza parlors in Chicago and every one of them claims to produce the best pizza in town, deep dish or thin crust or even New York-style. Of course, everyone has his or her own conception of what a best tasting...More

title: Great Pizza - but pick it up, don't deliver
review: Jimmy's has my favorite pizza in all of Chicago - it's absolutely delicious. We live in Lincoln Square, right around the corner from it. And we take advantage of it. However, the delivery is very spotty. Whenever we get it delivered, the pizza is always...More

title: BEST Pizza in Chicago!
review: Jimmy's Pizza Cafe at 5159 N Lincoln Ave, (corner of Foster) Chicago, IL has terrific pizza... and our family rates it the BEST we've had in all of Chicago, and we've sampled quite a lot.  The atmosphere is nothing to speak of, but the service...More

title: High Quality Food Delivered During Pandemic
review: Confined to our house during the covid-19 pandemic we were craving Thai food.  We had heard good things about Aroy Thai and they were offering pick-up or delivery.  We ordered a variety of dishes  (pot stickers, spring rolls, pad thai, pad sieuw, spicy bamboo chicken,...cucumber salad) from here.  I find most delivered food to be mediocre, but everything we got was delicious.  The food tasted very fresh, with lots of nuanced flavors and varying textures.  It arrived quickly and was still warm when we received it.  We will definitely order from them again—and go to the restaurant in person once the quarantine is lifted.  In the meantime if you’re looking for quality pick-up or delivered food, this place is a great choice.  Note that they accept cash only, including for delivery.More

title: Great authentic Thai food
review: Great authentic Thai food, with friendly atmosphere. The restaurant is BYOB, and now cash only. We had the crying tiger, papaya salad, spicy beef tendons soup, and pad seew noodle. I am Thai American, and can truly tell you that this place is the closest...thing to being in Thailand for Thai food.  They do take reservations, and I do recommend it especially for Friday and Saturday evening.More

title: Mediocre Boat Noodles
review: I visited to try their Boat Noodles. I have to say, the service was fantastic. And the food came out fast. But the Boat Noodles were too sweet. Had they been less sweet, I feel like they would have been rather good. But they weren’t....I imagine the rest of the food this place makes is probably delicious by the looks of it.More

title: Great Thai restaurant
review: My husband he is Thai so we have visited almost every Thai restaurant in Chicago. I visited long time ago Aroy and I loved it but then we didn't come back until recently. My second visit was just like the first one, perfect. I absolutely...love this cozy restaurant near the brown line station. The staff are super friendly but the food its AMAZING. I ordered a papaya salad and some spicy beef with vegetable and my hubby some noddle soup and we couldn't literally walk, we were extremely full. I love the fact they are very tradition and less Americanize so food its very authentic Thai. on top of food been delicious they have 2 great perks; first if you pay with cash they give you a discount and  second they are BYOB which its always A+. Only I will suggest its that they might have to change the rug soon cause it smells a little funny near the windows tables. Other than this hands down one of the best Thai restaurant in Chicago and for me the best in Ravenswood.More

title: Don't get the lunch special
review: Found this cozy clean place by coincidence and looking at their menu I knew it was a good one. I ordered the Panang curry and it was great. Ingredients are fresh and food come quickly and hot. Although, last week I made the mistake to...order the lunch special Panang curry and about a half a cup of curry were served on two cups of rice. It totally ruined the dish that normally is served separate, rice on the side. I was disappointed Aroy Thai cutting corners so therefore 4 stars. Everything else I ordered has been great. Suggestion: train the waitress in describing and recommending the several dishes in the extensive menu, besides curry and pad Thai. Give samples of unusual dishes we don't know. Add sauces to your condiments tray.More

title: Authentic in every way
review: When the king of Thailand comes to Chicago, this is where he eats. Everything is fresh, well seasoned, and authentic. Their noodle dishes are filling, their seafood choices are outstanding, and they even have desserts. Good choice.

title: Good but not special so far
review: Traveled to Ravenswood from the northern suburbs to try Aroy, a Thai restaurant featured on the local PBS Check Please. This is a small neighborhood restaurant with about 8 tables in one room and 4 in the other.   We started with the Sausage Combination of...Isaan and Sai Ina sausage. I'm not a sausage person but this had been recommended by a reviewer. There were two types of sausage. The Isaan was milder and somewhat boring but the other was spicy and I liked it better. It was a little dry and I would have liked a sauce or mustard with it.   We opted for the lunch special. The crab Rangoon was very tasty. I had the red curry. I usually get a yellow curry at my local Thai restaurant but they didn't have yellow curry. The red curry was OK but nothing outstanding. They served it over rice instead of rice on the side and that diluted the good curry flavor. My friend liked her Pad Woon Sen Noodles.   We have several good Thai restaurants in our area and I'm not sure I would return to this one.More

title: One of Chicago's best Thai restaurants
review: There are many Thai restaurants in Chicago, and a few of them are very good. Aroy Thai is one of that few - this place is among the very best. The menu is larger and more varied than most, with a wider range of choices...in every area - appetizer, soups, and main courses.  The ingredients are always fresh, and never taste as if they have been prepared long ago and just been microwaved when you order. They seem freshly prepared. And the spice content is not dumbed down for American taste. If you ask them to make it a bit more mild they will - but if you tell them that you enjoy spicy food, you'll get authentic heat. The black crab salad was extraordinarily flavorful, and quite spicy - though the black crabs gave up their meat reluctantly, and were a bit more work than I would be willing to put in again. Still, overall the salad was a treat. Even moreso was the beef in a spicy ginger sauce, with perfectly cooked green beans accompanying.  We will be coming back many times.  Service was friendly and efficient, and the price point was low ($30 for dinner for two, including appetizer). BYOB.More

title: Favorite Pad Thai!
review: A family member recommended we check out Aroy Thai for lunch while we were in town and we were not disappointed! We've tried lots of Thai restaurants across the US and Europe, and every time I order Pad Thai.  Aroy Thai's version is by far...my favorite. The sauce on the noodles was the perfect amount of sticky.  It wasn't greasy or heavy, just the perfect amount, and didn't leave a puddle of sauce on the plate.  Go for their lunch special! The food was well priced and well portioned for lunch.  We will certainly go back the next time we are in town.More

title: Dissapointing
review: We heard about Aroy Thai Restaurant on Check Please and based on the reviews we decided to try it. The service was excellent and everyone was very nice but the food was just your average thai fare with nothing standing out from most other Thai...Restaurants that I frequent. I really don't understand what the people on Check Please found so good about this place. Probably will not return!!More

title: Best Thai food in Chicago, period.
review: This is my go-to Thai place. I visit every two weeks. I have been eating Thai in Chicago since I lived in Wrigleyville in the late 1980s, and I have probably tried 80% of the Thai restaurants in the city. The food at Aroy Thai...More

title: Best and most authentic Thai food ever
review: The place is run by a Thai family and if you really want to try the authentic thai cuisine ask the owner for the Thai menu and recommendations, else you will just be looking at the american menu and getting the americanized toned down version...More

title: Best Thai ever in Chitown!
review: My niece is a big fan upon arrival she took me to this place n gushed about it all the time! We ordered so much food that I was going into food coma! Thank God they served their summer special- lemongrass tea what a refreshing...More

title: Authentic thai food
