review: So I have a co worker and she is from Thailand and she was always telling me to visto AROY because it was actually authentic thai food not Americanize that I would like it. I never went until my boyfriend and his friend invited me...More

title: Food good, atmosphere not so good
review: We went here for a casual dinner and like the small size of the restaurant. The menu was also interesting because you can choose between american style of authentic style thai food. We liked our meals, which were both noodle dishes and ate almost every...More

title: Very authentic Thai food
review: I am so glad I found this place. They had the dishes I couldn't find anywhere else in the States since I left Thailand 4 years ago. The food was very authentic and they gave us a huge amount of food compared to the price...More

title: Decent local BYOB Thai food. Delivery is quick and timely.
review: Decent local BYOB Thai food. Delivery is quick and timely.

title: Awesome! love it!
review: Awesome! love it!

title: $15 corkage fee???!!!!
review: Reserved here for a Sunday birthday lunch and was shocked that our already paid for BYOB champagne would cost $15 just to open! Imagine a restaurant that doesn't have a license to serve alcohol makes $15 on a bottle that you own!  Next table was...charged the same! What a racket. Plus it was not very tidy and flimsy plastic dividers between tables really doesn't protect. We left and enjoyed a great dinner with wine openning free up the street.....More

title: Horrible place.  Ordered 2
review: Horrible place.  Ordered 2 makis one of them Ebi Tempura. Ate 4 pieces and 3 of them had pieces of shrimp shells - they didn’t even bother to take it off! I complained to the waiter and all she offered was 10% discount for the...food which I barely ate....More

title: Fresh
review: Excellent Sashimi and spicy salmon/tuna salads! Would recommend if in the area. Friendly and attentive wait staff.

title: Good quality sushi, nice service
review: Good quality sushi, nice service, but personally I hate TV' s in restaurants and the layout isn't 'warm' and cosy...but good quality and tasty sushi so worth a visit !

title: Good food bad service
review: The food was very good, but our waitress Eve was horrible. She complained about not getting enough tip and sad that we didn't tip her the last time even dough I have been there for the first time that night. Never go there again thanks...to Eve!More

title: Excellent sushi fun atmosphere
review: I've never had an unpleasant dining experience here however sometimes it's busier here than normal because the locals bring in their entire families during their peak hours typically between 4pm till 6pm. Why is 4pm till 6pm so busy you ask? Well..because it's SUSHI HAPPY...HOUR Monday through Friday at these times and so cocktails and all their maki rolls are half off so it's a bargain to eat here at these times and every sushi roll I try never disappoints. I love their spicy Octopus roll, salmon rolls, tuna rolls, vegetarian based rolls and everything is so clean tasting with great presentation.  If you aren't a fan of tables of families with children then choose a different hour because the half off happy hour is the busiest time and usually single mothers with their children or all the parents will be here.  I'd advise anyone to get here at 4pm and relax, enjoy the good value and the sushi here is very tasty and portions are good.  I'll definitely be here more often once the weather's permits outside seating!More

title: Disappointing, especially compared to other sushi spots in Chicago
review: The sashimi matsu plate ($34) included five or six varieties of fish.  None of them were particularly appetizing.  While the fish seemed fresh, it lacked taste or flavor, and something was off about the texture.  Also, the Miso soup was not hot enough -- and...no, we don't drink scalding coffee.    The Kabocha soup was tasty and worth ordering again, but we do not plan to return.  There are many other positive Trip Advisor ratings; perhaps our experience was a one-off.More

title: Nice dinner
review: This was my first time here. My party of three had a dinner reservation for 5:30pm. We qualified for happy hour half price martinis. As you can see from my pics, I first enjoyed my Geisha martini made with Absolut vanilla vodka, Chambord, coffee liquor,...and pineapple juice normally for $11, but, was only $5.50 due to happy hour. I later enjoyed my Red Taco or Red Octopus made from effen’s vodka, apple schnapps, sweet & sour mix and simple syrup also for $5.50. I enjoyed both martini’s. I should have enjoyed the Red Octopus first because it was less sweet than the Geisha, which was sweeter or more like dessert.  We all enjoyed our shared fried dumpling appetizer. I also enjoyed my spicy ramen. Our total bill was $82.88 less gratuities. Eve was very good to accommodate our table needs. I will return here again during happy hour for more spicy ramen, dumplings, sashimi, or sushi.More

title: Great Japanese food
review: I enjoyed the tempura soba: loved the flavor and the noodles. My 2 rolls were very good as well. Well done!

title: Very good
review: Enjoyed the drinks, atmosphere, service and the food at this sushi and other Japanese food restaurant.

title: Great sushi in a fun environment
review: When I first moved to the neighborhood, Tank Sushi was a mainstay for me. Then it closed and briefly morphed into a Filipino restaurant, which promptly tanked (pardon the pun). Miku Sushi restored some of the same folks who originally created Tank. While Miku is...More

title: Great sushi before a great show
review: We came to the neighborhood because of a show at the Old Town School of Folk Music and were looking for a place nearby.  Good choice!  This place was excellent.  We made reservations but it wasn't really necessary.  It was still pretty early and the...More

title: Where’s the Fish?
review: This restaurants has changed a few times. We didn’t like Tank, but now that it’s Miku, we thought we’d give the spot another try. They have a special where it’s half price if you come in before 6pm.   Well...it’s still bad. The sushi just tasted...More

title: Best sushi and ramen- go for happy hour!
review: This is our favorite place to go for sushi and ramen. Happy hour everyday with half price sushi is the best!

title: Yummy Maki!
review: I'd never had an Uni Shooter-it was so dang good! We also had the Ika Maki.....WOW! The calamari in the roll completely did me in! I want more!

title: Good menu, high quality Japanese fare
review: Miku is an excellent example of a Chicago Japanese restaurant, offering everything from sushi to sashimi and many other Japanese items. Service was assiduous and speedy, the portions were appropriately sized and prepared, and the drinks list a reasonable accompaniment to the food. A good...More

title: Great Neighborhood Sushi
review: Had dinner here. Service was very good and the Sushi was excellent. Shared several Maki rolls all were very good especially the soft shell crab. All the dumplings also very good. Mainly Sushi but also a small hot food menu for those that don't like...More

title: Excellent Ramen
review: I was craving ramen and lamenting the fact that we didn't have a good ramen restaurant in the neighborhood, when my husband looked up Miku and noticed that they offered it. There are two options - regular and spicy roasted garlic miso - and they...More

title: Spicy Miso Garlic Ramen!
review: Love this place. I often go with my wife, but this month they have a special on ramen for $8! So I've even been making solo visits. These are the same folks who ran Tank sushi back in the day. Rolls and nigiri are also...More

title: Delicious!!
review: Definitely get to this restaurant, we'll worth the visit. Food was really brilliant, try the teppanyaki with beef, you will not regret it. Couldn't recommend this place enough!!

title: Great Lunch
review: Wanted to sit outdoors to eat on beautiful weather-September day.   Walking by spotted their menu and was just what I had a taste for ... Miso Soup and Seaweed salad.  Both delicious.  Even their water tasted great!  My companion had Californ I a Roll and...More

title: So Good!!
review: Small plates ar very filling.  Pork belly chips, pork belly buns, goat cheese salad all amazing!  Noodles looked good but I was too stuffed to try them!  Great service.  Cozy seating.  A bit loud for conversation but who wants to talk when the food is...More

title: Great Ramen!
review: I think they have better Ramen than most the trendy Ramen restaurants that have popped up around town in the last few years. The Tonkotsu Ramen is really, really good and really, really rich! They also have a great food happy hour that runs from...More

title: OK, BUT...
review: I love sushi so it's difficult to say anything adverse about Miku.  But it's also difficult to say anything great about it, either.  The flaming dish was interesting to see, but...the service was friendly, but...the decor was ok, but...the desert fried egg rolls with chocolate,...More

title: Sushi for Dummies
review: Unless you like cream cheese in every roll, the title of this review pretty much sums up the sushi at Miku.  There are so many real sushi restaurants in Chicago that this one can easily be skipped.

title: Contemporary, Efficient Staff & Awesome Sushi
review: There are a lot of restaurants in the immediate area of Miku Sushi, but if you enjoy sushi, this is definitely a place to go. There is on-street parking, as well as a parking lot on the other side of the street, so that isn't...More

title: My favorite Sushi of all time
review: This is the best sushi in Chicago.   Ocean Sundae is my all time favorite.  Owner is a doll!  They kept a lot of the dishes from Tank but is opened and better than ever!

title: Beautiful presentation
review: Last night we went out for a goodbye dinner and ordered the large sashimi platter.  When it arrived, it was a glorious sashimi sculpture - a work of art!  We very much enjoyed every bit of it down to the small cucumber fans.   My review...More

title: Sushi is back and better for Lincoln Square
review: There was definitely a major gap once Tank departed the area but luckily previous employees took over the spot and gave the community what it craved. A revamped restaurant all around but still has a few of the old rolls from the Tank days. What...More

title: First.
review: First.  We were literally the first table on opening night, and now I'm the first review on tripadvisor.  I'm going to give it 5 stars for potential.  I'm also comparing it to Tank which was our goto sushi place in Chicago.  Near the end Tank...More

title: Excellent Sushi at Reasonable Prices
review: We always enjoyed Miku's predecessor in this location, Tank Sushi, and were sad to see it go. We tried the new Miku, though, and are equally if not more pleased. The decor is updated, elegant and comfortable. The new menu has an array of absolutely...More

title: Amazing!
review: I'm kind of shocked this place doesn't have more reviews... Let's go people, this place was packed the few times we came!  We stayed at a nearby Airbnb and this was the closest coffee shop and boy am I happy!  The coffee is not ordinary...Dunkin donuts - they have different more exotic brews which were excellent. The bread pudding muffin was delicious and the customized egg sandwich on a bagel was a 10!  The gentleman at the cash register is a gem!  Super nice - super friendly - super helpful. Worth the trip if you're anywhere nearby!More

title: Great Local Brew with Bagels and Breakfast Sandwiches
review: This is a great local spot, just north of the Rockwell train station. Of course they have a wide selection of coffee drinks, but also have a nice spread of muffins, bagels and various bagel breakfast sandwiches. Two seating areas provide plenty of comfort and...space to spread out.More

title: So good but lose the doors
review: Wonderful neighborhood place with delish bagel sandwiches and drinks. Saloon style doors between kitchen and dining area are highly annoying though-very loud and disruptive as staff members walk back and forth. They don’t fit with the vibe and style.

title: Great atmosphere, but expensive
review: The coffee is great and the people who work here are really friendly. It caters to kids; mine enjoyed playing with the plastic dinosaurs while I ordered. Everything costs more than you'd expect for a coffee joint, but it's a nice neighborhood spot, and I...don't mind patronizing the one or two times we hit Jacob Park while we're in town.More

title: Amazing bagels
review: Great neighborhood spot. Awesome bagels and spread along with coffee, tea, donuts, and croissants from Thursday-Sunday (I believe). Highly recommended

title: Nice, but expensive
review: This place came highly recommended by my airbnb host and friends who live in the neighborhood. I don't drink coffee so I can't speak to the beans part, but the bagels, cookies, and other baked goods were delicious. They are a little over priced for...the portion size. The staff was very friendly and overall I would recommend it if you are in the area.More

title: Wonderful coffee shop!
review: We were staying in that area over the weekend and made a trip there 3 mornings in a row. Great service, very friendly and the lattes were amazing!! I loved this little cafe and their bagels and donuts were great too. Very quaint with a...small town feel.More

title: Good coffee and bagels
review: I usually stop here when running errands in the area.  I enjoy both their regular coffee and espresso drinks.  They also have pretty good bagels and bagel sandwiches.  Good stuff.

title: Good Coffee House in an Interesting Setting
review: The service is warm and friendly, the ambiance is arty and local, the food is carefully prepared, and it's reasonably priced.

title: Quality, fresh, strong coffee, bargain price
review: This corner shop attracts lots of walk-ins from Ravenswood neighborhood, many sipping bargain coffee while surfing free WiFi in the pleasant room next door. In nice weather, it's pleasant to sit outside at the picnic table or chairs.  Bagels and pastries are popular, but I...haven't tried them yet.  Beans by the pound and coffee filters, pots, etc. are for sale here.  Servers are friendly.More

title: Local Coffee Joint
review: Sustainable products, good breakfast food, fresh pastries! What more could you ask? Seating... sure, they have a room next door with wifi!

title: Great bagels, every time!
review: Service use to be questionable/terrible....but now!  Friendly and more pleasant to come to.  LOVE their lox bagel...ANY bagel and they always give you more than plenty of cream cheese ;0)  When I come visit this is my every day stop ;0)

title: Not quit right. Blame the hats.
review: Just. . . Can't . . . Quite get it right. Way too slow, manage to mess up at least one aspect of  your order every time. Maybe the stocking caps are too tight. Seriously, either the coffee is wrong, or they forget the bagel....More

title: not your Starbucks
review: I love this coffee shop for several reasons:   1. it has great coffee. They don't over roast the beans and the coffees (light and dark) are generally flavorful and smooth tasting.  2. the pastries are really good. Apparently they have a french? pastry chef from...More

title: Sandwiches are huge and...
review: Sandwiches are huge and tasty. Good coffee. Dining area is quiet and kid friendly.

title: Late night eats
review: Awesome tacos and they're open late. The price is very reasonable a great place to grab some tacos. I love the Kung Fu chicken and bacon brownie. They also have Gluten free options

title: Tacos and Nachos In A Bag!
review: This place is great fun. The idea, taking the best part of a taco out of the shell and putting it in a bag. Genius! We tried The Big Jim Reeves, Cheeseburger Nachos and The Cuban. Made fresh when ordered, all of these selections were...great! And so easy to eat! The store is great fun, too. Take a few minutes to check out the Taco Thief wall art. And then, there is the Unicorn Tears bottled water. There is something fun to see and read all over the store. Can't wait to return!More

title: Nachos With a Twist
review: I ordered The Angry Bird & Cheeseburger Nachos. The food was fresh and hot. Doughnuts are cooked onsite.

title: Taco in a bag
review: Went here for lunch.  First of all the customer service was excellent. I got the angry bird, so good. Great location. Totally worth eating here. :)

title: Cool Idea!
review: Chicago is known for its food, and you need to add this joint to your list of must places to eat! The name, Taco in a Bag, sounds funky on its own. What you get or Gourmet nachos in a bag. I have The Cheeseburger,...complete with fries on top. And it tasted just like it said, ... a cheeseburger, but in a bag! The shop is located in a little funky hipster area of town with lots of bars and other eateries nearby and very walkable. So it makes for an enjoyable evening out. Only in Chicago can you eat out of a bag!More

title: Kids loved the Taco in a Bag
review: We saw that Taco in a Bag had recently been opened at 4603 N. Lincoln Ave. in Chicago in the Lincoln Square area, so we decided to give them a try.  The staff was very efficient.  The tacos were a bit different as they are...sacks of tortillas with a variety of toppings.  We ordered the cheeseburger nachos and the angry bird.  The grandkids loved the names and the interior decor.  The tacos (or gourmet nachos) that we had were tasty.  We also tried an order of donut holes and they were pretty good, as well.  The prices are reasonable.  The big downside is that parking isn't always easy in this area.More

title: Interesting Concept
review: Have been trying to get Trip Advisor to update the address of Taco in a Bag from the Dundee location to its current location on N. Lincoln Avenue.   First thing to know it that this is street parking on Lincoln Avenue... no free parking. You...will need to get a parking sticker from one of the machines to put on your dashboard.   When we arrived there was no one else in the restaurant. Fortunately several more people came in and a few orders were picked up for takeout.  From what I understand Taco in a Bag is basically high end nachos with all of the ingredients placed in a bag. They have about 8 options for the taco in a bag. They have names like the "Big Jim Reeves, Cheeseburger Nachos, The Norberto, The Angry Bird" etc.  Some of the meat ingredients are chorizo, ground beef, chicken thighs, and more. They even have gluten free and a few vegetarian options. They also have Salads in a Bag and some dessert options.   I only gave this an average because it seemed that there were more corn chips in the bag than anything else. The other ingredients when I found them were good, but the major ingredient were the nacho chips.  We also had the Donuts in a Bag for dessert. These took several minutes to prepare. We had the Nutella donuts. When they arrived there was a big glob of whipped cream over the 5 donut holes. Wish I had known that. Since the donuts were hot the whipped cream started to melt and make a soupy mess. There was a drizzle of Nutella over the hot donuts, but it tasted more like chocolate sauce.  The interior of the restaurant looked like it was straight out of the Aqua teen hunger force cartoon. They only serve soft drinks and I do not know if it's a BYOB or not. When we were there we did not see anyone with any adult beverages.  I can now say I have been to Taco in a Bag on Lincoln Avenue, but I won't be in any rush to return.More

title: Don't Look Inside The Bag
review: I ordered a Cuban and a Norberto to go, and one week later, I ordered the same thing to stay.  Both ways are slamming' good.  The only negative is that on a take out bag, it does not look nearly as good as eating in....Also, the Cuban is hands down the best bag they have.  I also sampled a Mac Daddy; the cheese sauce was too much. Worth the trip for the Cuban (the Norberto was pretty good too!)More

title: NEW LOCATION - same great taste!
review: This place was awesome! If you are in Chicago, visiting or living be sure to hit this place up on North Lincoln ave! Patrick was an awesome addition to our visit, had great conversation and amazing tacos in a bag! All the sauces are hand...made, the combination of tastes is incredible, we would eat here often if we lived in Chicago! Thank you for such a fun stop in our travels!More

title: Great taste.
review: It was sad to see what everybody was eating at the food court with this gem right next to the other "chain" restaurants.  Excellent food.  I was skeptical at first but once I tasted it, I was impressed.  I got the signature "Big Jim" and...all the ingredients were fresh. Chips were from scratch, not like those typical Nacho chips. Onions and sour cream. Tastes melded together great.  I highly recommend this restaurant.More

title: Check out this hidden culinary gem while you can
review: Hidden deep in the Spring Valley Mall food court, Taco in a Bag is around for a limited time only. The proprietors landed on this spot after winning a reality show food contest and plan to relocate to a new concept in March 2015 when...More

title: Wow
review: I had no idea what to expect by a place owned by a competitive eater in a mall.  I can only say that it was great.  It is truly food served in a space age looking bag.  Here's the thing, the food was so tasty...More

title: Good thai food.
review: Nice little neighborhood place. Bare bones interior. Nothing special. Parking is difficult to find. Can get busy.

title: Yes?  No... maybe?
review: A bit west of my neighborhood, on Damen Ave, this smallish spot was suggested my a friend.  For a Friday night, there were few customers. The room  was visually dominated by very large round ceiling lamps.  The space was all white, with white resin chairs...and tables.  Thai restaurants are ubiquitous in the city, thus the competition must be strong.  Compared to similar spots, however, the offerings were somewhat limited.  No mee krob, or tud mun, or papaya salad, so I settled for a spinach rangoon.  I like small dishes, but these  six fried dumplings were tiny.  My "special" pad thai was made with bean thread (transparent noodles)  It did not significantly alter the dish.  Just pad thai.  My friend had a ground chicken and basil, a tad peppery hot, with brown rice.  In this case, white rice would have been better.  .  Our server did not speak much, if at all--s(he) was mechanically efficient--understandable since no other server was present.More

title: Say Yes to the Thai
review: Enjoyed dinner with friends who live in Ravenswood and dine here often. The food was excellent, and the owners very friendly. They don't serve alcohol but you can bring your own bottle of wine. They served it for us and I don't recall a corking...fee on the bill.  Modern, light, comfortable decor. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We shared our food and agreed that it was way above average. Terrific food and great service is a win-win.More

title: Great ambiance and Thai food
review: We chose Thai food, as we were looking for something light.  We were glad that we decided upon Yes Thai.  The restaurant is located just north of Foster Ave. on the east side of Damen Ave.  There is no parking lot, so street parking is...what you will get.  The restaurant doesn't seat that many people, so it shouldn't be a problem.  The interior of Yes Thai is very contemporary and nicely appointed.  The tables are set-up for mostly twos, though they can be pushed together as needed.  A family-run restaurant, our server was very attentive and efficient.  We ordered two appetizers.  The first was the baby egg rolls which was six smaller egg rolls filled with ground shrimp & chicken with a tasty sweet & sour dipping sauce.  We also ordered a seaweed salad which was on chilled cucumbers with a sweet & sour vinaigrette.  Our entree was the special Pad Thai.which was stir-fried glass (bean) noodles, egg, green onion, bean sprouts, crushed peanuts and lime with chicken and two shrimp.  We thought everything was quite tasty and because of the light Thai food and sharingthe food, it turned out to be a good choice for a lighter & later dinner.  I'm sure that we'll be back.More

title: Okay at Best
review: Listen - we went there because it was recommended by a local. It looked cute from the outside and we were told it was a family owned business with amazing food.   What we got- yes, cute atmosphere but... disheveled service, meh food (and I really...mean meh), and a forgettable dining experience if it weren't for the company we were surrounded by.   There was a line for pickup, for takeout, and they were horrible understaffed for any of it. As a huge supporter of local and small businesses, I still expect a certain level of excellence which were not met at Yes Thai.   Sorry!   :/More

title: Best Thai!!!
review: Love this Place!! The Crab Rangoon and Pot Stickers are amazing! If your in the Damen/Foster area.... Definitely check it out!

title: brief but interesting
review: My meal was not as good as I was hoping for. I usually have expectations that the food is going to have a price to good tasting ratio. I ordered the ginger chicken and it came with a few things in it that I hadn't...had in my thai food normally. Maybe they gave me the wrong order but I was disappointed by the taste somewhat. I went on a saturday for lunch and I can say I have had better at other thai places in Chicago that are not ranked as high on the tripadvisor list.More

title: Fabulous Food!
review: Fresh, rich, delicious Thai food in a modern café environment. Not one bad bite in the entire meal. We arrived and were greeted by a family member (running the business) who was setting out fresh flowers for the evening. He let us know that they...do not have an ALC lic, but directed my husband and our friend to the corner liquor store to BYOB back. The liquor store had a great selection, so they came back happy!  We started with cucumber salad, and crispy spring rolls and then had Pad Thai, Pad See Ew and a sweet curry with crispy noodles (Not red or green curry, I forget what the third type is called) Anyway, I had never had fried noodles with Thai, and it was very rich, but very delicious!!! Enjoy!More

title: Tasty Thai.
review: Yes was my first experience with Thai food. Growing up in the neighborhood, I saw the restaurant change about 50 times before anything stuck. From Serbian food to hot dogs, nothing survived long. Yes moved in and was an instant success. I recall my first...meal there, Chicken Pad Woon Sen. Tender glass noodles in a bowl with chopped chicken, scallions, carrot, and scrambled egg. Total comfort food, but not too heavy. Served with a tall glass of super sweet Thai Iced Tea and a little square of Egg Custard for desert. So glad to see they are still doing well.More

title: Quick Bite
review: Great place that looks modern, BYOB, great food and even better prices!   Nice little place that always delivers with great food and service. I love the fact that this place is family run, I think that is why we can taste the love in the...food.More

title: Fresh Thai food
review: Nice clean atmosphere. Restaurant has most tables for a party of two. Fresh food and large portions. Definitely recommended.

title: Good Thai Food
review: My first time here.  The place is small, comfy, mostly white color, and attentive staff.  Good location on Damen and Foster.  Gluten free and vegetarian on request.  No alcohol sold. Fair prices... Give it a try!!

title: clean, comfy, yum yum thai!
review: food is awesome, savory and addicting. location is brill. staff are hospitable. everything is white.   you have to try the crab rangoon and green curry. pad thai. hehe! try everything!   i have a monthly date with my best gal at yes thai.

title: Superb!
review: This is by far the best Thai food that I have had in the states thus far. The location is in a great location, in love the vibrant atmosphere of the seating area.  Very trendy and peaceful at the same time.

title: Favorite Thai Restaurant
review: Being new to the area (and Chicago) I was in desperate need of finding good Thai food, and this was the obvious solution since it was within walking distance.  After my first experience I was hooked.  The food is unfailingly fantastic every time as is...More

title: Very Good Thai in Ravenswood
review: Very happy to have found this Thai eatery in my new Ravenswood neighborhood.  The Entrees were not only prepared with obvious care and very tasty, but had some rather unique and distinctive flavors.   Also, seemingly rare these days, the dishes which we asked for 'spicy'...More

title: Excellent Thai fusion and authentic Thai food and very reasonably priced.
review: Excellent Thai fusion and authentic Thai food and very reasonably priced.

title: A great lunch and takeout thai restaurant, near my neighborhood. Love it.
review: A great lunch and takeout thai restaurant, near my neighborhood. Love it.

title: GREAT!!!
review: Great food, very reasonable.  For 4 adults, with 2 appitzers (large portions) our bill was around $40.  The other great thing about YES is it is a BYOB!!!  (there is NO corkage charge)  Very nice inside, serve was the best!

title: Can't be beat for cheap...
review: Can't be beat for cheap and tasty

title: excellent and affordable
review: excellent and affordable

title: The BEST THAI FOOD IN CHICAGO!!!!!!!! Food = Excellent, Service = A+++, Servers = Extremely Hot &amp...
review: The BEST THAI FOOD IN CHICAGO!!!!!!!! Food = Excellent, Service = A+++, Servers = Extremely Hot & Goodlooking  Check this place out!!! :-)

title: Outstanding Pastries! A must place to visit in Chicago!
review: My wife & I haven’t been to Chicago in eight years, so we went to Chicago for a mini vacation the week of 9/27/21. One place we had to stop by was Lutz Café & Pastry Shop to pick up some pastries to bring home...and also have some at midnight at the hotel!  Lutz’s started in 1948 and is a great pastry shop & café. One of my favorites is their Hazelnut Log! It is light and delightful.   If you have not been there, it is well worth a try.More

title: Pretty good pastries.  Nice a fresh
review: Had several pastries.  Chocolate mousse was outstanding.  Light and rich.  Fresh fruit tart was nice when eaten separately but the crust was way to thick to eat together.  Could not easily cut crust with fork and get both fruit and crust, but each separately were...excellent.  A little thinner crust would be better.  Whipped cream was fabulous.   Eclair was excellent and well made.More

title: Pastries OK
review: it's been a while since i visited lutz.  dropped by to pickup up a few pasties.  lemon log & orange mandarin roll were good.  napoleon was a bit hard for my taste. service was pleasant.

title: Viennese coffee service with pastries
review: Coffee was pretty good but the Black Forrest pastrie and Naploean seemed old. The pastries were very well made but just tasted like they had been sitting too long. Tables were not cleaned well nor the bathroom.

title: Happy it has survived
review: This is an old line Chicago, European bakery. It was one of many, now a survivor. It was always a place of beautiful marzipan creations. It is not your typical corner bakery. It has retained it's sort of 50's era charm. At the same time...it could use a bit if tasteful brightening up. Mainly the painted over wood paneling is a bit depressing. The offering compensate and then some. So just be happy it's still thriving and indulge.More

title: Ideal place to start the day
review: Went to Lutz for the first time on Saturday and loved it! Their Venetian/Austrian coffee service is perfect!

title: Cookies, Cakes And Pastries Oh My
review: It is hard to go wrong at this bakery. The cakes and pastries are outstanding. Most of the cookies are good, but some were dry. They even have chocolates and coffee, which I didn't try. But, I would go back.

title: Beat coffee
review: Order the coffee service. It is amazing. Service was great. Quiche was some if the best I have had. Pastries were great too.

title: Not for Calorie counters.
review: Cute little café, great food. Tortes and cakes are lovely, my absolute favorite Black Forest cake. So many to choose from, driving the extra distance for one of their cakes is well worth it.

title: Delicious pastries
review: Th dark chocolate sea salt candy is delicious as was the chocolate eclair and chocolate mouse cake. Also tried the cherry strudel which was yummy

title: Nice bakery
review: Lutz use to have more varieties of pasteries and many use to be made with marzipan. Today I only saw 1 pastery with marzipan and it was very good. Their Apple sheet Pasteur was very delicious.

title: Great coffee
review: The coffee is great! The chocolate croissant was devine.  Everything was wonderful and highly recommend it.

title: Just OK
review: Haven't been to Lutz in many years, so we stopped in for dessert and coffee last week while in town.  While staff was cheerful and service was good that evening the pastries we had were at best hit and miss.  Napoleon was so dry you...More

title: Lutz still keeps its cakes consistancy but looses in other pastries and closing the restaurant
review: Being a Northsider from Chicago trying other Cakes I think nothing can compare to Lutz. It has been a family tradition when my mom worked across the street and would buy these cakes for special occasions. As I got older I did like going there...More

title: Disappointed
review: They sell restaurant. com certificates but wing redeem them for pastries. Nowhere in the coupon did it state you must dine in OR they are limited to nonpastry items. I use these coupons often without any trouble until now. I haven't tasted the pastries yet...More

title: European pastry
review: I can recommend this bakery if your looking for old world bakery that has been in Chicago for over fifty year will not disappoint you. It's well worth the experience along with great pastry, and coffee too!

title: Lutz disappoints now
review: Haven't visited Lutz in years,  but decided to drop by to try their pastries.......Boy did they disappoint... Selection is limited now & pastries are now the quality of what you'd get a the grocery store.......This place was the best many years back...but I guess new...More

title: Lutz has gone downhill
review: We had been visiting this bakery frequently over the past couple of years.  We live in a suburb of Chicago and traveled quite a distance to go there.  In the last few months we have been bringing home baked goods that are half the size...More

title: Dissapointed with the current owners
review: Very disappointed with the current owners,  Our family had been going there since the early 60's and the German food was great, but now it has failed to meet expectation.  Also the parties are very "Lard" like in taste, nothing like the fresh parties that...More

title: Nice dessert spot
review: Went here after having lunch and shopping with friends. Nice  little cafe for having tea and dessert and chit chat with friends. They have sandwiches and salads which we didnt know...we will try next time we meet. Great gem of a place.I will definitely go...More

title: Recipes changed for the worse
review: I have been a customer for over 40 years.  Lutz has had ups and downs as the management has changed.  I stopped in last week and had some terrible sachet torte. They are now using cake frosting instead of dark chocolate and have ommitted the...More

title: Herr Lutz is Rolling in His Grave
review: Where to begin... I was so excited about coming here. I used to come here with my mom, who is from Germany, along with my aunts, uncles, and grandparents when they visited us from Germany. My visits date back from the very early 1970's. What...More

title: Apple Strudel
review: Stopped here for cake and coffee after Dim Sum and a driving tour of the city.  We bought an Apple Strudel for later and stayed for cake and coffee. The service was friendly and the coffee service was like in Europe (small pot of coffee,...More

title: quaint and nice food
review: Server was very friendly and checked up on us constantly, even though she was clearly getting busy as the place filled up. Ordered chx/mushroom crepe and goulash. Crepe was very interesting and satisfying, while goulash was just ok.  Tea and coffee service was nice, and...More

title: Not like it used to be
review: When we were growing up, Lutz's had fabulous pastries and delicious food. Obviously things have changed. We stopped and bought a napolean and an eclair a few weeks ago. Both were soggy and filled not with custard, as they should be, but with some sweet...More

title: Very nice little bakery & cafe that has been around since 1948
review: This past weekend my wife and I were in Chicago and had to stop by Lutz's for some of their pastries. They have a nice little cafe area to eat in although most people buy pastries to take home. Try their Marzipan Torte or their...More

title: Expensive
review: Lutz has gone downhill,the cake slices I purchased were ver average and EXPENSIVE, at 4.99 each they were small and had little taste. I am very disappointed.

title: Fantastic Old World Pastry after a Goulash Lunch
review: Lutz Pastry has been a favorite since the 60's.  Staying with family on a visit back home and had lunch at Lutz for the first time in over 20 years.  The waitress asked, "did you used to come in here a lot a long time...More

title: Service charge shock!
review: The Lutz Continental Cafe and Pastry was easy for our GPS to find and parking was easy.  The service was fine.  Lunch entrees were very good but nothing particularly special.  The server sampled the baumkuchen, which was the reason for the trip.  For a birthday...More

title: Delicious and Amazing
review: Saw a food network piece on their Baumkuchen and just had to try it. Family moved to a new house nearby, so we took a walk today and had lunch and desserts! The waitress was extremely nice, friendly and took our order promptly. Food was...More

title: i want to return in the summer and sit out on the patio.  german pastries.  inside is table clothes, small tables, and...
review: i want to return in the summer and sit out on the patio.  german pastries.  inside is table clothes, small tables, and they bring you coffee in the little silver pots.  They warm up your selections and then bring them out to your table on...More

title: I've only tried their cakes and they are awesome. Got my wedding cake here, did a great job and will actually make the...
review: I've only tried their cakes and they are awesome. Got my wedding cake here, did a great job and will actually make the top layer for 1 yr anniversary for free; just save your original invoice!  Best idea...

title: Miss the "old" Lutz Cafe
review: I grew up in the Lincoln Square neighborhood and moved to Skokie in 1966.  The old "German" area continues to bring back some very fond memories...two of which are the holiday season at Lutz's and  Meyer's Delicatessen on Lincoln. I moved to Wisconsin in 1995...More

title: Average and a bit Overpriced
review: We (party of 4) ate at Carbon Arc before a concert this past weekend.   We ordered appetizers -- hummus, brussel sprouts, beer nuggets -- all good but not outstanding. Waitress didn't know anything about beer and couldn't provide suggestions.  I think that it's really important...for all serving staff to receive some training on beer/alcohol if they want to provide the best service.   I ordered the grain salad with chicken.  I didn't expect the chicken to be cold. Blackened chicken would have made this salad so much better. Overall, our food was adequate -- not particulaly outstanding or special.  Prices seemed to be a little too high for what we received.  Wine prices were way out of line so we skipped the wine. I do think it's nice that the restaurant is attached to a theater.  The Arc would be a better place for families rather than couples/friends who want an intimate and/or specialized experience.More

title: Comfortable Family Lunch Spot
review: Late afternoon lunch in Lincoln Square and a hungry family group found a welcome landing spot.  Burgers of all types and french fries with the perfect salt to crunch ratio pleased the younger set.  Fish tacos and a variety of salads with protein worked for...those of us less excited about burgers.  The dining environment during the day is light and bright and the service high energy and welcoming.  The televisions around the dining area were showing old movies and the Cubs game all at a volume that could be heard without overpowering the room.  This casual, comfortable environment was exactly what we were looking for Saturday afternoon.  The timing of our late lunch found the establishment almost empty except for a few couples enjoying an afternoon cocktail so no competition for service.  Overall a very positive dining experience.More

title: Food-great!  Service-not great!
review: Boy, I hate to leave 3 stars but I feel the awful service warrants a 2 star reduction.  The food was fantastic-great location, cool vibe, comfortable seating.  We sat at the bar-2 of 4 total people in the space (one of which was a child)...Easy crowd for the bartender/server, we are not demanding and totally chill folk, never difficult but dang you would have thought we were invisible. I would understand if the place was busy but it was not the night we were there. Made me sad as truly the food was delicious but the service made us feel unwelcomed.  Will give it another try with the hopes it was just an off night for those working..More

title: Great for kids and their parents
review: A great place in Lincoln Square for family gatherings or quick bites. The Davis Theater hook-up (it's literally next door, but attached) is a major bonus. Good food, nice atmosphere, pleasant outdoor seating area on Lincoln Ave. Burgers may not be best in the city,...but they are fine. A totally unpretentious place. And the kids menu is better than most (this in a neighborhood that centrally caters to families).More

title: Mediocre at best
review: Went to Carbon Arc after a film at the Davis Theater. Dinner food was mediocre at best. Although the menu was promising, we were both disappointed. We ordered the pot roast, which turned out to be tough cubes of beef in a jus with bacon...(artificial?), baby carrots (hard), and potatoes (tiny slivers). It didn’t seem roasted, but rather re-heated. Fairly inedible. We also ordered some bread, which turned out to be a small loaf, freshly baked: VERY good. But otherwise not worth the fairly steep prices.More

title: Delicious food, great service & outrageous entertainment!
review: We were late going out to dinner and found Carbon Arc which was actually open to 10:00 p.m.  Parking on the street can be a bit tough, so we ended up parking in the public lot about a block north.  Carbon Arc is contemporary &...modern.  There is an entrance in front and you can actually enter from the Davis Theater without going outside.  We were seated immediately and were advised by the manager that they had 90's trivia bingo from 9 - 10 p.m.  Our server, Alex K., was friendly and efficient.  She brought our menus and took our drink order.  They had a daily special of a mashburger with French fries, so we did try that.  We also ordered a bowl of cream of mushroom soup with peas.  The burger was huge.  The soup was in a huge bowl and came with two biscuits.  We were still eating when the trivia bingo started and it turned out to be "drag queen bingo".  Well, the "queens" were fun and kept the full restaurant laughing.   During the first break, we ordered a piece of carrot cake which turned out to be a substantial piece.  Though we finished the burger by sharing it, we were unable to finish the soup & biscuits and the carrot cake.  There was more than enough leftover for another meal.More

title: Immediately connected to the Davis Theater  - the food was really good
review: We came from the Davis Theater and decided to stop for dinner at Carbon Arc, since it was right next door to the Theater.  In fact, there is a door from the lobby of the Davis Theater in to the Carbon Arc restaurant.  We were...seated immediately.  The restaurant has great ambiance and is contemporary or modern.  Our server was there immediately for our drink order and to provide us with menus.  We went with a cup of loaded baked potato soup, which was made with faux bacon, bit it actually tasted very good.  We also ordered the Merkts burger which is two smashburgers topped with Merkts pub cheese, BBQ sauce and real crispy bacon.  The burger also came with French fries which turned out to be very good.  Now, to be fair, I'm not necessarily a fan of smashburgers, as I prefer my burgers to be a 1/2 lb. of juicy, medium rare delight.  The burger did taste really good.  For dessert, we ordered a chocolate chip cookie dough egg-roll which came with a scoop of chocolate ice cream.  It was warm and it was rich.  Our server, Andrea, was excellent, efficient and friendly.  Before or after a movie, for lunch or dinner, we'll be back.More

title: Evening with family and friend
review: Two of us had ribs, two of us had the steak salad and the fifth had a large salad with chicken. The beers were great and the wine delicious. The service was excellent and we all had a great time. Were seated immediately even though...our reservation was a 1/2 hr late and only 4 of us were there. Must do again to try other entrees!More

title: Good Food, Slightly High Cost
review: My husband and I have visited Carbon Arc a couple of times for a meal before attending a movie at Davis Theater. It is a great option if you are short on time before your show for a drink and a bite to eat as...they are connected. However, make sure you give yourself ample time before the show as the food is served restaurant style and is not a quick order-and-go type place. The food is tasty if a tad over priced.  It is also not the most portable to take into the theater (this is an option on some dishes). The bar is great and they definitely give you your money's worth!!More

title: Dinner and a Movie
review: Good fare, unique food and pairings.  We had the combination board (charcuterie and cheeses).  The cheeses are not average, and may surprise you, but they go well with the various meats, pickled onions, mustard, and olives.  Keep and open mind.  Oh, and the warm bread....VERY good. I had the Prosciutto and Melon salad, which comes with a whipped brie.  Excellent!More

title: Chalkboard chicken worth the trip
review: The chalkboard chicken is outstanding: fried, with a coating that tastes a little buffalo-sauce like but not nearly as hot and some celery/Old Bay Seasoning elements. Crispy skin. Juicy chicken. Fresh made cole slaw. My partner got tacos which I didn't get to taste because...More

title: Handy restaurant before movie at Davis
review: I only ate here once. Pleasant staff, nice atmosphere and great for a meal before or after a movie at the attached Davis Theater. I had the Chalkboard Chicken, a fried chicken dish served with cole slaw, biscuits, and sausage gravy. One of the better...More

title: Brilliant!
review: What a great concept.  Our local and beloved Davis movie theater was recently restored to it's original beauty which was great all by itself.  However, the owners added a bar/restaurant to the location (Carbon Arc) which was a brilliant move!  They have a full bar...More

title: Birthday Celebration with 16 people
review: Terrible service, unprofessional & dismissive manager, food quality average, know Spanish if you go.

title: The best
review: I’m Colombian from New York and I can tell you best food ever next time  we visit Chicago  pueblito viejo is a mandatory stop my wife and my self love you place

title: Not a Mexican place - Colombian
review: Had a wonderful dining experience at Peublito Viejo.  Apparently it gets very festive later so we went early, not caring to indulge in the dancing, etc.  Very heavily decorated ceiling and walls, but the food is the attraction.  Great skirt steak, sides, and appropriate beverages....Our server, Carlos was great at explaining the dishes and his enthusiasm was not an exaggeration.More

title: Great restaurant!!!
review: A fun place to celebrate any occasion.  Great food. We celebrated a birthday and they really made the   birthday person feel very special, the music and dancing was so much fun!! I highly recommend Pueblito Viejo!!!

title: Excellent time !
review: After too many recommendations  from friends we decided visit this restaurant , Was our first time and seriously what a great experience , excellent service from Carlos he explained us every single dish , and he wasn’t wrong our food was really really delicious  I...can’t  wait to come back I love Colombian food now  ! I really recommend this  Restaurant !!More

title: Brunch with Colombian taste
review: I go to the place a few times a year, mainly for dinner, but the last time I was pleasantly surprised by solid enhancement in service and quality at lunch (brunch). We were served by Carlos Vera, a very knowledgeable and nice server that made...the difference. He recommended the great dishes for the day like "Bandeja Paisa", beans, rice, steak, plantain and arepas. The appetizers with yuca, empanadas and plantain were equally fabulous. The fruit juices (lulo) were also tasty and good. We loved the breaded chicken (the famous Milanesa) and all the sides of rice, yuca and sweet plantain were equally good. Strongly recommend the place not only for dinner (where there is music) but also for lunch.More

title: Delicious!!
review: First time at this restaurant and also first time eating Colombian food and I must say it was delicious. There was a group of 10 that went on Mother's day. Yes there was a wait but the food smelled so good we didn't mind. We...ordered empanadas, beef and chicken for appetizers, you must try these if you go. They are little fried pockets of heaven. I ordered steak, rice, beans and a small fried cornmeal bread came with the meal. Everything was so good, we ate going back in a couple weeks. The space is dark and cozy but definitely worth the visit. There is a small dance floor if you want to get your groove on. Very nice atmosphere.More

title: First night dinner
review: Asked our Uber driver about a great local place and this is where he took us. The food was amazing! The service was great! The atmosphere and decorations were so very festive.More

title: Road trip for a meal
review: Awesome food!!! Well worth the 2hr dive we did to eat here. Off the street parking is limited. It is across the street from the police department.

title: Good Colombian food
review: In our trip to Chicago we couldn't pass a good Latin food, this restaurant was great, delicious  fruit juice,  and the bandeja paisa, the picada and the fish were to die for. I will recommend this place 110% the server Jorge was friendly, funny and...Great serviceMore

title: Great atmosphere with outstanding music and good typical Colombian food
review: My wife and I went to have dinner on a Friday night to this very nice Colombian restaurant. The Menu has very typical Colombian dishes like empanadas, fruit juices from Colombia, picadas, very nice   "bandeja paisa", and multitude alcoholic drinks. The food was very good...More

title: Good time
review: Waiters A plus! Edgar and David are winners! Manager was great and smelled good, as well. Decor, kind of scary yet interesting. Very dim lights, but made the ambiance nice. Good was great for our first experience, especially the sweet plaintains and hot wings, along...More

title: Friends Gathering
review: Came with a group of friends here for a birthday gathering, it is a nice place , food is good , servers were nice, good music, nice place for group of friends to gather and enjoy.More

title: Mixed review
review: Pueblito Viejo could be a much better restaurant if it was not for a few things... On the plus side, the food is good, and our waiter was very nice. On the other hand, the restaurant does not offer any glasses of water (first I...More

title: SKIP IT!. Management is rude, bad Colombian food. Baseball caps not allowed.
review: We have the editor of one of the largest Hispanic Publications as a guest at our table. When he showed up he was wearing a baseball cap and was asked to take it off. He politely indicated that all the men in the next table...More

title: Walk on past this place...
review: I wish I could give this place ZERO stars.  Bad food; bad atmosphere; discriminatory.  I ordered a dish that sounded very good on the menu, but when it arrived everything was deep fried and hard including the rib portion which had bone in it.  Even...More

title: Great colombian food
review: I love this restaurant everyone is friendly the food is great and fast. Well if the place is full  you have to wait a little but is well worth the wait. Thank you pueblito viejo for your great food prices and service your friends from...More

title: Fun fare and good ambiance
review: This one of a few Colombian restaurants in the Chicagoland area. While I have been to its cousin in the Southport Area, Pueblito Viejo has a friendlier staff, and the management, headed by Wilson, does go out of its way to cater to the diner's...More

title: Like shopping at a grocery store
review: Baker Miller in Logan Square is the kind of bakery that has resorted to takeout and delivery during the global pandemic, which forces customers to make difficult decisions and go home with a grocery store cart-like accumulation of sandwiches, soups, pastries, breads, pies and smoothies....Located at 4655 North Lincoln Avenue, south of Lawrence, in the Logan Square neighborhood, it is open from 8 to 3 Thursday through Monday and uses its own flour in baked goods and grain-focused sandwiches. How about tomato and herb or broccoli cheddar soup? A blueberry banana smoothie? Loaves of sourdough or sunflower rye or fluffy white bread? Take and bake biscuits and cinnamon rolls?  Cups of Black Dog Gelato? Pumpkin muffins, blueberry oat muffins, scones, chocolate chip cookies? Pumpkin, cherry, pecan, key lime, caramel apple or whiskey caramel chocolate pecan pies? Roast turkey sandwich? I highly recommend the Patty Melt with a six-ounce beef patty, creamy white American cheese, caramelized onions and Baker Miller's special sauce on a brioche bun and the Reuben with house-made sliced pastrami, sauerkraut, creamy Swiss cheese and house-made Russian dressing on sunflower rye bread. And don't forget a pint of chocolate chip cookie dough.More

title: Mediocrity at a premium price
review: Migrated from Lincoln Square to 4655 North Lincoln Avenue after a lease dispute in 2018 Baker Miller is no stranger to turmoil, and amidst a global pandemic the concept from Megan Miller and husband David has resorted to take-out only from 8am until 3pm Thursday...through Monday.  Officially titled Baker Miller Bakery & Dinette, a combination café and mill house from former Bang Bang Pie employees that debuted in 2014, much of the Miller’s early praise came from house-ground Grains, hand-milled Flour and Chicago’s first “Toast Bar,” while critiques of both price and inconsistency have also been commonplace.  Using online or walk-up ordering during COVID-19, staff appropriately donning PPE but inattentive-bordering-on-rude while waiting for two slices of Bread to be toasted, it was on a nearby bench that the Miller’s goods were eaten, buttered naturally-leavened Sourdough an immediate highlight thanks to both tanginess and crumb while a $3.75 Biscuit was arguably underbaked at the bottom but nonetheless enjoyable.   Trying hard not to focus on prices, David and Megan’s commitment to their craft most certainly commendable, it is hard not to raise an eyebrow at $3.50 for a two-bite Sandwich Cookie that tastes mostly like Sugar, a quarter more for double the amount of Chocolate Chips and perfectly baked Dough faring far better in terms of taste as well as value.  Also performing well with a toothsome Thumbprint Cookie, Strawberry Jam providing just enough sweetness to a blend of Nuts and Oats, those seeking a “signature” item will find it in Baker Miller’s “Doughboy,” the baked round far lighter than a Doughnut and currently dressed like Cinnamon Toast Crunch Cereal clocking in at $4.50 after tax – far better than the more expensive Blueberry Oat Muffin which finds Fruit in a clump at the center of an otherwise flavorless matrix.More

title: Horrible.  I ordered a delivery.  It never came.  I called and called.  No answer.  No way to track order. Horrible
review: Horrible experience with to go order.  Never came and no one to talk to,  Abd bi tracking!   I will never go here again.

title: Overpriced and Average
review: We really want to like this cafe but it it grossly overpriced and just doesn’t support mediocre food. If you are looking for a biscuit sandwich Biscuit Man is significantly better. If you like greasy dense biscuits then BM is your place.

title: Fantastic food and service
review: Heard about the pie and looked this place up.  The menu was interesting so we drove in for brunch.  Wonderful friendly service and tasty food.  The pie is exceptional.

title: My favorite so far
review: Coffee was  ok. The food was amazing. We got pastries and food and nothing disappointed. Make sure to stop here.

title: A hidden & eclectic gem
review: Baker Miller is located on the west side of Western Ave., one block south of the Western C.T.A. Brown Line station.  They are only open for breakfast through lunch.  They are definitely in to  baked goods and there were a number of things that looked...really good, including the cinnamon rolls.  As you walk in, you pick up a menu and choose, then you order at the counter and they'll page you when your food is ready.  An interesting idea is a toaster at every table, along with a small table of jams, jellies and butters.  We ordered the Ben Biscuit and we also ordered the Southern Hash.  Both were tasty.  The prices are a bit high, but the food quality was very good.  The portions were ample, in fact, we took half of the Ben Biscuit and half of the Southern Hash home.  One thing that I couldn't figure out is that there was no soda available.  I'm not sure why not, though there were some higher end beverages.  The staff was friendly and efficient.More

title: Charming neighborhood bakery!
review: This small neighborhood bakery near/at Lincoln Square, a few blocks walk from the Western stop (Brown Line) is worth a visit if one is in the neighborhood.   The BLT and the sourdough cinnamon roll were both excellent!  Wheelchair accessible; small one-stall bathroom in the back...might present some difficulties though.More

title: Great little spot!
review: Had late breakfast with the family and everyone was delighted with their food. Service was quick and friendly and the place was super clean. Will definitely go back.

title: Fresh, Hearty & Delicious
review: Totally different than I had expected. This bakery/restaurant has wonderful, hearty, filling delights created by a passionate, deliberate owner. Everything here is of artisan quality, using fresh milled flours. Dishes were filling & satisfying. Even the coffee was excellent. The breads are interesting & substantial....Had to buy a loaf to take home & still enjoying this marvelous fare! Order at counter & self-service for the rest. Makes you feel a part of a family because of the way you help take care of the establishment.More

title: Delicious is an understatement!
review: The seasonal Apple Cider Doughboy was delicious....fresh milled grits with chorizo, poached egg, greens & tomato jam for breakfast....melt in your mouth delicious!! Portion was filling...I felt bad not finishing all my food. The restaurant is small, simple with posted art for sale by local...More

title: Plenty of good fresh coffee and delicious muffins
review: This is an unpretentious small place in the Lincoln Square neighborhood. The coffee is hot, fresh and very good. The oatmeal is yummy. There is a good variety of muffins, several of which are gluten free. Try the toast sampler! The grains in all the...More

title: Millennial Vibe with "Sweet and Savory" Comfort Food
review: Hidden in plain site, this eponymous (owned and run by the Millers), hard to spot storefront on the West side of Western Avenue, 2 blocks south of the Brown Line, simply has great food. The simple menu has extreme variety from a meatless (!) biscuits...More

title: Delicious bakery in Lincoln Square
review: I highly recommend this place if you are in the area. Fantastic coffee and even better baked goods. They even mill their own flour which you can purchase. They are known for their pies which are amazing as well. Super friendly staff and super quaint...More

title: Very enjoyable lunch
review: My wife and I recently had a very good lunch and a drink on the patio on a warm summer day.  Upon entry we were warmly greeted by the hostess and then  by an informative and helpful server, Jennifer.  The margarita exceeded our expectations and...my wife ordered an avocado salad and I had cheese enchiladas with mushrooms,  rice and beans,  The beans were not  the  least bit harsh and were the best I  have ever tasted,   Both dishes were very tasty and just as our server described,  Portions are very generous and I only finished because the food was so tasty,  The interior of the restaurant  is very large and a bit stark.  Prices are extremely reasonable, I can imagine that it can get hectic when crowded.  We plan to return,More

title: Tucsonan reviews Mexican restaurant.
review: Chips and salsa and margaritas were good.  The food was mediocre at best.  Steak tacos,tostada's and enchiladas were nothing more than ground up hamburger.  Tortillas were ok.  Bottom line...go elsewhere.  By the way, I know Mexican food because I have lived in Tucson for over...40 years.  This place would be out of business in mere days there.More

title: Great Location
review: It's in a great place where taking a walk after dinner takes you through a vibrant neighborhood. The food is standard Mexican fare . . . so if that's your thing, go for it!

title: Good food. BIIIGGGG portions.
review: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the city. The El Pastor Tacos are always my go-tos here. They serve large portions that would fill anyone up. The drinks are also pretty solid, my favorite being the spicy Michelada. Would definitely recommend for couples, or...families with children. The slight downside is that the larger sitting area does get quite loud during busy times.More

title: After Cabo
review: After flying in from Cabo San Lucas decided we needed one last taste of Mexico and Garcia's is where we dine for good Mx good when we are in Chicago.  Best deal on the menu are 2 steak tacos, rice and beans for 8$. Plenty...of food, tasty and affordable. The salsa is very good as are the green sauces ( hot ). As in any restaurant the more alcoholic drinks you have the bill will appropriately increase that's why the good costs are so great.More

title: A margarita bar that has food as a last resort
review: The food is mediocre and the atmosphere is “gringo tourists in unspecified Mexico.”  But the margaritas. The margaritas are good, and cheap, and mean business. Have some margaritas and you won’t even care about food quality.   Plus the service is friendly.

title: Great place for Margarita's
review: The food is cheap and in big portions. I had a burrito, and it was more than enough. The margaritas are also big and good.

title: Slow Lunch. Food cooked properly but not brimming with flavor.
review: Went for a late afternoon lunch during what I always called "the lull".. you know, that time between lunch and dinner where everything is not hectic and the place isn't packed to the gills with a lunch crowd or the early-birds for dinner.  Well, no...host was on, this can kind of be expected for late lunch. The bar was also closed so, no help there. Started walking in and a nice lady asked us to pick any seat we wanted, which we did. The place had maybe four other tables seated.  Waited about three minutes and a lady rushed by dropping off menus, no greeting or hellos.  Waited around for another three-to-five minutes and a lady came by with waters and salsa.  ...another five or so minutes and our waitress came by for our drink order. Knowing this was not going to be the fastest service otherwise, we also ordered food. Her demeanor was pleasant.  So, if this were a normal dinner service in a packed house, these kind of wait times would kind of make sense. But this was a meal during the slowest part of the day where there are people scrounging for work to be done - and I know this because A- I'm observant, and B- I've been working in front of house for 20+ years.  Food got there in another ten mintues (kitchen was on time at least), but then after we were obviously done with our food another fifteen minutes to get the check and another five to resolve it!  Please note, when I say 'obviously done' what I mean is: plates are stacked, napkins piled up in the empty tortilla chip basket. glasses are emptied, all used tableware is sitting on the side of the table to be bussed... we sat like that for those fifteen minutes, trying to make eye contact. One other table had walked in during our visit. they had three servers on. ...Or two and a busser, I'm not completely sure. The water/salsa lady only came by once, and we had to ask for refills on the water when the drinks were brought over.  Service gets a one. I'm sorry Garcia's, you got to step your game up.  The food - the food was, in general, good. Not Very Good, not Average.   The salsa seemed like it was made with a good recipe, a little too much cilantro for my liking but tasty. The chips were hearty and did not easily break. This was the highlight of the meal.  We both ordered a burrito. One al Pastor for me (yay, pork!), one Picadillo, add cheese for the lady. The burritos were standard in sizing, and wrapped well (AKA did not fall apart). The tortillas were thick enough not to rip, but thin enough to not feel like a mouth full of tortilla dough on each bite. The flavors were... OK. Maybe the little bit of heat from the salsa was killing off any hidden, subdued flavors in that meat but I doubt it. My pork had a good combination of texture and it was made right, there was just very little to write home about in the flavor zone. Yes it was pork. Yes it was cooked properly. Yes it was built right. No, it did nothing to make me want to go back and order another one. My lady felt the same about her ground beef.    So, as I said, good? Yes, Very good, no. Average? Probably, but I would like to think it was just an off day. 3.5 out of 5. because the salsa was on point.  Pricing: Good for what you get, I suppose, if you're ignoring the near-blandness of the food. three out of five. We both had an imported 12 oz beer at $4.50 each,  domestic bottles were $3.50. The whole shebang was under $30. Kind of pricey for lunch, but at least the burritos were a good size.  Overall two out of five. I wish I could call this experience "average"... but those were some damned long wait times for food that was just a bit above average. As mentioned beforehand, maybe it was an off-day at Garcia's. I would like to try them again for dinner, maybe some of those famous margaritas they are known for would make a dinner service more enjoyable.More

title: Great Food, Large Portions
review: Service was prompt. Food and drinks were all good. We ordered a pitcher of red sangria. Very good. Highly recommend the queso fundido as an appetizer (melted cheese and chorizo with corn or flour tortillas). The burritos were large and tasty. My husband was happy...with the enchiladas, too. Our son ordered a strawberry milkshake which he said was also very good.More

title: Good mexican food
review: My wife and I visited here for lunch while in town with 2 other couples, and we were pleased with our visit. It took a bit to get seated (even with an empty restaurant), but we were served quickly. The food was great, and the...menu had a great variety, including drinks. Overall we were pleased, and would definitely stop by again if we are in the area again.More

title: Very good Mexican food & fun people watching
review: We came to Garcia's Restaurant on a warm day.  This Garcia's Restaurant is located in Lincoln Square just a few stores south of Lawrence Ave.  There is decent and easy diagonal parking on Lincoln Ave., but there is also a parking lot at the end...More

title: Great lunch option
review: We enjoyed our lunch and felt the price was very reasonable. Corn tortillas were good , on the smaller side so be sure to keep that in mind when ordering tacos.

title: Very Good Food
review: My adult daughter really liked her large ginger margarita and we both enjoyed our dinners.  We both chose a combination plate and found the chicken dishes were the least tasty so we would not order that protein again.  The cheese and the ground beef were...More

title: One of our favorite Mexican restaurants
review: The food is always great and large portions. Atmosphere and service are decent. Great margaritas. We generally go for lunch so we can't speak to the dinner crowd but lunchtime is usually pretty quiet and service is quick.

title: You might try another place.
review: It was busy the night I was there, early on a Sunday evening.  Ignored by the hostess and finally had to go up to her and say hey, I was ahead of the last two parties,   She seated me.   Ordered a Mango Margarita and some...More

title: Great Margaritas
review: The place is a jewel in the neighbourhood. It is amazing place with great food and drinks. And it is always full. You can probably make a reservation but we went there 3 times and there were tables available but naybe we were lucky. The...More

title: Bad service, bad managers, sticky floors... no apologies.
review: Bad service, bad management, rude bartender, sticky floors. And we never made it to the dinner table thanks to all the bad service.  This is a big place with tables lined up in rows like a cafeteria. We made our way into the bar area...More

title: Great food, great value
review: Go here instead of the chain Mexican restaurants.  We started with the gigantic Margaritas made with Patron and lime juice and chips and fresh salsa on the side - very picant and satisfying . Very tasty and worth the price. The tortilla soup is make...More

title: Needs to improve some areas...
review: I hate to knock off 2 stars for this review because the food was great! If only they could get a handle on the logistics of running a restaurant, it could be really great.  The food, like I said, is great! Nice portions, taste is...More

title: I really wanted to love this place
review: My wife and I came here during our first trip to Chicago years ago, and we loved it. When I came back to town by myself, I made sure to make the trek up to Lincoln Square just to revisit the place. I'm not sure...More

title: Super Mexican Food
review: Had a lay over in Chicago and took a trip to this Lincoln Square Restaurant. The enchiladas were super, ceviche very good, and queso dip excellent.  Prices on the higher side of reasonable. Service was quick and friendly. Will return.

title: Chips are really good.  I like their fresh salsa.
review: I didn't love the guac, usually I devour the stuff, but I was done after a couple of bites.  I had the veggie fajita, it was good, but the seasoning was a bit lacking in flavor to me.  It was a busy lunch crowd and...More

title: TORTILLA SOUP IS TO DIE FOR
review: TORTILLA SOUP! TO DIE FOR x 100! Nice atmosphere & food is par or above with other good Mexican places in Chicago... BUT NOT THE BEST. I would suggest going strictly for the tortilla soup :) The area is great to walk around in, and...More

title: Mexican food
review: A very Yuppie type restaurant with average Mexican food. The restaurant atmosphere is to wide open and not typically Mexican. It gives the feeling of eating in a cafeteria. It seems as though most people go there to drink.

title: Great Tacos
review: The fish and chorizo tacos are amazing. The soft taco shells are handmade and you are almost too full after a two-taco dinner.  Get the green sauce!

title: A must when visiting Chicago
review: Whenever visiting family in Chicago, we drive to Lincoln Square to eat at Garcia's. The food is great and satisfies this westerner. Mexican can be quite different east of the Mississippi! The food portions are generous, so order wisely. The burritos definitely need to be...More

title: Quality food, big portions, watery salsa, bad service
review: The food is awesome, the portions are big.  I got the Fajitas De Pollo which was very tasty.  Lots of chicken but i had to wait like 5 mins to get my tortilla.  The waiter never came to the table..had to ask for salsa and...More

title: not that great
review: garcis use to be one of my favorite mexican restuarants until they remodeled it since then the prices have went up and it seems that the quality has went down it looks alot nicer since they remodeled it i just wish that food would quality...More

title: Amazing rolls, great price
review: If you’re craving sushi and don’t want to spend a lot, this is an awesome option. Rolls are big so make sure you go with someone else to share and try more options. Spicy tuna, godzilla, yellow tail... all delicious. Careful not to over order...because they will charge you for left overs (which is fair).More

title: Average place, nothing special
review: Average food quality, too cold inside, there was a Sushi Tokoro Wi-Fi network but no password for customers.

title: Average At Best
review: All-you-can-eat sushi was ordered in this visit.  All appetizers ordered were tasty and served hot.  The sushi was served on a boat that was like an aircraft carrier.  It was beautiful and looked impressive.  But, WAY too much rice was used to make each roll....In fact, some rolls, already thick with rice, were doubled up with rice on the bottom.  Also, the roll pieces were too big for the average mouth and many fell apart in the soy sauce.More

title: Delicious
review: I went there for lunch break and thought about getting the all you can eat lunch special. Glad I didn't. The 3 roll lunch special was more than enough. Everything tasted so fresh and delicious.   Definitely my place to eat sushi.

title: Right next to German school
review: Nice little sushi spot next to the Germán school. Good sushi and rolls and attentive service. BYOB as well so good bang for your buck. We'll definitely be back

title: QUICK FIX FOR A SUSHI CRAVING, STOP BY SUSHI TOKORO
review: My fam and I are fans of Sushi so, we've tried MANY restaurants in the Chicago area. Most recently we dined at Sushi Tokoro which is located just north of the El on Western Ave. Overall, the restaurant staff was prompt, friendly and responded very...quickly to our requests. There are 2 choices for dining: ordering off the menu or $22 for all you can eat. We choose the $22. It was the day after Christmas, December 26th and we were surprised to find the restaurant at almost 95% capacity with several additional hungry diners picking up carry out. We ordered 8 rolls for 2 people which voila, it came displayed on "the Boat". I know it's cheezy but, I love it when Sushi arrives on a bamboo boat. This one filled up the empty space with a plastic fish decor, cute ;). The rolls were filling but, had a little too much rice, making them hard to eat in one bite. Even though we had 8 different kinds of rolls, they all tasted very similar. We think it's because on the flat fee. For the price and good service, we would go back but, the food quality is only so-so. A few notes: There is parking on the street, just make sure you pay at the green box, otherwise Chicago will ticket you. Public transportation is available, Brown Line and CTA. For weekends, I highly recommend making reservations and it's a BYOB restaurant.More

title: Good food and friendly service
review: I live near this restaurant.  I enjoy the food here and come at least once a month.  The prices are good and the food is high quality.  The service if very friendly and attentive.  I would recommend the hibachi grill items.

title: This is what I'm talkin' 'bout!
review: Fresh hi quality sushi. Great value. Get the Davis Roll. Really really good. Pleasant,easy going staff. Will go back soon.

title: Fresh Sushi in a Modern Space
review: Sushi Tokoro is a fairly new restaurant located on Western Ave near Lawrence in the Logan Square neighborhood. You can find paid street parking fairly easy later in the evening, but maybe not during the day because this area does get a lot of traffic....The Western (#49) and Lawrence (#81) buses do run very frequently. It is also very close to the Western Brown line station.   We came on a weekday to have the all-you-can-eat sushi. The restaurant is clean and modern with a touch of pop from the band of light that runs horizontally across the middle of the wall that changes color. They have plenty of tables in addition to the prime seating where diners can watch the sushi chefs perform their magic. You can choose to order from the regular menu a la carte or from the special ayce menu. The sushi is better than average. Very fresh. Not padded with a lot of rice. Most of the hot items were good, but the fried items were a little cold like they have been sitting out for a while. This also reflected on the sushi rolls that contained fried shrimp or soft-shelled crab. Otherwise, most of the nigiri and maki were very tasty. If you order enough sushi, they will present it on a boat or bridge beautifully decorated. Be sure to finish what you order because they can charge you for what you don't finish. Service was very good. Servers were very polite and attentive. And the restaurant is BYOB.More

title: Great Local BYOB Find
review: The restaurant is clean. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The prices are good, and the food is very good. I will definitely visit again.

title: Good but not great
review: The all you can eat sushi for $16.99 lunch is a good bargain even if it is from a special menu and not the main menu which means things like the tataki and many rolls are not included.  The fish is fresh, however, it is...More

title: This used to be a wonderful
review: This used to be a wonderful Place! We loved to eat all their great food that reminded us of our wonderful country. Now, the place is so small, uninviting, and not Mekatos! They got rid of the glass cases where you were able to choose...all the delicious treats. The empanadas and the pandebonos taste so different! We were so disappointed!! We have been coming here for years...but there are other places that also have this kind of food. We will go there instead . So sad...We waited for a couple of years for the “new” place to open. But is new is just not ok.More

title: Great little bakery with a lunch counter
review: Our teenagers that we adopted from Colombia enjoyed selecting baked goods and candies from home. The sweet bread ring with guava paste was delicious!

title: Delicioso
